title: GTC 2025 Keynote [S72484]
abstract: Don't miss this keynote from NVIDIA founder and CEO Jensen Huang. He'll share how NVIDIA's accelerated computing platform is driving the next wave in AI, digital twins, cloud technologies, and sustainable computing.

title: Quantum Computing: Where We Are and Where We’re Headed [S74495]
abstract:
Doors open at 9:00 a.m.  Session begins at 10:00 a.m.
NVIDIA founder and CEO Jensen Huang hosts industry leaders from Alice & Bob, Atom Computing, D-Wave, Infleqtion, IonQ, Pasqal, PsiQuantum, Quantinuum, Quantum Circuits, QuEra Computing, Rigetti and SEEQC to learn today's state of the art and what the future holds for useful quantum computing. These unprecedented fireside chats bring together the whole quantum computing community for an overview of this exciting technology.

title: 007 Evaluations for Your Customer Assistant LLM Agent: No Time for Hallucinations [DLIT71470]
abstract:
Evaluate and optimize an LLM customer assistant, ensuring it performs robustly, accurately, and with no hallucinations in real-world scenarios. Leverage the NeMo Evaluator Microservice to create unit tests to track Gen AI model quality continuously during the development:

Optimize accuracy in your local languages for multilingual deployments and AI sovereignty.
Employ LLM-as-a-judge to ensure truthfulness and toxicity.
Evaluate end-to-end RAG applications.
Master techniques for visualizing evaluation results, and use these insights to make informed decisions and improvements to your LLM agents. You'll have access to a k8s deployment of NeMo Microservices pipeline and NIM, which will be ready for experimentation.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic understanding of LLMs.
Basic understanding of evaluations.
Python.

title: 1,001 Ways to Write CUDA Kernels in Python [S72449]
abstract:
You have to write a CUDA kernel. Did you know you can do it without leaving Python? We'll explore best practices for writing CUDA kernels using Python, empowering developers to harness the full potential of GPU acceleration. Gain a clear understanding of the structure and functionality of CUDA kernels, learning how to effectively implement them within Python applications. We’ll cover essential concepts including memory management, thread organization, and optimization techniques that are critical for achieving high performance.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: 200M Protein-Protein Interactions Analyzed in Seconds Using NVIDIA’s BioNemo, OpenFold, and EquiDock Framework [P74397]
abstract: Proteins drive biological processes, including carcinogenesis, where protein-protein interactions (PPIs) are crucial for understanding cellular mechanisms and identifying therapeutic targets. Detailed knowledge of binding modes among human proteins is vital, but predicting all PPIs is computationally expensive due to limited 3D structures and scalability issues. NVIDIA's BioNemo framework addresses these challenges with optimized models like EquiDock for rigid docking and Openfold for accurate structure prediction. We used experimental 3D structures from the Research Collaboratory for Structural Bioinformatics, predicting missing ones with Openfold, and evaluated over 15,000 human proteins for PPIs. EquiDock enabled docking, achieving an 80-500X speedup over classical methods using NVIDIA H100 NVL GPUs with 94GB VRAM. This setup allowed inference of over a million pairwise interactions in under five seconds per interaction, making large-scale PPI exploration feasible and efficient.

title: 3D BiCycle GANs Meet LLMs: Multimodal Structure-Based Ligand Design [P73548]
abstract: Discover how 3D BiCycle generative adversarial networks (GANs) and large language models (LLMs) synergize to revolutionize ligand design, tackling complexity and inefficiency in drug discovery. Explore our groundbreaking approach to accelerate the development of lifesaving therapies.

title: 3D 物理真实数字资产加速推动机器人开发进程 [S71763]
abstract: 我们将在演讲中，介绍 3D 物理真实数字资产尤其是铰链模型资产的特点，以满足机器人开发者用户在 Isaac Sim 平台下的仿真与视觉感知等任务中，对于仿真环境的诉求。这项有意义的工作可帮助开发者降低完成 Sim2Real 任务所需的成本。

title: 3D 物理真实数字资产加速推动机器人开发进程 [S71763]
abstract: 我们将在演讲中，介绍 3D 物理真实数字资产尤其是铰链模型资产的特点，以满足机器人开发者用户在 Isaac Sim 平台下的仿真与视觉感知等任务中，对于仿真环境的诉求。这项有意义的工作可帮助开发者降低完成 Sim2Real 任务所需的成本。

title: 4Kp60 Live Video Stream Optimization Running on NVIDIA Holoscan for Media [P74385]
abstract: Discover how we ported our bitrate optimization technology to the NVIDIA Holoscan for Media platform, demonstrating high-quality, optimized AV1 livestreaming of 4Kp60 video. Using the platform SDKs allowed us to keep our development focus on content-adaptive encoding, and on adding its advantages to live broadcasting.

title: Accelerate AI development with flexible GPU cloud solutions (Presented by IREN) [EXS74411]
abstract: AI developers often face issues such as high costs, hardware shortages, and inefficient scaling. Flexible GPU cloud solutions can address these problems by offering on-demand access to high-performance GPUs, reducing capital expenditure, and allowing dynamic scaling based on workload.

title: Accelerate AI: Enhance Performance and Efficiency Using Google Cloud (Presented by Google Cloud) [S74313]
abstract: We'll delve into the technical innovations that make AI hypercomputer architecture so powerful and discuss how it translates into tangible benefits for AI practitioners. We'll examine how Google Cloud extends this power to the edge with Google Distributed Cloud, enabling you to deploy and run AI models closer to your data sources and users, minimizing latency and maximizing performance. Learn how these integrated services streamline the entire AI life cycle, from data ingestion and preparation to model training, deployment, and monitoring. Discover why choosing Google Cloud is the optimal path for running your AI workloads, offering unparalleled performance, scalability, and a comprehensive suite of tools to accelerate your AI journey.

title: Accelerate AI: Enhance Performance and Efficiency Using Google Cloud (Presented by Google Cloud) [S74313]
abstract: We'll delve into the technical innovations that make AI hypercomputer architecture so powerful and discuss how it translates into tangible benefits for AI practitioners. Discover why choosing Google Cloud is the optimal path for running your AI workloads, offering unparalleled performance, scalability, and a comprehensive suite of tools to accelerate your AI journey.

title: Accelerate AI Innovation and Broaden Access to Resources Through the National AI Research Resource (NAIRR) Pilot [S72517]
abstract:
Katie will present an overview of the National AI Research Resource (NAIRR) pilot, a public-private partnership aimed to drive innovation and national competitiveness by supporting novel research and reaching broad communities. The pilot, launched in January 2023, involves 12 agencies and 26 nongovernmental partners, offering resources such as access to cloud computing, advanced computing platforms, models, and datasets. Katie will make clear the broad eligibility for the NAIRR pilot program, which includes researchers and educators from U.S.-based institutions including universities, nonprofits, and small businesses with federal grants. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerate AI Innovation with Cloudera’s AI Studios (Presented by Cloudera) [EXS74287]
abstract: Organizations are seeking practical solutions to rapidly build and deploy AI applications that deliver measurable business outcomes. Discover how Cloudera AI Studios empowers teams to rapidly create domain-specific Gen AI applications. Learn how Cloudera’s low-code tools for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), fine-tuning of foundation models, and deploying AI agents to streamline workflows and adapt models to your unique data and business needs. You'll gain actionable strategies to reduce development time, increase operational flexibility, and integrate Gen AI effectively into your workflows.

title: Accelerate AI Innovation With NVIDIA and Azure AI Foundry (Presented by Microsoft) [S74611]
abstract: Step into a new era of computing with generative AI, where the boundaries of innovation are continuously expanding and bringing ideas to life with the powerful partnership between NVIDIA and Microsoft. Explore how to access NVIDIA's latest AI models with Azure AI Foundry to customize and power market-ready AI applications. Whether you're a developer building advanced AI applications, a data scientist training and tuning models, an IT administrator managing AI workloads for cost, performance and scale, or a technical decision-maker looking to AI for strategic advantage, this session will provide valuable insights and practical guidance for accelerating AI innovation.

title: Accelerate AI Results for Your Business: Leverage the WWT AI Proving Ground (Presented by World Wide Technology) [S74028]
abstract: Clients across industries are leveraging the World Wide Technology (WWT) AI Proving Ground to accelerate, secure, and scale their AI journey across all levels of the AI product stack. Learn how WWT’s AI Proving Ground helps clients identify a use case, demo a solution, and run a pilot to get to AI outcomes faster.

title: Accelerate and Scale Your AI Deployment Through Automated Infrastructure Selection and Management [P74458]
abstract: Discover how to optimize AI deployment costs using cutting-edge predictive performance models. We'll explore new techniques to automate the selection of hardware and software configurations for AI models, helping organizations minimize operational expenses and energy consumption. By leveraging advanced deep learning performance predictions, you'll learn how to reduce the time spent on manual benchmarking, enhance scalability, and achieve faster time-to-market for your AI solutions. We'll show real-world examples of cost savings and performance gains across different industries, providing insights into how predictive analytics can transform AI operations. This session targets anyone who deploys their own AI models and needs to consider their cost and energy consumption without compromising performance.

title: Accelerate and Scale Your AI Deployment Through Automated Infrastructure Selection and Management [P74458]
abstract: Discover how to optimize AI deployment costs using cutting-edge predictive performance models. We'll explore new techniques to automate the selection of hardware and software configurations for AI models, helping organizations minimize operational expenses and energy consumption. By leveraging advanced deep learning performance predictions, you'll learn how to reduce the time spent on manual benchmarking, enhance scalability, and achieve faster time-to-market for your AI solutions. We'll show real-world examples of cost savings and performance gains across different industries, providing insights into how predictive analytics can transform AI operations. This session targets anyone who deploys their own AI models and needs to consider their cost and energy consumption without compromising performance.

title: Accelerate Apache Spark With GPUs [CWE71722]
abstract:
Did you know GPUs can reduce the cost of your Apache Spark workloads? Find out how! Whether you're new to Apache Spark or a long-time user, we're here to talk about large-scale data processing, your production workloads, optimal configurations, and how to introduce GPUs to your environment. We can answer questions about job qualification and tuning with GPUs, as well as potential performance gains, cost savings, or power usage reduction possible with GPU-accelerated Spark. Learn about the migration journey others have already undertaken.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerate Apache Spark With GPUs [CWE71722]
abstract:
Did you know GPUs can reduce the cost of your Apache Spark workloads? Find out how! Whether you're new to Apache Spark or a long-time user, we're here to talk about large-scale data processing, your production workloads, optimal configurations, and how to introduce GPUs to your environment. We can answer questions about job qualification and tuning with GPUs, as well as potential performance gains, cost savings, or power usage reduction possible with GPU-accelerated Spark. title: Accelerate Cancer Research With AI-Driven Multimodal Data Integration [P74176]
abstract: Explore cutting-edge techniques for integrating diverse oncology data types to create machine learning-ready datasets. Learn how to leverage GPU-accelerated foundation models for generating rich embeddings from clinical records (text and tabular data), medical imaging (radiological and histopathology images), and molecular profiles, enabling revolutionary AI discoveries in cancer research.

title: Accelerate Clustering Algorithms to Achieve the Highest Performance [DLIT74335]
abstract:
Clustering is commonly applied across industries for applications such as recommendation systems and fraud detection. In this lab, through examples, we'll discuss techniques to accelerate common clustering algorithms and tips/tricks to derive the highest performance.
Prerequisite(s):

Python, beginner familiarity with clustering techniques.

title: Accelerate Computational Lithography for Optical Proximity Correction [S71759]
abstract: We'll show how Samsung has accelerated its optical proximity correction (OPC) workloads using NVIDIA GPUs and the newly adopted NVIDIA cuLitho. With increasing lithography complexity in semiconductor manufacturing, GPU acceleration through cuLitho has enabled Samsung to achieve significant performance improvements, enhancing both speed and efficiency in critical OPC processes.

title: Accelerate Data Analytics on GPUs With the RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark [DLIT71528]
abstract:
The RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark leverages the distributed big data processing framework of Spark along with the power of GPUs to greatly speed up ETL and analytics workloads while reducing cost. In this training lab, we'll walk through the RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark, including running SQL queries on CPU and GPU in Spark and also diving into the toolset that helps enable success with the RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark.
Prerequisite(s):

An understanding of large-scale analytics and Apache Spark is not required, but would be helpful.

title: Accelerate Data Analytics on GPUs With the RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark [DLIT71528]
abstract:

title: Accelerate Data Intelligence with GPUs and RAPIDS on Databricks [S73654]
abstract: We'll explore the integration of NVIDIA GPUs and RAPIDS with Databricks, showing how GPU acceleration transforms data processing and analytics workflows. Together we accelerate tasks from pandas operations to Apache Spark tasks, from Dask workloads on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to building end-to-end solutions from data ingestion through building Gen AI models. We'll highlight recent advances in the Databricks-NVIDIA partnership, including the availability of DBRX as an NVIDIA NIM microservice, empowering organizations to build efficient, governed AI factories on their proprietary data.

title: Accelerate Data Intelligence with GPUs and RAPIDS on Databricks [S73654]
abstract: We'll explore the integration of NVIDIA GPUs and RAPIDS with Databricks, showing how GPU acceleration transforms data processing and analytics workflows. Together we accelerate tasks from pandas operations to Apache Spark tasks, from Dask workloads on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to building end-to-end solutions from data ingestion through building Gen AI models. We'll highlight recent advances in the Databricks-NVIDIA partnership, including the availability of DBRX as an NVIDIA NIM microservice, empowering organizations to build efficient, governed AI factories on their proprietary data.

title: Accelerate Data Science and Leverage Foundation Models in Digital Biology [DLIT71306]
abstract:
In recent years, the intersection of artificial intelligence and biology has opened new frontiers in scientific discovery. With the ability to process vast amounts of biological data, accelerated analysis and foundation model approaches are transforming digital biology, uncovering patterns that were previously inaccessible. This training lab provides hands-on experience for how foundation models can be leveraged to analyze biological data, with a single-cell genomics example. Gain a deep understanding of the end-to-end process, from pre-processing and analyzing single-cell data to fine-tuning an LLM foundation model and evaluating its performance. Learn how foundation models can uncover biological insights, while NVIDIA’s platform accelerates the entire process, enabling fast and scalable results. Get an overview of relevant NVIDIA solutions in digital biology, such as Parabricks, Vista2D, RAPIDS, and BioNeMo, and acquire the practical skills to use them to tackle complex biological challenges with GPUs.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic Python, ML, and dockers understanding.

title: Accelerate Distributed Apache Spark Applications on Kubernetes With RAPIDS [S72008]
abstract: Get an in-depth look at how to accelerate distributed Spark applications using NVIDIA's RAPIDS framework on AWS EKS Kubernetes clusters. We'll present an overview of an analysis platform based on Kubeflow Notebooks open-source software, followed by an explanation of using Docker to build GPU-enabled Spark worker and scheduler node images. We'll talk through the setup of running Distributed Spark on Kubernetes and accelerating distributed Spark applications using RAPIDS and GPU-enabled workers, as well as the technical challenges of GPU-enabled distributed Spark applications and how to set up the RAPIDS Qualification Tool to profile our Spark jobs, and we'll share benchmarks and initial results for GPU-enabled distributed data engineering workloads. Preliminary results show significant cost savings for large GPU compute workloads.

title: Accelerated Python: The Community and Ecosystem  [S72450]
abstract:
Python is everywhere. Simulation, data science, and Gen AI all depend on it. Unfortunately, the dizzying array of tools leaves a newcomer baffled at where to start. We'll take you on a guided tour of the vibrant community and ecosystem surrounding accelerated Python programming. Explore a variety of tools, libraries, and frameworks that enable efficient computation and performance optimization in Python, including CUDA Python, RAPIDS, Warp, and Legate. We'll also discuss integration points with PyData, PyTorch, and JAX communities. Learn about collaborative efforts within the community, including open source projects and contributions that drive innovation in accelerated computing. We'll discuss best practices for leveraging these frameworks to enhance productivity in developing AI-driven applications and conducting large-scale data analyses. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerate Drug Discovery for Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Using BioNeMo Framework [P74370]
abstract: With the exciting advances in generative AI, we're entering a new era of drug discovery. The time required for the drug discovery phase could be reduced by up to 50%, unlocking new opportunities for the development of treatments for challenging diseases. We'll demonstrate how we integrate cutting-edge generative AI and predictive models for key drug properties — such as absorption, distribution, metabolism, excretion, and toxicity — along with binding assessments, to create a powerful drug discovery platform. This platform has already been applied to the development of drug candidates for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), and our in silico experiments show nice concordance when validated with affinity selection mass spectrometry.

title: Accelerated Tabular Processing with Polars & RAPIDS [S74362]
abstract:
As data workloads grow in scale and complexity, achieving optimal performance is critical for data engineers and scientists. Polars, a high-performance DataFrame library written in Rust, is already known for its speed and efficiency. This talk explores how to take Polars a step further by integrating NVIDIA RAPIDS for GPU-accelerated data processing — using your preexisting code. 

Learn practical strategies for seamlessly incorporating NVIDIA RAPIDS into existing Polars workflows. We'll cover leveraging GPU-enabled backends, optimizing data transfer between CPU and GPU, and accelerating key operations such as filtering, aggregations, and joins. By harnessing CUDA, you'll unlock significant performance improvements with minimal code changes. Gain actionable insights to enhance Polars workflows with GPU acceleration, as well as the tools and knowledge to supercharge your pipelines while preserving your existing codebase.

title: Accelerate Energy Transformation With Industry Domain AI Models [S72520]
abstract:
Energy companies handle some of the world’s largest and most complex datasets, from seismic surveys and well logs in the oil and gas sector to power plant operations data, technical documentation, grid sensor data and smart meter readings in the power sector.

Panelists will share real-world examples of how generative AI is not only driving significant cost savings, but also unlocking new revenue streams by enhancing productivity and operational efficiency. The discussion will delve into strategies for accelerating AI adoption, reducing operating costs, and enabling faster, safer, and more informed decision-making.

Key topics will include overcoming challenges in AI model development and deployment, as well as insights into how AI can help the energy sector achieve greater efficiency, sustainability, and reliability across the entire value chain.

title: Accelerate Enterprise AI Applications with NVIDIA AI Enterprise and NVIDIA DGX Cloud on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (Presented by Oracle) [S74279]
abstract:
Learn how Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) integrates NVIDIA AI Enterprise and NVIDIA DGX Cloud to deliver accelerated AI development, training, and inference at scale. Enterprises can seamlessly leverage GPU-optimized tools, pre-trained models, and powerful AI infrastructure to enhance performance, scalability, and efficiency for AI workloads. OCI simplifies licensing, automates deployment, and provides comprehensive enterprise-grade support, enabling seamless operations. We'll show how OCI customers can unlock new levels of AI productivity with NVIDIA AI Enterprise and DGX Cloud, benefiting from unified support, data residency, and availability across OCI regions.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerate Enterprise AI With NVIDIA Blueprints (Presented by World Wide Technology) [EXS74202]
abstract: Discover how to leverage NVIDIA Blueprints to deliver complex enterprise AI solutions while reducing complexity and accelerating your journey from proof of concept to production. We'll share proven methods to quickly deliver impactful solutions on top of NVIDIA Blueprints to enhance performance and drive continuous innovation across your organization’s AI initiatives.

title: Accelerate FHE-Based DNN Secure Inference With GPU [P74396]
abstract: Securing deep neural network (DNN) inference with fully homomorphic encryption (FHE) offers a promising approach to safeguarding user data in cloud-based machine learning services. However, current implementations face significant challenges, with computation times more than 10,000 times slower than standard plaintext inference. By developing a novel FHE-friendly neural network computation pipeline and optimizing the parallelization and workload distribution across GPU streaming multiprocessors, we substantially improved the efficiency of FHE-based DNN inference, achieving a speedup of approximately 100X. First we'll explore the performance bottlenecks of FHE-based DNN inference, then present our approach to parallelization and workload balancing in detail. Our implementation represents a critical step toward making FHE-based DNN inference practically viable.

title: Accelerate Fortran and C/C++ Code With NVIDIA HPC Compilers [CWE74521]
abstract: If you're curious about accelerating Fortran, C, and C++ applications on NVIDIA hardware, join us to explore the tools and approaches offered by the NVIDIA HPC SDK. NVIDIA experts will guide you through the available programming models and libraries that best suit your needs. They'll also share their experiences in porting applications to the NVIDIA ecosystem, with a special focus on the latest platforms like Grace-Hopper.

title: Accelerate High-Performance Signal Processing Using GPU/CUDA [S71459]
abstract:
There's a huge potential for transformation of sensor signal processing architectures. We'll demonstrate this by showing a radar signal processing use case. Learn about significant performance gains that can be achieved in a short time when switching from CPU- to GPU-based systems.

Radar systems with phased-array antennas can have impressive detection performance. However, this performance comes with high signal processing demands due to the amount of data produced. The processing is typically embedded, which stresses the requirements for processing efficiency.

We will:
•	Dive into the experience of developing GPU-based systems, highlighting the technical challenges and how they were overcome.

•	Explain the benefits of leveraging the latest NVIDIA libraries such as cuSolver and cuBlas for signal processing filters.

•	Tell you about the over 500% processing gains achieved with GPUs. and how these advances can be applied to all kinds of sensor processing.

Additionally, we will discuss how adopting NVIDIA Holoscan can make it easier to create and manage complex sensor applications, thereby significantly improving engineering efficiency.

title: Accelerate High-Performance Signal Processing Using GPU/CUDA [S71459]
abstract:

title: Accelerate Inference on NVIDIA GPUs  [S72330]
abstract:
Deploying large language models for inference at scale is inherently complex, often requiring intricate optimizations across compute-bound and memory-bound regimes. We examine automatic vertical fusion, epilogue optimization, and adaptive kernel generation across batch sizes for GEMV and GEMM workloads, addressing key efficiency concerns, from NVIDIA CUDA® graph captures and optimized all-reduce strategies to custom kernel registrations. We'll highlight Together AI's journey in optimizing inference performance across the stack.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerate Large Language Model Training with Hybrid GPU-Based Compression [P73587]
abstract: We explored new techniques on using lossless and lossy GPU-based compression library to accelerate LLM training. We conducted a detailed communication analysis with 3D parallelism and ZeRO-1. We designed a selective and hybrid compression scheme that increase the throughput per GPU during training while maintaining baseline accuracy.

title: Accelerate Large-Scale AI Training Pipelines: Solve Checkpointing Challenges for LLMs and Multi-Modal Models (Presented by DDN) [S74360]
abstract: The explosive growth in large language models and multi-modal AI models has placed unprecedented demands on infrastructure, particularly during large-scale training. Key bottlenecks, such as I/O inefficiencies and checkpointing delays, can significantly impact time-to-insight and overall productivity. Learn how advanced data intelligence platforms, including the newly qualified DDN AI400X3 with the NVIDIA Blackwell architecture, deliver unmatched performance and scalability for training pipelines.

title: Accelerate Model Development and Deployment for Drug Discovery and Life Sciences: Q&A From the EMEA Region [S73097a]
abstract: Learn about the latest developments and the next generation of NVIDIA software to accelerate drug discovery and life sciences. BioNeMo is NVIDIA's platform to accelerate state-of-the-art chemistry, biology, and genomics foundation modeling. NVIDIA Parabricks is our state-of-the-art genomics platform that accelerates our understanding of biology. Together with the entire NVIDIA full-stack computing platform, the technology to discover the nature of biology and disease, and to develop new drugs and therapeutics, has never been faster and more accessible. We'll discuss the latest advancements in the capabilities of both platforms, aspects of our future roadmap, and real-world demonstrations of successful programs leveraging our technology.

title: Accelerate NVIDIA AI Enterprise With Data Intelligence to Achieve Faster Industry Outcomes (Presented by DDN) [S74353]
abstract: Discover how data intelligence platforms accelerate NVIDIA AI Enterprise, including NeMo, NIM, and CUDA, by delivering unmatched scalability, efficiency, and performance. Learn the importance of how a fully software-defined, containerized architecture seamlessly integrates with NVIDIA's advanced AI platforms, enabling real-time data access and low-latency processing at scale. Explore how metadata-optimized design accelerates AI training, inference, and model deployment, while native multi-tenancy ensures secure resource sharing and streamlined operations. Join us to explore how data intelligence platforms propel AI innovation by optimizing NVIDIA AI workflows across cloud, edge, and data center environments to drive key industry outcomes.

title: Accelerate NVIDIA AI Enterprise With Data Intelligence to Achieve Faster Industry Outcomes (Presented by DDN) [S74353]
abstract: Discover how data intelligence platforms accelerate NVIDIA AI Enterprise, including NeMo, NIM, and CUDA, by delivering unmatched scalability, efficiency, and performance. title: Accelerate Physical AI Development Workflows with Omniverse Cloud Sensor RTX [DLIT74496]
abstract:
This hands-on lab introduces developers to NVIDIA Omniverse Cloud Sensor RTX, a set of APIs and microservices for physically accurate sensor simulation. Ideal for robotics engineers, autonomous vehicle developers, and AI specialists, this lab offers practical experience in leveraging the Sensor RTX APIs to accelerate the creation and testing of autonomous systems.
Prerequisite(s):

Experience with 3D software, Python and APIs.

title: Accelerate Physical AI Development Workflows with Omniverse Cloud Sensor RTX [DLIT74496]
abstract:
This hands-on lab introduces developers to NVIDIA Omniverse Cloud Sensor RTX, a set of APIs and microservices for physically accurate sensor simulation. Prerequisite(s):

Experience with 3D software, Python and APIs.

title: Accelerate R&D in Quantum Computing [S73197]
abstract:
Quantum computers are one day expected to solve problems out of reach of even the most powerful classical processors. But these computers won't operate in isolation. Instead, quantum computers will form an integral part of high  performance computing architectures that transform some of today’s most challenging workflows, such as drug discovery, portfolio optimization, and many others. Learn how AWS and NVIDIA are collaborating to bring this shared vision to life through AWS’ quantum service, Amazon Braket, and NVIDIA’s CUDA-Q platform. By providing the tools needed by customers, wherever they are in their quantum journey, they can learn and innovate with easy access to a diverse range of quantum computing hardware on Braket. We'll describe recent progress to improve the runtime performance on quantum processors by over 10-fold, enabling researchers to maximize efficiency when running their algorithms. Finally, as a first step toward understanding the longer-term classical compute resource requirements up and down the quantum stack to deliver a production-grade, hybrid quantum infrastructure for customers, we’ll describe our recent work to enable NVIDIA's CUDA-Q framework for all quantum devices on Braket.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerate Reservoir Modeling for the Energy Transition With Physics-Informed AI Techniques [S73019]
abstract: Discover how sequential Physics-Informed Neural Operators (PINO), developed with NVIDIA Modulus and integrated with generative adversarial networks (GANs) and optimizers, can revolutionize subsurface modeling for both traditional and emerging energy applications. Learn new techniques to enhance reservoir simulations and address evolving challenges in sustainable resource management, with a focus on optimizing existing oil & gas production to minimize environmental impact, and modeling carbon capture and storage (CCS) in depleted oil reservoirs to support decarbonization efforts.

title: Accelerate Robotics Development With Digital Twins: Strategic Insights for Innovators [S73891]
abstract: Explore how Idealworks builds on NVIDIA Isaac and Omniverse to revolutionize robotics through advanced simulation and synthetic data generation. We'll delve into how idealworks applies digital twins in single-robot use cases and advanced research. Learn about the practical use of vSLAM mapping, depth estimation with extended service set networks, and real-time 3D perception using nvblox in Isaac Perceptor. We’ll also discuss the creation of synthetic datasets using Omniverse extensions, accelerating our development cycles. Discover why companies should invest in simulation for industrial robotics development to save time, reduce costs, and streamline development.

title: Accelerate Robotics Development With Digital Twins: Strategic Insights for Innovators [S73891]
abstract: Explore how Idealworks builds on NVIDIA Isaac and Omniverse to revolutionize robotics through advanced simulation and synthetic data generation. We'll delve into how idealworks applies digital twins in single-robot use cases and advanced research. title: Accelerate Science With NVIDIA HPC Compilers [S74505]
abstract: Learn how to accelerate Fortran, C, and C++ applications on multicore CPUs or GPUs. Explore popular HPC programming models supported by NVIDIA HPC SDK — OpenACC, OpenMP, CUDA, or even standard parallelism in Fortran and C++. We'll cover diverse solutions offered by the SDK to meet the unique requirements of performance portability, productivity, and performance tuning with the emphasis on the latest GPU platforms, such as Grace Hopper.

title: Accelerate Science With NVIDIA HPC Compilers [S74505]
abstract: Learn how to accelerate Fortran, C, and C++ applications on multicore CPUs or GPUs. title: Accelerate Super Long-Context LLM Inference [S72568]
abstract:
As the context length of LLM serving continues to increase, the inference time escalates dramatically. To strike this issue, we devise three key techniques: A fine-grained sparse attention algorithm for the pre-filling phase, equipped by a high-performance token-sparsity attention kernel using Tensor Core with CUTLASS CUTE, which delivers an 8X speedup at a 10X sparse rate without sacrificing accuracy; block-sparsity attention for the decoding phase, which further doubles the sparse rate while preserving accuracy with novel KV cache clustering; dynamic chunked pipeline parallelism, which decomposes a long sequence into chunks with adaptively updated chunk size based on an analytical cost model to balance pipeline stages, resulting in about 2X acceleration over Tensor Parallelism on eight GPUs. The above optimizations have empowered over 20X and 4X speedups for the pre-filling and decoding phases, respectively, while preserving accuracy with context length of 1 million tokens.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerate the Future of AI-Defined Vehicles and Autonomous Driving [DD40000]
abstract:
AI-defined vehicles are shaping the future of autonomous driving. To safely develop and deploy these vehicles, an end-to-end platform that combines high-performance in-vehicle computing and a scalable infrastructure is required. See how NVIDIA is leading this AI-centric approach with our three-computer solution, spanning from the cloud to the car, and gain insights into how generative AI is accelerating the industry toward a foundation model-empowered, end-to-end approach to bring the autonomous driving experience to the next level.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerate the Future of Healthcare: AI-Powered Innovations for Imaging, Digital Health, and Beyond [S72493]
abstract:
Join Roland Rott, president and CEO of imaging at GE HealthCare, and Parry Bhatia, chief AI officer, to explore how GE HealthCare is transforming diagnostic imaging with cutting-edge AI technologies. Learn how NVIDIA’s Foundational Model Training, Simulation, and Edge AI Platform enable GE HealthCare to enhance diagnostic accuracy, streamline workflows, and improve patient care. Discover AI's role in supporting the detection and treatment of cancers, Alzheimer’s, and cardiac disease, as well as addressing global healthcare disparities. This session highlights how AI-driven imaging is reshaping modern medicine, offering personalized insights and advancing health outcomes worldwide.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerating 4D Flow MRI Reconstruction Using GPU [P73495]
abstract: This poster presents accelerated compressed sensing-based reconstruction with Non-Decimated Discrete Wavelet Transform (NDWT) as Sparsifying transform for 4D Flow MRI. We accelerate the reconstruction process by writing the dedicated CUDA kernels for NDWT decomposition, as well as reconstruction parts, that improves the reconstruction time by 7X to 60X while maintaining the reconstructed image quality.

title: Accelerating Advanced Materials Discovery With Generative AI: Tutorial and Case Studies [S72651]
abstract:
We'll dive into the transformative impact generative AI is having on the discovery of new advanced materials — things like batteries, semiconductors, and climate technologies. Learn about the latest generative AI models for advanced materials discovery, how we trained them, and how to apply them, as we walk through a real-life case study in the world of carbon removal materials.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerating AI Adoption with AI Factories  [S71405]
abstract:
We'll introduce a hub-and-spoke model designed to democratize AI across large enterprises, striking the perfect balance between centralized and decentralized AI development. We'll explore the full spectrum — from operating models and governance to technical foundations with the AI Factory and value tracking. We'll take a deep dive into the AI Factory’s technical foundations and showcase how the NVIDIA stack can supercharge AI development and accelerate enterprise-wide adoption. Finally, we'll highlight the tangible benefits of building an AI Factory, including reduced risks, lower costs, and faster time-to-market for business teams.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerating AI and HPC with an Adaptive Converged Platform (Presented by QCT) [S74062]
abstract: Dive deep into the QCT POD, a pre-validated, turnkey AI and HPC solution. Designed to simplify building foundational infrastructure for generative AI training, QCT POD also facilitates the implementation of retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems and supports HPC workloads. Explore new techniques for using QCT POD’s data management tools and storage capabilities to streamline data pipelines seamlessly, from edge to data center. Discover how these innovative solutions can improve performance, optimize workflows, and accelerate the deployment of AI and HPC applications.

title: Accelerating AI from Edge to Cloud: MediaTek’s Leading-Edge Vehicle and Datacenter Solutions (Presented by MediaTek) [S74504]
abstract: This session will cover MediaTek’s groundbreaking automotive and datacenter AI solutions. Dr. Ephrem Anthony Chemaly will dive into MediaTek’s Dimensity Auto portfolio for software-defined vehicles, leveraging NVIDIA’s next-gen GPU accelerated AI computing and NVIDIA RTX graphics. Anki Nalamalpu will explore MediaTek’s leading-edge AI datacenter solutions, highlighting the company's leadership in advanced process and packaging technology, industry-leading architecture, and comprehensive ecosystem partnerships.

title: Accelerating AI from Edge to Cloud: MediaTek’s Leading-Edge Vehicle and Datacenter Solutions (Presented by MediaTek) [S74504]
abstract: This session will cover MediaTek’s groundbreaking automotive and datacenter AI solutions. Anki Nalamalpu will explore MediaTek’s leading-edge AI datacenter solutions, highlighting the company's leadership in advanced process and packaging technology, industry-leading architecture, and comprehensive ecosystem partnerships.

title: Accelerating AI: Memory's Impact on GPUs (Presented by Samsung Semiconductor) [S74571]
abstract:
The relentless pursuit of AI, high performance computing, robotics, autonomous vehicles, and immersive gaming has pushed the boundaries of what's possible in graphics and accelerated computing. At the heart of this revolution are Samsung's advanced memory and storage solutions that power NVIDIA's GPU architectures today and into the future, delivering exceptional performance, capacity, and efficiency.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerating AI Pipelines: Boosting Visual Search Efficiency [S71676]
abstract:
We'll explore the optimization of Microsoft's Bing Visual Search using NVIDIA’s TensorRT and CV-CUDA libraries, achieving a 5X performance improvement in large-scale image processing pipelines. With billions of images to process, we'll discuss key techniques for optimizing AI models to enhance efficiency, reduce latency, and cut total cost of ownership (TCO). We'll take a deep dive on how CV-CUDA, nvImageCodec, TensorRT, and ONNXRuntime worked together to achieve this optimization, discussing topics including batched image decoding and pre-processing, efficient I/O bindings, and streamlined inference processing.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerating AI Pipelines: Boosting Visual Search Efficiency [S71676]
abstract:
We'll explore the optimization of Microsoft's Bing Visual Search using NVIDIA’s TensorRT and CV-CUDA libraries, achieving a 5X performance improvement in large-scale image processing pipelines. With billions of images to process, we'll discuss key techniques for optimizing AI models to enhance efficiency, reduce latency, and cut total cost of ownership (TCO). We'll take a deep dive on how CV-CUDA, nvImageCodec, TensorRT, and ONNXRuntime worked together to achieve this optimization, discussing topics including batched image decoding and pre-processing, efficient I/O bindings, and streamlined inference processing.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerating AI with Purpose-Built Cloud Infrastructure (Presented by Together AI) [EXS74255]
abstract: The next generation of AI demands an entirely new kind of cloud — one designed from the ground up to meet the unique challenges of generative AI, advanced reasoning, and the road to superintelligence. This session by Together AI will delve into the three critical pillars of an AI-optimized cloud: state-of-the-art hardware purpose-built for AI workloads, cutting-edge software that maximizes performance, and integrated services that simplify model development and deployment. Together, these elements form the foundation of AI-first clouds that accelerate innovation, turbocharge performance, and empower researchers and businesses to achieve transformative outcomes.

title: Accelerating Automotive Transient Aerodynamics CFD Simulation  [S72457]
abstract: BMW, Siemens, and NVIDIA will present the results of their collaboration on accelerating automotive transient aerodynamics simulations. Traditionally, transient aerodynamics simulations are very computationally intensive. This is due to large model sizes needed to capture all the details of the vehicle, including external and internal (under-hood) flows. Additional complexity and computational cost is added by including rotating rims in the analysis. We'll present the results of accelerating these Simcenter STAR-CCM+ simulations on the latest GPU hardware. We'll discuss the impact on the design process and the potential to add more fidelity to the simulations, as well as the energy savings of leveraging accelerated approaches.

title: Accelerating Automotive Transient Aerodynamics CFD Simulation  [S72457]
abstract: BMW, Siemens, and NVIDIA will present the results of their collaboration on accelerating automotive transient aerodynamics simulations. Traditionally, transient aerodynamics simulations are very computationally intensive. This is due to large model sizes needed to capture all the details of the vehicle, including external and internal (under-hood) flows. Additional complexity and computational cost is added by including rotating rims in the analysis. We'll present the results of accelerating these Simcenter STAR-CCM+ simulations on the latest GPU hardware. We'll discuss the impact on the design process and the potential to add more fidelity to the simulations, as well as the energy savings of leveraging accelerated approaches.

title: Accelerating Business Insights with RAG AI and Modern Data Platforms [S71888]
abstract:
Enterprises are leveraging AI to make smarter business decisions, but a common challenge they face is integrating diverse, siloed data into AI services. For AI models to deliver more meaningful insights, they need to be trained on enterprise data, which is often spread across multiple environments. 

Learn how Cohesity – powered by NVIDIA NeMo Retriever and NIM microservices – enables enterprises to transform siloed, diverse data into actionable insights for AI-driven decision-making, enhance RAG to meet global business needs, and provides you with tools to streamline data access, optimize model training, and build smarter systems that deliver real-time, impactful business decisions.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerating Data Analytics Workflows on GPU Systems [CWE72882]
abstract:
Are you looking to accelerate your data analytics workflow on GPUs? Is your workflow bottlenecked by complex and slow-running SQL queries or dataframe operations? Join our session on data analytics workloads on GPUs, where you'll discover how to accelerate your data processing with cutting-edge NVIDIA hardware and software solutions. Learn about libraries like RAPIDS and Spark, powerful tools that leverage GPUs for fast data processing, and explore NVIDIA's Grace Hopper and Grace Blackwell architectures designed to accelerate your data workloads like never before.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerating End-to-End CAE Workflows: Cloud-Native and On-Premises [S73002]
abstract:
Computer-aided engineering(CAE) is used to study behavior of mechanical systems, electrical systems, fluid dynamics, thermodynamics, and more. CAE is used by a variety of industries such as aerospace, automotive, electrical engineering, and architecture to model, simulate, and optimize the performance of technologies ranging from data centers to aircraft to handheld electronics before they are physically built.  

Explore NVIDIA’s new platform that accelerates the entire CAE workflow and facilitates the creation of cloud-native CAE solutions. We'll highlight the ecosystem partners we're working with for accelerating the CAE workflow. We'll introduce NVIDIA’s portfolio of technologies for CAE workflow acceleration — CUDA-X, Omniverse, Modulus, Warp, etc.

title: Accelerating Enterprises’ GenAI Innovation (Presented by QCT) [S74054]
abstract: We'll begin with an overview of a generative AI scenario, followed by an introduction and a hands-on demo of the QCT AI Dev. Kit. Learn how to rapidly deploy AI services for operational guidance through a live demo featuring robot arm integration. You can explore everything from retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) framework implementation to inference deployment. We will show how QCT's hardware portfolio and development kit accelerate your journey from AI concept to solutions, helping you navigate the complexities of modern AI infrastructure while optimizing for performance and efficiency.

title: Accelerating Enterprises’ GenAI Innovation (Presented by QCT) [S74054]
abstract: We'll begin with an overview of a generative AI scenario, followed by an introduction and a hands-on demo of the QCT AI Dev. Kit. title: Accelerating Genome-Wide Association Studies Using Mixed-Precision Computations on Alps Supercomputer [S72297]
abstract:
We exploit the widening margin in tensor-core performance between [FP64/FP32/FP16/INT8,FP64/FP32/FP16/FP8/INT8] on NVIDIA Ampere and Hopper GPUs to boost the performance of output accuracy-preserving mixed-precision (MxP) computation of
genome-wide association studies (GWAS) of 305,000 patients from the U.K. BioBank, the largest-ever GWAS cohort studied for genetic epistasis using a multivariate approach. We highlight the numerical robustness of our MxP approach, illustrate the performance impact on our HPC GWAS application using Summit/Leonardo/Alps supercomputers, and compare them against Frontier.

abstract:

title: Accelerating Genomic Analysis: Building the Foundation for Next-Generation Genomic Models in Healthcare [S72432]
abstract: Accelerated genomic analysis pipelines enable the rapid, scalable data processing required to create the datasets for training biological foundation models. This dataset will feed future AI algorithms that can enhance applications in rare disease research, oncology interpretation, and drug discovery, advancing precision medicine solutions.

title: Accelerating Industry AI Workloads with NVIDIA NIM and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (Presented by Oracle) [S74281]
abstract: Discover how NVIDIA Blueprints integrate with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) to accelerate AI/ML workloads. NVIDIA's optimized, validated containers adapt dynamically across GPUs, providing peak performance while reducing deployment complexity and time-to-production. Explore key industry use cases: • Healthcare: Accelerate drug discovery with tools like AlphaFold, generating protein sequences tailored to genomic inputs for personalized therapies. • Telecommunications: Enhance customer support, knowledge bases, and field operations using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). NVIDIA’s Multimodal PDF Data Extraction Blueprint extracts and summarizes text, audio, and video embedded in PDFs. Learn how OCI's robust infrastructure and the NVIDIA accelerated computing platform deliver scalable, production-ready AI capabilities for telco and healthcare.

title: Accelerating Industry AI Workloads with NVIDIA NIM and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (Presented by Oracle) [S74281]
abstract: Discover how NVIDIA Blueprints integrate with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) to accelerate AI/ML workloads. title: Accelerating Insights and Efficiencies in Automotive Manufacturing using Immersive Digital Twins [S73011]
abstract:
Learn about Omniverse, AI, and the evolving role of digital twins in revolutionizing the automotive industry, with particular focus on the integration of internet-of-things (IoT) data. We'll discuss how micro twins (a scaled-down version of a digital twin) enable real-time visualization of an entire plant, providing critical insights that drive smarter, data-informed decision-making. Leveraging IoT connectivity allows digital replicas to unlock new ways of monitoring plant operations, identify root causes of quality issues, and optimize our performance through data replay. We're pushing the boundaries of this technology, and believe the future lies in AI-assisted intelligence, where our digital twins evolve into a powerful tools capable of offering actionable process-related insights through simple queries. Our work with NVIDIA promises to unlock a new era of operational efficiency, predictive maintenance, and intelligent automation.  

Our team is helping develop a miniature-scale digital twin, called the "micro twin," to provide visibility across our entire plant. Utilizing the Apple Vision Pro, this visualization enables users to view the whole plant in a single, immersive experience, making complex processes easy to monitor at a glance. Additionally, with the integration of NVIDIA's NIMs with large language models, users will be able to communicate with the digital twin directly. These combined technologies are setting the foundation for a dynamic, interactive digital twin experience that aligns with our commitment to innovation in plant management.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerating Linguistic Diversity: GPU-Powered Corpus Curation With NVIDIA NeMo Curator for Spanish, French, and Other Non-English Languages [DLIT73337]
abstract:
Developing LLMs for non-English languages often faces the challenge of limited or imbalanced datasets. We present a cutting-edge approach to curating high-quality text corpora for languages like Spanish, French, and beyond, leveraging the power of GPU acceleration. We'll delve into the methodologies for constructing a comprehensive corpus, starting with basic heuristics for text selection and cleaning through more sophisticated techniques, such as semantic deduplication. Finally, we'll explore the innovative strategies for synthetic data generation, a crucial step in augmenting the dataset where real-world examples are scarce.
We'll show how NVIDIA's NeMo Curator can perform these tasks with remarkable speed and efficiency. You'll leave with practical insights into corpus curation workflows that can be applied to a variety of non-English languages, paving the way for more inclusive and representative language technologies.
Prerequisite(s):

A solid programming background.

title: Accelerating LLM Applications: Enhancing Performance With NVIDIA NIM [P72964]
abstract: We're developing a PoP (point of purchase) generation application using LLMs to optimize the fully manual process currently in place. With a strong need for efficiency improvements and automation, we're exploring NVIDIA NIM to boost generation speed and overall performance.

title: Accelerating LLM Applications: Enhancing Performance With NVIDIA NIM [P72964]
abstract: We're developing a PoP (point of purchase) generation application using LLMs to optimize the fully manual process currently in place. With a strong need for efficiency improvements and automation, we're exploring NVIDIA NIM to boost generation speed and overall performance.

title: Accelerating Model Development and Deployment for Drug Discovery and Life Sciences [S73097]
abstract: Learn about the latest developments and the next generation of NVIDIA software to accelerate drug discovery and life sciences. BioNeMo is NVIDIA's platform to accelerate state-of-the-art chemistry, biology, and genomics foundation modeling. NVIDIA Parabricks is our state-of-the-art genomics platform that accelerates our understanding of biology. Together with the entire NVIDIA full-stack computing platform, the technology to discover the nature of biology and disease, and to develop new drugs and therapeutics, has never been faster and more accessible. We'll discuss the latest advancements in the capabilities of both platforms, aspects of our future roadmap, and real-world demonstrations of successful programs leveraging our technology.

title: Accelerating Physics Using Quantum Computing and Synergies With Machine Learning (Presented by Ansys) [EXS74415]
abstract: As the frontiers of computational physics evolve, the convergence of quantum computing and machine learning offers unparalleled opportunities to tackle long-standing challenges in simulation and optimization. We'll present Ansys' work using CUDA-Q to integrate these cutting-edge technologies to accelerate physics-based computations and enhance the efficiency of complex engineering tasks. By leveraging quantum algorithms applied to large matrix operations, we are researching how to accelerate linear and nonlinear partial differential equations.

title: Accelerating Physics Using Quantum Computing and Synergies With Machine Learning (Presented by Ansys) [EXS74415]
abstract: As the frontiers of computational physics evolve, the convergence of quantum computing and machine learning offers unparalleled opportunities to tackle long-standing challenges in simulation and optimization. We'll present Ansys' work using CUDA-Q to integrate these cutting-edge technologies to accelerate physics-based computations and enhance the efficiency of complex engineering tasks. By leveraging quantum algorithms applied to large matrix operations, we are researching how to accelerate linear and nonlinear partial differential equations.

title: Accelerating Portfolio Optimization [DLIT71690]
abstract:
Join our in-depth exploration of cutting-edge techniques to accelerate portfolio optimization on GPUs. We'll unpack how to formulate optimization problems in terms of risk-reward trade-offs under various constraints. We'll discuss how to transform traditionally sequential optimization algorithms into parallel ones that can leverage GPU acceleration to manage complex, high-dimensional investment portfolios efficiently. Concrete examples using FX options and equity portfolios will be provided.
Prerequisite(s):

Familiarity with Python and Jupyter Lab environments.

title: Accelerating Quantum Computing  [CWE71500]
abstract:
Join us and learn about quantum computing at NVIDIA! We'll show you how to use CUDA-Q and cuQuantum to accelerate your quantum computing research, from simulating algorithms and processors to running hybrid quantum-classical workloads. In this interactive session, we'll discuss how to take full advantage of NVIDIA’s most powerful GPUs to explore the benefits of quantum computing. Join NVIDIA quantum software experts to learn more about the CUDA-Q open-source platform for programming quantum processing units (QPUs), GPUs, and CPUs seamlessly, and how it integrates with cuQuantum to accelerate applications simulation. Discuss your ideas with the team and give us feedback on your experience using NVIDIA’s quantum computing software.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Accelerating Quantum Research on GPUs [P73517]
abstract: Quantum research at NVIDIA includes novel methods for efficient on-GPU simulation, the use of AI models to extend our capacity to study quantum systems, and novel algorithms for machine learning on quantum devices.

title: Accelerating Radiation Therapy Planning With Faster Beamlet Dose Calculations Using GPU Technology [P73297]
abstract: This study highlights the integration of NVIDIA RTX 6000 Ada GPU-based beamlet dose matrix calculation into radiation therapy treatment planning, offering a significant leap in computational efficiency without sacrificing treatment accuracy. By streamlining computational workflows, this advance enhances radiation therapy planning, ultimately improving patient care.

title: Accelerating Robust Humanoid Robot Development for any Industry [CWE73360]
abstract:
Compute for humanoid robotics is crucial to deliver optimized performance and advanced AI capabilities. NVIDIA Jetson Thor for humanoid robotics features a next-gen Blackwell architecture with integrated safety features and high-performance computing to ensure safe and efficient interactions in real-world environments. Interact with our experts to understand how to unlock power and performance for humanoid robotics applications from software, AI models, and libraries to compute. Join us to accelerate your humanoid robotics projects and drive innovation in embodied AI. Please note that Yuke Zhu and Chen Su will only be present on Thursday, while Teresa Conceicao and Spencer Huang will only be present on Friday. All other listed experts will be present at both session times.

title: Accelerating ROS 2 Workloads With NVIDIA GPU-Powered Libraries and AI Models [DLIT71433]
abstract:
Learn how to accelerate ROS 2 workloads using NVIDIA’s latest GPU-powered libraries for AI and robotics. This hands-on lab will explore how to leverage generative AI and GPU-accelerated ROS 2 packages to enhance robotic workloads in real time. Gain experience with optimizing ROS 2 packages for GPU acceleration, including techniques for improving performance and reducing latency in AI perception, navigation, and more. We'll also demonstrate NVIDIA Isaac's powerful AI and simulation tools, designed for seamless integration with ROS 2.
Prerequisite(s):

Experience with OpenUSD, NVIDIA Omniverse and 3D CAD software.
Experience in Python.
Basic knowledge of NVIDIA Isaac Sim and Isaac ROS.

title: Accelerating Sovereign AI Factories: Insights from Telco Case Studies [S73439]
abstract:
The pace of AI Factory deployments by Telecom companies have ramped up significantly in the past 18 months. 

Telcos are establishing themselves as AI factory providers by leveraging their intrinsic strengths in managing and investing in complex infrastructure, being the trusted national providers of essential infrastructure, plus having access to data centers' power and space. In a growing number of countries, Telecom companies are providing the national ecosystem including government, universities, startups, and enterprises with the required AI infrastructure and platform, supporting industry and government efforts to drive AI impact across society. 

We'll explore how Telcos from different regions are approaching the opportunity and driving impact in their countries.

title: ACGT: Blazing Fast Bits-to-Bases [P74492]
abstract: This poster walks you through the extreme data processing needs of Roche Sequencing's NGS R&D efforts. See how we integrate the latest GPU technologies to process next-generation sequencing data in a streaming, real-time fashion as close to the source of data generation as possible. Solving this complex challenge requires leveraging several key NVIDIA features including TensorRT, Magnum IO, and Clara Parabricks.

title: Achieve Scale: Accelerate AI Adoption for Business Impact (Presented by Accenture) [S73055]
abstract: Join our panel discussion with NVIDIA and Accenture, where business leaders share their experiences and strategies for expediting AI deployment in the face of time-to-market pressures. Learn how collaboration and integrated solutions can streamline the path from concept to implementation, ensuring your organization stays competitive.

title: Adaptive Distribution Generator: Powering Split-Step Quantum Walks with CUDA-Q [P72789]
abstract: The poster explores a quantum machine learning model, the SSQW (Split-Step Quantum Walk), designed to fit lognormal and normal distributions. The SSQW leverages quantum entanglement to learn complex statistical patterns and simulate quantum dynamics. Quantum simulation workflows benefit from CUDA Quantum's capabilities, which are effective even on CPU-based systems. This suggests promising potential for future GPU acceleration in quantum computing tasks.

title: Address Complex/Logical Tasks With Conversational AI: Multi-Agent, Multi-Turn Framework From Scratch [DLIT71269]
abstract:
Learn to build an agent framework to tackle the multi-turn complex task, how to add tools, and multi-turn agents behavior. Learn how to build conversational AI agents that can tackle complex tasks with ease, and explore new techniques for multi-turn conversations and persona-based interactions.
Prerequisite(s):

Python, GenAI.

title: A Deep Dive Into the Future of Liquid-Cooled AI Data Centers (Presented by Supermicro) [S74305]
abstract:
Supermicro dives into the present and future of liquid-cooled AI infrastructure. We'll cover real-world success stories from the world's largest liquid-cooled AI deployments, and preview future liquid-cooling total solutions. Supermicro highlights liquid-cooling best practices and reference architectures to maximize computing density, efficiency, and productivity for the whole data center.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: A Deep Dive Into the Latest HPC Software [S71350]
abstract:
Take a deep dive into the latest developments in NVIDIA software for high performance computing applications, including a comprehensive look at what’s new in programming models, compilers, libraries, and tools. We'll cover topics of interest to HPC developers, targeting traditional HPC modeling and simulation, quantum computing, HPC+AI, scientific visualization, and high-performance data analytics.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Advanced LLM App Evaluation: Building Real-Time Guardrails for Real-World LLM Risk Mitigation [S71692]
abstract: As LLM apps become more widespread, so do their associated risks — protecting your LLM application from malicious inputs and undesired outputs is critical in both development and production. We'll share lessons learned from dozens of productionized use cases into applying LLM evaluations and guardrails to enhance the safety and relevance of Gen AI systems in real-world environments.

title: Advanced Medical AI Development with MONAI: From Interactive Annotation to Foundation Models [DLIT71265]
abstract:
This hands-on training lab demonstrates how to build end-to-end medical AI workflows using the latest tools: MONAI Label, VISTA-3D, MAISI, and VILA-M3. Learn to combine AI-assisted annotation, interactive segmentation, synthetic data generation, and advanced visual-language understanding to create powerful medical imaging applications. Gain practical experience with these tools while understanding how they complement each other in real-world scenarios.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic Python understanding and basic ML understanding.

title: Advanced Multi-GPU Scaling: Communication Libraries [S72578]
abstract:
Do you need to compute larger or faster than a single GPU allows, but a multi-GPU library providing the functionality you need isn't available? Learn how to scale your application to multiple GPUs and multiple nodes with the different available multi-GPU communication libraries. We'll introduce CUDA-aware MPI, NVSHMEM, and NCCL using a real-world application example.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Advanced RAG Pipelines: Engineer Scalable Retrieval Systems for Enterprise AI  [S73015]
abstract:
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems integrate the reasoning capabilities of large language models and information retrieval by searching for the relevant content from a large corpus to generate informed, accurate responses. Learn how to build advanced, custom RAG applications. You'll explore the design of an end-to-end RAG system, including data preparation, indexing, retrieval, and response generation. Then, we'll show how you can leverage Haystack pipelines with multiple NVIDIA NIMs such as the LLM, text embedding, and reranking microservices to self-host on a Kubernetes production environment at scale. Finally, we'll discuss AI models evaluation and customization for specific RAG tasks. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Advanced Techniques for Inference Optimization With TensorRT-LLM [S71693]
abstract:
Learn new strategies for large language model (LLM) inference optimization that apply cutting-edge research in battle-tested production implementations to massively improve latency, throughput, and cost. We’ll go beyond the basics of engine building and quantization with in-depth explorations of why and how to use new techniques like speculative decoding, tensor parallelism, and LoRA swapping with TensorRT-LLM.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Advancements in Physical AI: Startups Using OpenUSD, Robotics, and Simulation [S72461]
abstract: Join us for a lightning talk designed for developers. Startup leaders will share their experiences using NVIDIA Omniverse, focusing on the practical applications of OpenUSD in 3D projects. Attendees will hear how startups have scaled digital twins for physical AI usecases including warehouse operations, automotive design, and 3D product configuration. This "birds of a feather" session will provide valuable insights and technical details for those looking to integrate these tools into their 3D workflows.

title: Advance Research and Clinical Workflows With an AI Factory for Medical Imaging [CWE71523]
abstract:
Join NVIDIA experts to explore the field of medical imaging AI. Discover how MONAI empowers researchers, developers, data scientists, and enterprises to rapidly create ground truth data and develop state-of-the-art models. Delve into the latest advancements in generative AI and 3D foundational models, exploring their applications in creating synthetic medical imaging data and enabling AI-assisted annotations. Engage directly with our product managers, developer relations experts, and solution architects in interactive discussions addressing your specific challenges and questions in the realm of medical AI.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Advances on Decision Optimization [S72290]
abstract:
Decision-making in complex systems is driven by insatiable demand for performance and efficiency, pushing traditional approaches to their limits. How to achieve more efficient prescriptive analytics?
Join us to explore NVIDIA groundbreaking innovations in GPU-accelerated decision optimization, including primal-dual linear programming (PDLP) and mixed-integer linear programming (MILP) heuristics. These advancements  deliver order-of-magnitude speedups and record-breaking solutions for real-world challenges.
In this session, you'll:

title: Advance Surgical Imaging: Explore Software-Defined Video Pipelines for Enhanced Flexibility and AI Integration [S74534]
abstract: Traditional image processing in surgical systems often relies on specialized hardware, such as field-programmable gate arrays, to handle tasks from sensor data acquisition to image formation. While effective, this hardware-centric approach limits flexibility, scalability, and integration with AI. We'll explore how transitioning to software-defined imaging pipelines addresses these challenges, offering greater adaptability across diverse camera and sensor types while enabling advanced AI-driven capabilities. We'll also discuss the trade-offs between hardware and software implementations, and the transformative potential of NVIDIA’s ecosystem in accelerating this shift.

title: Advancing AI in Healthcare: The Power of Holoscan Sensor Bridge and IGX [EXS75113]
abstract: Reducing AI processing latency is critical for industries relying on real-time decision-making. Holoscan Sensor Bridge delivers an innovative solution by dramatically lowering input latency, enabling faster AI inference and real-time responsiveness. We'll explore how this breakthrough technology is transforming healthcare and industrial automation, unlocking new possibilities in AI-assisted diagnostics, surgical guidance, and defect detection.

title: Advancing AI Reasoning: From Games to Complex Problem Solving [S73862]
abstract: The evolution of artificial intelligence has seen remarkable milestones, particularly in developing systems capable of advanced reasoning. This panel will explore the journey from AI mastering strategic games to tackling complex, real-world problems. We will delve into the significance of integrating deliberate, System 2 thinking into AI models, enabling them to process information more thoroughly and solve intricate tasks. The discussion will highlight the challenges and breakthroughs in enhancing AI’s reasoning capabilities, the role of reinforcement learning and self-play in training, and the implications of these advancements for future applications. By examining case studies and their performance in complex reasoning tasks, we aim to shed light on the current state and future directions of AI reasoning research.

title: Advancing AI to Build the Most-Trusted Driver [S72844]
abstract:
We'll present some of Waymo's latest AI research, with a focus on expanding the capabilities of Waymo's autonomous vehicle stack, and those of the simulator that helps Waymo evaluate their performance and safety.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Advancing AI Workloads with PCIe Gen6 and New System Architectures (Presented by Micron Technology) [S74471]
abstract: Join us for an in-depth session on the latest advancements in AI infrastructure, focusing on PCIe Gen6 technology and innovative system architectures driven by AI demands. Learn how the NVIDIA H100 GPU, leveraging NVIDIA GPUDirect Storage (GDS), achieves impressive data transfer rates over a PCIe Gen6 switch to Micron’s PCIe Gen6 data center SSDs. We will discuss the escalating storage requirements for AI workloads and the critical role of Gen6 storage solutions. Data from Astera Labs will showcase the performance of GDS on the Scorpio Switch connected to Micron PCIe Gen6 drives. Understand the cutting-edge network and deployment requirements for NVIDIA MGX-based systems. We will present the latest data on the NVIDIA GH200 Grace Hopper™ system, highlighting storage connectivity through NVIDIA BlueField®-3 DPU and the benefits of GDS. Additionally, we will demonstrate the power savings achieved by MGX systems compared to standard servers equipped with the NVIDIA H100 GPU.

title: Advancing Automotive Factory Planning at BMW With AI-Enabled Digital Twins [S71550]
abstract: Join us to explore how BMW delivers factory planning applications, built on NVIDIA Omniverse and OpenUSD, to an industrial scale, transitioning from on-premises GPUs to fully managed, high-performance cloud infrastructure, supporting hundreds of our factory planners. We’ll share how BMW developers built an integrated ecosystem and data pipeline, automating processes such as file conversion, authoring system integration, and file validity management. Additionally, we’ll showcase our suite of adapted and custom extensions developed for tasks like clash detection and scene segmentation. Finally, learn how our teams are pushing innovation with LLM-powered solutions like our intelligent assistant to seamlessly navigate complex factory environments and enhance usability.

title: Advancing AV Development With Sensor Simulation and Cosmos [DD40002]
abstract: Learn how the NVIDIA Omniverse Blueprint for AV Simulation and Cosmos are enabling AV developers to enhance their simulation workflows and solve the most important problems in AV development and testing. This session will feature workflows developed by NVIDIA's AV simulation ecosystem partners for scenario creation, synthetic data generation, 3D reconstruction and closed loop simulation.

title: Advancing Data Center Infrastructure to Support High-Density AI Requirements (Presented by EdgeConneX) [S74197]
abstract: Deep dive into the evolution in data center deployment methodologies to support liquid cooling infrastructure within the physical data center environment. Gain insights into the emerging challenges faced by the industry and the future direction for designing adaptable data center architectures that can evolve with future technological innovations.

title: Advancing Data Center Infrastructure to Support High-Density AI Requirements (Presented by EdgeConneX) [S74197]
abstract: Deep dive into the evolution in data center deployment methodologies to support liquid cooling infrastructure within the physical data center environment. Gain insights into the emerging challenges faced by the industry and the future direction for designing adaptable data center architectures that can evolve with future technological innovations.

title: Advancing Driving and Vehicle Safety by Harnessing AI, Data, and Software [S72943]
abstract: Join Volvo Cars and Zenseact for a technical deep dive into their journey toward a software-defined technology stack. Learn how they tackled architectural challenges, leveraged deep learning to enhance driver assistance systems, and optimized iterative development cycles to deliver scalable, safety-critical solutions. Gain practical insights into deploying advanced technologies that drive innovation in vehicle safety.

title: Advancing Driving and Vehicle Safety by Harnessing AI, Data, and Software [S72943]
abstract: Join Volvo Cars and Zenseact for a technical deep dive into their journey toward a software-defined technology stack.
