title: Advancing GPU as a Service: Build a New Serverless Platform for AI-Native Cloud Applications (Presented by Vultr) [S74289]
abstract:
In the traditional world of cloud compute, multi-cloud architectures depend on leveraging Kubernetes as an abstraction layer for running containers across cloud compute providers. What happens, however, in the world of AI-native applications? Just as in cloud compute, we need Kubernetes as an abstraction layer to run containerized AI models across GPU providers in conjunction with running containerized application logic across CPU providers. A new serverless, GPU-based cloud compute platform is needed for building and running AI native applications on Kubernetes leveraging NVIDIA AI Enterprise and NVIDIA-powered AI model orchestration leveraging Run:AI.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Advancing Health and Improving Patient Outcomes With AI [S72849]
abstract:
The healthcare and life sciences industries generate more data than any other industry, representing immense potential for insights-driven optimization. The challenge lies in refining this diverse and vast raw data into actionable insights that can transform drug development and health outcomes. We'll delve into the pivotal role of AI foundries in healthcare, showing how companies are harnessing advanced technologies to discover and develop new personalized medicines faster, as well as ensure access to patients who need them.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Advancing Molecular Design with Deep Learning [S72646]
abstract:
Prof. Michael Bronstein and Prof. Bruno Correia present an exploration into how geometric deep learning is enabling protein and molecular design. Protein-based drugs, which rely on strong protein-protein interactions (PPIs), are increasingly important in modern medicine. The vast structural data available on PPIs allows machine learning models to operate effectively on proteins' complex, non-Euclidean surfaces.

In this session, Michael Bronstein and Bruno Correia will explore how geometric deep learning methods are advancing functional protein design. Key applications include predicting interface sites, classifying binding pockets, and identifying surface motifs. The talk will also highlight collaborative efforts with the EPFL Lab of Protein Design and Immunoengineering and AITHYRA, a Research Institute for Biomedical Artificial Intelligence founded by Austrian Academy of Sciences.

title: Advancing Robot Navigation With Real-Time Voice-Guided Commands and Natural Language [P72385]
abstract: See a novel real-time, voice-guided robot navigation method that transforms natural language directives into precise actions using a Contextual Spatial Cognition Module (CSCM). By integrating speech-to-text models with NVIDIA's Isaac Sim and leveraging RTX 3080 Ti GPUs, we provide new solutions for improving robot control in dynamic, complex environments, enabling efficient obstacle avoidance and advancing human-robot collaboration.

title: Advancing Robot Navigation With Real-Time Voice-Guided Commands and Natural Language [P72385]

title: Advancing the Frontier of Medical Devices with Physical AI [S72948]
abstract: The healthcare sector is evolving rapidly, with medical devices, treatment facilities, and operating rooms transitioning toward fully robotic systems. We'll address the vital role of physical AI — models designed to understand, interact, and navigate within this new paradigm. Delve into the comprehensive workflows across training, simulation, and runtime that underpin these technological advances. We'll explore how platforms like MONAI, Omniverse, Isaac Lab, and Holoscan are critical in developing next-generation medical devices. These tools create a robust ecosystem for innovation, empowering you to lead in the transformation of healthcare. Join us to enhance your skills and contribute to the future of medical technology, where intelligent robotic systems are the norm.

title: Advancing the In-Car User Experience with Hybrid LLM Architecture [S72742]
abstract: Cerence AI is pioneering in-car innovation with Cerence xUI, its new, LLM-based AI assistant platform that will advance the next generation of agentic in-vehicle user experiences. xUI, built on Cerence’s CaLLM family of cloud and embedded LLMs and SLMs, leverages NVIDIA’s advanced AI technologies to offer efficient, accurate, and personalized responses, regardless of connectivity. In this panel, AI leaders from global automakers JLR and Renault will join Cerence AI and NVIDIA to discuss the future of AI-powered in-car assistants, including the importance of integrating embedded in-car models and cloud-hosted AI to deliver agentic experiences that make every journey safer, smarter, and more enjoyable.

title: Advancing Transaction Fraud Detection in Financial Services With NVIDIA RAPIDS on AWS [S72625]
abstract:
Transaction fraud detection is a $43 billion annual problem. AI for fraud detection uses multiple machine learning models to detect anomalies in customer behaviors and connections, as well as patterns of accounts and behaviors that fit fraudulent characteristics.

We'll discuss and share the optimal workflow with data ingestion, data processing and transformation, feature engineering, model training, model inference, and event sequence and notifications running on various open source ML frameworks, NVIDIA AI tools, Triton Inference Server on Amazon EKS or EC2 instances on NVIDIA GPUs. The cost to build features to train AI racks up into hundreds of millions of dollars. NVIDIA RAPIDS and RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark on Amazon EMR enable data processing to be 14X faster at 8X lower cost, compared to CPUs based on fraud detection data benchmarks.

title: A Flexible Framework for High-Quality, Real-Time Human Pose Estimation [P72345]
abstract: Real-time human pose (skeleton) estimation is crucial in many multimedia applications, such as surveillance, virtual/extended reality (VR/XR), and healthcare. We therefore propose a flexible framework for real-time human detection, tracking, and pose estimation. It combines robust person detection using Scaled-YoloV4, efficient optical-flow-based tracking, and the high-quality RTMPose algorithm for skeleton extraction. Experiments confirm that the algorithm performs well in challenging conditions, such as crowded scenes with substantial occlusion, and for different modalities (RGB camera video, thermal video, or rendered content).

title: Agentic AI at the Edge: Real-Time Sentiment Analysis for Engaging Customer Interaction [S72239]
abstract:
Discover an AI agent that reimagines customer interactions, turning physical spaces into engaging and personalized experiences. Using on-device Vision Transformers (ViTs) on NVIDIA Jetson, this solution performs real-time sentiment analysis to gauge audience reactions while providing relevant product contents and ensuring rapid responsiveness. It processes sensitive data locally, sending only anonymized metadata to the cloud via Kafka streams, and employs hybrid cloud reinforcement learning and generative AI to tailor advertisement content dynamically. Leveraging NVIDIA DeepStream for real-time video analytics and a closed-loop feedback mechanism, the system continuously improves interactions with customers to maximize their experiences and improve business ROI.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Agentic AI for Physical Operations [S72758]
abstract:
Envision an AI agent designed to interact with your warehouse—a complex logistical environment of autonomous robots, potential hazards, and workers. This session will demonstrate how we've harnessed the power of Spatial AI agents. These agents, leveraging natural language, provide operations teams with a deep understanding of their operating environments and reason-based processes optimization.

We’ll deep dive on building spatial AI agents to complement human operators managing complex operations, powered by NVIDIA NIMs, NVIDIA Llama Nemotron LLM, and NVIDIA Cosmos Nemotron VLM. These agents can quickly analyze and understand objects, spaces, geometry and spatial relationships in 3D, then can produce actionable, real-time intelligence to manage the flow of goods, optimize space utilization, improve process efficiency, and ensure worker safety. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Agentic AI in the Enterprise: Transform Business Operations (Presented by Infosys) [EXS74456]
abstract: Don’t miss this opportunity to learn how enterprises can enhance productivity, boost efficiency, and drive innovation co-working with agents in our fast-paced session on potential and impact of agentic AI on businesses across various sectors.

title: Agentic Architecture and Digital Human Capabilities for Complex Customer Support  [S72752]
abstract: Learn how agentic architecture, and digital human capabilities, can help solve complex customer support cases. We'll demonstrate a business use case in the context of a retirement plan provider, and how the firm aims to improve its retirement plan participant experience. We'll demonstrate two capabilities built jointly between Accenture and NVIDIA teams: a virtual advisor to support retirement plan participants, and an AI agent to assist human agents in the contact center supporting plan participants.

title: Agentic Cloud: Using Agents to Build Tomorrow’s Cloud (Presented by DigitalOcean) [EXS74250]
abstract: DigitalOcean is a cloud provider with more than 600,000 customers, including many growing tech companies. Learn how DO is using agents — a bleeding-edge innovation that will drive how we use generative AI — to improve the experience for cloud developers. We’ll also show why the use of agents allows DO to customize the cloud for its customers and, in turn, make AI simple enough for anyone to use. We'll talk about the key considerations in deploying agents within a cloud infrastructure, lessons learned from deploying it at massive scale, and how the company is operationalizing NVIDIA H100 and H200 GPUs for model training, inference, agents, and natural language interfaces.

title: AI-Accelerated Design: From Data Centers to Molecules (Presented by Cadence) [S74469]
abstract: We live in an age of limitless opportunity, driven by the engineers and scientists tacking the hard problems facing society. Being able to effectively leverage the latest in agentic AI solutions to solve your design and research challenges is critical. We'll cover how Cadence and NVIDIA solutions can help you in the full-stack of AI design: from data centers to edge devices and physical AI systems to the life sciences.

title: AI Accelerated Design: From Data Centers to Molecules (Presented by Cadence) [EXS74463]
abstract: We live in an age of limitless opportunity, driven by the engineers and scientists tacking the hard problems facing society.  Being able to effectively leverage the latest in agentic AI solutions to solve your design and research challenges is critical. title: AI-Accelerated Materials Discovery for Next-Generation Lithium Metal Batteries [S72864]
abstract: AI is revolutionizing the search and design of new molecules that will enable the next-generation lithium metal batteries (LMBs) to drive our energy future. We'll dive into SES's efforts and achievements in leveraging cutting-edge AI-techniques to rapidly explore molecular universe at magnitudes (10^11) beyond any scale ever attempted. Some of these molecules generated by AI techniques are already successfully synthesized and under test in electrochemical devices, demonstrating superior performances and revealing an encouraging future of AI-assisted materials design. This AI-driven materials discovery based on comprehensive mapping of molecular universe represents a breakthrough not only for energy storage technology, but in a broader sense for any industry sectors relying on organic materials, such as drug discovery, biomedicine, catalysts, or photo-/electro-chemicals.

title: AI Accelerating a Country: Advances from Gefion, an AI Supercomputer in Denmark [S72318]
abstract:
Learn about an exciting strategic collaboration that is bringing large-scale AI computing power to Denmark, and how the new AI supercomputer is accelerating the work of many innovators. The goal of the Danish Centre for AI Innovation (DCAI) is to accelerate research and innovation in fields from healthcare and life sciences to the green transition, supporting the development of innovative solutions to the world’s biggest problems. 

Hear from DCAI’s CEO Nadia Carlsten about what it takes to stand up one of world’s largest supercomputers, and how customers from academia, startups, and large companies are using this new facility to make headway in healthcare, life sciences, and quantum computing.

title: AI Accelerating a Country: Advances from Gefion, an AI Supercomputer in Denmark: Q&A From the EMEA Region [S72318a]
abstract:
Learn about an exciting strategic collaboration that is bringing large-scale AI computing power to Denmark, and how the new AI supercomputer is accelerating the work of many innovators. title: AI Agent-in-a-Box: Design and Deploy Robust Edge AI Applications (Presented by Inventec) [EXS74308]
abstract: Edge AI delivers low-latency responses and enhanced data security while operating within constrained computing resources. These edge devices serve as real-world AI agents capable of addressing diverse missions. We'll share our experiences in developing AI applications on high-performance servers and deploying solutions using edge AI boxes powered by NVIDIA Jetson platform. We'll explore real-world use cases, such as monitoring regional cloud and fog patterns, supporting medical diagnostics, detecting anomalies in production lines, and utilizing robots for assembly operations. Furthermore, we'll outline our decision-making process for selecting and optimizing algorithms to balance resource constraints with user expectations, ensuring optimal performance, efficiency, and reliability across various scenarios.

title: AI Agents and Digital Humans Shaping the Future of Interaction in Telecoms [S72988]
abstract:
The integration of AI agents and digital humans is transforming industries by redefining how organizations engage with customers and streamline operations. We'll delve into the cutting-edge developments and challenges in deploying digital human agents and AI-driven solutions across various domains in the telecommunications industry.

Alan Dennis, from Kelley School of Business, will present insights from his groundbreaking research on the effectiveness and user perceptions of digital human agents compared to chatbots and human agents. His studies, which include neurophysiological and behavioral analysis, highlight the promise and pitfalls of current digital human technologies and their potential to overcome algorithm aversion.

Complementing these academic perspectives, two executives from leading telco solution providers will share their experiences and strategies for leveraging AI agents to enhance network operations and customer experience in telecommunications. The panel will discuss real-world applications, showing the practical and transformative impact of AI in this sector.

title: AI Agents for Real-Time Video Understanding and Summarization: Q&A From the EMEA Region [S72784a]
abstract: The NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization enables the creation of interactive analytical agents that reason through massive amounts of video, assess physical processes, and provide decision-making insights to streamline operations. The blueprint combines powerful vision language models, large language models, and NeMo retriever into a full suite of software for building, fine-tuning, and deploying a diverse set of visual understanding agents. These interactive AI Agents leverage real-time, multi-camera streaming and long-context understanding in our factories, warehouses, airports and cities — helping operations teams to make better decisions, faster, from richer insights and more natural interactions. Learn more about NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization and how you can customize and deploy on-premises or in the cloud.

title: AI Agents for Real-Time Video Understanding and Summarization [S72784]
abstract:
The NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization enables the creation of interactive analytical agents that reason through massive amounts of video, assess physical processes, and provide decision-making insights to streamline operations. The blueprint combines powerful Vision Language Models (VLMs), Large Language Models (LLMs), and NeMo retriever into a full suite of software for building, fine-tuning, and deploying a diverse set of visual understanding agents. These interactive AI Agents leverage realtime multi-camera streaming and long context understanding in our factories, warehouses, airports and cities - helping enable operations teams to make better decisions faster from richer insights and more natural interactions.
Learn more about NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization and how you can customize and deploy on-prem or in the cloud.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI Agents in Production: Insights and Future Directions [S72884]
abstract:
As a leading developer platform for generative AI orchestration, LangChain has been at the forefront of the journey of AI agents from experimental concepts to essential components in production systems. We'll cover key lessons learned from LangChain’s experience enabling customers to develop, deploy, and manage enterprise AI agents in production at scale, and will explore emerging technologies that will shape the future.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI Agents on the Road: Revolutionizing In-Vehicle Intelligence with NVIDIA NIM and RAG [S71213]
abstract: The automotive industry is evolving beyond static dashboards, AI agents are taking the wheel in delivering real-time intelligence. Join Dataloop and TCS  as we introduce a next-generation in-vehicle AI agent that continuously monitors vehicle health parameters and dashboard indicators, providing context-aware, real-time insights and actionable recommendations in a conversational interface. This intelligent co-pilot is built on Dataloop’s AI orchestration pipeline, integrating NVIDIA NIM microservices and a RAG framework to enhance response generation, decision-making, and user interaction. We’ll explore how TCS uses AI agents that transform mobility, offering personalized, proactive support for drivers and fleet operators.

title: AI Agents: Shaping the Future of Cybersecurity [S72441]
abstract:
Generative AI is poised to revolutionize cybersecurity by deploying fleets of intelligent agents capable of continuously analyzing enterprise-wide data to detect and respond to threats in real-time. Join leading AI and security experts as they discuss how these AI agents are set to fundamentally transform the landscape of cybersecurity.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI and AFM-Assisted Structure Prediction of Protein Complexes [P74391]
abstract: We introduce a novel approach for protein structure prediction using atomic force microscopy (AFM) images. Taking advantage of latest deep learning methods like transformers, diffusion models, and neural radiance fields (NeRFs) with AFM images, gives another fast and economical approach for  protein structure prediction.

title: AI as a Disruptive Technology in Semiconductor Manufacturing: A Deep Learning Framework for Advanced Node Metrology and Defect Inspection [P74402]
abstract: The semiconductor manufacturing sector is witnessing a significant paradigm shift driven by the adoption of AI technologies. AI is being leveraged to optimize various aspects of semiconductor manufacturing, including process control, defect detection, yield improvement, and quality assurance. Its ability to analyze vast datasets in real time has made it a disruptive force in the industry. We'll share our journey, best practices, insights, and lessons learned from our ongoing AI R&D at imec, focused on advanced node metrology and defect inspection.

title: AI-Assisted Software Tool Support for C++ HPC Applications on NVIDIA GPUs [P73609]
abstract:
Automated tools for software development and performance tuning of C++ HPC applications are important because of the trend that these applications have significant code complexity, and that node architectures of top supercomputers seen on top500.org are increasingly heterogeneous and complex. We discuss our work on two automated tools that are assisted by modern AI technologies: 

1. CodeRosetta for CUDA: Source-to-source code transformation between C++ and CUDA, assisted by LLMs.
2. APEX for Kokkos CUDA: Auto-tuning for Kokkos programs using CUDA, assisted by k-means clustering for tuning parameter search strategies.

This work is unique because of its use of modern ML techniques and LLMs, and because it considers HPC applications using C++ performance portable programming library on NVIDIA GPUs rather than the CUDA library.

title: AI at Scale: Lessons from Capital One’s Agentic AI Adoption [S72858]
abstract:
Capital One is taking a well-managed approach to scaling enterprise AI in the regulated financial services industry. This fireside chat will discuss Capital One's development and adoption of generative and agentic AI technologies, highlighting key initiatives that balance innovation in customer experience with well-governed and risk-centered approaches. Discover how the company creates differentiated value through proprietary in-house AI development, including real-world examples of deploying multi-agentic systems that combine generative AI with rigorous validation frameworks. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI Content Creation: Steps Toward Applications in The Field (Presented by SoftServe) [S73075]
abstract: We'll showcase the collaboration between Avery Products and SoftServe in leveraging generative AI for content creation. The focus is on training intellectual property-compliant models to generate high-quality visuals, like packshots, for marketing and digital use. A key aspect is the integration of 3D digital twins, where products are scanned to create virtual replicas, ensuring consistency and accuracy across all marketing assets. We'll also cover video generation using NVIDIA AI Blueprints, enabling seamless narration and storytelling for products. This innovative approach enhances creative workflows while maintaining compliance and brand integrity.

title: AI Day Startup and VC Networking Hour [SE71164]
abstract: Join us for a networking hour to connect with founders, developers, and venture capitalists (VCs) after the conclusion of the AI Day sessions. This is your chance to exchange ideas, form valuable connections, and dive deeper into the world of AI with some of the brightest minds in the industry.

title: AI Developer Tools for Accelerated Computing — Scarce Data Isn't Scary! [S72867]
abstract: Learn how we're creating coding tools that empower and level up developers' accelerated coding abilities (CUDA skills, profiling, and optimizing) by building high-quality validation harnesses, intuitive user experiences, and a flywheel for AI and GPU expertise. And find out when they'll be in your hands.

title: AI-Driven Code Evolution: Unlocking Next-Level Performance [S72816]
abstract: As AI-generated code becomes more prevalent, developers face the challenge of optimizing that code for specific hardware environments, particularly NVIDIA GPUs. Learn how context-aware AI code optimization is crucial for improving runtime performance, energy efficiency, and scalability in GPU-accelerated systems. We'll delve into techniques for adapting code to leverage NVIDIA’s unique parallel processing capabilities, enhancing performance across AI workloads while minimizing bottlenecks.

title: AI-Driven Data Centers: Optimizing Total AI Solutions in the AI Age With Ubitus (Presented by ASUSTek Computer Inc.) [S74184]
abstract: The rapid growth of artificial intelligence is transforming the data center landscape. ASUS explores the success of AI-driven data centers with Ubitus, where AI is leveraged to optimize operations, enhance efficiency, and reduce costs. We delve into key areas of optimization, including data center infrastructure planning, platform management, and building platform as a service to enable AI solutions. Through the lens of the Ubitus case study, we examine how a leading cloud technology provider is implementing these solutions to deliver superior performance and value in the AI age. This analysis highlights the transformative potential of AI in shaping the future of data center infrastructure.

title: AI-Driven Data Centers: Optimizing Total AI Solutions in the AI Age With Ubitus (Presented by ASUSTek Computer Inc.) [S74184]

title: AI-Driven Digital Twins: Real-Time Physics and Accelerated Simulation Using NVIDIA Technologies [S73028]
abstract:
This talk explores how Ansys leveraged NVIDIA Omniverse Blueprint for CAE using CUDA, Modulus, and Omniverse for the creation and deployment of digital twins. We'll dive into developing a high-fidelity CFD solver optimized for NVIDIA hardware (Grace, Hopper, Blackwell), enabling fast and accurate physics simulations. We'll then talk about the Integration of NVIDIA Modulus AI framework to easily build customized AI solutions that can improve designer productivity and quickly identify optimal design configurations. Finally, we'll show how we are leveraging Omniverse for real-time, photo-realistic visualization with examples. This combination of hardware and software solutions empowers engineers to build and deploy highly accurate digital twins with unprecedented speed, dramatically shortening product development cycles. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI-Driven End-to-End Solution for Floodborne Object Detection and Public Safety [P72661]
abstract: This poster presents an AI-driven, end-to-end solution for automatically detecting and tracking floodborne objects, enhancing public safety and disaster management. By using computer vision technologies and edge computing, this timely research addresses the gap in real-time monitoring of urban debris during floods, improving emergency response and mitigating health and environmental risks.

title: AI-Driven Network Diagnostics: Revolutionizing Telecom Troubleshooting (Presented by Tech Mahindra) [S74420]
abstract: The session will talk about how AI and digital twin technologies can streamline network diagnostics, dramatically reducing response times and operational expenses by providing a comprehensive, predictive approach to network management and maintenance.

title: AI-Driven Paradigms in Therapeutic Design for Drug Discovery [S72079]
abstract: This session showcases advancements in therapeutic drug design facilitated by artificial intelligence, from targeted gene therapies to small molecules and protein design. We'll highlight how AI is streamlining the design and delivery of genetic therapies with specific examples from Dyno Therapeutics, where accelerated foundation models help researchers develop capsid proteins targeting specific tissues. We'll also explore Cellarity's approach to integrating continuous reinforcement learning with single-cell omics data to tailor novel compounds that precisely influence disease cell states. Furthermore, we'll cover SyntheticGestalt's innovative use of a foundation model based on 3D structural data of billions of compounds, illustrating its significant impact on the accuracy and extrapolation of drug properties. We'll delve into the patterns of how these technologies not only accelerate the drug development process, but also enhance the specificity and efficacy of treatments, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the quest to cure human diseases.

title: AI-Driven Safety at the Edge: Minimize Industrial Incidents [S71452]
abstract: We'll explore the essential role of AI in enhancing workplace safety. We'll present a comprehensive overview of developing vision-based AI solutions at the edge to create safer and smarter industrial environments, significantly reducing the risk of incidents.

title: AI Economics: How Cyndx Kept 3B Requests in Budget (Presented by Cloudflare) [S74299]
abstract: The cost of developing, deploying, and scaling AI  is a critical factor in productizing AI. Paul Benton, director of data from Cyndx, will unlock the blueprint for productizing AI while staying on budget, to help business and technology leaders, engineers, and architects navigate today’s economic challenges and opportunities with AI.

title: AI, Energy, and Climate: Driving Sustainability and Energy Security [S72680]
abstract:
At a time when energy systems are under pressure and managing energy consumption is central to climate targets, the rise of generative AI has sparked concern about how much electricity AI systems use. We'll consider the data behind these concerns, and ask whether advances in the efficiency of AI technology can deliver sustainable innovation. We'll also consider the role of regulators in ensuring that the implementation of AI is aligned with climate and energy policy.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI for Humanoid Robots  [S73182]
abstract: Humanoid robotics hardware is seeing a major acceleration in progress. It's reasonable to expect commercially viable humanoid hardware to exist within three years. The question is, how do we build the AI that can make these robots helpful? Humanoids have high dimensional action spaces and high dimensional multimodal observation space, posing challenges to existing paradigms. We'll explore these challenges in more depth and highlight some promising paths forward.

title: AI for Safe and Efficient Trading in Electronic Markets [S72692]
abstract:
The problem of designing a trading strategy has traditionally been deconstructed into first making predictions ("alpha"), and then desperately deciding on trading actions with those predictions as input. As we approach a decade from the release of AlphaGo, and with the surge of interest in planning and reasoning in the context of large language models, we describe some the problems and opportunities in creating a true end-to-end trading strategy using AI.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI Frontiers: Shaping the Future of Our Communities [SE75028]
abstract: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing how communities function, offering transformative opportunities. This panel will explore AI’s potential to shape the future of communities by enhancing decision-making, infrastructure, and engagement. AI-driven tools are optimizing urban planning, improving public services, robotics, and fostering sustainable development. By integrating human creativity with AI’s capabilities, communities can leverage this technology to build resilient, inclusive, and sustainable futures.

title: AI in Action: Improving Customer Service Across Industries With Agentic AI [S73054]
abstract:
AI agents are improving customer support by enhancing self-service capabilities and automating routine communications. Explore the strategies and challenges behind successful AI agent deployments through real-world use cases from the retail, financial services, and healthcare sectors. Gain practical advice to help you enhance customer experiences, derive data-driven insights, and improve efficiency and productivity.

abstract: Explore strategies for building and managing an efficient AI infrastructure that streamlines both training and inference. In this panel discussion, industry leaders will discuss how they leverage NVIDIA and Google Cloud's AI solutions to optimize resource utilization, reduce costs, and improve the overall performance of their AI applications.

title: AI Inference Infrastructure: From Parameters to Production (Presented by Baseten) [S74245]
abstract: Building production infrastructure to serve generative AI models is a new type of multidisciplinary engineering problem that combines applied model performance research, distributed hardware orchestration, and tasteful developer experience engineering. We’ll walk from raw model weights to highly optimized model inference engines, grow these engines into globally available services, and establish repeatable processes for maintaining rapidly-evolving systems.

title: AI Inferencing using NIM with Serverless GPUs (Presented by Microsoft) [S74603]
abstract: In the rapidly evolving world of AI, companies face challenges in incorporating AI into their applications due to the need for rapid upskilling and adapting to new models. Learn how NVIDIA NIM, provided as containerized microservices, offer cutting-edge AI models optimized for specific scenarios. By inferencing these models with serverless GPUs, developers can streamline the deployment and management of AI solutions. Learn about the benefits of using NVIDIA Blueprints for key AI use cases, and how to leverage Azure's autoscaling platform to enhance your applications with AI capabilities.

title: AI Innovations Driving Economic Growth [S73782]
abstract: In this panel, you’ll hear from companies who are leveraging technologies from conversational AI to multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) to drive innovation in healthcare, agriculture, and education. Hear from specialists from a diverse range of industries working to support farmers, improve healthcare outcomes, and expand access to education. We'll delve into the technologies making these advancements possible and share real-world examples highlighting practical applications. We'll discuss the challenges and opportunities of implementing AI solutions, the impact already being seen, and the ongoing potential of these innovations.

title: AI Meets Robotics: European Startup Showcase [S73752]
abstract: Learn how five innovative European startups are developing robotics and automation systems accelerated by NVIDIA platforms to deliver world-class solutions. Learn how their real-world applications are using next-generation technologies at the intersection of robots, sensors, and artificial intelligence. Discover how these innovations are transforming industries by simplifying the development and utilization of autonomous systems across manufacturing, healthcare, and beyond.

title: AI on Location: Deploying Mobile Private Networks and Edge Compute for Next Gen Content Pipelines [S72513]
abstract: This session will explore the integration of containerized cloud applications running locally with NVIDIA Holoscan for Media to drive innovative new broadcast workflows. Using Verizon’s 5G Private Network with Enterprise AI solution, users will be able to take advantage of cloud and software-driven workflows on locally deployable hardware, enabling cutting edge workflows on an IP-secure environment while minimizing the need for specialized hardware. Explore how you can build a workflow that leverages NIMs alongside cutting edge technologies like SMPTE 2110, 5G wireless video & AI analysis to create new and exciting broadcast pipelines.

title: AI on Location: Deploying Mobile Private Networks and Edge Compute for Next Gen Content Pipelines [S72513]

title: AI-Powered Art: The Influence of Robots on Creative Expression [S71191]
abstract:
While artists can work with AI as a tool, a collaborator, or a muse, when a robot is added to the mix, artists are defining what role the robot will play in their creative practice. For some, like Emanuel Gollob, his robot synchronizes with the observer’s brainwaves and helps them “do nothing” and daydream. Artist Alex Reben uses robots and AI as executors of his conceptual works, a means to an end that couldn't have been achieved without the use of this technology. Catie Cuan develops interactions with robots, by first designing the robot to move and feel in a way that complements her vision, and then the way she and the audience experience that interaction builds further on her creative voice. And BREAKFAST transforms real-time data from the natural world to tell stories through his kinetic artworks. By understanding how artists use robots, we can learn more about the cultural impact of using robots for certain experiences. We can also teach the public about robotics and AI, and we can inspire innovative applications in other fields.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI-Powered Robotics: Forging the Future of Intelligent Automation [S72529]
abstract:
Attend this lightning talk session to gain a comprehensive understanding of the current state of AI-enabled robotics and automation, as well as a glimpse into the future of smart manufacturing.

As we enter a new era of industrial automation, the integration of artificial intelligence, advanced robotics, and smart manufacturing technologies is revolutionizing the production landscape. This session brings together industry leaders to explore the cutting-edge developments at the intersection of AI, robotics, and industrial automation. 

Experts will discuss the integration of AI into autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) and industrial robot arms, and the development of more intuitive robotic systems. They will share how their companies are leveraging AI technologies to enhance robotic capabilities, improve autonomous systems, and optimize manufacturing processes.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI Promise to Profits: Maximize Business ROI with Accelerated Computing  (Presented by IBM) [S74483]
abstract: AI looks like a goldmine waiting to be tapped, but many organizations are discovering that success hinges on their ability to wrangle their data. Unlock, accelerate, and protect your data with the NVIDIA accelerated computing platform to minimize costs, address ethical dilemmas, and overcome technical hurdles that make sustainable monetization of AI tricky. We'll discuss how to solve for common AI delivery model challenges and accelerate time-to-value with customer-facing AI workloads that leverage NVIDIA technologies.

title: AI-RAN in Action [S72987]
abstract: Two AI trends are driving the need for an AI-enabled infrastructure at the 5G/6G radio access network (RAN) edge. Inferencing for generative AI and AI agents requires AI compute infrastructure to be distributed from edge to central clouds. At the same time, it's clear that the RAN is evolving to an AI-native infrastructure. The AI-RAN brings these trends to fruition, providing an accelerated computing infrastructure that accelerates both radio signal processing and AI workloads. In the past six months, both Softbank in Japan and T-Mobile in the United States have taken leading roles toward transforming their networks to AI-RAN. Our panel will explore the motivations and practicalities of delivering a commercial grade AI-RAN network to transform commercial return on investment and increase spectral efficiency, network capacity, and network utilization.

title: AI-Ready Data Centers: Integrated and Intelligent for High-Performance Workloads (Presented by Schneider Electric) [S74468]
abstract: The impact of high-density compute has fundamentally changed data center design. Higher density means more power, more heat, and more cooling. As the rack density of AI workloads increases, the physical infrastructure needed to support it changes as well. Join us as we discuss end-to-end AI-ready data center designs, high performance power trains, and cooling solutions needed for AI loads.

title: AI-Ready Data Centers: Integrated and Intelligent for High-Performance Workloads (Presented by Schneider Electric) [S74468]
abstract: The impact of high-density compute has fundamentally changed data center design. Higher density means more power, more heat, and more cooling. title: AI Research Careers: From Research to Reality [S73849]
abstract: Hear a panel of pioneering AI researchers share their personal journeys and the transformative impact of their work. Get insights into how their research has revolutionized real-world applications of AI, from generative AI and robotics to digital twins to urban planning, and more. Discover the challenges and triumphs of AI research. Discover the pathways to success in AI research, garnering motivation and actionable advice from those who've shaped the field, ensuring that you'll leave inspired and equipped to embark on your own AI research journey.

Get insights into how their research has revolutionized real-world applications of AI, from generative AI and robotics to digital twins to urban planning, and more. Discover the challenges and triumphs of AI research. Discover the pathways to success in AI research, garnering motivation and actionable advice from those who've shaped the field, ensuring that you'll leave inspired and equipped to embark on your own AI research journey.

title: AIRSPEED: 用于具身智能的开源通用数据生产平台 [S74390]
abstract: 具身智能依赖于有效的数据采集，但面临高成本、场景受限和缺乏数据集标准等挑战。为了解决这些问题，我们推出了 AIRSPEED，一个用于具身人工智能数据生产的开源的平台。AIRSPEED 通过软硬件解耦以降低成本，支持多种设备进行多样化的数据收集，支持通过仿真平台进行合成数据生成，并自动化数据集构建。它包括三个服务：用于真实世界数据的数据采集服务、用于合成数据的数据生成服务和用于构建金字塔结构数据集的数据集构建服务。AIRSPEED 旨在提高数据生产效率和质量，从而改善具身智能模型的性能。我们的实验证实了 AIRSPEED 在提高数据生产效率方面的有效性。源代码和更多关于 AIRSPEED 的详细信息可以在这里找到：https://github.com/airs-admin/airspeed

title: AI Safety for Ecommerce in Emerging Markets [S72559]
abstract: Learn about safeguarding emerging pipelines that leverage AI-generated content for ecommerce workflows and enhancing the safety layer to include cultural and political nuances specific to internet retail in the Indian subcontinent by integrating NeMo Guardrails into the content moderation suite. We'll demonstrate the advantages of programmable rails for content moderation and topic modeling with NeMo Guardrails in Flipkart's AI-assisted customer service workflows for ecommerce.

title: AI’s Enterprise Breakthrough: Delivering Real-Time Intelligence at Scale (Presented by VAST Data, Inc.) [S74355]
abstract:
Learn how enterprises can overcome the constraints of retrieval-augmented generation pipelines to enable secure, real-time, AI-powered decision-making. We'll showcase a universal view into all of an enterprise’s structured and unstructured data to achieve advanced AI-enabled decision-making.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI’s Enterprise Moment: Enterprise AI Breakthrough - Data comes alive! (Presented by VAST Data, Inc.) [S74356]
abstract: Join VAST Data and Deloitte as they demonstrate how enterprises can break through the limitations of RAG pipelines to achieve secure, real-time, AI-driven decision-making. Learn how VAST’s Platform, Deloitte’s AI strategy, and NVIDIA’s accelerated computing work together to power enterprise-scale AI with real-time indexing, seamless data integration, and zero-trust security.

title: AI's Next Frontier: Taking Autonomy from Digital to Physical Reality [S73038]
abstract:
We'll explore the exciting potential of generative AI beyond the digital realm, delving into its real-world applications and the challenges innovators face in deploying safe, scalable, and robust AI systems in the physical world. Through examples like autonomous vehicles, warehouse drones, and more, you'll gain insights into the transformative power of AI and the groundbreaking work being done to push its boundaries.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AI’s toughest tasks: Lessons from Scaling Enterprise AI from Edge to Exascale (Presented by HPE) [S74331]
abstract: Unlock the secrets to overcoming the often-overlooked challenges of enterprise AI deployments at all stages of development and deployment with actionable advice and real-world demonstrations showcasing customer successes and use cases including chatGPT clones, GitHub Copilot Clones, Text-To-SQL, RAG and more.

title: AI to ROI with CDW and NVIDIA (Presented by CDW) [EXS74325]
abstract: Let CDW guide you through your journey to unlock the value of your data with cloud, hybrid, and managed services expertise. Our partnership means you have access to experts who understand how to keep your data secure and accessible while reaping the benefits of AI innovation.

title: AI Training Fault Self-Healing (Presented by RunSun) [S74189]
abstract: Full-chain monitoring is the foundation of AI training fault self-healing, enabling comprehensive detection of critical anomalies from data loading to model output. Through intelligent anomaly detection and dynamic scheduling, the self-healing mechanism quickly identifies and resolves hardware, software, or system-level faults. In practice, fault recovery time is reduced by 80%, system stability is enhanced, and resource utilization and training efficiency are significantly improved.

title: AI Unleashed: Physical AI Meets Agentic AI (Presented by LTIMindtree) [S74065]
abstract: Ready to revolutionize your operations? Combining Physical AI with Agentic AI is a game-changer for your business. Imagine having systems that not only interact seamlessly with the physical world but also make autonomous decisions in line with your business objectives. This powerful combination boosts efficiency, adaptability, and innovation across various applications. Combining Physical AI’s ability to handle tasks requiring direct manipulation of objects and environments with Agentic AI’s decision-making prowess creates autonomous systems that perform complex tasks effortlessly. Picture a smart factory robot adapting to real-time production changes. Ultimately, integrating Physical AI with Agentic AI empowers your systems to be more intelligent, versatile, and capable of tackling dynamic challenges in the real world. LTIMindtree is taking our clients to the Future. Faster. Together. Join us!

title: AI Unlocked: Foundations for a Secure Innovation Era (Presented by Trend Micro) [S74455]
abstract: With AI accelerating at a staggering pace, we face a crucial question: how do we foster groundbreaking advancements while ensuring robust cybersecurity against evolving threats? We'll explore the intersection of AI and cybersecurity, focusing on balancing innovation with effective risk management, leveraging agentic AI for adaptive defenses, and accelerating outcomes with NVIDIA AI technologies. You'll leave armed with insights and tools to make informed decisions and stay protected confidently in the AI era.

title: Aivres DevOps AI Platform: End-to-End AI Infra. Solution (Presented by Aivres) [S74274]
abstract: To efficiently deploy NVIDIA NIM services, Aivres has a DevOps AI platform for enterprise to provide control and visibility into your AI infrastructure, workloads, and users. This platform enables the management of multiple device platforms, and efficiently allocates and optimizes AI computing resources to allow the easy, efficient deployment of NIM services, providing a one-stop AI business management platform at enterprise level, and supporting the rapid iteration and online application of models.

title: AI 创业企业在中国的发展与助力 [S73846]
abstract: NVIDIA 初创加速计划来到中国已 10 年之久，其伴随和经历了 AI 行业在中国的重要成长阶段。在此章节中我们将向大家介绍 NVIDIA 初创加速计划如何与生态合作伙伴共同助力中国创业企业成长。同时 3 家会员企业将分享他们如何利用创新技术推动行业变革，为社会创造更大价值。

title: AI 如何加速赋能汽车工业设计 How AI is Revolutionizing Automotive Industrial Design [S71562]
abstract:
探索 AI 如何改变汽车设计流程，重点关注三个关键领域：
使用 NVIDIA Modulus 进行空气动力学预测，显著减少传统计算方法所需的时间成本，提升分析效率。
在 Omniverse 中可视化风阻预测结果，帮助决策者更直观地理解空气动力学表现，从而做出更精准的设计优化和性能改进决策。
利用 Stable Diffusion 生成汽车内饰设计样式参考，能够为造型创意设计提供多样化的灵感，快速探索不同风格和元素组合。
我们将指导您了解 AI 在汽车设计中的实际应用，并就这些先进技术如何重塑行业提供见解。
Explore how AI is transforming the automotive design process with a focus on three key areas: using NVIDIA Modulus for aerodynamic prediction, visualizing these predictions in Omniverse, and leveraging Stable Diffusion to generate car interior designs as styling references. We'll guide you through the practical applications of AI in automotive design, offering insights into how these advanced technologies are reshaping the industry.

title: A Journey to Improved LLM Serving Performance [S72029]
abstract: Achieve exceptional performance by deploying and serving large language models for your business applications. We’ll demonstrate how we leverage advanced inference techniques and production-ready runtime engines to achieve efficient LLM serving within Generative AI Hub. You’ll learn best practices for optimizing LLM inference performance, as well as how we reduce latency and increase throughput for a superior user experience. Discover how we simplify LLM deployment process and rapidly integrate new LLMs into Generative AI Hub to fuel business applications. Let’s explore how to unlock the full potential of LLMs and deliver outstanding AI experiences for your enterprise.

title: Al-Driven Assistance for Critical Medical Procedures Using Real-Time Machine Learning [P73462]
abstract: We present IntuBlade, an AI-powered video laryngoscope designed to enhance emergency intubation by providing real-time guidance and overcoming traditional limitations in critical care settings. Explore how our innovative device, developed with NVIDIA technology, offers advanced solutions like anatomical tagging, low-light enhancement, and augmented reality (AR) simulation, with the potential to improve intubation success rates and streamline procedures in diverse medical environments.

title: Al-Driven Assistance for Critical Medical Procedures Using Real-Time Machine Learning [P73462]
abstract: We present IntuBlade, an AI-powered video laryngoscope designed to enhance emergency intubation by providing real-time guidance and overcoming traditional limitations in critical care settings. Explore how our innovative device, developed with NVIDIA technology, offers advanced solutions like anatomical tagging, low-light enhancement, and augmented reality (AR) simulation, with the potential to improve intubation success rates and streamline procedures in diverse medical environments.

title: AlphaBind: A Domain-Specific Model to Predict and Optimize Antibody-Antigen Binding Affinity [P73510]
abstract: We present AlphaBind, a domain-specific model for guided affinity optimization of parental antibodies that achieves state-of-the-art performance by utilizing protein language model embeddings from NVIDIA BioNeMo ESM-2nv and pre-training on millions of quantitative antibody-antigen binding measurements in vitro. We demonstrate (with in vitro validation) that an AlphaBind-powered antibody optimization pipeline delivers candidates with substantially improved binding affinity across four parental antibodies.

title: A Multimodal Large Language Model to Bridge Natural Language and Protein Sequences for Protein Engineering [P73522]
abstract: TourSynbio-7B is introduced as the first multimodal large language model designed specifically for protein engineering without external protein encoders, leveraging the natural similarities between protein sequences and language. Trained on a massive protein-text dataset and fine-tuned with instructions, it outperforms GPT-4 on protein-related tasks. Combined with TourSynbio-Agent, it provides a unified interface for various protein engineering tasks and has demonstrated practical success in wet lab applications, improving efficiency and outcomes in enzyme modification experiments.

title: An AI-Driven System for Large-Scale Digital Pathology Annotation and Characterization [P73579]
abstract: We offer a software solution and deep learning approach for leveraging the structural heterogeneity found in histopathology images when answering disease-related questions.

title: An AI Team Lead’s Guide: Drive Developer Teams' Excellence [S73837]
abstract:
AI is in the active implementation phase across all industries, and the pressure on developer teams is high because business is pushing to deliver advanced solutions fast. Lack of skills is still one of the top barriers for AI implementation, and technical leaders across the world need to recruit bright talents and then upskill and maintain them to achieve results and provide opportunity for staff personal development. 

Our panel will discuss where to find the right skills, how to  implement the learning paths to grow the hottest skills in the market within your team and validate their knowledge, and how to interact with the wider ecosystem by learning about successful examples of national AI projects. If you're a developer considering the next step in your career, or a business leader exploring ways to ensure your teams have the skills needed to tackle new workloads, this session is for you.

title: Analyzing and Visualizing Large Data Interactively Using Accelerated Computing [DLIT74336]
abstract:
In this lab we'll explore how to accelerate visualization of large data using common visualization packages used in key industries. Such visualizations can deliver powerful insights in an intuitive way and can make results more approachable to a wider audience.
Prerequisite(s):

Python, data analysis.

title: An Enterprise-Ready AI Platform: Unlocking Real-Time Insights at Scale [S72206]
abstract:
Enterprises are increasingly adopting Gen-AI to transform operations and deliver actionable insights, but existing solutions often fall short of meeting the demands for scalability, security, and real-time performance required by the enterprise. In this session, we introduce the VAST InsightEngine with NVIDIA, a comprehensive, purpose-built Gen-AI platform that integrates NVIDIA inference microservices (NIMs) with the VAST Data Platform to address these challenges.

Designed to support both structured and unstructured data at a massive scale, the VAST Insight Engine delivers real-time pipeline orchestration and AI inference as a service, creating a one-stop solution for enterprise AI. It enables enterprises to build custom pipelines suited to their needs and also leverage pre-built AI pipelines.  Additionally, we will give an overview of several industry use cases from multi-modal RAG through vision language models. Finally, we describe a robust multimodal RAG pipeline powered by the VAST InsightEngine.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: A New Era of Generalist Robotics: The Rise of Humanoids — Q&A From the EMEA Region [S72543a]
abstract: The ChatGPT of robotics has arrived. Humanoid robots will be one of the largest form-factor deployments of generalist robotics the world has ever seen. Hear from luminaries across some of the world's leading humanoid robotics companies about their outlook on the future of humanoid robotics, and what it'll take from foundation models, simulation technology, and computing to get there.

title: A New Horizon of AI-Driven Autonomous Operations for the Energy Industry [S72501]
abstract:
The use of AI in process control brings a new horizon for the autonomous plant. An AI controller can minimize human intervention in processes with superior capability than conventional closed loop and advanced control technologies.

AVEVA and NVIDIA have partnered to create an AI-driven solution for the energy industry that provides autonomous plant control through not only steady-state, but also complex transient conditions, such as changing feed levels, startups, and unplanned disruptions. This cutting-edge solution leverages AVEVA’s Dynamic Simulation as an accurate digital replica of the process plant to safely and quickly train NVIDIA’s Raptor Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) agent. Results show that DRL agents are an extremely promising addition to process control technology to bring reliable and repeatable operation during complicated events, reducing the operator workload and the vulnerability to lost production.

title: A New Horizon of AI-Driven Autonomous Operations for the Energy Industry [S72501]
abstract:

AVEVA and NVIDIA have partnered to create an AI-driven solution for the energy industry that provides autonomous plant control through not only steady-state, but also complex transient conditions, such as changing feed levels, startups, and unplanned disruptions. This cutting-edge solution leverages AVEVA’s Dynamic Simulation as an accurate digital replica of the process plant to safely and quickly train NVIDIA’s Raptor Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) agent. Results show that DRL agents are an extremely promising addition to process control technology to bring reliable and repeatable operation during complicated events, reducing the operator workload and the vulnerability to lost production.

title: A New Path to Embodied AI [S72594]
abstract: Building general-purpose embodied intelligence has been a core goal of AI since its inception 70 years ago. The field has evolved through multiple hypotheses, beginning with search as a solution, followed by knowledge-based systems, and, most recently, leveraging large language models for robotics. Yet, the challenge of creating generalist embodied agents capable of performing thousands of tasks across diverse environments remains unsolved. Building such a generalist robotic agent presents a "chicken-and-egg" problem: to train agents for generalization, we need vast amounts of robotic/agent data from varied environments, but gathering such data is impractical without deploying robots/agents that already generalize. I propose a new framework that leverages alternative sources of "indirect" supervision to build robotic agents from the ground up. I'll focus on three key principles: (1) How to generate self-supervised data for training robots? (2) How to bootstrap robot learning by observing human videos? and (3) How can robots learn to adapt via large-scale training in simulation? I'll demonstrate this framework's potential for scaling robotics AI through several case studies.

title: An Introduction to Building Humanoid Robots [S72590]
abstract:
Developers are building more intelligent, responsive, and efficient humanoid robots capable of transforming industries such as manufacturing, healthcare, and retail. NVIDIA is building Isaac GR00T — a platform for developing humanoid robots. 

Isaac GR00T has four parts: robot foundation models for cognition and control, simulation frameworks built on NVIDIA Omniverse and Cosmos, data pipelines for generating synthetic data and environments, and finally — a supercomputer in the robot Jetson AGX Thor. This engaging session will cover the latest advancements in each of the four pillars of the platform built by NVIDIA Research and Engineering through concrete use cases and examples. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: An Introduction to NVIDIA Cosmos for Physical AI [DLIT74500]
abstract:
In this introductory, hands-on course, learners will explore NVIDIA Cosmos™, a platform of generative world foundation models (WFM), advanced tokenizers, guardrails, and an accelerated data processing and curation pipeline built to accelerate the development of physical AI.
Prerequisite(s):

An understanding of AI model training, fine tuning, and deep learning frameworks.
Experience with Python programming.
Basic experience with 3D software and workflows.

title: An Introduction to NVIDIA Cosmos World Foundation Models [S72431]
abstract:
NVIDIA Cosmos is transforming how robots and autonomous vehicles learn, accelerating physics-aware synthetic video generation with world foundation models. Join Ming-Yu, NVIDIA’s VP of Generative AI Research, to see how Cosmos is democratizing physical AI development—giving developers open models and tools to build custom world models faster than ever.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: An Introduction to OpenUSD [S72488]
abstract: Universal Scene Description is much more than just a file format. This open, powerful, easily extensible world composition framework has APIs for creating, editing, querying, rendering, simulating, and collaboration within highly complex 3D scenes. NVIDIA continues to invest in helping evolve USD for workflows beyond media & entertainment to enable industrial digitalization workflows and the next wave of computer vision and generative AIs. Join this session to learn about the latest developments from NVIDIA and our next major milestones.

title: Announcing Mujoco-Warp and Newton: How Google DeepMind and NVIDIA are Supercharging Robotics Development [S72709]
abstract:
Physical AI models enable robots to autonomously perceive, interpret, reason, and interact with the physical world. Google integrates AI models into humanoid robots that execute tasks in real-world environments. To ensure effective operation in diverse and complex settings—such as various kitchen layouts—a ""simulation-first"" approach is essential.

Physics plays a crucial role in robotic simulation, providing the basis for accurate virtual representations of robot behavior and interactions within realistic environments. In this session, we will introduce Newton, an open-source, extensible, GPU-accelerated physics engine built on NVIDIA Warp, designed specifically for advancing robot learning and is result of deep collaboration between NVIDIA and Google DeepMind,. 

Learn how Google improved its simulation performance by integrating Newton into critical parts of its humanoid simulation pipeline.

title: Anonymized Network Sensing Graph Challenge [S72825]
abstract: The MIT/IEEE/Amazon Network Sensing Graph Challenge seeks to enable large, open, community-based approaches to protecting networks. Many large-scale networking problems can only be solved with community access to very broad datasets with the highest regard for privacy and strong community buy-in. This challenge provides an opportunity to highlight novel approaches for optimizing the construction and analysis of anonymized traffic matrices using over 100 billion network packets derived from the CAIDA internet telescope. A GraphBLAS reference implementation is provided to illustrate a well-defined context for demonstrating innovation. We'll show a simple solution that's entirely based on NVIDIA GPUs and open-source software. Our implementation is based on the RAPIDS ecosystem and achieves a 300X speedup for graph construction and a 178X speedup for calculating graph properties on a single GPU.

title: A Novel Antibody Design Platform Using Active Learning and Model-Based Reinforcement Learning [P72658]
abstract:
Therapeutic Antibodies have six complementary determining regions (CDRs). CDRs are flexible loops with unique binding characteristics compared to other protein interactions. Between the CDRs, there are framework regions (FWRs) that support CDRs.

Our research generates novel and antigen-specific antibodies by orchestrating CDR and FWR sequences. Additionally, we control the sequence similarity of generated antibodies to human antibody sequences to minimize undesired immune reactions. To do this, we use reward models that evaluate antibody properties. Reward models are improved by the wet lab assays using active learning. Also, we adopt antigen-antibody cross attention with chemical features to maximize the utilization of a small amount of data. Finally, three different antigens were tested through in vitro wet lab experiments to identify specific antibodies.

title: A Platform Engineering Approach to Composable AI-Native Applications (Presented by Vultr) [S74292]
abstract: In 2025, enterprises are accelerating deployment of new AI models to production. Enterprises are transforming every line of business function across industries, from healthcare to manufacturing to financial services, and more. ITOps, DevOps, and CloudOps teams are reorganizing to extend internal platform engineering teams to build a new foundation for an accelerating line of business solutions. We'll show how platform engineering teams can pre-compose AI-native "cloud stacks," leveraging Vultr and NVIDIA NIMs ad Run:AI for rapid innovation and deployment of new AI models at scale.

title: Application Optimization for NVIDIA Grace CPU [S72978]
abstract:
The NVIDIA Grace CPU, NVIDIA’s inaugural CPU for the data center, delivers exceptional performance whether paired with NVIDIA’s best-in-class data center GPU or combined with a second Grace CPU in the Grace Superchip. While offering impressive out-of-the-box performance and power efficiency, understanding and optimizing applications is essential to fully harness the capabilities of the Grace CPU.
We'll show how to optimize existing applications — ranging from HPC to data center workloads — to maximize their performance on Grace. We'll cover best practices, including recommendations on compiler options, performance libraries, and coding considerations for targeting the NVIDIA Grace CPU. Discover how to leverage developer tools to detect and bring to life optimization possibilities using a data-driven approach for real-world applications.

title: Applying AI Weather Models With NVIDIA Earth-2 [DLIT71336]
abstract:
Explore how NVIDIA Earth-2 facilitates efficient weather and climate modeling. Learn how to run a large and growing stack of global AI weather forecasting models and how downscaling models generate super-resolution outputs. Discover use cases and applications benefiting the most from this emerging technology.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic familiarity with Python.

title: Apply Multi-Node Multi-GPU Computing to HPO and Inference [DLIT71619]
abstract:
With ever-increasing amounts of data and limited compute resources, training competitive ML models end-to-end can take hours, days, or even weeks. Parallel computing offers a solution. Join us to learn how to reduce your end-to-end ML pipeline and increase model accuracy by parallelizing and distributing model training, hyperparameter optimization, and inference across GPUs.
Prerequisite(s):

Foundational understanding of a data science workflow on tabular data.
Experience with programming in Python.
Experience with the Pandas and scikit-learn API.

title: Architectural Design for 21st Century Cities with Zaha Hadid Architects [S71764]
abstract: Hear from Zaha Hadid Architects (ZHA), a pioneer in digital design, about how they're using Omniverse to scale their 45-year-old, innovation-focused practice globally. ZHA are using their field-tested architectural computation framework to customize Omniverse and streamline collaborative workflows across design, analysis, visualization, and construction. Their approach enables a high frequency of design iterations that is needed to meet the challenges of rapidly creating sustainable, yet engaging, cities and buildings for the 21st century.

title: A Scalable Approach Toward Trustworthy AI [S71986]
abstract: Learn how to scale the computation of trustworthiness assessment for diverse AI models and data types in a unified way. Based on concrete examples from computer vision and text generation, we'll show how the evaluation of biases and robustness can be leveraged to improve the safety and adoption of AI models in practice.

title: A Technical Deep Dive on the Joint Gen AI Platform VMware Private AI Foundation With NVIDIA (Presented by VMware by Broadcom) [S74478]
abstract: Hear from Broadcom and NVIDIA experts as they provide an in-depth technical deep dive into the joint Gen AI platform, VMware Private AI Foundation with NVIDIA. Explore detailed technical demos showcasing the platform's key capabilities. And don’t miss out — stay until the end for an exciting surprise!

title: Audio-Driven Facial Animation Technology for NVIDIA Audio2Face [S71082]
abstract: We'll describe the audio-driven facial technology that's used for NVIDIA Audio2Face. From its beginning to current models, we'll explain how it evolved and which techniques contributed to get to the current high-quality model. We also explain how the technique is deployed as product. Finally, we introduce the future direction of Audio2Face technology.

See how an electric car manufacturer can securely ask almost anything of their limited edition truck using speech AI and the next generation in XR user interfaces

title: Automate 3D Surgical Modeling With Text-to-3D Mesh and NeVA Framework  [P73600]
abstract:
We present an AI workflow that automatically generates 3D models using patient records and written information, improving accuracy and efficiency in surgical planning, especially for flap operations with NVIDIA GPUs. The workflow enhances preoperative simulations and preparations, aiding healthcare providers in making informed decisions.

The workflow uses NVIDIA’s NeVA Framework to process 2D medical images and patient details through a visual language model (VLM), generating surgical strategy reports. It combines text and images to produce 3D meshes using multiview diffusion and a reconstructor in the NVIDIA Omniverse Kaolin APP, creating clinical-grade models with minimal human involvement. The system includes real-time evaluation and refinement, ensuring clinical accuracy. By automating implant and surgical guide creation, it speeds up planning, improves precision, and enhances understanding of surgical details, reducing risks and improving patient outcomes.

title: Automate 5G Network Configurations With NVIDIA AI LLM Agents and Kinetica Accelerated Database [DLIT72350]
abstract:
Learn how to create AI agents using LangGraph and NVIDIA NIM to automate 5G network configurations. You'll deploy LLM agents to monitor real-time network quality of service (QoS) and dynamically respond to congestion by creating new network slices. LLM agents will process logs to detect when QoS falls below a threshold, then automatically trigger a new slice for the affected user equipment. Using graph-based models, the agents understand the network configuration, identifying impacted elements. This ensures efficient, AI-driven adjustments that consider the overall network architecture.
We'll use the Open Air Interface 5G lab to simulate the 5G network, demonstrating how AI can be integrated into real-world telecom environments. You'll also gain practical knowledge on using Python with LangGraph and NVIDIA AI endpoints to develop and deploy LLM agents that automate complex network tasks.
Prerequisite(s):

Python programming.

title: Automated Curation and Classification of Post-Disaster Imagery Using AI-Assisted Labeling and Ontology for Enhanced Data Insights [P72682]
abstract: Efficient post-hurricane damage assessment is crucial for advancing resilience and engineering practices. We propose a streamlined, AI-driven method to automate the curation and classification of large disaster image datasets. This approach leverages pre-trained recognition models to extract labels and processes the data through custom word embeddings to generate similarity scores. AWS Rekognition, integrated with Lambda triggers, simplifies label extraction, while the NV-Embed-v2 model improves classification accuracy by ranking term relevance. This solution enhances the organization of large-scale disaster repositories, making it easier to retrieve critical insights. The proposed method can improve post-disaster analysis and resilience efforts, addressing the challenges of unstructured data with greater efficiency and accuracy.

title: Automatic 3D Models Editing With Text Prompts and Super Resolution [P73043]
abstract: We introduce a solution that combines automatic 3D model editing and super-resolution capabilities using a custom multi-view implementation of the NVIDIA NIM Stable Diffusion model. This method allows users to modify 3D models through simple text-based prompts while simultaneously improving the visual fidelity of the assets via super-resolution techniques. Our fully automated pipeline eliminates the need for manual mask selection and dynamically identifies regions for editing, resulting in high-quality geometry, textures, and surface details. Seamless integration with the Omniverse environment enables rapid prototyping and refinement, significantly enhancing both the productivity and creative flexibility of designers and artists.

title: Automatic 3D Models Editing With Text Prompts and Super Resolution [P73043]
abstract: We introduce a solution that combines automatic 3D model editing and super-resolution capabilities using a custom multi-view implementation of the NVIDIA NIM Stable Diffusion model. This method allows users to modify 3D models through simple text-based prompts while simultaneously improving the visual fidelity of the assets via super-resolution techniques. Our fully automated pipeline eliminates the need for manual mask selection and dynamically identifies regions for editing, resulting in high-quality geometry, textures, and surface details. Seamless integration with the Omniverse environment enables rapid prototyping and refinement, significantly enhancing both the productivity and creative flexibility of designers and artists.

title: Automatic 3D Models Editing With Text Prompts and Super Resolution [P73043]
abstract: We introduce a solution that combines automatic 3D model editing and super-resolution capabilities using a custom multi-view implementation of the NVIDIA NIM Stable Diffusion model. This method allows users to modify 3D models through simple text-based prompts while simultaneously improving the visual fidelity of the assets via super-resolution techniques. Our fully automated pipeline eliminates the need for manual mask selection and dynamically identifies regions for editing, resulting in high-quality geometry, textures, and surface details. Seamless integration with the Omniverse environment enables rapid prototyping and refinement, significantly enhancing both the productivity and creative flexibility of designers and artists.

title: Automatic Large-Scale Synthetic Data Generation for Developing Fully Automated Trains [S71367]
abstract: For the development, specification, and testing of fully-automated trains, access to vast amounts of sensor data covering the entire operational design domain (ODD) is critical — particularly for non-regular scenarios where real-world data is scarce or unavailable. By harnessing the power of NVIDIA Omniverse, we’ve developed a cutting-edge toolchain that traverses the ODD and orchestrates the simulation of both regular and non-regular railway scenarios at massive scale. This comprehensive synthetic data, combined with real-world data, creates a robust foundation for training advanced machine learning models specifically tailored for railway automation, overcoming the limitations of conventional data sources.

title: Autonomous Navigation and Inspection Using Multimodal LLM Without Global Maps [P72933]
abstract: We developed a new solution for autonomous robot navigation and inspection using a multimodal LLM, eliminating the need for global maps. By leveraging Jetson AGX Orin, lidar, and cameras, we enable real-time obstacle avoidance and crack detection in featureless environments like tunnels, offering new possibilities for infrastructure maintenance and safety operations in challenging environments.

title: Autonomous Systems and Remote Sensing for Better Earth Data [S72838]
abstract: How MIT’s focus on complex, often distributed and networked, system is advancing  interaction of physical systems with humans or software, and the quantification of appropriate notions of information for the purpose of decision-making with terrestrial and aerial autonomous vehicles. How Voxelmaps utalizes geospatial and remotes sensing data to build 4D volumetric model of the planet, combining visual, spatial and temporal data to create the most detailed map of the world. It does this using Multi-Resolution, Voxel Occupancy Grids.

title: Autonomous Vehicle Development With NVIDIA Platforms [CWE73325]
abstract:
Chat with NVIDIA experts to explore the complete development pipeline of autonomous vehicles, focusing on three NVIDIA platforms for AI training, simulation, and in-vehicle compute. Discuss how datasets are collected and utilized to train AI models that enable autonomous driving, the role of simulation in testing and validating these models before deployment, and the innovations in in-vehicle computing that enable safe autonomous driving.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: AutoTune: An Automatic, Data-Efficient Pipeline for Fine-Tuning LLMs Using Synthetic Data Generation [P73568]
abstract: Small language models (SLMs) fine-tuned using downstream task-specific datasets exhibit performance comparable to large pre-trained models (LLMs). In the absence of annotated datasets, synthetic data generation using strong teacher models can be used to generate the fine-tuning dataset. This process typically results in large datasets with long training times. Curriculum Learning (Bengio et al; ICML-09) has shown that presenting data in increasing order of difficulty can reduce the data requirements while obtaining similar performance. However, ordering synthetically generated data is difficult without human intervention. We explore a novel direction of data-efficient synthetic data generation by using teacher LLMs to autonomously assess and develop curriculums for fine-tuning SLMs on downstream tasks.

title: AVC Bot: A Text2SQL Chatbot for Supply Chain Data With Near-Perfect Accuracy [P73580]
abstract: The supply chain field involves handling complex and voluminous structural data. Traditional methods of querying this data are cumbersome and limited to experienced planners. We develop AVC Bot, a chatbot that aims to bridge the gap on a particular domain in the supply chain field — Availability vs. Commit (AVC). AVC Bot satisfies all domain-specific requirements while still achieving close to 100% accuracy.
