title: Avoid an AI Upset With Scalable Infrastructure and Adaptable Cloud (Presented by Applied Digital) [EXS74207]
abstract: The saying is true: Defenses win championships, and every winning team starts with a strong foundation. The same philosophy prevails in the challenging AI arena. From scalable large-scale liquid-cooled data centers (designed to reach 400MW) to adaptable cloud solutions, explore how purpose-built infrastructure is driving AI’s biggest breakthroughs. Learn how these innovations provide scalable, sustainable solutions tailored to the needs of hyperscalers and startups, empowering industries to achieve their most ambitious AI goals.

title: Bending Scaling Laws with Brighter Algorithms [S73204]
abstract: Scaling laws tell us "more is more" — that brute-force scaling of data and compute smoothly enhances AI capabilities. Yet, in reality, this path is becoming increasingly unsustainable, which calls for algorithmic innovations to bend the scaling laws and accelerate progress. I will present our recent efforts in this spirit, including gradient-based methods for enhancing synthetic data, symbolic search algorithms for supercharging test-time reasoning, and test-time training that enables continuous model learning and adaptation.

title: Benefits of LLM Domain Adaptation Using NeMo Microservices [P74403]
abstract:
Case Study: Adapting an open-source LLM for domain-specific question-answering.
Technology: Using synthetic training data from NeMo Curator and inference optimization using NIM. 
Results: Improving quality, latency, cost, and portability compared to closed LLMs.

title: Benefits of LLM Domain Adaptation Using NeMo Microservices [P74403]

title: Best Practices and Techniques for Building Agentic and Retrieval Pipelines [CWE72181]
abstract:
Explore the latest techniques for building retrieval pipelines and agentic workflows that can uncover fast, accurate insights within your data. Bring your hardest data processing and retrieval challenges and work one-on-one with NVIDIA experts to learn about the latest techniques, technologies, and tools to unblock your projects. Please note that Bartley Richardson, Sean Sodha, Vinay Bagade, Devin Robison, Matt Penn, Santiago Pombo, and Fei Yu will only be present on Tuesday, while Nick Reamaroon will only be present on Friday. All other listed experts will be present at both session times.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Best Practices for Building an Enterprise RAG App Atop Unstructured Data at Scale (Presented by Cohesity) [EXS74267]
abstract: Bringing data to AI models can have its challenges. Instead, Cohesity product leaders will share best practices for how to do the opposite: bring AI to where your enterprise data already lives. Learn how Cohesity built retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) services on petabytes of unstructured data across multiple data sources. Topics include a review of data search, information retrieval and answer generation, as well as scalability and security considerations.

title: Best Practices in Feature Engineering for Tabular Data With GPU Acceleration [DLIT73713]
abstract:
Feature engineering is an important component in (tabular) machine learning solutions, which can be easily integrated into existing models and boost model accuracy. The tabular data structure limits the models' capabilities to learn the relationships between features, so adding handcrafted features can significantly improve model performance. We'll teach best practices for feature engineering techniques specific to tabular data building off our teams' collective experience competing in data science competitions such as Kaggle and RecSys. Learn how to create features from categorical, numerical, and time-series data, and accelerate your data frame operations on GPU. We'll use RAPIDS, an open-source software that accelerates the whole data science pipeline from data preprocess/engineering to machine learning on GPU.
Prerequisite(s):

Python programming using libraries, such as pandas and NumPy.
Basic understanding of machine learning, decision trees and feed forward neural networks.

title: Best Practices to Implement Your AI Strategies in the Enterprise [S71775]
abstract:
Enterprises struggle to implement generative AI, but are looking to transition to full-scale production for cost savings and new revenue models. Reliability, security, and scalability are crucial for mission-critical AI applications. We'll explore best practices for implementing AI strategies, highlighting AI's value and potential impact. Learn how customers leverage NVIDIA AI Enterprise, which includes NVIDIA NIM and NVIDIA NIM Agent Blueprints, to gain insights on challenges, lessons, and best practices for all stages of the AI journey.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Better Bioimaging Analytics for Better Medicines [P74309]
abstract: We harness recent breakthroughs in computer vision and generative AI to achieve advanced bioimaging analytics approaches in drug research and development across a diverse range of imaging studies. Implementation has focused on delivering benefits to pre-clinical studies, both in efficiency and depth of knowledge of the biological context of observations from high-dimensional imaging data. Our approach leverages the MONAI framework, inference microservices (NIMs), and GPU-accelerated computing to automate object detection, featurization, and visualization, helping to accelerate decision-making steps. Our bioimaging analytics advance encompasses multiple imaging methods, (CT/PET, MRI, histopathology, cellular and ultra-structural microscopy, imaging mass spectrometry, spatial omics) working to unify information across biology and focus the optimal experiment to the question. The study was conducted in accordance with the GSK Policy on the Care, Welfare, and Treatment of Laboratory Animals

title: Better Virtual Prototyping: Using Global Illumination to Enhance VR Simulations [S72083]
abstract:
Virtual engineering and prototyping is a hallmark use case of VR. Immersive virtual environments have proven to be a valuable evaluation tool for assembly and maintenance, repair, and operational processes. However, the growing demands from higher resolutions and increasing frame rates in head-mounted displays pose significant challenges for rendering physically based global illumination and ray tracing effects in real time.
We'll explore NVIDIA’s RTX Global Illumination (RTXGI) SDK and its application in the context of virtual prototyping. We'll give a comprehensive overview of the structure and capabilities of the RTXGI SDK, and demonstrate how it can be seamlessly integrated into an industrial high-performance VR rendering engine. We'll also show the system’s application across various practical use cases.

We'll also show the system’s application across various practical use cases.

title: Beyond Genomes: A Global AI Dataset for Biology   [S73257]
abstract: The vast majority of life on earth remains undiscovered and has not been digitized for AI applications and foundation models. You will learn how we constructed a global data supply chain across five continents. This unique dataset is two orders of magnitude more diverse in biological sequences (DNA and protein) than any publicly available data. We’ll share the techniques and tools used to gather and process such a diverse dataset, explain how generative models can be trained to model coevolution in specific environments, and demonstrate practical applications of this dataset in genetic medicine and beyond.

title: Beyond Prediction: The Future of Inference in AI, Science, and Society [S73880]
abstract: Explore how inference, a fundamental concept in reasoning and decision-making, is evolving across disciplines, shaping everything from AI systems to scientific discovery and societal impact. We'll bring together diverse perspectives and spark discussion on cutting-edge advancements, ethical considerations, and future trends.

title: Beyond Silos: Unlock AI’s Full Potential With Petabit-Scale Data Mobility (Presented by Stelia) [EXS74582]
abstract:
Traditional cloud computing, where compute is anchored to data location, is no longer viable for modern AI workloads. This session explores the fundamental shift toward data mobility and interconnection, enabling AI infrastructure to scale beyond the limitations of siloed resources. We'll dissect the challenges of existing models, examine the barriers to AI scalability, and introduce petabit-scale data mobility as the solution for AI training and deployment at hyperscale. 

Discover how interconnected compute resources redefine performance, flexibility, and efficiency — ushering in a new era where AI operates without boundaries across compute, network, and storage environments.

title: Beyond the Camera: Revolutionize Content Creation With Advanced Lip-Sync AI [S71969]
abstract:
Dive into the world of next-generation content creation as we unveil an innovative lip-sync model designed to break down barriers for millions of creators. We'll take you on a journey through the development of a cutting-edge AI system that's set to transform video production. We'll explore the challenges of processing vast amounts of diverse audio-visual data, the intricacies of our generative adversarial network (GAN)-based architecture with StyleGAN innovations, and the optimization techniques that make this technology scalable for millions of users.

Learn how we tackled common issues in lip-sync technology, from audio-visual misalignment to identity preservation, and discover the potential applications of this model in conjunction with existing B-roll and AI director capabilities. Whether you're an ML engineer, AI researcher, or developer working on large-scale video processing systems, you'll gain valuable insights into the future of AI-assisted content creation.

title: Beyond Visualization: Empowering Interior Designers With Streamlined Workflows and Accurate Cost Estimation [P73479]
abstract: The interior design industry faces numerous challenges, from time-consuming manual cost estimations and budget overruns to miscommunication with clients and difficulties in visualizing designs. Explore how our 3D platform, powered by OpenUSD, Omniverse, and Unreal Engine 5, is addressing these pain points. Discover how this platform streamlines workflows, enables accurate cost estimation, and facilitates seamless collaboration between designers and suppliers. Experience the power of real-time rendering and interactive design, and witness the transformation of the interior design process from concept to reality.

title: Beyond Visualization: Empowering Interior Designers With Streamlined Workflows and Accurate Cost Estimation [P73479]

title: BharatGen: A Generative AI Initiative for Inclusive Innovation Using NVAIE [S72746]
abstract:
The “Make AI for India” initiative is democratizing digital access for millions by enabling seamless engagement in native languages. By harnessing advancements in generative AI, this program aims to create solutions tailored to India’s diverse linguistic and cultural contexts. Central to this effort is the “My Nation, My Voice” campaign, ensuring equitable access to services across various dialects.

In agriculture, real-time sensor data provides farmers with localized information, empowering informed decision-making. In ecommerce, automated product listings in multiple languages promote inclusivity for rural sellers and micro, small, and medium enterprises via the Open Network for Digital Commerce.

By transforming India into a global data powerhouse through the “Bharat Data Sagar,” the initiative leverages the country’s cultural diversity for innovative AI applications. NVIDIA AI Enterprise (NVAIE) enhances BharatGen's training efficiency, achieving a 92-95% scalability factor and enabling the development of high-quality AI models for India’s multilingual population.

title: Blackwell Numerics for AI [S72458]
abstract: We'll describe the number formats supported by Blackwell GPU architecture and their best uses for AI. We'll also explain the recipes for using these formats for both training and inference, providing accuracy and speed results. Software and tool support will also be discussed.

title: Blackwell Programming for the Masses With OpenAI Triton [S72876]
abstract: Get an overview of how the Triton programming language supports NVIDIA’s new Blackwell GPU architecture. We'll examine the design and implementation details of this new backend, showing how it leverages Blackwell's new hardware features without breaking backward compatibility with previous architectures. Learn about the compilation pipeline and key optimizations, and see benchmark results that demonstrate real-world performance gains. This talk is ideal for developers interested in leveraging Triton for high-performance computing on Blackwell GPUs.

title: Blackwell Programming for the Masses With OpenAI Triton [S72876]
abstract: Get an overview of how the Triton programming language supports NVIDIA’s new Blackwell GPU architecture. title: Blackwell TensorCore and Memory Subsystem Optimizations for Applications [CWE72552]
abstract:
We'll introduce the new-generation TensorCore programming guide, explaining how to build up Blackwell TensorCore GEMM, how to utilize new introduced low-precision TensorCore, how to map the above concepts to CUTLASS, and better utilize CUTLASS. We'll also share techniques to optimize memory bandwidth and maximize latency hiding. A straightforward rule of thumb can predict the bandwidth utilization of a kernel, simplifying the allocation of staging buffers in shared memory.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Blueprint for Scalable AI: Deploying RAG Applications With WARRP (Presented by Weka) [EXS74225]
abstract: The WEKA AI RAG Reference Platform (WARRP) is a modular, cloud-agnostic architecture designed to simplify and accelerate the deployment of scalable AI inference pipelines. Leveraging WEKA’s advanced data platform with NVIDIA NeMo and NIM, WARRP delivers unmatched performance, seamless workload portability, and adaptability for enterprise AI environments.

title: Blueprint for Supercharging LLM Inference With "PagedAttention over RDMA" (Presented by Weka) [S74226]
abstract: Learn how "PagedAttention over RDMA" (PAoR) revolutionizes large language model serving by addressing key-value (KV) cache challenges with RDMA networking and WEKA’s high-performance distributed storage. This session showcases seamless integration with vLLM and TensorRT-LLM, enabling faster inference with reduced latency and increased throughput across multi-node environments.

title: Blueprints for Success: Navigating Multimodal Ingestion for Real-World RAG [DLIT71592]
abstract:
In this comprehensive course, you'll delve into the real-world applications of multimodal retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). Through a series of hands-on modules, learn how to leverage NIM agent blueprints as a one-stop solution for your AI projects. Much of the course is a deep dive into a real-life multimodal RAG application at scale, utilizing NVIDIA NIMs. You'll gain the knowledge and skills needed to implement and optimize multimodal data ingestion, embedding, and retrieval. You'll also learn how NVIDIA Blueprints can guide your AI solution from proof of concept (POC) to production using self-hosted microservices. This holistic approach ensures that you are equipped to handle every stage of the AI development lifecycle. In the end, you'll have a solid understanding of NIM agent workflows and be able to apply them effectively in real-world scenarios, taking your AI projects to the next level.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic knowledge of Python.
Basic knowledge of LLMs.
Familiarity with basic RAG concepts.

title: Branch Support 3.0: How Digital Humans are Revolutionizing RBC's Branch Experience [S72693]
abstract:
In today’s fast-evolving financial landscape, fraud prevention and customer support are critical yet resource-intensive areas for banks. RBC, in collaboration with NVIDIA and Quantiphi, developed an innovative fraud support agent designed to address these challenges directly in branches.
Using NVIDIA NIM, NeMo Guardrails, NeMo Retriever, PEFT/LoRA, and ACE/Tokkio pipelines, we built a digital avatar that empowers branch employees to handle fraud and account access issues with ease. By providing second-monitor support via a digital agent, this solution improves operational efficiency and reduces the need for specialized fraud call centers.

We'll highlight the unique challenges of in-branch expertise variability and the potential for digital transformation within retail banking, offering practical insights into the intersection of AI, banking, and real-time customer service.

title: Break Free from Closed Models: Unlock the Power of Open Source Now (Presented by Meta) [S74485]
abstract: Discover how leading companies are leveraging open-source AI to drive innovation and reduce costs. Learn how this shift toward transparency can benefit your organization and stay ahead of the curve in the rapidly evolving world of AI

title: Break the ExaFLOPS Barrier With Scientific Workflows Using the Megatron Training Framework [S73707]
abstract: We built a generalizable multi-modal scientific workflow using the Megatron framework with a focus on protein design applications. We trained generative models preferentially aligned with experimental feedback and achieved more than 1ExaFLOPS sustained performance in mixed precision on five diverse supercomputing systems, including systems in the top 10 list of most powerful supercomputers, such as Aurora, Frontier, Alps, and Leonardo. Our implementation sets high benchmarks for multi-modal protein design workflows.

title: Bridge the AI Readiness Gap: Unified Data Center Management for Accelerated AI Adoption [S74592]
abstract:
AI adoption continues to broaden in the enterprise market, yet most data center infrastructure isn't matching the needs of AI development and inferencing. Traditional IT management isn't aligned with the needs of AI practitioners, leading to inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and slow deployment cycles. 

Charlie Boyle (vice president, DGX Software, NVIDIA) and Mike McDonough (executive director, software products, Lenovo) will explore how Lenovo and NVIDIA are partnering to maximize cluster workload performance and efficiency, increase uptime for AI, and increase resiliency in the data center.

title: Bridge the AI Readiness Gap: Unified Data Center Management for Accelerated AI Adoption [S74592]
abstract:
AI adoption continues to broaden in the enterprise market, yet most data center infrastructure isn't matching the needs of AI development and inferencing. Charlie Boyle (vice president, DGX Software, NVIDIA) and Mike McDonough (executive director, software products, Lenovo) will explore how Lenovo and NVIDIA are partnering to maximize cluster workload performance and efficiency, increase uptime for AI, and increase resiliency in the data center.

title: Bridging AI and HPC with Adaptive Infrastructure: From Inference to Large-Scale Industrial Workflows (Presented by Oracle) [S74320]
abstract: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) and NVIDIA technologies seamlessly bridge AI and HPC workloads. Using Terraform, Ansible, and rule-based tagging, OCI automates the deployment of NVIDIA HPC, AI, and visualization containers to the correct OCI compute shapes, helping ensure optimal performance and cost-efficiency. AI containers are deployed on NVIDIA Hopper GPUs, while visualization and media workloads use NVIDIA L40S GPUs with RTX Cores. OCI simplifies AI workload deployment by providing validated configurations and pre-packaged recipes that guide users in hardware selection, networking, and software stack decisions. Kubernetes clusters are auto-provisioned with Prometheus, Grafana, and MLFlow, enabling scalable MLOps and infrastructure monitoring. This automation eliminates manual setup, allowing enterprises to scale AI inference and industrial workflows like molecular dynamics, sensor processing, and generative AI efficiently, helping to reduce time to market and optimize resources.

title: Bridging Innovation: The Transformative Era Before Full-Blown Humanoid Robots Emerge (Presented by MSI) [S74186]
abstract: We'll present some autonomous mobile robot (AMR) use cases in smart factories and logistics warehousing.
date_time: How AI-powered autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) enable process automation in smart factories: technical details and implementation challenges

title: Bridging Medical Gaps from Malaria to Cancer: On-Device AI Diagnostic Solutions Powered by NVIDIA Jetson [P74394]
abstract: We introduce an innovative AI solution addressing global health disparities, showing how our on-device AI diagnostic platform, powered by NVIDIA JETSON, is revolutionizing malaria and cervical cancer diagnostics, from the world's most remote areas to developed countries. Learn how this technology complements high-quality diagnostics not only in regions with limited medical infrastructure, but also in countries with advanced healthcare systems.

title: Bridging Performance and Flexibility in Network Architecture [S73339]
abstract: A lack of dynamic flexibility, the ability to change fabric on the fly is a significant challenge for building networking architectures. In this talk we will explore some real-world implementations of Spectrum-X and share important lessons learnt. You’ll see how you can change the number of GPUs you use without having to rewire the cluster or do complex configuration changes. You’ll learn how to maximize the benefit provided by the flexibility of the architecture and see how simple implementation is for network engineers used to Ethernet fabrics.

title: Bridging Sim-to-Real With Robot Learning Tools and Techniques  [CWE73364]
abstract:
Robot learning is a crucial for developing adaptable and efficient robots so you can build effective robot policies and get robots to adapt to new skills across many embodiments thru a simulation-first approach. Join NVIDIA robot learning experts on how to bridge the gap between simulation and real-world performance. NVIDIA's Isaac Lab, Isaac Sim, and Omniverse platforms offer powerful tools for synthetic data generation, reinforcement learning, imitation learning, and sim-to-real transfer. Please note that Stephan Pleines and Teresa Conceicao will only be present on Friday. All other listed experts will be present at both session times.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Bridging Sim-to-Real With Robot Learning Tools and Techniques  [CWE73364]
abstract:
Robot learning is a crucial for developing adaptable and efficient robots so you can build effective robot policies and get robots to adapt to new skills across many embodiments thru a simulation-first approach. Join NVIDIA robot learning experts on how to bridge the gap between simulation and real-world performance. NVIDIA's Isaac Lab, Isaac Sim, and Omniverse platforms offer powerful tools for synthetic data generation, reinforcement learning, imitation learning, and sim-to-real transfer. Please note that Stephan Pleines and Teresa Conceicao will only be present on Friday. All other listed experts will be present at both session times.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Bring Accelerated Computing to Data Science in Python [DLIT73877]
abstract:
With datasets growing rapidly in volume, velocity, and veracity, the demand for more efficient data processing has never been higher. This lab walks through how to apply open-source GPU accelerators from the NVIDIA RAPIDS project for common Python data science workflows.
Prerequisite(s):

Experience with Python, ideally including Pandas and NumPy.
Experience working with Polars, NetworkX, and XGBoost a plus.

title: Bringing AI to Radar: A Deep Dive Into Neural Networks for Perception [S71595]
abstract: Radar data is inherently rich, offering detailed information about the environment, but traditional algorithms struggle to unlock its full potential. Learn how AI provides the ideal solution for radar perception, leveraging radar's unique velocity data to enhance perception accuracy. We'll also discuss radar-only freespace estimation made possible through on-the-fly ground truth data generation, driven by SLAM and Bayesian algorithms, exploiting the temporal nature of driving data.

title: Bringing AI to the Operating Room: Edge Computing for Real-Time Surgical Phase Recognition [P73599]
abstract: Real-time surgical phase recognition using AI can optimize workflows, enhance training, and improve patient safety during robotic surgery. We present a novel system tested in live robotic hernia repairs, demonstrating the feasibility of bringing this powerful technology into the operating room.
location: Bringing AI to the Operating Room: Edge Computing for Real-Time Surgical Phase Recognition [P73599]

title: Bringing Enterprise Chatbots to Life With AI-Powered Digital Humans [S71183]
abstract: Learn how to bring digital human experience to your enterprise chatbots. We'll dive deeper into building and customizing a reference virtual assistant workflow connecting digital humans to any reference chatbot or large language model, or a retrieval augmented generation workflow.

title: Bringing Enterprise Chatbots to Life With AI-Powered Digital Humans [S71183]
abstract: Learn how to bring digital human experience to your enterprise chatbots. We'll dive deeper into building and customizing a reference virtual assistant workflow connecting digital humans to any reference chatbot or large language model, or a retrieval augmented generation workflow.

title: Bringing Enterprise Chatbots to Life With AI-Powered Digital Humans [S71183]
abstract: Learn how to bring digital human experience to your enterprise chatbots. We'll dive deeper into building and customizing a reference virtual assistant workflow connecting digital humans to any reference chatbot or large language model, or a retrieval augmented generation workflow.

title: Bring Massive-Scale Vector Search to the GPU with Apache Lucene [S71286]
abstract:
Lucene has long been the dominant player in search, in part because of its foundational role in so many software tools. As unstructured data continues to grow and as LLMs and generative AI continue to advance, it is increasingly critical to support massive-scale vector embeddings in modern search systems. The recently released lucene-cuvs library addresses this critical need by supercharging vector search algorithms in Lucene.

Join this session to learn how the NVIDIA cuVS library accelerates Apache Lucene’s vector search capabilities on GPUs, enabling faster queries and scalable indexing for massive workloads without compromising quality. We’ll dive into the advanced algorithms for approximate nearest neighbors and clustering provided by cuVS, share key benchmarks, and discuss the transformative performance impact across Lucene’s broader ecosystem of databases.

title: Build a Co-Pilot for Industrial Process Monitoring and Quality Control [DLIT72753]
abstract:
Powered by AI, co-pilots are revolutionizing the way industrial workers perform manual tasks, significantly improving operational efficiency and quality. This course will demonstrate how intelligent assistants use computer vision and natural language processing to monitor and optimize repetitive processes. These processes are often defined by Standard Operating Procedures, step-by-step instructions that are essential in maintaining consistency and quality in industrial settings. Integrating co-pilots into these industrial processes can help guide workers through tasks and identify errors in real-time, enhancing productivity and yields.
In this hands-on session, you’ll learn how to build industrial co-pilots with Vision Language Models (VLMs) and Large Language Models (LLMs). Plus, you’ll explore how to customize and optimize AI models for any use case, process, and industry.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic understanding of AI, NVIDIA Pre-trained models, and Python.

title: Build a Customizable HPC Platform With Enhanced GPU Fault Tolerance [S72096]
abstract: Learn more about how to strategize around, design, build, and configure a high performance computing (HPC) cluster with advanced GPU fault tolerances with Kubernetes on AWS. When running a HPC cluster, it's important to have robust recovery mechanisms to ensure minimal downtime and high availability. Take this to the next level by developing robust components from the ground up that integrate with Kubernetes to provide recovery from GPU XID errors in a seamless manner. We’ll also cover best practices of building a scalable HPC cluster in a multi-tenant environment bundled with enhanced GPU observability.

title: Build Advanced AI Clouds With the Data Intelligence Platform (Presented by DDN) [S74286]
abstract: As AI enterprises expand their capabilities with generative AI applications and agent deployment, NVIDIA AI Cloud Partners (NCPs) must evolve. Learn how a data intelligence platform impacts service enhancement by accelerating data discovery, streamlining NIMs and NeMo workflows, reducing data movements, managing distributed data, and enabling massive, elastic, online scaling to support growing customer demands. We'll demonstrate the real business value for both NCPs and their enterprise clients.

title: Build Agentic AI Applications With Large Language Models [DLIW73641]
abstract:
The bar for what AI-powered agents can do has been steadily rising over the past few years. New breakthroughs allow them to not only engage in conversations, but also use tools, conduct research, and execute on complex objectives at scale. This course helps you develop sophisticated agent systems that can execute on deep thought, research, software calling, and distributed operation.
You'll gain hands-on experience in designing agents that efficiently retrieve and refine information, intelligently route queries, and execute tasks concurrently using orchestration tools like LangGraph and deployment abstractions like NVIDIA NIM microservices. By the end of the course, you'll be proficient in creating scalable, high-performance agent architectures capable of thriving in dynamic, real-world applications.
You’ll learn:

Fundamentals of agent systems, including tool-calling, state management, and content pipelines.
How to develop concurrent, multi-threaded agents using LangChain and LangGraph.
How expert systems can be adapted for real-time data retrieval, processing, and adaptive feedback.
 How to use NVIDIA NIM and other scalable frameworks for robust, real-world agentic use cases.


Prerequisite(s):

Familiarity working with LLM-based applications.
Familiarity with LLM orchestration frameworks like LangChain.
Intermediate Python experience.


Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

title: Build AI Agents With Multi-Modal Models [DLIW73638]
abstract:
Just as humans have multiple senses to perceive the world around them, more and more computer sensors are being developed to capture a wide variety of data. In the health industry, computed tomography (CT) scans provide a 3D representation to detect potentially dangerous abnormalities. In the robotics industry, lidars help robots see depth and navigate their complex environments. In this course, you'll develop neural network agents that can reason using many different data types by exploring multiple fusion techniques.
You’ll learn about:

Different data types and how to make them ready for neural networks.
Model fusion, and the differences between early, late, and intermediate fusion.
PDF extraction using OCR.
The difference between modality and agent orchestration.
Customization of NVIDIA AI Blueprints for for video search and summarization.

Upon completion, you'll be able to orchestrate several multimodal agents into an application.

Prerequisite(s):

Basic understanding of Python, including classes, objects, and decorators.
Basic understanding of neural networks, such as image convolution and sequential models.


Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

title: Build AI-Enabled 3D Video Communication Pipelines With Maxine NIM [CWE73291]
abstract:
AI is changing the landscape of video communication and content generation. We'll share insight into how Maxine 3D and Maxine Studio Voice can be powerful ingredients in elevating the meeting experience, and address your questions about Maxine NIM and SDKs that can accelerate both cloud and on-device workflows.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. title: Build an Adobe Learning Manager Chatbot Using NIM RAG Workflow [P73555]
abstract: The modern learner demands engaging, personalized, and interactive learning experiences. To meet this expectation, Adobe Learning Manager (ALM) is pioneering the development of an AI-driven chatbot that enables learners to interact with courses in a conversational manner. This innovation is made possible by integrating ALM's platform with NVIDIA's NIM services. ALM's chatbot leverages LLM, Retriever, Embedding, and Reranking microservices to deliver low-latency and high-throughput interactions. By hosting the model on ALM's server, the chatbot can process learner queries in real time, providing instant responses and facilitating a seamless learning experience. We'll delve into the technical details of ALM's integration with NVIDIA NIMs, highlighting the benefits and challenges of deploying AI-driven chatbots in a large-scale learning platform. We'll also showcase the impact of this innovation on learner outcomes and the future of interactive learning experiences.

title: Build an AI Research Assistant With NVIDIA AI Blueprints [DLIT74486]
abstract:
NVIDIA AI Blueprints show developers how to build complex solutions using NVIDIA software. In this hands-on training lab, you'll build an interactive AI-powered research assistant that includes:

A stylized digital human avatar for interactivity.
A retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) system for multimodal document understanding.
An AI agent that will research topics and discuss its findings.
Prerequisite(s):

Experience building GenAI applications in Python frameworks like LangChain.
Experience building and running software containers.

title: Build and Deploy High-Quality Generative AI Agent Systems (Presented by Databricks) [S74440]
abstract: Generative AI has the potential to disrupt every industry. However, building a high-quality generative AI agent system where the outputs are accurate, safe, and governed is difficult to do. Learn how you can build, deploy, evaluate, and govern AI agent systems on a single unified solution. Mosaic AI by Databricks is designed to streamline the entire Gen AI life cycle. You can securely use your enterprise data to augment, fine-tune, or build your own custom LLM, powering these models with a semantic understanding of your business.  Also, hear from Experian on how they built out an end-to-end AI solution to help fight identity theft.

title: Build and Manage Customizable LLM Pipelines Using NIM Operator [S72050]
abstract: This session explores the intricacies of managing LLM inference pipelines on Kubernetes. We’ll examine how the NIM Operator streamlines the deployment and orchestration of inference pipelines using NIMs. Additionally, we’ll showcase how NeMo services can be used to customized inference workflows and enable data flywheels. Finally, we’ll provide a deep dive into deploying NeMo services with the NIM Operator on a Kubernetes cluster to build and manage data flywheels with ease.

title: Build and Run Next-Generation AI on Azure’s Proven AI Infrastructure Platform (Presented by Microsoft) [S74606]
abstract: AI infrastructure innovation and performance are powering the next frontier of AI models. Learn more about how Microsoft Azure partners deeply with NVIDIA to bring the latest GPU and networking technologies to Azure’s leading cloud AI infrastructure. Explore how our end-to-end systems approach delivers optimization and industry-proven performance. Hear how you can take advantage of Azure’s experience with organizations of all sizes to securely deploy and manage cloud infrastructure to train and inference next-gen generative AI models.

title: Build and Run Next-Generation AI on Azure’s Proven AI Infrastructure Platform (Presented by Microsoft) [S74606]
abstract: AI infrastructure innovation and performance are powering the next frontier of AI models. Learn more about how Microsoft Azure partners deeply with NVIDIA to bring the latest GPU and networking technologies to Azure’s leading cloud AI infrastructure. Explore how our end-to-end systems approach delivers optimization and industry-proven performance. Hear how you can take advantage of Azure’s experience with organizations of all sizes to securely deploy and manage cloud infrastructure to train and inference next-gen generative AI models.

title: Build a Next-Generation Generative Recommendation Engine Based on Torch [P74367]
abstract: Generative recommendation models, exemplified by Meta’s HSTU, have sparked a surge of interest in the industry and are seen as the new standard for next-generation sparse models. The key innovation is introducing a multi-layer, stackable transformer-like structure, which significantly enhances the precision of user sequence modeling but also comes with substantial computational costs. To address this, we've developed a comprehensive solution based on Torch that covers both training and inference, supporting models with computational volumes of 100 GFLOP/example, or even larger, at a relatively low cost. The new model has delivered significant business gains in practical applications since its launch.

title: Build an Ultimate AI Infrastructure to Meet New Challenges of Development (Presented by xFusion Technologies) [S74270]
abstract: AI drives the reshaping of the computing industry landscape, and computing power is the foundation of innovation. We’ll share our observation about the vigorous development of AI computing industry and our solutions to tackle the challenges of the skyrocketing compute demand.

title: Build a Scalable, Performant, and Cost-Effective Managed Inference Service (Presented by Crusoe.ai) [S74476]
abstract: Crusoe Cloud delivers reliable, high-performance AI compute and a robust platform to accelerate your AI journey. Learn how our customers take advantage of our industry-leading startup times, intelligent load balancing, and managed orchestration on top of NVIDIA L40S and H100 Tensor Core GPUs to build scalable AI inference applications. Discover how we developed a scalable, cost-effective managed inference service that provides API-driven access to the latest models. Join us to see how Crusoe Cloud delivers high performance, scalability, and savings — helping you achieve more, faster.

title: Build a Strategic Foundation for Enterprise Gen AI [S72357]
abstract:
Generative AI is now central to global business strategies, with a recent survey showing that nine in 10 companies are already deploying or piloting the technology. However, with this integration comes the challenge of scaling AI development and deployment across the enterprise. We’ll delve into the critical elements required to operationalize Gen AI at scale — including proven infrastructure with a comprehensive software stack that enables high reliability and uptime, high visibility into cluster and job status, and simplified workload management to maximize developer productivity.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Build CUDA Software at the Speed of Light [S72574]
abstract: CUDA is well known for performance, but do you know how to compile CUDA software with the same speed and efficiency? Join one of NVIDIA’s build engineers (and original author of CUDA support in CMake) to learn how to design your build infrastructure to have super-fast builds, quick CI turnaround, and small binaries. If you are a developer, build, release or DevOps engineer, or just interested in best practices for building CUDA applications, this session is for you!

title: Build Digital Humans, Visual Agents, and AI-Generated Podcasts for RTX PCs And Workstations [S72938]
abstract: NVIDIA RTX AI provides an end-to-end, GPU-accelerated platform for building and deploying state-of-the-art AI models across PC and cloud. Developers can use RTX to build private, on-device AI that keeps your data and applications secure, while tapping into the power of AI on your PC. We'll showcase and guide developers on the end-to-end suite of tools to streamline development and deploy outstandingly fast, AI-enabled applications for the 100 million Windows RTX PCs.

title: Build Generative AI With NVIDIA NeMo [CWE73358]
abstract:
Connect with NVIDIA experts to answer your generative AI model development and deployment questions. Whether you're just beginning your journey into generative AI or you're a seasoned professional, our specialists are here to guide you through every step of building generative AI models.

We can discuss a wide range of topics, such as model architectures, dataset requirements, parallelism techniques, optimizations, advanced customization and evaluation methods. Additionally, learn how to add guardrails to orchestrate dialog management, ensuring accuracy, appropriateness, and security in your applications.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Build High-Performance and AI-Enabled Sensor Processing Applications [DLIT71305]
abstract:
Along with the demand for real-time insights and autonomous decision-making comes the need for scalable edge solutions that can process AI-enabled sensor data at the source and scale out to on-premises or cloud. However, several formidable challenges lie ahead:

Real-time latency requirements.
Complexity of building and maintaining custom pipeline for AI-enabled sensor processing.
Hardware heterogeneity needs (for a solution not tied to a specific type of hardware).
Multimodality sensor processing.
Compute-efficient visualization.
Integration from edge to on-premises to cloud distributed network.
Long-term whole-stack stability.
Holoscan SDK is NVIDIA’s real-time, low-latency, and domain-agnostic SDK to build, deploy, and scale domain-agnostic AI-enabled sensor processing applications. We'll demonstrate how to scale with Holoscan, while stressing core components including simplification of I/O from sensor to GPU, AI inferencing and accelerated computing, and real time visualization.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic python, ML, and dockers understanding.

title: Build Immersive Teleoperation Systems for Robotics [CWE72617]
abstract:
Meet the experts who'll show how NVIDIA’s immersive technologies are transforming humanoid robotics development. NVIDIA Omniverse, Isaac Lab, Isaac Sim, and AI-driven robotics SDKs allow for fully interactive, 3D environments that replicate complex real-world scenarios, enabling precise training and performance tuning before deployment. The integration of AI further enhances immersion by enabling robots to learn from their surroundings, adapting to dynamic environments with minimal human intervention. This seamless blend of virtual and physical worlds accelerates the creation and scaling of sophisticated autonomous systems across industries.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Building a 3D Image-Based Search System for Medical Images: How Can Foundational Models Help? [S72436]
abstract: Dive deep into the transformative potential of foundational multimodal models in the realm of medical imaging. We'll explore how advanced models can be harnessed to build sophisticated 3D medical image search systems that meet the exacting standards of clinical relevance. We'll walk you through the latest tools and technologies available, shedding light on how to effectively implement them in your projects. Learn about the critical search criteria — such as accuracy, speed, and specificity — that are essential for clinical applications, and discover how to configure your system to prioritize these factors. We'll also discuss strategies for managing the costs associated with building and operating these systems, ensuring you can achieve high performance without exceeding your budget. You'll see some hands-on examples and gain actionable insights and practical knowledge that will help you develop cutting-edge 3D image search solutions in the medical field.

title: Building a 3D Image-Based Search System for Medical Images: How Can Foundational Models Help? [S72436]

title:
Building AI Agents With Multimodal Models
 [DLIW73645]
abstract:
Just like how humans have multiple senses to perceive the world around them, more and more computer sensors are being developed to capture a wide variety of data. In the health industry, computed tomography (CT) scans provide a 3D representation to detect potentially dangerous abnormalities. In the robotics industry, lidars help robots see depth and navigate their complex environments. In this course, learners will develop neural network agents that can reason using many different data types by exploring multiple fusion techniques.
You’ll learn about:

Different data types and how to make them ready for neural networks.
Model fusion, and the differences between early, late, and intermediate fusion.
PDF extraction using OCR.
The difference between modality and agent orchestration.
Customization of NVIDIA AI Blueprints for for video search and summarization.

Upon completion, you'll be able to orchestrate several multimodal agents into an application.

Prerequisite(s):

Basic understanding of Python, including classes, objects, and decorators.
Basic understanding of neural networks, such as image convolution and sequential models.


Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

title: Building an In-House Accelerated Computing Platform to Power AI and Data Analytics  [S72977]
abstract: Adyen's internal accelerated computing platform is built and administrated in-house on our private cloud, just like the remainder of our infrastructure. Get a sense of why and how we built this, what design decisions were made from a platform perspective, and the value unlocked so far for machine learning, generative AI, and analytics.

title: Building an Optimized AI Platform for the Banking Industry [S72735]
abstract:
Within BNP Paribas Group, AI has been integrated into processes and tools since 2016. The progressive use of this technology, and data management, are now at the heart of the Bank's 2025 strategic plan.  However, enhanced computation capabilities and cloud evolutions encompass multiple transformative dimensions. 
 
Join us to learn how BNP Paribas balances technological innovation, regulatory compliance, and resource optimization to build a hybrid AI platform to deliver the group AI strategy.  We will highlight our approach to enabling key capabilities for the bank including AI-augmented applications, seamless human-AI interaction in business processes, and unified data/AI governance.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Building a Scalable Enterprise Multi-Agent Platform for Financial Services   [S72854]
abstract:
BlackRock's Aladdin® Copilot is an innovative generative AI tool that helps institutional investors instantly harness the power of BlackRock’s Aladdin investment management platform to make more-informed business decisions faster. As Aladdin Copilot's capabilities continue to expand, the Aladdin AI Engineering team has developed an enterprise, multi-agent platform that enables federated application development in a controlled and explainable environment that can scale with the needs of the organization. During this presentation, BlackRock will dive into the technical architecture of this multi-agent orchestration platform, including key design decisions made to reduce platform latency and support developer productivity. They will also discuss how they used NVIDIA NIM to optimize platform performance and future plans for agentic evaluation.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Building Edge and Robotics Applications with Generative AI on NVIDIA Jetson [CWE72628]
abstract:
Generative AI is transforming robotics and edge applications. We’re enabling large language models (LLMs), vision language models (VLMs), vision transformers (ViTs), and stable diffusion models to run efficiently on energy-efficient NVIDIA Jetson devices, with multi-modal VLMs like VILA accelerating development.

Bring your questions and join this interactive session with NVIDIA experts to get direct help with your use cases and learn more about the practical aspects of using generative AI for your robotics and edge applications.

title: Building Enterprise AI: From Innovation to Production With LTIMindtree's Gen AI Platform Powered by NVIDIA AI Solutions (Presented by LTIMindtree) [EXS74061]
abstract: Explore how AI platforms tackle last-mile challenges in enterprise data and content integration, scaling effortlessly for a larger end-user base while ensuring robust governance and guardrails. Discover LTIM's Canvas.ai, an AI platform powered by NVIDIA's cutting-edge technologies like Nemo Guardrails and NIMS services, designed to create flexible, secure AI solutions that evolve with your business needs. This strategic collaboration not only accelerates time-to-market, but also reduces costs and enhances compliance, empowering your organization to achieve its AI goals with confidence. Learn how NVIDIA AI solutions provide a solid foundation for critical areas such as model hosting, serving on GPUs, and compliance guardrails. We'll deliver valuable insights into transforming your enterprise AI journey from innovation to production.

title: Building Enterprise Sovereign AI: The Future of Data Sovereignty and Secure AI Infrastructure — A Testimonial Journey (Presented by PNY Technologies) [S74196]
abstract: This testimonial session will delve into the critical aspects of designing and deploying sovereign AI data centers, emphasizing the importance of national security, data governance, and technological independence in the age of rapid AI advancement. PNY have designed full AI training and inference stack from scratch handling the financial and investment aspects and providing technological expertise to ensure the data centers are optimized for AI and high-performance computing workloads, while also investing in the necessary energy infrastructure to power these facilities.

title: Building Future-Ready AI With Agents and Data Flywheels: Insights From NVIDIA’s Enterprise Deployments [S72338]
abstract: We’ll share insights, best practices, and lessons learned from building scalable, enterprise-ready AI solutions using AI agents and data flywheels. Drawing from our enterprise generative AI deployments, including chatbots, copilots, and ‘talk-to-your-data’ solutions, we’ll show how we implemented AI agents to orchestrate LLMs, APIs, and workflows for automating multi-step tasks, and data flywheels to drive continuous improvement of LLMs through user feedback. These architectural patterns are key to keeping enterprise AI solutions accurate, scalable, adaptable, and relevant in fast-paced business environments.

title: Building Generative AI for a Billion Indian Voices [S73151]
abstract: We'll discuss building domain-specific generative AI solutions that are voice-first and cost effective. We'll dive deep into how we build our Multilingual IndicASR, IndicLLM, and IndicTTS using NVIDIA NeMo framework. Furthermore, we'll explore new techniques to deploy these speech AI models using NVIDIA RIVA framework and TensorRT-LLM for serving the LLM models with FP8 on H100 GPU Infrastructure to achieve the lowest cost of ownership. We'll also address key research challenges in building state-of-the-art multilingual automatic speech recognition, LLM, and text-to-speech models, ensuring our voice-to-voice generative AI stack delivers real-time performance.

title: Building LLM Agent Applications for the Financial Services Industry [CWE73336]
abstract:
Join this session to discuss the end-to-end solution for building a large language model (LLM) agent that can handle complex scenarios like banking and quantitative trading. From the application pipeline, training to inference acceleration, learn about best practices for building an intelligent agent for financial services industry (FSI) customers using LLMs.

title: Building LLMs: Accelerating Pretraining of Foundational Models With FP8 Precision [S71921]
abstract: Delve into the transformative journey of Zoho's large language model (LLM) foundational model evolution. We’ll explore how our shift from the Fairseq framework to NVIDIA's cutting-edge NeMo framework significantly boosted our training performance and model quality. See how adopting FP8 precision significantly transforms pre-training performance and costs while retaining model quality. We'll also compare FP8 with BF16 precision and delve into the advanced techniques essential for achieving effective FP8 convergence. Discover how the integration of NVIDIA H100 GPUs, coupled with DGX OS, has streamlined our training processes, reducing time and enhancing throughput. We’ll share insights into the technical advancements and operational efficiencies achieved, and how these innovations have set a new benchmark in LLM pre-training.

title: Building RAG Agents With LLMs [DLIW73644]
abstract:
Agents powered by large language models (LLMs) are quickly gaining popularity from both individuals and companies as people are finding new emerging capabilities and opportunities to greatly improve their productivity. An especially powerful recent development has been the popularization of retrieval-based LLM systems that can hold informed conversations by using tools, looking at documents, and planning their approaches. These systems are exciting to experiment with and offer unprecedented opportunities to make life easier, but also require many queries to large deep learning models and need to be implemented efficiently. This course will demonstrate how you can deploy an agent system in practice and scale up your system to meet the demands of your customers.
You’ll learn:

The components needed to create a simple RAG agent that considers the set of documents provided to it.
Organization techniques to structure your system in a modular way, so you can scale up the deployment from a web-hosted service to a dedicated GPU cluster.
Tracking schemes to evaluate your system's efficiency and quality of output.


Prerequisite(s):

Intermediate understanding of Python, LangChain comfort, and comfort with LLMs.
RAG 101/Prompt-Eng/LangChain recommended.

Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

title: Building Scalable Data Flywheels for Continuously Improving AI Agents [S73280]
abstract: Enterprises need a scalable, efficient, and modular solution for building data flywheels to capture the latest data to periodically train and improve the models that power AI agents. NVIDIA NeMo offers a complete solution for building these flywheels. NeMo enables enterprises to quickly and easily collect and process data, customize the generative AI models, evaluate the model's performance, and implement guardrails to ensure responsible and ethical use of the model. Learn about the ease of use, flexibility, and advanced techniques that will help you build your scalable solutions faster.

title: Building Semantic Search and Data Mining Applications With GPU-Accelerated Vector Search [CWE71289]
abstract:
By 2025, a majority of data will be unstructured. Join our interactive session to learn how you can harness GPUs to perform semantic search and data mining at scale on embeddings created from unstructured data. We will dive into the cuVS library and provide an overview of the various databases and libraries that have integrated it to achieve state-of-the-art performance for building and searching vector indexes.

title: Building the World’s First Intelligence Delivery Network, and How it Will Transform AI (Presented by Northern Data Group) [S74235]
abstract: Introducing our groundbreaking Intelligence Distribution Network, a truly distributed infrastructure that places inference as close to the edge as possible. By combining Taiga’s experience in running large-scale GPU systems and workloads with Gcore’s pedigree in content delivery network technology, we’ve built a system that ensures optimal data privacy, performance, and scalability for the next phase of AI. We’ll explore the architecture, highlighting how this innovative approach reduces latency and boosts efficiency. Join us for a live demo as we show how this (we believe) world-first system redefines high-performance, user-centric data processing.

title: Building World Models in the Era of Generative AI [S73970]
abstract:
Today’s developers are struggling to get accelerated infrastructure optimized for the demands of modern LLM customization. As model sizes increase, so will the demand for high-performance compute, therefore developers must use resources more efficiently. In addition, there’s an overwhelming array of tools, services, open-source models, and platforms to customize generative AI, but many developers don’t know where to begin. Before productive training begins, many offerings require developers to validate and test environments before fine-tuning occurs, amounting to loss of resources and slower time-to-train. Learn how to build a world-class model using NVIDIA DGX Cloud, with all the tools and capabilities you need, starting from data curation through model training to fine-tuning and inferencing. See how NVIDIA DGX Cloud, a fully-managed platform with high performance compute clusters, optimized at every layer, provides Day One productivity, allowing you to focus on delivering AI-driven outcomes.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

See how NVIDIA DGX Cloud, a fully-managed platform with high performance compute clusters, optimized at every layer, provides Day One productivity, allowing you to focus on delivering AI-driven outcomes.

title: Building World Models in the Era of Generative AI: Q&A From the EMEA Region [S73970a]
abstract: Today’s developers are struggling to get accelerated infrastructure optimized for the demands of modern LLM customization. As model sizes increase, so will the demand for high-performance compute. Therefore, developers must use resources more efficiently. In addition, there’s an overwhelming array of tools, services, open-source models, and platforms to customize generative AI, but many developers don’t know where to begin. Before productive training begins, many offerings require developers to validate and test environments before fine-tuning occurs, amounting to loss of resources and slower time-to-train. Learn how to build a world-class model using NVIDIA DGX Cloud, with all the tools and capabilities you need, starting from data curation through model training to fine-tuning and inferencing. See how NVIDIA DGX Cloud, a fully-managed platform with high performance compute clusters, optimized at every layer, provides Day One productivity, allowing you to focus on delivering AI-driven outcomes.

title: Build Lightning-Fast Data Science Pipelines in Industry With Accelerated Computing [S74334]
abstract: In this set of lightning talks, leading data science practitioners across industries will share their journey with practical tips for adopting accelerated computing. Learn how data scientists are using new zero-code change interfaces for accelerated libraries within AI and ML pipelines to improve productivity and cut costs.

title: Build LLM Applications With Prompt Engineering [DLIW73636]
abstract:
With the incredible capabilities of large language models (LLMs), enterprises are eager to integrate them into their products and internal applications for a wide variety of use cases. These include text generation, large-scale document analysis, chatbot assistants, and more.
The fastest way to begin using LLMs for diverse tasks is with modern prompt engineering techniques. These techniques are also foundational for more advanced LLM-based methods, such as retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT). In this workshop, you’ll work with an NVIDIA language model NIM, powered by the open-source Llama-3.1 large language model, alongside the popular LangChain library. The workshop will provide a foundational skill set for building a range of LLM-based applications using prompt engineering.
You’ll learn how to:

Understand how to apply iterative prompt engineering best practices to create LLM-based applications for various language-related tasks.
Be proficient in using LangChain to organize and compose LLM workflows.
Write application code to use LLMs for generative tasks, document analysis, chatbot applications, and more.


Prerequisite(s):

Familiarity with basic programming fundamentals, such as functions and variables.

Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

title: Build Next-Gen Agents With Large Vision Language Models [DLIT71406]
abstract:
Vision-language models (VLM) are taking computer vision by storm, offering scalability and robust zero-shot solution for countless industries. In this lab, you will learn how to use VLM NIMs and the Video Search and Summarization AI Blueprint (VSS). You will get hands on experience calling VLM NIM APIs and build a video understanding agent. Then you will dive into the inner workings of VSS to learn how VLMs, LLMs and the latest Graph RAG techniques are used to build a powerful agent capable of summarizing and answering questions over long videos.
Prerequisite(s):

Python and Computer Vision.

title: Build Next-Generation AI Factories With DOCA-Accelerated Networking [S71638]
abstract:
Generative AI is revolutionizing cloud data centers, pushing the limits of what is possible in computing. As businesses strive to harness the power of AI, the need for a new class of data centers has emerged — one that can meet the demands of these advanced technologies. NVIDIA DOCA is at the forefront of this transformation, offering AI and cloud innovators an extensive suite of tools designed to create cutting-edge cloud data centers tailored for GenAI workloads.

Learn how NVIDIA DOCA empowers organizations to build AI factories that deliver exceptional performance, scalability, and efficiency. Gain insights into the strategic benefits of using NVIDIA DOCA, including enhanced security, optimized data processing, and seamless integration with existing systems. Join us to learn how NVIDIA DOCA plays a crucial role in advancing AI for transformative business outcomes.

title: Build Physics-Based Digital Twins for Co-Simulation (Presented by SoftServe) [S71963]
abstract: Learn how to build physically accurate simulations with NVIDIA Omniverse using OpenUSD and the FMI/FMU standard, a leading framework for model exchange and co-simulation across different tools. We'll explore how to synchronize the PhysX engine from the Omniverse platform with external models wrapped in FMUs, using an FMU master for seamless co-simulation. Gain actionable insights into setting up precise simulations that enhance system interoperability, performance, and integration across diverse platforms.

title: Build Physics-Based Digital Twins for Co-Simulation (Presented by SoftServe) [S71963]
abstract: Learn how to build physically accurate simulations with NVIDIA Omniverse using OpenUSD and the FMI/FMU standard, a leading framework for model exchange and co-simulation across different tools. title: Build Real-Time, Voice-Controlled AI Teammates In Games [S73229]
abstract: We build a real-time voice-controlled AI teammate feature akin to GPT-4o in the game NARAKA:BLADEPOINT MOBILE PC VERSION, enhancing player experience and retention rates. Through noise recognition advancements, natural language understanding, and low-latency engineering, the game has garnered widespread player appreciation and shown a 4% increase in retention among participants.

title: Build Reasoning Models to Achieve Advanced Agentic AI Autonomy [S74781]
abstract:
Reasoning models represent a paradigm shift in AI for developing truly intelligent agentic systems. Unlike previous types of models, reasoning models can not only imitate human behavior, but can explore different ways of finding solutions on their own. The reasoning model’s approach also often leads to superior answer quality and often surprising and unexpected insights and solutions.

We'll explain how reasoning models like DeepSeek-R1 are built using various techniques such as distillation and reinforcement learning with scalable (non-human) feedback, and the applications these models are unlocking. We'll also cover open tools, like NVIDIA NeMo, that you can use to create, fine-tune, or distill reasoning models and customize the open models for your domain.

title: Build Safe Enterprise AI With NVIDIA NIM [S72356]
abstract: Migrating from proofs of concept to production enterprise AI systems requires safely harnessing your enterprise data to build trusted applications. Simple guardrails aren't enough; organizations need to orchestrate safe connections to their vast data systems, and carefully sanitize and curate data to ensure optimal results. In this session, Rehan Jalil, CEO of Securiti AI, will explore the essential pillars for building safe enterprise AI with NVIDIA NIM and share his thoughts on implementing enterprise AI security. Learn how to leverage your organization's data estate, overcome key hurdles in AI development, and position your enterprise at the forefront of the AI revolution.

title: Build Scalable AI Training and Inference Infrastructures for Data Centers: From Design to Deployment (Presented by PNY Technologies) [S74193]
abstract: Discover how to design and deploy scalable AI training and inference infrastructures for data centers. Learn how PNY Technologies leverages compute, networking, storage, and software to create powerful AI solutions with seamless integration, enhanced support, and operational efficiency.

title: Build Secure and Scalable Gen AI Applications With Databases and NVIDIA AI [S71521]
abstract:
In today’s enterprise landscape, the demand for secure and scalable Gen AI applications is at an all-time high. We'll show you how to leverage SQL databases to interface seamlessly with popular language models, including those hosted on the NVIDIA AI Enterprise platform. Learn to build applications that perform vector searches using embeddings from database-stored data and explore hybrid searches combining various data types. We'll also cover developing end-to-end applications with frameworks like LangChain and Gradio, and highlight using SQL databases for managing chat history and feedback data for analytical purposes.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Build Secure and Scalable Gen AI Applications With Databases and NVIDIA AI [S71521]
abstract:

title: Build Secure Enterprise-Class Agentic Applications by Co-Locating Data and AI (Presented by Couchbase) [EXS74347]
abstract: Learn how to co-locate data with LLMs, from the cloud to the edge, to power critical agent applications that can't tolerate data traversing the internet. We'll also cover how to analyze and manipulate JSON data using the NL2SQL tool.

title: Build the Future of AI Infrastructure: From Silicon to Secure Systems at Scale (Presented by Cisco) [S74617]
abstract:
In an era where AI workloads push boundaries of traditional infrastructure, organizations face a critical inflection point. This session highlights how the Cisco-NVIDIA collaboration is reshaping enterprise AI system deployment and scaling. We'll examine real-world performance data demonstrating how the convergence of networking, compute, and security creates a foundation for next-generation AI applications, including:
•	Infrastructure implications and fabric for AI workloads, including performance analysis and innovations that improve efficiency and reduce completion times.
•	Cisco-NVIDIA technology integration to enhance performance and visibility.
•	Benefits of simplified cluster and fabric management for operators and users.
•	Approaches to securing AI systems, workloads, and applications.

Expect live performance data, architectural insights, and demonstrations to bridge theory and implementation to address key challenges in infrastructure integration, performance optimization, and security.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Build the Next-Generation AI Data Center: From Design to Deployment at Scale (Presented by Hyve Solutions) [EXS74359]
abstract: The rapid evolution of AI workloads demands a fundamental rethinking of data center architecture. We'll explore NVIDIA's groundbreaking AI Factory platforms and Hyve Solutions' comprehensive approach to building and scaling AI infrastructure. We'll dive deep into the convergence of accelerated computing, networking, and cooling technologies that enable modern AI factories.

title: Build Trust and Reliability in Agentic and Physical AI — Every Time! (Presented by HPE) [S74333]
abstract:
As AI evolves from prompted generation to taking autonomous action, reliability, safety, and scalability are more important than ever — particularly when applied to essential tasks like business decision-making and managing physical systems.

This dynamic, demo-based session will delve into real-world applications of agentic and physical AI; from how robotic brains are developed to the design of sophisticated business tools, and more. Gain valuable insights from HPE and NVIDIA’s customer and partner ecosystem and practical knowledge on leveraging AI with confidence and reliability to rapidly and securely build and deploy automated workflows, ensuring a competitive edge.

title: Build Trustworthy AI: Guardrailing Gen AI Applications [CWE73354]
abstract:
Learn how to safeguard enterprise generative AI applications with NVIDIA NeMo Guardrails scalable LLM rail orchestration platform. We can answer your questions about applying the latest LLM rails for security, safety, and topical relevance, using auditing and analytics to continuously improve rail and application effectiveness, and customizing and extending rails through a robust LLM safety software ecosystem.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Build Visual AI Agents With RAG Using an Agentic AI Toolkit, NVIDIA Riva, and AI Blueprint for Video Search and Summarization [DLIT72055]
abstract:
Discover how to create your own visually perceptive AI agents to analyze video. In this session, you'll construct an agentic retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipeline by using an Agentic AI Toolkit to integrate NVIDIA Riva Speech Services NIM and the VSS blueprint. We’ll demonstrate a practical example that performs agentic RAG on egocentric (first-person) video feeds, enabling dynamic, open-world Q&A.
Prerequisite(s):

Understanding of Generative AI, experience with Open AI, NIM, and NVIDIA AI Enterprise.

title: Build Visual AI Agents With RAG Using an Agentic AI Toolkit, NVIDIA Riva, and AI Blueprint for Video Search and Summarization [DLIT72055]
abstract:
Discover how to create your own visually perceptive AI agents to analyze video. In this session, you'll construct an agentic retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipeline by using an Agentic AI Toolkit to integrate NVIDIA Riva Speech Services NIM and the VSS blueprint. We’ll demonstrate a practical example that performs agentic RAG on egocentric (first-person) video feeds, enabling dynamic, open-world Q&A.
Prerequisite(s):

Understanding of Generative AI, experience with Open AI, NIM, and NVIDIA AI Enterprise.

title: Build your next Vision AI application for Physical AI on a Digital Twin [S72902]
abstract:
Physical AI improves the efficiency and safety of large space environments such as factories and warehouses by using cameras and advanced computer vision models to facilitate tracking and dynamic responses based on the spatial insights. However, developing vision AI applications for such settings often presents challenges, including limited data availability, unusable sources, and infrastructure constraints, making it difficult to accurately perceive and interpret complex, large-scale environments.

This session explores how NVIDIA Metropolis, Omniverse and synthetic data generation addresses these challenges. Using a warehouse use case, you’ll learn to create high-fidelity digital replicas of physical environments, simulate what-if scenarios, and generate synthetic data to fine-tune visual language models (VLMs) for customized, accurate, and reliable applications. Finally, deploying the solution utilizing Metropolis NIMs and AI Blueprints to implement scalable, real-world-ready vision AI applications for physical AI.

Whether you are new to vision AI applications or an experienced practitioner, this talk provides a comprehensive guide to streamline your app deployment from simulation, training, to runtime.

title: Bypassing LLM Security and Safety Guardrails [P73562]
abstract: We show that an attacker can use traditional and state-of-the-art evasion attacks to bypass LLM guardrail detection within Azure AI Content Safety. This exposes a security vulnerability, allowing for malicious actors to inject harmful or inappropriate content that bypasses guardrails and propagates to the protected LLM.

title: ByteQC: Large-Scale Quantum Chemistry Package Accelerated by GPUs [P74380]
abstract: This poster introduces our open-source package, ByteQC, designed to accelerate large-scale quantum chemistry simulations using GPUs. We implemented several widely-used algorithms from the quantum chemistry community and integrated them into a fully GPU-accelerated, systematically improvable embedding (SIE) framework. Benchmark results demonstrate the efficiency of our package and its ability to handle very large systems. With the help of SIE, simulations involving approximately 400 carbon atoms at the CCSD(T) level can be performed using a single A100 GPU. We also highlight several GPU techniques employed in the project, such as building a dynamic product-consumer model, efficiently reducing irregular numbers of adjoint threads, and performing large contractions on GPUs.

title: Carbon Sequestration Model of Fourier Neural Operator: From 3D to 4D Dynamics [P73285]
abstract: Fourier Neural Operators (FNOs) are effective for carbon dioxide (CO2) geological sequestration (CGS) due to their computational efficiency and accuracy. However, they have been limited to 2D scenarios and struggle with 3D multiphase flow and geochemical reactions. We developed an autoregressive Fourier neural operator (AGFNO) to predict 3D multiphase flow, CO2 dissolution, and mineralization for long-term CGS. The AGFNO incorporates finite difference concept to handle 4D spatiotemporal problems and uses permeability variations to couple hydraulic and chemical fields. AGFNO achieved high R² values in predicting reservoir pressure, CO2 saturation, fluid density, and mineral volume fractions. It's significantly faster than simulations and outperforms other deep learning models in convergence speed and error accumulation. Its predictions align with mass conservation and have excellent physical significance, offering a novel approach for CGS capability estimation, inverse modeling, and optimization.
