title: CARDIA3D: Comprehensive Anatomical Recognition and Deep-Learning Imaging Algorithm for 3D Cardiac CT [P72960]
abstract: Join us as we explore new solutions for multiclass semantic segmentation in 3D cardiac CT images to address the critical lack of models capable of annotating both large structures — like atria and ventricles — and fine details such as coronary arteries, fat, and plaques. By enhancing recognition of multiple classes in high-resolution CT data, we aim to improve feature extraction for heart-focused AI applications and pave the way for future developments, such as training a cardiac-specific language model to interpret 3D CT images. This work is timely and important, filling a significant gap in cardiac imaging tools essential for advancing precision medicine.

title: CARDIA3D: Comprehensive Anatomical Recognition and Deep-Learning Imaging Algorithm for 3D Cardiac CT [P72960]
abstract: Join us as we explore new solutions for multiclass semantic segmentation in 3D cardiac CT images to address the critical lack of models capable of annotating both large structures — like atria and ventricles — and fine details such as coronary arteries, fat, and plaques. title: Cascaded Fine-Tuning of a Multimodal LLM for Pancreas Diagnostic Support  [P73498]
abstract: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) represent a growing frontier in artificial intelligence, particularly for tasks requiring the integration of visual and textual information. We explore the potential of MLLMs as support tools in clinical practice, specifically focusing on pancreatic image analysis. MiniGPT-v2, an MLLM, was fine-tuned in a cascaded way for pancreas localization, tumor classification, and tumor localization on two publicly available datasets. A precision of 0.87 and recall of 0.87 were obtained for tumor classification. For pancreas localization, IoU was 0.59 on the NIH dataset, and 0.56 on MSD dataset. For the generalization task of localization on AbdoemnCT-1k, the IoU was 0.84 for liver, 0.72 for kidney, 0.70 for spleen, and 0.49 for pancreas, respectively.

title: Catalyzing Generative AI From Cloud to Edge (Presented by QCT) [S74177]
abstract: Discover how AI is seamlessly integrated with QCT's comprehensive solutions from cloud to edge. Learn how QCT's infrastructure, powered by NVIDIA, supports complex AI training across containers, bare metal, and private cloud environments, all built on QCT's advanced data center servers. With robust designs, QCT empowers enterprises to develop real-world generative AI use cases tailored to diverse needs with QCT's edge servers and proprietary toolkits. QCT is dedicated to helping enterprises implement a complete end-to-end AI pipeline in their AI transformation journey, specifically by delivering solutions to meet their business challenges.

title: Challenges and Breakthroughs in RAG Implementation for On-Prem Industrial Copilot Assistants [S72896]
abstract: Deep dive into Siemens' Industrial Copilot for operations with a special focus on integrating operational time-series data as industrial context, time-series generative search breakthroughs, and optimized agentic design to meet performance and quality-of-response metrics by shop floor target personas.

title: Choosing Fractional GPU Instances in the Cloud for Graphics or AI Development [CWE72834]
abstract:
As the demand for high performance computing grows, fractional NVIDIA GPU instances in the cloud offer a flexible and cost-effective solution, enabling companies to harness powerful GPU capabilities without committing to full-instance costs. We’ll discuss how fractional GPUs can be leveraged for graphics-intensive applications or accelerate developmental AI training processes, and we'll talk you through the technical considerations for choosing available instance types for either type of workload.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: City-Scale AI with Digital Twins [S71824]
abstract: Discover how our city-scale smart AI project utilizes NVIDIA Metropolis, video language models (VLMs), and AI agents to deploy a comprehensive set of real-time anomaly detection models in urban environments. From traffic flow monitoring and emergency vehicle recognition to roadwork and infrastructure safety, this session showcases how public-private partnerships drive successful implementations. By integrating DeepStream, TensorRT, Triton, NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization, and MTMC (Multiple-Camera Tracking), alongside digital twin simulations, we ensure real-time data collection, continuous model retraining, and robust anomaly detection across dozens of urban scenarios.

title: Clinical Trial Patient Matching and Recruitment of the Future, Driven by AI/Gen AI (Presented by EY) [S74120]
abstract: AI is revolutionizing the way patients are matched and recruited for clinical trials, while reducing the  cost and improving time, accuracy, and efficiency of finding the right patients the first time. Join influential leaders in clinical trial domain and LLM technology space as they describe how this transformative technology was used across clinical trial process, from design and development to application and deployment at scale.

title: Clinical Trial Patient Matching and Recruitment of the Future, Driven by AI/Gen AI (Presented by EY) [S74120]

title: Cloud-Native Approach to Achieving Training Resilience and Efficiency at Extreme Scale [S73410]
abstract:
As we scale AI training from 1,000 to 100,000 GPUs, infrastructure downtime becomes increasingly costly and challenging to manage. Leveraging a hybrid HPC and cloud architecture, we propose a solution that integrates AI/HPC cloud stacks to address key problems of fault tolerance, resource management, and real-time monitoring. Our approach supports a wide range of workload managers and integrates application and system anomaly data to enable transparent failure handling. We'll explore the unique errors seen at scale as we built this system, and the lessons learned from some of the largest training deployments in the world.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Coldplate Requirements for Direct Liquid Cooling of AI Processors (Presented by CoolIT Systems) [S74262]
abstract: We'll look at novel single-phase direct liquid cooling (DLC) coldplate architectures and DLC system designs needed to manage processors with upwards of 2,000 W of thermal design power (TDP), while also discussing the evolving industry requirements around predictability and reliability. We'll also touch upon the importance of reducing time-to-market and enhancing monitoring and reporting tools.

title: Compliance Comparison With Generative AI   [P73021]
abstract:
In today's fast-paced world, staying compliant with ever-evolving regulations can be a daunting task for organizations. Identifying which policies are affected by changes is time-consuming, prone to human errors, and costly. But what if there was a smarter solution?

We'll share our insights and experience in compliance comparison designed to revolutionize policy analysis and regulatory compliance. With our technology, we streamline compliance processes end to end, reducing costs and enhancing efficiencies; empowering organizations to stay ahead of regulatory changes and transforming compliance from a burden to a competitive advantage.

title: Compound Recommendation and Generation Framework for Flame-Retardant Additives in Batteries via MegaMolBART  [P73605]
abstract: This framework, built on NVIDIA BioNeMo, supports customized compound generation by diffusion transformer (DiT), significantly improving the structural and chemical validity of designing flame-retardant additives (FRAs). The system uses adaptive algorithms for customized FRAs analysis to enhance screening. For FRAs compounds, it selects two for retraining through iterations. The molecule screening process involves three steps: retaining molecules with valid forms, excluding those in the input set, and retaining entries from the ZINC15 database. FRAs screening checks 12 properties like MP (melting point), BP (boiling point), FP (flash point), and molecular weight (MWT). Adaptive adjustments increased compounds meeting standards. Additionally, 100 FRAs-related molecules were generated, with 10 high-quality candidates selected.

title: Comprehensive Guide to Getting AI Agents Into Production (Presented by Databricks) [S74587]
abstract: Step into the world of AI agent development with Databricks. We'll explore how to build high-quality AI agent applications, cutting down the path to production. Gain insights into efficient application design. Learn how to leverage Databricks for designing production-quality Gen AI applications. See a comprehensive end-to-end demonstration that shows the practical application of these tools and strategies in real-world scenarios. This session is your gateway to mastering the intricacies of AI agent development, offering actionable knowledge to streamline your projects with Mosaic AI, Databricks, and NVIDIA.

title: Compression and Decompression on GPUs: nvCOMP and the Blackwell Decompress Engine [CWE72611]
abstract:
We'll connect with you to discuss compression use cases in data analytics, genomics, deep learning (DL), and more.  We'll answer your questions about how to achieve best performance with the Blackwell Decompress Engine, and we'll discuss nvCOMP's new APIs, including Python APIs, along with other new features in the library.

abstract:
This exciting session called the Electronic Theater will feature the best animations, visual effects, and scientific visualizations produced in the last year, and presented at SIGGRAPH Asia 2024 in Tokyo. The jury assembled this show to represent the must-see works in computer graphics. Join us to watch this show, truly cinematic and fun experience.

List of whole committee members can be found under the following link https://asia.siggraph.org/2024/about-the-event/siggraph-asia-2024-committee/computer-animation-festival-committee/

title: Computing Infrastructure for AI 2.0 (Presented by H3C) [S74410]
abstract: We'll explore the transformative role of computing infrastructure in the AI 2.0 era, highlighting challenges, innovations, and opportunities in building the foundation for next-generation artificial intelligence.

title: Confidential and Verifiable AI Computing: Ensure Trust, Privacy, and User Ownership in AI Systems [S74635]
abstract: “Attention Is All You Need” coauthor and NEAR Protocol co-founder Illia Polosukhin presents research on confidential and verifiable AI computation. The talk details an approach to training, fine-tuning, and utilizing models and agents that allows for the decentralized, transparent properties of open source while creating a business model for developers and researchers. He presents a novel design for a confidential, decentralized AI cloud that combines NVIDIA Confidential Computing and payment channels with a mechanism called “Proof-of-Response” to deliver service-level agreement in a decentralized environment. This enables model and agent developers to monetize their work without needing to run their own services, provides end-to-end privacy for individuals and businesses, verifiability of what data was used, and proof that outputs came from an AI system.

title: Connecting Industrial Data to Digital Twins With Microsoft Power BI, NVIDIA Omniverse, and OpenUSD [DLIT71322]
abstract:
This hands-on lab guides developers through the process of creating a cloud-based IoT application using NVIDIA Omniverse Kit and Microsoft Azure. Participants will learn to develop, deploy, and integrate a containerized Omniverse Kit application with a web-based front-end, focusing on data streaming and state management in industrial scenarios.
By the end of this lab, you'll be able to develop a cloud-hosted application that leverages NVIDIA Omniverse for backend processing and a web interface for real-time data visualization and interaction. This lab is ideal for software developers interested in cloud-based IoT solutions, real-time data streaming, and industrial digital twin applications.
Prerequisite(s):

Knowledge of cloud computing concepts and Microsoft Azure services.
Familiarity with IoT, data streaming, and 3D graphics.
Experience with Python programming, NVIDIA Omniverse and OpenUSD.

title: Connecting Industrial Data to Digital Twins With Microsoft Power BI, NVIDIA Omniverse, and OpenUSD [DLIT71322]
abstract:

title: Connecting NIM to Uncompressed Audio/Video Pipelines With Holoscan for Media [S72563]
abstract: Holoscan for Media is a software-defined platform running on AI infrastructure to develop, deploy, and run live media applications. It supports uncompressed media over IP with PTP synchronization for live broadcasters and allows customers to run applications from multiple software vendor on centralized certified commercial off-the-shelf hardware. Servers can be repurposed from day to day depending on user needs. We showed the latest progress and vendor adoption at IBC in September 2024, including live graphics, vision mixing, and live AI captioning. We'll present the recent improvements to the platform, highlighting benefits for live broadcasters, and detail how it can leverage NIMs with live media streaming.

title: Connecting NIM to Uncompressed Audio/Video Pipelines With Holoscan for Media [S72563]
abstract: Holoscan for Media is a software-defined platform running on AI infrastructure to develop, deploy, and run live media applications. It supports uncompressed media over IP with PTP synchronization for live broadcasters and allows customers to run applications from multiple software vendor on centralized certified commercial off-the-shelf hardware. Servers can be repurposed from day to day depending on user needs. We showed the latest progress and vendor adoption at IBC in September 2024, including live graphics, vision mixing, and live AI captioning. We'll present the recent improvements to the platform, highlighting benefits for live broadcasters, and detail how it can leverage NIMs with live media streaming.

title: Connecting Smart Cities to the tourist experience with Agentic AI  [S72394]
abstract:
Join us to learn how we’ve incorporated Video Analytics AI Agents to create  human-centric solutions for cities. By integrating multimodal agentic AI, Centific’s platform, AI Data Foundry, unifies urban infrastructure with personalized tourism services, enabling real-time data insights and seamless collaboration. This platform leverages a wide NVIDIA stack including NVIDIA NIMs, AI Blueprint for video search and summarization,  Cosmos Nemotron VLM, RIVA, Metropolis, and Triton technologies. Learn how this approach optimizes tourist and resident experiences, enhances urban systems, and establishes the first adopters of this transformative technology to be the new leaders in global tourism. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Connect With Accelerated Optimization AI Experts [CWE73299]
abstract:
Join NVIDIA experts for a Q&A session on linear programming and mixed integer programming. You can join this open-ended forum whether you have a specific workload in mind or just want to explore the possibilities of acceleration. Bring your questions, feedback, and challenges and get ready to optimize your operations with NVIDIA.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Connect With Cybersecurity, Gen AI, and Threat Hunter Experts [CWE73356]
abstract:
Learn how enterprises are leveraging the NVIDIA AI platform and our partner ecosystem to help detect and prevent security threats as they happen. With NVIDIA AI and accelerated computing, organizations can transform security operations centers with agentic AI, deploy advanced privacy solutions with confidential computing, and redefine threat detection at a scale previously impossible. Curious about integration across multiple hardware and software stacks? We’ve gathered experts with a wide breadth of experience and expertise to answer questions from data scientists, developers, and enterprise IT managers alike. Join us to learn how NVIDIA’s cybersecurity full stack can help accelerate and transform how security is being done today.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Connect With IGX and Jetson Hardware/Software Experts on IPC and Embedded Applications [CWE73454]
abstract:
NVIDIA IGX and Jetson are the world's leading computing platform for AI at the edge. It offers high-performance compute and advanced NVIDIA AI software stack as well as an extensive ecosystem to help you create and take products to market. Join with NVIDIA engineers and experts to ask your questions and join discussion on topics ranging from hardware design, platform software, sensors and connectivity. For questions about AI models, software SDKs and application frameworks, please join CWE 73457.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. title: Connect With Wen-mei Hwu, Author of "Programming Massively Parallel Processors: A Hands-on Approach" [CWE75384]
abstract:
Join us for an exclusive opportunity to meet Wen-mei Hwu, renowned senior distinguished research scientist at NVIDIA and professor emeritus at the University of Illinois. Wen-mei is celebrated for his pioneering contributions to computer architecture and parallel computing, including the development of the superblock compiler scheduling framework and his work on GPU computing. Don't miss this chance to engage with a computing legend and get your books autographed!
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. You can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Coordinating via Foundation Models for Heterogeneous Multi-Robot Search and Rescue  [S71244]
abstract: Multi-agent systems can be deployed using foundation models along with NVIDIA Omniverse to facilitate search-and-rescue operations with a team of heterogeneous robots, each possessing unique capabilities. Learn how multi-agent foundation models enhance coordination, data sharing, and decision-making in complex environments. We'll show real-time simulations of diverse robot morphologies (including wheeled, legged, and airborne systems) working together in dynamic, unstructured environments to complete rescue missions efficiently.

title: Correcting Hallucinations in Large Language Models [P74310]
abstract: We explore a specific technique for hallucination correction called “post editing,” in which the model corrects hallucinations of an LLM after a response has been generated.

title: Correcting Hallucinations in Large Language Models [P74310]
abstract: We explore a specific technique for hallucination correction called “post editing,” in which the model corrects hallucinations of an LLM after a response has been generated.

title: Crack the AI Black Box: Practical Techniques for Explainable AI (Presented by DigitalOcean) [S74147]
abstract: Artificial Intelligence often operates in ways that are challenging to interpret, creating a gap in trust and transparency. Explainable AI (XAI) bridges this gap by providing strategies to demystify complex models, enabling stakeholders to understand how decisions are made. We'll explore foundational XAI concepts and provide practical methods to bring interpretability into developing and deploying AI systems, ensuring better decision-making and accountability. You'll learn actionable techniques for explaining AI behavior, from feature attributions and decision-path analyses to scenario-based insights. Through a live demonstration, you'll see how to apply these methods to real-world problems, enabling you to diagnose, debug, and optimize your models effectively. In the end, you'll have a clear roadmap for integrating XAI practices into your workflows to build trust and confidence in AI-powered solutions.

title: Crafting a New Automotive Experience With End-to-End Embodied AI [S72691]
abstract: Knight Rider. The Batmobile. Herbie. Society has dreamed of automating vehicles for decades, but what does the road to autonomy look like? Alex Kendall, co-founder and CEO of self-driving AI company Wayve, lifts the lid on the embodied AI that's set to supercharge the automotive industry. He'll focus on the technology driving this new era of assisted and automated driving forward: an end-to-end, multimodal foundation model. Learn how this AI will transform the way we interact with our vehicles, and deliver collaborative, safe, and scalable automated driving solutions.

title: Create and Manage On-Prem AI Clusters With Base Command Manager [DLIT71603]
abstract:
This lab will introduce the NVIDIA Base Command Manager software and describe the best practices for managing AI infrastructure. You’ll gain hands-on experience with provisioning cluster nodes, managing software images, creating users and groups, deploying Kubernetes, running a containerized workload, building a custom monitoring script, and configuring nodes with GPUs. We'll cover both Base Command Manager, which is included in the NVIDIA DGX SW stack, and Base Command Manager Essentials, which is included in NVIDIA AI Enterprise.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic Linux administration knowledge.

title: Create and Manage On-Prem AI Clusters With Base Command Manager [DLIT71603]
abstract:

title: Create, Cure, Care: Reimagining Healthcare — Driving Innovation From Ideation with AI  [SE73736]
abstract:
Generative AI and foundational models are transforming healthcare and life sciences by enhancing efficiency, driving breakthroughs, and enabling tailored approaches to care. These technologies are creating a future where innovation changes how care is given, making patient outcomes and experiences much better. They're doing this by accelerating drug discovery, improving clinical workflows, and improving patient care.

This panel brings together leaders from CytoReason, AITEM, Therapyside, and Superluminal Medicines, showcasing how NVIDIA inference microservices (NIMs), AI blueprints, and BioNeMo are driving advances in diagnostics, therapy workflows, and drug development. Through a technical and forward-looking discussion, we’ll explore how these innovators are integrating AI into their systems, overcoming challenges, and shaping a future where technology fundamentally transforms patient care and advances the potential for better health for all.

title: Create Multilingual 2D Digital Humans for Enterprise  [S72370]
abstract: Unlock the potential of NVIDIA's AI technologies to create dynamic, multilingual digital avatars. Discover how Maxine's Audio2Face-2D, Lip Sync, and Riva's translation seamlessly integrate to animate high-resolution 2D portraits with synchronized lip movements and custom voices in multiple languages. Learn about NVIDIA NIM™ microservices for secure, high-performance AI deployment across various platforms. Explore how these innovations can enhance customer service with 24/7 AI-driven avatars and transform AI-generated content and streaming experiences. Join us to elevate your virtual interactions with NVIDIA AI.

title: Create Multilingual 2D Digital Humans for Enterprise  [S72370]
abstract: Unlock the potential of NVIDIA's AI technologies to create dynamic, multilingual digital avatars. Discover how Maxine's Audio2Face-2D, Lip Sync, and Riva's translation seamlessly integrate to animate high-resolution 2D portraits with synchronized lip movements and custom voices in multiple languages. Join us to elevate your virtual interactions with NVIDIA AI.

title: Create, Store, Evaluate: Reimagine Data Model for Boosting Agentic RAG With NVIDIA NIM (Presented by Wipro Limited) [S74502]
abstract: Learn how the Nemo framework and NIMs, integrated into Wipro’s WeGA studio, can enhance the performance of agentic retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems. NeMo curator brings the efficiencies in data generation paired with WeGA’s multi-turn data generation. Explore data alignment strategies to enhance the retrieval accuracies, which in tern boosts the acceptance and adoption of the Gen AI applications. Our comprehensive evaluation framework combines NeMo Evaluator and WeGA metrics to evaluate model performance faster. This data model cuts across industries and brings the ability to process complex unstructured data.

title: Create, Store, Evaluate: Reimagine Data Model for Boosting Agentic RAG With NVIDIA NIM (Presented by Wipro Limited) [S74502]
abstract: Learn how the Nemo framework and NIMs, integrated into Wipro’s WeGA studio, can enhance the performance of agentic retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems. title: Create your own End-to-End Data Flywheel on NVIDIA DGX Cloud  [S72871]
abstract: In this session, learn how to build an end-to-end generative AI pipeline with NVIDIA AI technologies on DGX Cloud. We'll begin with an overview of a DGX Cloud cluster and how to deploy NeMo Microservices. Next, using the microservices, we'll demonstrate how to leverage synthetic data generation and retrieval-augmented generation to create a novel dataset. Lastly, together we'll fine-tune a community LLM with the custom dataset, and deploy the final model as a NIM on DGX Cloud for inference. Come learn how DGX Cloud enables the end-to-end LLM development pipeline and serves your AI development needs!

title: Create your own End-to-End Data Flywheel on NVIDIA DGX Cloud  [S72871]
abstract: In this session, learn how to build an end-to-end generative AI pipeline with NVIDIA AI technologies on DGX Cloud. We'll begin with an overview of a DGX Cloud cluster and how to deploy NeMo Microservices. Next, using the microservices, we'll demonstrate how to leverage synthetic data generation and retrieval-augmented generation to create a novel dataset. Lastly, together we'll fine-tune a community LLM with the custom dataset, and deploy the final model as a NIM on DGX Cloud for inference. Come learn how DGX Cloud enables the end-to-end LLM development pipeline and serves your AI development needs!

title: Creating a Digital Twin of the French Railway: From Point Cloud to Operational Efficiency [S71822]
abstract: Learn how the SNCF, which operates over 27,000 kilometers of tracks, is leveraging a digital twin to enhance operational efficiency. We'll explore the real-world implementation of this innovative tool, which uses 3D and business data (point clouds, repositories, BIM models, etc.) to optimize worksite planning, secure critical spots like railway crossings, provide predictive maintenance simulations, and reconcile data repositories with the actual infrastructure (as-planned vs. as-built). Gain insights into how NVIDIA's ecosystem, including Omniverse, Isaac, Replicator, and NIMs, enables the creation of a scalable enterprise architecture. This architecture makes advanced AI, simulation, and visualization capabilities accessible to end users, integrating seamlessly into their business processes. Understand how these technologies can be applied to improve your own infrastructure management projects for better planning, safety, and maintenance.

title: CUDA Developer Best Practices [CWE72433]
abstract:
Join this live Q&A session with some of NVIDIA’s own CUDA developers to demystify the process of building real-world CUDA applications. From utilizing CUDA accelerated libraries, profilers, and debugging tools to setting up CI pipelines, packaging, and builds — this session covers the entire development life cycle. If you’re looking for practical guidance on integrating GPU acceleration into your software, this is the perfect opportunity to get answers and advice from engineers who develop and maintain CUDA software every day.

title: CUDA: New Features and Beyond [S72383]
abstract:
The CUDA platform is the foundation of the GPU computing ecosystem. Every application and framework that uses the GPU does so through CUDA's libraries, compilers, runtimes and language — which means CUDA is growing as fast as its ecosystem is evolving. At this engineering-focused talk by one of the architects of CUDA, you'll learn what's new and what's coming next for both CUDA and GPU computing as a whole.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: CUDA on Microsoft Windows and WSL [CWE74590]
abstract:
Join this session to discuss any topic related to CUDA support for MS Windows and WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux). We can answer questions about everything from Windows integration and configuration best practices to developer-focused CUDA APIs to help you get the best performance on Windows and from next-gen Grace Hopper and Grace Blackwell systems.

title: CUDA Techniques to Maximize Compute and Instruction Throughput [S72685]
abstract:
Come reload your hat with tricks and tips to optimize compute and latency bound kernels.
This session will explain core concepts, briefly illustrate where these concepts are seen in our profiling tools, and outline general optimization strategies using specific examples.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: CUDA Techniques to Maximize Concurrency and System Utilization [S72686]
abstract:
Do you want to increase the concurrency of GPU work in your application? In this tutorial, we will primarily focus beyond individual kernels to show you how to improve concurrency and system utilization for your CUDA applications.
You will learn how to hide launch latencies, improve load balancing, handle concurrency and synchronization, and optimize resource management and data movement.

title: CUDA Techniques to Maximize Concurrency and System Utilization [S72686]
abstract:

title: CUDA Techniques to Maximize Memory Bandwidth and Hide Latency [S72683]
abstract:
Do you want to write speed-of-light CUDA kernels? When a hand-written kernel is the right approach for the job, you want to use the best possible practices to maximize performance on the GPU. In this tutorial, we will showcase techniques to maximize memory bandwidth and hide memory latencies in our CUDA kernels, including how to efficiently use shared memory, distributed shared memory and asynchronous data copies.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: cuKAN: GPU-Accelerated Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks [P74384]
abstract:
cuKAN is an experimental GPU-accelerated library that maximizes GPU training and inference throughput for ML models that utilize the Kolmogorov-Arnold representation theorem. Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KAN) are a new class of machine learning models that use composable parametric curves (e.g., B-splines) to model input data distributions. Unlike the non-convex N-dimensional hyperplane decision boundaries learned by perceptrons, such curves often offer a more intuitive understanding what information from the input domain the model picked up on.

cuKAN allows you to develop and accelerate KAN-based models on NVIDIA GPUs. It vastly outperforms most currently available open-source KAN implementations, such as pyKAN and efficientKAN, and it supports different spline functions and exposes many knobs and customization options to tune KAN models for your individual use cases.

abstract:

Whether you're just beginning your journey into AI or you're a seasoned professional, our specialists are here to guide you through every step of building generative AI models. title: Curvature-Aware Expert Merging for Enhanced Performance in Foundation Models [P72504]
abstract: We introduce CAMEx, a novel expert merging protocol that leverages natural gradients to account for the non-Euclidean curvature of the parameter manifold. This innovative approach enhances performance, reduces costs, and optimizes resource utilization in scaling large language and foundation models.

title: Customer Service 2.0: Transforming Experiences with AI Agents and Digital Humans [S73441]
abstract:
The integration of digital humans and AI agents is transforming the customer service landscape, offering innovative solutions that enhance engagement and support. Powered by NVIDIA technology, digital humans deliver lifelike interactions that foster genuine connections, while AI agents use sophisticated algorithms to analyze customer needs and provide timely, personalized assistance. We'll explore how these technologies work in tandem to elevate customer experiences, streamline operations, and improve service efficiency. We'll show real-world applications and success stories from our partners, illustrating how organizations can leverage NVIDIA's capabilities to create impactful customer service strategies. Join us to discover the powerful synergy of digital humans and AI agents in reshaping customer engagement.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Customize Generative AI Models for Industry-Specific Solutions [CWE73242]
abstract:
In this session, NVIDIA experts will guide you through the technical processes of customizing generative AI models, focusing on how to optimize performance, accuracy, and latency for real-world applications. We’ll dive deep into the customization techniques available using NVIDIA’s Nemotron-4 model suite, covering everything from LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation) tuning to advanced fine-tuning methods like reinforcement learning with human feedback (RLHF). Learn how to leverage domain-specific data and adapt pre-trained models to meet the unique requirements of your industry. You’ll also discover best practices for balancing model complexity with computational resources, and how to integrate customized AI into existing workflows to drive measurable impact.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

You’ll also discover best practices for balancing model complexity with computational resources, and how to integrate customized AI into existing workflows to drive measurable impact.

title: Custom Solutioning with Generative AI: Optimizing Visual Data Sets for Superior Content Creation [S72835]
abstract: In the world of generative AI, creating visually stunning and relevant imagery goes beyond simple fine-tuning — it requires a deep understanding of both the technical and creative aspects of image generation. Explore how Getty Images approaches custom solutioning by blending advanced generative AI techniques with visual content expertise. We'll dive into the complexities of optimizing datasets for personalization, the significance of clean foundational models, the tools needed, and the process behind crafting datasets that deliver high-quality results. The audience will gain insights from Getty Images and TriggerXR’s recent collaboration for Sony Pictures and other case studies, including a collaboration with 3D content developer Tafi to build custom models for background generation – all showcasing the intricacies of dataset preparation, customization, and real-world application. By combining technical AI expertise with an artistic eye, we deliver AI-generated visuals that meet the highest standards of quality, creativity, and ethical standards.

title: cuTENSOR Optimizations for Quantum Circuit Simulation Using Tensor Network on Grace Hopper [P74382]
abstract:
Tensor network-based quantum circuit simulation serves as a crucial tool for both research and practical applications in quantum computing. cuTENSOR, responsible for contracting Tensor pairs in Tensor networks, significantly influences the efficiency of the entire Tensor network contraction.
We investigated the simulation of the Zuchongzhi 60-qubit, 24-cycle quantum circuit on GH200. We leveraged the Grace host memory and explored optimization techniques including the Looped Transpose-Transpose-GEMM-Transpose method (Looped-TTGT) and Fused trinary tensor contraction. Our evaluation demonstrated that these optimizations effectively utilize both the increased memory capacity and higher chip-to-chip (C2C) bandwidth of the GH200 architecture. The benchmark on the GH200 running with the 256GB-scheme showed a 7.97X speedup over an x86+H100 system running with the 32GB-scheme.

title: Data Center Operators Must Lower Risk As GPU Costs Rise: Future-Proof Your Data Center (Presented by DDC Solutions) [EXS74443]
abstract: S&P Global reported in a Business Impact Report that the demand for AI accelerators is growing and the cost to deploy GPUs, power, cooling, and data center construction can be 5-10 times more costly. Equipment exposure to water hazards from sprinklers and overhead chilled water cooling is not an “if,” but when. A single outage can rapidly expand across the facility, affecting hundreds of pieces of expensive equipment. Learn how DDC mitigates risk by lowering the loss footprint from an entire data center to a single cabinet, all while delivering ultra-high-density cooling with up to 100KW air and 400KW liquid-to-chip ready per cabinet.

title: Data Center Operators Must Lower Risk as GPU Costs Rise: Future-Proof Your Data Center (Presented by DDC Solutions) [S74444]

title: Data Center Vision 2030: How Data Center Infrastructure Will Evolve to Support AI and Accelerated Compute. (Presented by Vertiv) [S74239]
abstract:
The adoption of AI and accelerated compute is guiding the future of data center technology development, including the key power, cooling, and service elements to support AI initiatives. CIOs must play a strategic and future-thinking role to create a comprehensive strategic roadmap, governance structure, and AI economic models that align IT investments with business goals to drive sustainable growth.

title: Data Expressways: Unlocking the Full Potential of AI With Next-Gen Networking [S71190]
abstract:
We'll introduce newly announced networking solutions and advanced features that are specifically designed for AI data centers. By showcasing cutting-edge technologies and recent innovations, we'll explore how these developments are set to revolutionize the landscape of AI model training and deployment. title: Deep Dive Into GPU-Accelerated Visual Data Preprocessing Using NVIDIA Libraries/SDKs [CWE72379]
abstract:
Discover the latest optimizations in NVIDIA's image and signal processing libraries, including CV-CUDA, NPP, nvJPEG, and DALI — a fast and flexible data loading and augmentation library. Learn how to leverage a range of data processing solutions, from low-level image and signal processing primitives in NPP to easy-to-use building blocks in CV-CUDA, and how to create high-performance data processing workflows in DALI. We'll also introduce new libraries like CV-CUDA and nvTiff, alongside updates to DALI, NPP, and nvJPEG

title: Deep Dive into Small Language Model Development for Various Domains and Applications [CWE73400]
abstract:
In this session you will learn how NVIDIA’s small language models (SLMs) are developed, which established new state-of-the-art accuracy numbers on multiple benchmarks. This session covers the standard pre-training technique and more sophisticated pruning and distillation techniques to develop base models, as well as advanced alignment techniques to turn base models into state-of-the-art instruct models. We will also share best practices in SLM development for various domains and applications. 
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. title: Deep Learning for Options Trading: An End-to-End Approach [P73468]
abstract: The U.S. options market has grown significantly over the last decade. Given the increasing popularity of options trading by market participants conducted in modern electronic exchanges, there's an unprecedented opportunity to engage in large-scale data analysis of options trading. We introduce a novel approach to options trading strategies using a highly scalable and data-driven machine learning algorithm, directly leveraging vast amounts of market data and GPU-accelerated training to conduct options trading on behalf of an active investor.

title: Defining AI-Native RAN for 6G  [S72985]
abstract: The telecoms industry is working to integrate AI into the design, operation, and optimization of 6G networks to enable unprecedented levels of automation, efficiency, and adaptability. The AI-native 6G radio access network (RAN) embodies this expectation and makes AI a foundational element of the 6G stack. In this session, leading telecoms industry stakeholders will outline how they're advancing 6G research, with AI integration, to revolutionize connectivity, performance, and societal transformation. They'll explore how the AI-native 6G RAN can deliver extreme levels of radio access performance, integrating technologies like deep learning and edge computing, promoting sustainability, enhancing public safety, and driving economic growth through advanced applications like smart cities, digital twins, and immersive communication.

In this session, leading telecoms industry stakeholders will outline how they're advancing 6G research, with AI integration, to revolutionize connectivity, performance, and societal transformation. They'll explore how the AI-native 6G RAN can deliver extreme levels of radio access performance, integrating technologies like deep learning and edge computing, promoting sustainability, enhancing public safety, and driving economic growth through advanced applications like smart cities, digital twins, and immersive communication.

title: Defining the Accelerated Quantum Supercomputer [S74424]
abstract:
Quantum computing has the potential to offer giant leaps in computational capabilities, impacting a huge range of industries, from drug discovery to portfolio optimization. Realizing these benefits requires pushing the boundaries of quantum information science in developing algorithms, researching more-capable quantum processors, and creating tightly integrated quantum-classical systems and tools. We'll review these challenges, offer insight into how AI supercomputing will enable quantum advantage, and discuss the latest developments in software and systems for tightly integrated quantum-classical computing. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

abstract:
In this session, executives from three leading telcos will share their unique journeys of embedding AI into their organizations. They'll discuss how AI is driving measurable value across critical areas such as network optimization, customer experience, operational efficiency, and revenue growth. Gain insights into the challenges and lessons learned, key strategies for successful AI implementation, and the transformative potential of AI in addressing evolving industry demands.

title: Deloitte Quartz Atlas AI, Powered by NVIDIA  [EXS74644]
abstract: Deloitte's Quartz Atlas AI for Drug Discovery, powered by NVIDIA, leverages generative AI to accelerate the development of new pharmaceuticals by rapidly generating 3D biomolecular structures and predicting drug-to-protein binding. This innovative solution enhances efficiency throughout the drug discovery process by providing data-driven insights from gene to function. By harmonizing fragmented multi-modal data for AI adoption, Deloitte creates custom data paradigms that bridge the gap between data and the scientific process. Operating at the intersection of science, engineering, data, AI, and business, Deloitte's team delivers comprehensive scientific solutions. The Deloitte and NVIDIA alliance further accelerates AI innovation, enabling organizations to access cutting-edge computing power and develop deep learning models that offer new capabilities and competitive advantages.

title: Delta’s AI-Integrated Robot and D-Bot With Omniverse (Presented by Delta Electronics) [S73977]
abstract: Discover how Delta leverages Omniverse Isaac Sim to design, optimize, train, and deploy autonomous control systems for its robots and D-bots, enhancing efficiency and performance in smart factory automation.

title: Delta’s AI-Integrated Robot and D-Bot With NVIDIA Omniverse (Presented by Delta Electronics) [S73973]
abstract: Discover how Delta leverages NVIDIA Omniverse to design, optimize, train, and deploy autonomous control systems for its robots and D-bots, enhancing efficiency and performance in smart factory automation.

title: Delta’s Grid-to-Chip Power Solutions for Gigawatt-Scale AI Data Centers (Presented by Delta Electronics) [S73978]
abstract: Find out Delta’s new developments in grid-to-chip power solutions to optimize energy efficiency in gigawatt-scale data centers for AI training.

title: Democratizing AI Model Optimization: A Managed Service Platform for Fine-Tuning Beyond RAG (Presented by SHI International Corp.) [EXS74116]
abstract:
As enterprises of all sizes attempt to incorporate generative AI solutions into their workflows, they increasingly face the limitations of using generic foundational models: contextual misalignment, data privacy and compliance challenges, and performance inconsistency. Typical reliefs, such as prompt engineering and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), introduce their own drawbacks — increased inference latencies and shallow enterprise knowledge. Fine-tuning addresses these by generating optimized domain-specific solutions with organizational intelligence, but is technically complex and computationally intensive, limiting its feasibility.

The Fine-Tuning As a Managed Service platform solves this problem by providing a managed platform that pairs human AI expertise, leveraging varied fine-tuning techniques — supervised, reinforcement learning, PEFT etc. — with NVIDIA’s NIMs and GPUs to deliver optimized performant models for all enterprises, removing a key hurdle for organizations in realizing the return on investment in generative AI.

title: Deploy AI and HPC on NVIDIA GPUs With Google Hypercompute Clusters (Presented by Google Cloud) [S74318]
abstract: Learn the benefits of deploying and managing AI and HPC workloads using Google Cloud Hypercompute Clusters. We'll discuss how Google Cloud helps simplify cluster deployment and management, with the Cluster Toolkit providing pre-configured blueprints with HPC best practices baked in. Learn how centering on clusters as dedicated, time-bound resources that serve a specific job or campaign helps you quickly and easily get performant resources for your most demanding AI and HPC workloads.

title: Deploy and Leverage NVIDIA Grace Blackwell and Grace Hopper in Your Data Center [CWE74386]
abstract:
NVIDIA Grace Hopper and NVIDIA Grace Blackwell are a new breed of memory-converged CPU-GPU superchips, engineered to meet the challenges of AI, high performance computing, and data processing. Learn about the unique architecture of these superchips and their versatile form factors that simplify data center deployment. We'll address such questions as how the 900 GB/s NVLINK Chip-to-Chip interconnect enables the CPU and GPU to access all system-allocated memory, how you can seamlessly migrate your x86-based workloads to the Arm-based Grace CPU, and the performance gains you can expect to unlock for your applications.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Deploying RAG Pipelines for Production at Scale [DLIW73643]
abstract:
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines are revolutionizing enterprise operations. However, most existing tutorials stop at proof-of-concept implementations that falter when scaling. This workshop aims to bridge that gap, focusing on building scalable, production-ready RAG pipelines powered by NVIDIA NIM microservices and Kubernetes. Participants will gain hands-on experience deploying, monitoring, and scaling RAG pipelines with the NIM Operator and learn best practices for infrastructure optimization, performance monitoring, and handling high traffic volumes.
The workshop begins by building a simple RAG pipeline using the NVIDIA API catalog. Participants will deploy and test individual components in a local environment using Docker Compose. Once familiar with the basics, the focus will shift to deploying NIMs, such as LLM, NeMo Retriever Text Embedding, and NeMo Retriever Text Reranking, in a Kubernetes cluster using the NIM Operator. This will include managing the deployment, monitoring, and scalability of NVIDIA NIM microservices. Building on these deployments, the workshop will cover constructing a production-grade RAG pipeline using the deployed NIMs and explore NVIDIA's blueprint for PDF ingestion, learning how to integrate it into the RAG pipeline.
To ensure operational efficiency, the workshop will introduce Prometheus and Grafana for monitoring pipeline performance, cluster health, and resource utilization. Scalability will be addressed through the use of the Kubernetes Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) for dynamically scaling NIMs based on custom metrics in conjunction with the NIM Operator. Custom dashboards will be created to visualize key metrics and interpret performance insights.
You’ll be able to:

Build a simple RAG pipeline using API endpoints, deployed locally with Docker Compose.
Deploy a variety of NVIDIA NIM microservices in a Kubernetes cluster using the NIM Operator.
Combine NIMs into a cohesive, production-grade RAG pipeline and integrate advanced data ingestion workflows.
Monitor RAG pipelines and Kubernetes clusters with Prometheus and Grafana.
Scale NIMs to handle high traffic using the NIM Operator.
Create, deploy, and scale RAG pipelines for a variety of agentic workflows, including PDF ingestion.


Prerequisite(s):

Familiarity working with LLM-based applications.
Familiarity with RAG pipelines.
Familiarity working with Kubernetes.
Familiarity working with Helm.


Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

title: Designing and Simulating Next Generation Data Centers & AI Factories With Cadence and NVIDIA [S73004]
abstract: With the explosion of generative, agentic, and physical AI, the next industrial revolution has begun. Companies and countries are shifting from trillion-dollar traditional data centers to accelerated computing with a new type of data center — AI factories. Join Cadence and NVIDIA experts to learn about the role of AI factories and the challenges in designing, building, and operating these new facilities. Explore how advanced physics-based simulations, powered by Cadence Reality Digital Twin, NVIDIA Omniverse, and OpenUSD, enable data center teams to design these complex AI factories at scale with greater efficiency and optimized performance. Get briefed on how the broader data center ecosystem can support these efforts and the acceleration of AI-powered innovation for every industry and field.

title: Designing and Simulating Next Generation Data Centers & AI Factories With Cadence and NVIDIA [S73004]

Get briefed on how the broader data center ecosystem can support these efforts and the acceleration of AI-powered innovation for every industry and field.

title: Designing the Future: Protein Engineering, AI, and Responsible Innovation [S72681]
abstract: Join us as we explore the cutting-edge advancements in protein engineering and molecular design, focusing on how artificial intelligence is revolutionizing the field. We will discuss the latest breakthroughs in protein science, including AI-driven structure prediction and de novo protein design. The session will also address the critical aspects of AI safety in this domain, examining potential risks and ethical considerations as we push the boundaries of what's possible in molecular engineering.

title: Designing Transparent AI Systems for Scientific Discovery: Patterns and Practices for Human-AI Collaboration [S72049]
abstract: While Generative AI has shown remarkable capabilities in scientific domains, its true potential emerges when integrated thoughtfully with human expertise and scientific workflows. This talk explores architectural patterns and methodological frameworks for creating effective human-AI collaborative systems, with a focus on scientific discovery processes. We'll examine how to design AI systems that not only propose solutions but transparently reveal their reasoning pathways, enabling scientists to evaluate and build upon the AI's analytical process.

title: Designing VLM-Based AI Agents for Large-Scale Video Analysis [S71611]
abstract: Dive deep into innovative architectures for building vision language models (VLMs)-based AI agents for large-scale video processing pipelines. Explore strategies to maximize the benefits of VLMs and their comprehensive visual understanding capabilities, balanced with computational efficiency.

title: Develop and Deploy Optimized Generative AI Apps in the Cloud [CWE73361]
abstract:
Connect with experts from our product and cloud teams on the full stack integrations NVIDIA offers with our valued cloud partners. Whether you're a pro coder and prefer to build everything yourself from the ground up or would rather use the breadth of services that the cloud service providers have to offer.  We’ll discuss how the fully managed, full stack DGX Cloud platform that includes NVIDIA AI Enterprise with NeMo and NIM microservices, available on our leading cloud partners, can help you get from pilot to production quickly and cost effectively. Ask our experts on how to harness the power of NVIDIA's end-to-end AI platform to create, manage, and scale generative and agentic AI applications in the cloud. Gain a comprehensive understanding of how to integrate these cutting-edge technologies to maximize performance, efficiency, and innovation in AI-driven solutions. Whether you're a developer, data scientist, or IT professional, this session will equip you with the knowledge and tools necessary to advance your AI endeavors in the cloud.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Develop and Observe Gen AI On-Prem With Z by HP GenAI Lab and AI Studio (Presented by HP) [S74470]
abstract: Data and logic are core IP required for creating custom AI. By training and creating models on local compute, sensitive data remain secure, keeping data, logic, and IP private; however, developers that need to create AI on-premises cannot easily access adequate local GPU with current market options. We'll use Z by HP GenAI Lab to create and tune a Gen AI project with NVIDIA NGC and Galileo evaluation technology to refine and locally deploy a model. This session is for technical AI developers who need develop AI on-prem to meet privacy requirements. Learn how this ready-to-go solution offers an easy, simple, and safe way to create and deploy on-premises AI projects.

title: Developing an OpenUSD Configurator Experience for Apple Vision Pro [DLIT71323]
abstract:
Explore the future of retail with spatial computing. In this hands-on lab, we'll have the opportunity to create an application for the Apple Vision Pro (AVP) that allows users to configure a photoreal, 3D asset. This includes how to develop an application and set it up to communicate with a product configurator built with the Omniverse Kit SDK and OpenUSD. We'll also learn how to implement custom Swift UI to interact with the virtual product in real time. You'll learn to leverage advanced technologies to create immersive, interactive retail experiences.
For participants who plan on testing their final application with the Apple Vision Pro, please note that glasses are not permitted to be worn with the device.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic knowledge of Swift programming language and SwiftUI framework.
Familiarity with Xcode IDE and iOS development basics.
Familiarity with VS Code IDE and Python development basics.
Basic knowledge of OpenUSD, NVIDIA Omniverse and the Omniverse Kit SDK.

title: Developing Immersive Experiences on Apple Vision Pro With NVIDIA Omniverse [CWE72382]
abstract:
Join this interactive session with NVIDIA product managers, engineers, and developer relations to explore how NVIDIA Omniverse can be harnessed to develop cutting-edge immersive experiences on the Apple Vision Pro. Learn about the seamless integration of Omniverse with the Apple Vision Pro, enabling real-time 3D collaboration, simulation, and content creation for extended reality applications. Discover ways to maximize performance and visual fidelity in spatial computing experiences.

title: Developing Industrial Digital Twins Applications for Apple Vision Pro [DLIT71325]
abstract:
This advanced lab guides developers through creating captivating spatial experiences for Apple Vision Pro, leveraging SwiftUI and Xcode for frontend development while utilizing NVIDIA Omniverse as a powerful backend server. You’ll explore visionOS development techniques to develop immersive user interfaces for interacting with and optimizing your industrial digital twin.
By the end of this lab, you'll be able to create a fully interactive and immersive spatial experience that seamlessly blends digital content with the physical space using Apple Vision Pro technology. This lab is tailored for developers interested in spatial computing and creating next-generation applications for Apple Vision Pro.
For participants who plan on testing their final application with the Apple Vision Pro, please note that glasses are not permitted to be worn with the device.
Prerequisite(s):

Proficiency in Swift programming language and SwiftUI framework.
Experience with Xcode IDE and iOS development basics.
Experience with VS Code IDE and Python development basics.
Proficiency in OpenUSD, NVIDIA Omniverse and the Omniverse Kit SDK.

title: Developing Industrial Digital Twins Applications for Apple Vision Pro [DLIT71325]

This advanced lab guides developers through creating captivating spatial experiences for Apple Vision Pro, leveraging SwiftUI and Xcode for frontend development while utilizing NVIDIA Omniverse as a powerful backend server. title: Developing Next-Gen AVs with Physical AI-Powered World Foundation Models [DD40001]
abstract: This session demonstrates how NVIDIA is leveraging our Cosmos World Model Development platform and end-to-end world models to safely develop and deploy autonomous vehicles.  Learn how customers are accelerating current workloads, and adopting new technologies to curate video data, find the most valuable data assets to train complex and rare corner cases, fine-tune AV world models, and enable video generation for the most complete coverage of simulation and validation scenarios.  Additionally, we showcase the scalable infrastructure needed to deliver the performance and efficiency necessary for developing safe AVs at scale.

title: Developing Next-Gen AVs with Physical AI-Powered World Foundation Models [DD40001]
abstract: This session demonstrates how NVIDIA is leveraging our Cosmos World Model Development platform and end-to-end world models to safely develop and deploy autonomous vehicles.  Learn how customers are accelerating current workloads, and adopting new technologies to curate video data, find the most valuable data assets to train complex and rare corner cases, fine-tune AV world models, and enable video generation for the most complete coverage of simulation and validation scenarios.  Additionally, we showcase the scalable infrastructure needed to deliver the performance and efficiency necessary for developing safe AVs at scale.

title: Developing OpenUSD Applications for Controllable Generative AI [DLIT71319]
abstract:
In this hands-on lab, learn to develop an AI-powered application that combines the capabilities of NVIDIA NIM microservices with the NVIDIA Omniverse platform to create real-time, AI-driven experiences. You’ll start by building an Omniverse Kit-based application and then integrate NIM microservices like Edify3D and USD Search, which enables the generation of high-fidelity OpenUSD scenes and are fully controllable, allowing us to produce dynamic, AI-generated content within minutes.
By the end of this lab, you'll have hands-on experience in customizing Omniverse applications and leveraging NVIDIA’s AI technologies to push the boundaries of real-time 3D content creation. This lab is ideal for developers and content creators looking to enhance their skill set with cutting-edge tools in the rapidly evolving field of AI-generated 3D experiences.
Prerequisite(s):

An understanding of fundamental programming concepts in Python 3 such as functions, loops, dictionaries and arrays and Python 3 related libraries.

title: Developing Physics ML Models for Engineering and Science Applications [CWE73647]
abstract:
High-fidelity simulations in science and engineering are computationally expensive and time-prohibitive for quick iterative use cases, from design analysis to optimization. NVIDIA Modulus, the physics machine learning platform, turbocharges such use cases by building physics-based deep learning models that are 100,000X faster than traditional methods and offer high-fidelity simulation results.

Come meet our Modulus experts and bring your questions. Learn the basics of physics-informed deep learning and data-driven deep learning applied to problems having roots in physics, and understand the unique techniques that Modulus brings that help you apply deep learning to modeling multi-physics simulations systems. We can discuss how to leverage these principles to apply deep learning, and can explore the building blocks provided by the Modulus platform, including different scalable architectures like neural operators, graph neural networks, physics-informed neural networks, diffusion models, etc.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Developing Solutions for and With BlueField-3: A Network Telemetry for AI Clusters Case Study (Presented by Arista) [EXS74211]
abstract: Learn about the ability to build integrated solutions that leverage telemetry from the BlueField-3 SuperNIC and correlate it with other datasets. As an example, we'll showcase an agent that unifies configuration and correlates real-time telemetry from various network elements, such as switches in AI clusters. This extensibility can enable rapid identification and notification of hardware and software failures across the entire cluster.

title: Develop the Future of Photoreal Spatial Computing With Apple Vision Pro and Omniverse [S72711]
abstract:
Join Apple and NVIDIA for a technical deep dive about spatial computing. This session will give an overview of how advancements in high-fidelity immersive interaction within spatial environments are made possible with Apple and NVIDIA Omniverse. Now developers can create and experience OpenUSD-based digital twins specific for their enterprise workflow. Learn how hybrid computing enables traditional computing methods to be combined with cloud computing to stream datasets directly to the Apple Vision Pro.
Attendees will gain valuable technical insights in spatial computing development that will enhance collaboration, drive industry innovation, and create unparalleled user experiences. Discover the transformative capabilities of the combination of the Apple Vision Pro and NVIDIA Omniverse that redefines the art of possibility across several industries.
Don't miss out on this chance to understand the evolving landscape of immersive technologies.

title: Develop World Foundation Models With NVIDIA Cosmos [CWE74542]
abstract:
Learn how world foundation models generate physics-based synthetic video data to advance physical AI development. Explore open tools for video processing, tokenization that accelerates training, and frameworks to customize models for autonomous vehicles, robotics, and humanoids. Get help from experts to optimize your physical AI development pipelines with NVIDIA Cosmos.

title: DevOps for Gen AI App Development: Build Scalable and Reproducible LLMOps Pipelines [DLIT71682]
abstract:
As Gen AI applications become increasingly prevalent, development practices must evolve to meet modern standards. Learn how to address the gap between data science and modern development practices. In this lab you’ll build a scalable and reproducible LLMOps development pipeline. Using off-the-shelf software, you'll integrate key tools like NeMo Customizer, NeMo Evaluator, NVIDIA NIM, and MLFlow into one GitOps-driven pipeline. By the end of this lab, you'll be equipped to support data scientists with flexible, cloud-agnostic pipelines.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic experience with Kubernetes.
Basic experience with Helm.

title: DGX Cloud Deep Dive [CWE72870]
abstract:
Connect with the technical team behind NVIDIA DGX Cloud to gain insight into how you can get the most out of the platform. Learn how DGX Cloud, along with other NVIDIA software and partners, can power your next-generation AI application. Come prepared with questions about the infrastructure, orchestration, and software behind DGX Cloud, and learn how to leverage all of these components to do the work you’re looking to do, and how to design and integrate your applications and workflows. Whether you’re just getting started or have been working with NVIDIA for years, this is a great opportunity to learn more about how the platform really works, and how you can harness that for success in your enterprise projects.

title: DGX Spark: Your Personal AI Supercomputer [S74680]
abstract: DGX Spark brings the power of Grace Blackwell to your desktop.  In this session, we will take an in depth look at the hardware and software powering DGX Spark as well as key use cases for the system and a sneak peek into the latest development efforts and demonstration software.

title: Differentiate Yourself: Go-to-Market for AI Startups [CWE75130]
abstract:
AI makes it easier to build new products, so it’s more important than ever to differentiate yourself. Let's talk real go-to-market (GTM) strategy for AI startups and discuss practical ways to get your product to market. Nothing's off the table — strategy, positioning, funding, and effective growth tactics.

Connect with NVIDIA experts, including founders of startups acquired by NVIDIA who understand the hustle. This session is perfect for founders and team members at startups. Bring your sales and marketing challenges, leave with a plan.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. title: Different Types of Digital Humans, and What's Under Their Gen AI Hood (Presented by Marvik) [S74084]
abstract: Discover the concept of digital humans and their various applications. We'll explore potential use cases from customer support to digital influencers, highlighting the design process, generative models used, and orchestration behind each application. Explore how tools such as NVIDIA NIMs can enhance the proposed architecture for improved scalability and richer results, and what to expect with NVIDIA ACE.

title: Diffusion Models: The Swiss Army Knife for Generative AI in Science: Q&A From the EMEA Region [S73269a]
abstract: Diffusion models have transformed generative AI by enabling breakthroughs in diverse applications, such as images, videos, and speech. We'll show that these versatile frameworks extend beyond traditional domains and hold substantial potential for scientific data modeling. Through case studies spanning molecular generation, protein design, and weather modeling, we'll explore the unique opportunities and challenges involved in leveraging diffusion models to answer complex scientific questions.

title: Diffusion Models: The Swiss Army Knife for Generative AI in Science  [S73269]
abstract: Diffusion models have transformed generative AI by enabling breakthroughs in diverse applications, such as images, videos, and speech. We'll show that these versatile frameworks extend beyond traditional domains and hold substantial potential for scientific data modeling. Through case studies spanning molecular generation, protein design, and weather modeling, we'll explore the unique opportunities and challenges involved in leveraging diffusion models to answer complex scientific questions.

title: Digital and Physical AI Helps Write a New Chapter in Medicine [S71353]
abstract:
AI is revolutionizing healthcare by seamlessly integrating digital and physical technologies to address critical industry challenges. Digital AI agents now provide round-the-clock, individualized healthcare services, significantly reducing the administrative burden on medical teams. Concurrently, the convergence of AI and biology offers unprecedented insights into biological processes, enabling the exploration of vast therapeutic possibilities. In the physical realm, AI-powered medical devices and robotics enhance precision in diagnostics and treatments while optimizing operational efficiency. Domain-specific computing platforms are fostering a more responsive and patient-centric healthcare ecosystem. These advancements collectively promise to improve health outcomes on a global scale, marking a transformative chapter in medical history. Join Kimberly Powell, NVIDIA’s vice president of healthcare and life sciences, to explore how these advancements are reshaping the future of the industry. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Digital Health: The Tech, the Blueprints, the Transformations [CWE71260]
abstract:
Join NVIDIA experts to explore the field of digital health. Discuss how NVIDIA NIM and Blueprints empower developers, researchers, and enterprises to quickly create generative AI solutions in healthcare incorporating clinical documentation and agentic health workflows. Dive into the latest advancements in generative AI foundational models, learning about their applications in understanding, summarization, and how they intersect in real-world clinical applications. Engage directly with our product managers, developer relations, and solution architects in discussions that address your challenges and seek answers to your questions.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. title: Digital Material Capture for a Lived-In Universe (Presented by HP) [S74472]
abstract: Landis Fields from Industrial Light & Magic (ILM) and Vladimir Petkovic from Adobe discuss Landis’ latest project and how his 3D workflow — leveraging OpenUSD, digital capture of physically based materials, and advanced 3D rendering techniques — helps bring humanity and reality to his storytelling.

title: Digital Material Capture for a Lived-In Universe (Presented by HP) [S74472]
abstract: Landis Fields from Industrial Light & Magic (ILM) and Vladimir Petkovic from Adobe discuss Landis’ latest project and how his 3D workflow — leveraging OpenUSD, digital capture of physically based materials, and advanced 3D rendering techniques — helps bring humanity and reality to his storytelling.

title: Digital Twins to Human-Centric Knowledge: An Integrated System for Manufacturing Expertise [P74512]
abstract: Explore how digital twins and AI transform manufacturing knowledge capture through a novel framework that combines synthetic data generation, multi-modal knowledge graphs, and mixed reality interfaces to achieve over 90% accuracy in operation recognition. This solution addresses the critical challenges of human-centric systems by making implicit manufacturing knowledge more accessible and actionable, demonstrated through a metal additive manufacturing use case.

title: Digital Twins to Human-Centric Knowledge: An Integrated System for Manufacturing Expertise [P74512]
abstract: Explore how digital twins and AI transform manufacturing knowledge capture through a novel framework that combines synthetic data generation, multi-modal knowledge graphs, and mixed reality interfaces to achieve over 90% accuracy in operation recognition. This solution addresses the critical challenges of human-centric systems by making implicit manufacturing knowledge more accessible and actionable, demonstrated through a metal additive manufacturing use case.

title: Direct Liquid Cooling for AI Systems: Design Requirements from the Processor to the Data Center (Presented by CoolIT Systems) [S74213]
abstract:
We'll explore the performance requirements and key features of liquid-cooled products and infrastructure (coldplates, manifolds, piping networks, and coolant distribution units) needed to support current and next-generation NVIDIA AI processors and MGX NVL platforms. We'll discuss how data center operators can future-proof their facility infrastructure to accommodate NVIDIA’s expanding liquid-cooled portfolio and avoid obsolescence.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.
date_time: Higher secondary flow rate capability and pressure head are critical to supporting next-generation liquid-cooled products (exceeding 1.2 LPM/kW)

title: Discover Breakthroughs in AI, In-Vehicle Supercomputing, and Quantum to Achieve Operational Excellence (Presented by DXC Technology Services, LLC) [S74453]
abstract:
We'll share our breakthroughs in four transformative topics, with best practices from public sector and automotive projects: 
•	Migrate retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) model to NVIDIA AI for faster time-to-market and cost optimization. 
•	Manage operational performance and security by integrating NVIDIA AI with Intelligent Operations. 
•	Leverage quantum computing for logistics optimization problems. 
•	Integrate NVIDIA Drive AD stack to support autonomous driving and consolidate in-vehicle compute systems.

title: Discover the Sustainability Promise of AI Data Centers [S72211]
abstract:
AI equals more data centers, and more data centers equals more energy. Curbing carbon emissions is a growing concern for data center operators. Discover how AI data centers of the future will be the most sustainable data centers, and the criticality of power and cooling infrastructure in this equation.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Discover the Sustainability Promise of AI Data Centers [S72211]
abstract:
AI equals more data centers, and more data centers equals more energy. Curbing carbon emissions is a growing concern for data center operators.
