title: Distributed Agentic Multi-Modal LLM Deployments [S72654]
abstract:
Future enterprise architectures for edge AI inference will be multi-modal. With core foundation model (FM)/LLM functions centralized (attention, MLP-FFNN, layer normalization, residual connection) and some functions distributed to edge (retrieval-augmented generation, input processing-tokenization/vector embedding/position encoding [maybe], guardrails, caching, inference optimization-sampling/beam search). In addition, in multi-modal architectures, convolutional neural networks (CNNs) will be integrated with the FM/LLM.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Distributed Agentic Multi-Modal LLM Deployments [S72654]
abstract:
Future enterprise architectures for edge AI inference will be multi-modal. With core foundation model (FM)/LLM functions centralized (attention, MLP-FFNN, layer normalization, residual connection) and some functions distributed to edge (retrieval-augmented generation, input processing-tokenization/vector embedding/position encoding [maybe], guardrails, caching, inference optimization-sampling/beam search). In addition, in multi-modal architectures, convolutional neural networks (CNNs) will be integrated with the FM/LLM.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Distributed and Differentiable Fluid Dynamics with Accelerated Python [S72057]
abstract: Explore the development of modular, scalable, and differentiable computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations using accelerated Python. In this joint talk from Autodesk and NVIDIA, we'll discuss techniques for scaling multi-resolution Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) simulations up to 100 billion cells on distributed multi-GPU systems powered by NVIDIA's GH200 hardware. Gain insights into the challenges and advancements involved in enabling large-scale simulations for industrial design and physics-based machine learning, with a focus on usability.

title: Distributed and Differentiable Fluid Dynamics with Accelerated Python [S72057]
abstract: Explore the development of modular, scalable, and differentiable computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations using accelerated Python. In this joint talk from Autodesk and NVIDIA, we'll discuss techniques for scaling multi-resolution Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) simulations up to 100 billion cells on distributed multi-GPU systems powered by NVIDIA's GH200 hardware. Gain insights into the challenges and advancements involved in enabling large-scale simulations for industrial design and physics-based machine learning, with a focus on usability.

title: Domain-Adapted LLM for Offshore Integrity and Reliability [S73150]
abstract: Join us in an innovative application of domain-adaptive pre-training and supervised fine-tuning for asset integrity and reliability. Petrobras has transformed a 30-year-old knowledge dataset into a "game-changing" AI assistant for offshore and onshore operations, leveraging NVIDIA's NeMo framework.

title: Domain-Adaptive Pre-Training: Tailoring LLMs for Specialized Applications [DLIT71175]
abstract:
In this hands-on lab, explore an end-to-end approach for building domain-specific large language models. Learn how to curate domain-specific datasets, design and train custom tokenizers, and execute the pre-training process to tailor LLMs for specialized applications. You'll gain practical skills and knowledge necessary to adapt LLMs to your unique domain requirements and to real-world use cases.
Prerequisite(s):

Some familiarity with basic deep learning fundamentals.

title: Don’t Go It Alone With Gen AI — Do it Anywhere With Nutanix and NVIDIA (Presented by Nutanix) [S74251]
abstract: As your business attempts to pivot and adopt generative AI, ask yourself: are you ready? Explore the integration of NVIDIA AI Enterprise with NIM inside Nutanix Enterprise AI (NAI) as a microservice platform powerhouse to easily deploy, monitor, and adapt Gen AI anywhere under your control, on-premises to the public cloud. Allow traditional IT personnel to become AI resources quickly, making it simple to manage, easy to secure, and predictable to budget without per-API or per-token costs.

abstract: Get an in-depth look at the transformative power of multi-agent systems in orchestrating  enterprise customer experience (CX). We'll dive into how real-time voice agents and L1.5 semi-autonomous resolution agents, working together, achieve swift response and contextual next-best action.

title: Driving 6G Development With Advanced Simulation Tools [S72994]
abstract: The NVIDIA Aerial Omniverse Digital Twin (AODT) is a platform that leverages the power of NVIDIA accelerated computing, NVIDIA Omniverse, and NVIDIA Aerial to provide a comprehensive, scalable, and flexible solution for 6G research and development. The platform enables researchers and developers to customize, program, and test 6G networks in near-real time, with AI/ML in the loop, and to simulate and optimize the network performance and quality of service based on site-specific data and system-level simulation. The platform has been adopted by Keysight and Ansys with advanced simulation tools. One is leveraging our state-of-the-art 3D electromagnetic ray tracing model and radio access network (RAN) modules for advanced 5G/6G end-to-end simulations. The other has integrated their PerceiveEM Solver into the AODT to leverage NVIDIA AI/ML with full-stack RAN in the loop to accelerate and simplify 6G research and development. The NVIDIA Aerial Omniverse Digital Twin has also empowered academia to unleash the potential of cloud and AI-native networks for 6G system research, design, and development.

title: Driving Smarter Financial Intelligence: The Power of Deeply Trained Domain-Specific Llama Models [P71458]
abstract: We present FIN-LLAMA3, a finance-specific large language model designed to outperform general-purpose AI models in key financial tasks like question-answering, stock movement prediction, sentiment analysis, and financial text summarization. By leveraging vast financial datasets and cutting-edge pre-training and fine-tuning techniques using the NeMo framework, our model offers a highly optimized tool for enhancing financial decision-making and analysis. This work provides a new, specialized solution to the unique challenges of interpreting complex financial data and predicting market behaviors with precision.

title: Driving Telco Innovation: Distilling Large Models Into Economical Small Language Models for Agentic Workflow Automation [S71545]
abstract:
Discover how the largest telecom company in the United States fine-tuned open-source models to create LLM-driven customer-agent interaction categories, dramatically enhancing customer service and reducing costs. We’ll explore how our approach achieved an 85% cost reduction, while seamlessly transitioning from OpenAI with no compromise in performance or quality. By distilling large language models into efficient small models, we optimized telecom AI without sacrificing effectiveness. These interaction categories now play a critical role in customer churn models, identifying service gaps, enabling proactive outreach, and reinforcing the company's commitment to a customer-first strategy.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: DSCA: Dual Structure With Cross-View Attention for Single-View 3D Reconstruction [P72981]
abstract:
Reconstructing 3D models from 2D images remains a challenging task in computer vision due to the loss of geometric properties in 2D projections. While recent machine learning advances, particularly in 2D diffusion models, have shown promise, issues like inconsistent shapes and geometric inaccuracies persist. Our research addresses these challenges through a novel approach: DSCA (Dual Structure with Cross-view Attention)

The key innovations include
 • Decomposes objects into fine and coarse structures
 • Applies Medial-Axis Transformation (MAT) for reconstruction
 • Utilizes cross-view attention for improved geometric consistency

 Evaluated on the ShapeNet dataset, DSCA achieves superior results:
 • F-Score: 0.8986
 • Chamfer Distance: 0.0223
 • Volume IoU: 0.5975

These metrics demonstrate DSCA's significant improvement over existing methods in both geometric accuracy and detail preservation.

title: Dynamo - Generative AI Inference At Scale [CWE73249]
abstract:
Deploying AI models for real-world applications demands efficient inference strategies to handle their intense memory and compute requirements. Learn the key phases of LLM inference and provide practical techniques for developers and data scientists to optimize model performance, reduce costs, and achieve scalable deployment. We'll also cover state-of-the-art attention mechanism improvements, such as multi-query and flash attention, to optimize memory use during inference. Additionally, we'll explore model serving strategies like in-flight batching and speculative inference, which can significantly enhance GPU utilization while minimizing latency in production environments.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Earn your RAG-ing rights: Learn how to Power Smarter AI with Object Store and NVIDIA NIM Microservices (Presented by MinIO)  [EXS71482]
abstract: Vector databases are essential for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) applications. Learn how to architect vector database infrastructure to improve throughput and scalability using NVIDIA GPUs and object storage.

title: Earth to AI: Engineering a Sustainable Future [S73451]
abstract: "Earth to AI" brings together industry leaders to explore how AI and climate science are transforming business strategies for a sustainable future. From cutting-edge technologies to innovative funding models, this panel highlights actionable ways to drive climate resilience and economic growth.

title: Edge Computing 101: Introduction to Smart Edge and Autonomous Robots [S72890]
abstract:
Discover the potential of NVIDIA's edge AI platform in transforming the future of smart edge and autonomous robotics. This session will provide an overview of the platform's capabilities across embedded edge, industrial edge, and enterprise edge environments. Learn about the best practices and software framework that enable AI-powered robots and intelligent vision systems from advanced sensor processing to real-time decision-making. Explore how these innovative technologies are creating generative physical AI systems and shaping industries across healthcare, retails, robotics, transportation, manufacturing and more.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Edge Computing 101: Introduction to Smart Edge and Autonomous Robots: Q&A From the EMEA Region [S72890a]
abstract: Discover the potential of NVIDIA's edge AI platform in transforming the future of smart edge and autonomous robotics. Get an overview of the platform's capabilities across embedded edge, industrial edge, and enterprise edge environments. Learn about the best practices and software framework that enable AI-powered robots and intelligent vision systems, from advanced sensor processing to real-time decision-making. Explore how these innovative technologies are creating generative physical AI systems and shaping industries across healthcare, retail, robotics, transportation, manufacturing, and more.

title: Effective Drug Discovery By Predicting Bioactivities Using Graph Neural Network And Self- Attention [P73500]
abstract: This study enhances bioactivity prediction by integrating drug-target interactions using protein-ligand complex data from molecular docking. Traditional deep learning methods in bioactivity prediction focus on the ligand structure-bioactivity relationship, but bioactivity is influenced by multiple factors like drug-target interactions, signaling pathways, and pharmacokinetics. The study introduces a Drug-Target Interaction Graph Neural Network (DTIGN), which utilizes multi-head self-attention to identify binding pockets and poses in docking results. Ground truth data from crystal structures are used to validate and refine bioactivity predictions through semi-supervised learning. A new benchmark dataset is established, and the proposed method outperforms nine leading deep learning methods, improving predictions by 27.03%.

title: Effective Fundraising Techniques [DD73695]
abstract: Join Lu Zhang, founder and managing partner of Fusion Fund, as she shares proven strategies for fundraising. This session will cover techniques for attracting investors, crafting compelling pitches, and building the right relationships for your startup.

title: Effective GPU Utilization with Run:AI [CWE73253]
abstract:
Everything you wanted to know about Run:AI but were afraid to ask, including:

title: Efficient Large Language Model Customization [DLIW73630]
abstract:
Enterprises need to execute language-related tasks daily, such as text classification, content generation, sentiment analysis, and customer chat support. And they need to do so in the most cost-effective way. Large language models can automate these tasks, and efficient LLM customization techniques can increase a model’s capabilities and reduce the size of models required for use in enterprise applications.
In this course, you'll go beyond prompt-engineering LLMs and learn techniques to efficiently customize pretrained LLMs for your specific use cases. We’ll cover how to do this without engaging in the computationally intensive and expensive process of pre-training your own model or fine-tuning a model's internal weights. Using NVIDIA NIM microservices, NeMo Curator, and NeMo Framework, you’ll learn various parameter-efficient fine-tuning methods to customize LLM behavior for your organization.
Prerequisite(s):

Professional experience with the Python programming language.
Familiarity with fundamental deep learning topics like model architecture, training, and inference.

Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

title: Electric Vehicle Recharge Scheduling on GPUs [P71608]
abstract: Electric vehicles (EV) are increasingly popular due to their environmental benefits, but they can strain the power grid. Optimizing EV charging in large parking lots is a challenge. This study uses a metaheuristic approach on a graphics processing unit to schedule EV charging in a smart parking lot. We propose using a particle swarm optimization algorithm (PSO) and a genetic algorithm (GA) to create an efficient charging schedule that minimizes cost and respects charger and feeder capacities. The algorithm leverages parallelism in GPU. The GPU implementation speeds up the calculation by 134.5X compared to a sequential execution on CPU. It can optimize a 20-EV lot in 0.46 seconds and a 500-EV lot in 5.80 seconds, allowing for real-time computation.

title: Embeddings are Limiting AI Agents: How Codeium used NVIDIA GPUs at Scale During Inference to Improve Retrieval Current [S71317]
abstract: Many retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)-based solutions use embeddings to add context to prompts for LLMs. However, embeddings have significant limitations, especially when using large data sources, and this becomes particularly problematic for agentic systems that are expected to reason and edit across more code simultaneously. Learn how Codeium turned this into an inference-time compute problem powered by NVIDIA GPUs at scale to increase retrieval accuracy by 4x over state-of-the-art embedding models, enabling the first generally accessible agentic tool for software development, the Windsurf Editor.

title: Empower Complex Data Workflows: A Scalable Multi-Agent Solution [P74404]
abstract: Explore a scalable, multi-agent approach for automating Full Waveform Sonic (FWS) workflows to deliver high-resolution subsurface imaging. By integrating advanced natural language capabilities, this solution transforms complex geophysical data into actionable insights, meeting the demands of energy transition initiatives like geothermal and carbon capture with efficiency and sustainability.

title: Empower Enterprise AI: On-Premises Solutions With ASUS and APMIC (Presented by ASUSTek) [S74445]
abstract: Unlock your business potential with enterprise-grade AI solutions. Discover how ASUS and APMIC integrate NVIDIA hardware and software to deliver secure, on-premises AI capabilities, empowering your organization to implement advanced AI models like ChatGPT within your own infrastructure.
date_time: Empower Enterprise AI: On-Premises Solutions With ASUS and APMIC (Presented by ASUSTek) [S74445]

title: Empowering Breakthroughs: Leveraging AI Across Pharma From Discovery to Trials With Innovators  [S73267]
abstract:
AI is transforming the biopharmaceutical landscape, enabling breakthroughs in drug discovery, development, and clinical trials. NVIDIA and Pfizer will share key insights into how innovation is shaping the future of biopharma. We'll spotlight cutting-edge startups pushing the boundaries of AI in biopharma and discuss how these innovations are being applied to solve some of the industry's biggest challenges.

Explore how AI-powered tools, platforms, and collaborations are accelerating R&D and bringing transformative therapies to market. We'll also provide an inside look at how NVIDIA and Pfizer partner and engage with startups in this rapidly evolving space, highlighting collaborative models and success stories that are driving progress from lab to clinic.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Empowering Global Change: United Nations Adopts AI to Further Sustainable Development Across Nations [S74341]
abstract: Join Lan Guan, Accenture’s chief AI officer, and Lambert Hogenhout, the United Nations’ chief data officer, and NVIDIA for an exciting discussion on the groundbreaking collaboration between Accenture and the United Nations to create a generative AI chatbot powered by Accenture’s AI Refinery, built on NVIDIA’s cutting-edge technology.

title: Empowering Global Ecommerce With Generative AI [S72655]
abstract: From both a business and a technical perspective, we'll provide an overview of how generative AI was used to empower global ecommerce at Alibaba International. AI was leveraged to enhance the efficiency and efficacy of different aspects of Alibaba International's business, from marketing, product listing, customer service, and design to compliance and risk management. Our experience is a case study for others who want to develop a comprehensive AI solution for a complex, multifaceted business. From a technical point of view, this involves serving multiple models of different sizes and purposes under different service load requirements. The diversity of applications requires different types of NVIDIA inference GPUs and customized TensorRT-LLM. We'll explain the planning and optimization of this family of models on the abovementioned NVIDIA infrastructure.

title: Empowering Innovation: Startups Enabling Scientific Breakthroughs [S73885]
abstract: Explore how NVIDIA technologies are accelerating scientific breakthroughs in oceanography, drug discovery, and more. Join our panel of leaders from startups across domains as they show how platforms like BioNeMo and Earth-2 are empowering researchers to address critical challenges in climate science, marine conservation, and pharmaceutical innovation. The speakers will dive deep into the technology driving these innovations, including the ways in which computer vision is enabling the characterization of the physical and dynamic properties of the ocean in real time, and how it's equipping open-source communities with the information they need to address society's greatest challenges. Learn how our speakers have used cutting-edge technologies to drive revolutionary change.

title: Empowering Voices, Expanding Horizons: The Human Side of AI [SE74554]
abstract: Transforming the future of AI starts with empowering diverse communities. We'll bring together leaders driving change through innovative partnerships with NVIDIA, breaking down barriers to AI education and careers. Explore how these collaborations open doors to underrepresented talent, foster inclusivity, and reshape the AI ecosystem to reflect the voices and potential of all people. Discover the transformative power of community-driven efforts to expand opportunity, fuel innovation, and create a more equitable AI future.

title: Empower Next-Generation AI With NVIDIA SuperPOD and Pure Storage AI Solutions (Presented by Pure Storage) [S74435]
abstract: Unlock the full potential of AI with NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD and Pure Storage FlashBlade, delivering exceptional performance for faster inferencing, model training, and AI deployments. Learn how to gain unmatched density, industry-leading reliability, consistent performance at scale, and a modern architecture purpose-built for flash technology, that enables seamless AI workloads across multi-GPU environments to transform AI workflows, enhance decision-making processes, and drive breakthroughs across diverse industries such as healthcare, finance, and more.

title: Empower the Federal Workforce With Generative AI: Boost Productivity, Efficiency, and Job Satisfaction [S73424]
abstract: As generative AI transforms industries across the globe, the U.S. government is poised to harness this technology to empower its workforce, boosting productivity, efficiency, and overall job satisfaction. This panel of esteemed government and industry leaders will explore how generative AI can enhance government operations, streamline workflows, enhance decision-making, and enable employees to focus on more meaningful, impactful tasks. By reducing routine burdens, generative AI has the potential to create a more dynamic and engaged workforce. We'll also tackle the challenges of implementing this technology in a governmental context, such as ethical considerations, data privacy, and regulatory standards. Join us for an engaging conversation on how generative AI can redefine the workplace, empowering a more agile and efficient public sector workforce.

title: Enable AI-Native Networking for Telcos with Kubernetes [S72993]
abstract: As telcos transform their networks for the age of AI, utilizing the Bluefield 3 (BF3) DPU engines has been challenging for developers and clients alike. Yet, BF3 is a critical part in deploying and securing an accelerated compute cluster to enable this networking-for-AI infrastructure. The DOCA Platform Framework (DPF) simplifies this task, providing a framework for LCM (life cycle management) and provisioning of both the BF3, as a platform, and the services running on it as K8 containers. DPF is deployed via two network operators in the K8 environment that allow you to deploy and service chain NVIDIA and third-party services. With this, for the first time, independent software vendors (ISVs), operating systems (OS) vendors, and developers can deploy and orchestrate services with ease, as well as onboarding these tools to their environment. In this session, OS and ISV partner companies who've adopted the DPF will share their experience, what they are able to achieve, and what comes next.

title: Enable AI-Native Networking for Telcos with Kubernetes [S72993]
abstract: As telcos transform their networks for the age of AI, utilizing the Bluefield 3 (BF3) DPU engines has been challenging for developers and clients alike. Yet, BF3 is a critical part in deploying and securing an accelerated compute cluster to enable this networking-for-AI infrastructure. The DOCA Platform Framework (DPF) simplifies this task, providing a framework for LCM (life cycle management) and provisioning of both the BF3, as a platform, and the services running on it as K8 containers. DPF is deployed via two network operators in the K8 environment that allow you to deploy and service chain NVIDIA and third-party services. With this, for the first time, independent software vendors (ISVs), operating systems (OS) vendors, and developers can deploy and orchestrate services with ease, as well as onboarding these tools to their environment. In this session, OS and ISV partner companies who've adopted the DPF will share their experience, what they are able to achieve, and what comes next.

title: Enable AI-Native Networking for Telcos with Kubernetes [S72993]
abstract: As telcos transform their networks for the age of AI, utilizing the Bluefield 3 (BF3) DPU engines has been challenging for developers and clients alike. Yet, BF3 is a critical part in deploying and securing an accelerated compute cluster to enable this networking-for-AI infrastructure. The DOCA Platform Framework (DPF) simplifies this task, providing a framework for LCM (life cycle management) and provisioning of both the BF3, as a platform, and the services running on it as K8 containers. DPF is deployed via two network operators in the K8 environment that allow you to deploy and service chain NVIDIA and third-party services. With this, for the first time, independent software vendors (ISVs), operating systems (OS) vendors, and developers can deploy and orchestrate services with ease, as well as onboarding these tools to their environment. In this session, OS and ISV partner companies who've adopted the DPF will share their experience, what they are able to achieve, and what comes next.

title: Enable Blackwell Inference With TensorRT Model Optimizer [S72609]
abstract: Learn about TensorRT Model Optimizer's quantization and speculative decoding techniques for NVIDIA GPU platforms, with a focus on Blackwell. We will introduce the FP4 and other quantization formats on Blackwell, go through quantization recipes including post-training quantization (PTQ) and quantization-aware training (QAT), and demonstrate the latest results for large language models (LLM) and diffusion models. We’ll also cover new features like speculative decoding, which further boosts the inference speed on latest GPU architectures.

title: Enable Blackwell Inference With TensorRT Model Optimizer [S72609]
abstract: Learn about TensorRT Model Optimizer's quantization and speculative decoding techniques for NVIDIA GPU platforms, with a focus on Blackwell. title: Enable End-to-End AI Infrastructure With ASUS AI Cluster Solutions (Presented by ASUStek Computer, Inc.) [S74276]
abstract: Simplify your AI infrastructure with ASUS integrated cluster solutions. We eliminate complexity by offering a preconfigured and optimized solution that spans hardware and software. Focus on achieving your AI goals with our easy-to-deploy and manage solution.

title: Enable End-to-End AI Infrastructure With ASUS AI Cluster Solutions (Presented by ASUStek Computer, Inc.) [S74276]
abstract: Simplify your AI infrastructure with ASUS integrated cluster solutions. We eliminate complexity by offering a preconfigured and optimized solution that spans hardware and software. Focus on achieving your AI goals with our easy-to-deploy and manage solution.

title: Enable Enterprise AI Adoption by Building Trust in AI Assets and Processes [S71889]
abstract:
Technology organizations have mastered the process of building, maturing, and releasing traditional software assets in a way that instills trust throughout the process. AI/ML assets represent a new paradigm lacking the same mature control level. To accelerate production-ready AI, AI workflows must be integrated within an organization’s standard DevOps and security frameworks — operating from a single source of truth.

We'll explore how existing frameworks can be expanded to encompass AI pipelines, emphasizing sustainable and secure processes that build trust in AI assets and facilitate a smooth transition from concept to production. We'll share insights from large organizations that have successfully integrated their DevSecOps practices into their AI workflows, illustrating the benefits for the organization and the data scientists and MLOps teams focused on delivering maximum value from AI/ML services.

title: Enable Human Telepresence with Generative AI [S72755]
abstract: We present the key research challenges in enabling highly photorealistic digital human synthesis. Departing from the industry-wide de-facto approach of using expensive multi-view human data captures, we present our innovative techniques that successfully harness the power of generative AI, large internet-scale data, and state-of-the-art neural 3D scene representations to create AI-based foundation models for highly photorealistic 3D digital human synthesis. We present the numerous downstream applications enabled by these foundational pieces of technology for digital humans, including, AI-mediated telepresence, content creation for film and gaming, and digital agents. We deep dive into AI-mediated telepresence and highlight many practical considerations encountered while building real-time cloud-enabled streaming systems for such telepresence solutions. Finally, we highlight open frontiers, which are avenues for further research in digital human understanding and creation.

title: Enable Intelligent Storage to Process Data for AI Applications  [S71937]
abstract: The common implementation of AI pipelines today is to bring data to AI. This works well when your dataset is relatively small and co-located. When we look at the next step of AI journey, we know one thing for sure: there will be a lot more data in a lot more locations. The effective way to address this challenge is to push AI processing closer to where the data is. This concept is “AI Content-Aware Storage (AI CAST).” The vision of content-aware storage is to enable intelligent storage to process data for AI applications. We'll demonstrate the architecture of AI CAST by leveraging  NVIDIA Blueprints and NIMs to accelerate the retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipeline by incorporating storage and storage metadata in the Continuous Data Ingest and vector DB management.

title: Enable Intelligent Storage to Process Data for AI Applications  [S71937]

title: Enable Novel Applications in the New AI Area in Medicine: Accelerated Feature Computation for Pathology Slides [P73532]
abstract:
In the field of digital pathology, histologic slides are scanned at high resolution and stored as images, amounting to ~50GB of data in uncompressed form. A key application of such whole slide images (WSI) is the extraction of quantitative pathological features (QPFs), which have many medical applications (e.g., breast cancer grading; see Amgad et al 2024).

We implemented an accelerated pipeline to compute QPFs directly from WSIs. The pipeline is built using PyTorch and designed to run efficiently on the GPU. It includes tissue and tumor detection, cell instance segmentation, and the computation of cellular features (texture and shape features). Our first prototype showed more than a magnitude of speedup compared to a popular open-source library.

GPU-accelerated QPFs have the potential to bring down the computation time of many novel medical applications (that are currently research-only) to a level where they meet turnaround requirements for clinical use.

title: Enable Tensor Core Programming in Python with CUTLASS 4.0 [S74639]
abstract: CUTLASS 4.0 introduces a new Python interface around the core abstractions within CUTLASS, allowing developers to unlock the same customizability and performance achieved today with C++ CUTLASS exclusively with Python. We'll preview how the CuTe programming model and a rich set of language-like features can be used to write performant custom kernels in a Pythonic way.

title: Enable Tensor Core Programming in Python with CUTLASS 4.0 [S74639]
abstract: CUTLASS 4.0 introduces a new Python interface around the core abstractions within CUTLASS, allowing developers to unlock the same customizability and performance achieved today with C++ CUTLASS exclusively with Python. We'll preview how the CuTe programming model and a rich set of language-like features can be used to write performant custom kernels in a Pythonic way.

title: Enabling a Future of Personalized Healthcare: Tackling Data Rates [S72071]
abstract: Personalized healthcare will revolutionize medical practice. In order to drive this change, data generation rates are growing at a staggering pace, and with them the need for technology that can adapt to current and future needs. Learn how the fusion of industry-leading compute and AI is removing bottlenecks and accelerating the timeline to the next generation of genomic insights for research and clinical pioneers.

title: Enabling Exabyte Scale AI Training and Inference (Presented by Pure Storage) [S73937]
abstract: GPU cloud providers and HPC projects are pushing the boundaries of leading-edge AI applications. These exabyte-scale AI training and inference projects demand extremely scalable performance and ultra high-density storage while also addressing power consumption and space constraints. Learn how you can scale AI training and inferencing projects including architecting for GPU cloud environments, delivering data throughput at scale, maximizing performance density, managing extremely large file volumes, and increasing Ethernet network performance. Gain insights into delivering exabyte-scale AI performance from hyper-scaler and HPC projects.

title: Enabling the Agent-First Future: Advancing Test-Time Search and Compute Infrastructure for Agentic Systems (Presented by Nebius) [S74365]
abstract: There's growing evidence that enhanced test-time computation unlocks the full potential of agentic systems, allowing them to search over strategies, roll back decisions, and dynamically reevaluate their actions. NVIDIA GPUs, powered by CUDA and NCCL libraries, play a crucial role in enabling these compute-intensive operations, accelerating massive searches and dynamic rollbacks with unparalleled speed through their parallel processing capabilities. However, significant infrastructural challenges remain, particularly in building lightweight environments where agents can efficiently undo actions, fork processes, and iterate rapidly. We'll explain how Nebius combines GPU acceleration with innovative infrastructure solutions to meet these challenges, showing how test-time search transforms software engineering agents and positions businesses for success in an agent-first world.

title: Enabling the Agent-First Future: Advancing Test-Time Search and Compute Infrastructure for Agentic Systems (Presented by Nebius) [S74365]
abstract: There's growing evidence that enhanced test-time computation unlocks the full potential of agentic systems, allowing them to search over strategies, roll back decisions, and dynamically reevaluate their actions. title: End-to-End Optimization of Onboard Autonomy Workloads [S73114]
abstract: Nuro Driver is an L4-capable, AI-first autonomy stack. Autonomy workloads have different performance characteristics than classical data center workloads, and thus can require different optimization approaches. They tend to be more heterogeneous and non-uniform, while being required to adhere to rigid execution constraints. We'll first explain how to define and measure relevant performance metrics, and then deep dive into how we achieved the targets for Nuro Driver. We'll cover mechanisms like compute resource isolation, workload scheduling, quantization challenges across different model types, and multi-GPU-aware ML compiler framework.

title: Energy and Shared Memory Contention-Aware Execution of DNN Inference on Multi-Accelerator Heterogeneous SoCs [P73492]
abstract:
Two distinguishing features of state-of-the-art mobile and autonomous systems are: (1) there are often multiple workloads, mainly deep neural network (DNN) inference, running concurrently and continuously; and (2) they operate on shared memory system-on-a-chips (SoCs) that embed heterogeneous accelerators tailored for specific operations. State-of-the-art systems lack efficient resource management techniques to maximize total system throughput.

We propose HaX-CoNN, a novel scheme that characterizes and maps layers in concurrently executing DNN inference workloads to a diverse set of accelerators within an SoC. Our scheme uniquely takes per-layer execution characteristics, shared memory contention, and inter-accelerator transitions into account to find optimal schedules. We evaluate HaX-CoNN on NVIDIA Orin, NVIDIA Xavier, and Qualcomm Snapdragon 865 SoCs. HaX-CoNN can minimize memory contention by up to 45% and improve total latency and throughput by up to 32% and 29% compared to the state of the art.

title: Energy-Efficient Supercomputing Through Tensor Core-Accelerated Mixed-Precision Computing and Floating-Point Emulation [S71487]
abstract: The trends in computer architecture, primarily driven by AI-based applications (most recently, large language models), has led to a rapid increase in the reduced- and mixed-precision computing capabilities of GPUs. These processors demonstrate an outsized power-efficiency (FLOPS/watt) advantage over systems almost exclusively focused upon native single- and double-precision arithmetic. Thus, there is a great deal of motivation to leverage these capabilities, through the use of various mixed-precision algorithms and emulation techniques, to facilitate greater scientific computing throughput without sacrificing accuracy. We'll touch upon a number of these approaches and present real-world case studies that provide compelling evidence in support of this path to increasing the science per watt of supercomputers.

title: Energy Transition: The Impact of Generative AI in Power Generation, Transmission, and Distribution [S73745]
abstract: Learn from the global industry thought leaders who are shaping the power industry to meet demands of the energy transition. This lightning talk session will bring Southern California Edison, Saudi Electric, Energy Power Research Institute, and Siemens Energy together to discuss the use of generative AI to better predict demand forecasting for distributed energy resources, and to make grid resilient.

title: Enhance ASR and TTS Models with LLM for Accessible Mathematical Learning in Students with Disabilities [P73346]
abstract: We present a solution to improve math education accessibility for students with visual and hearing impairments by leveraging NVIDIA NeMo's automatic speech recognition (ASR) and test-to-speech (TTS) capabilities and NIM's language models. This approach enhances equal access to education for students with disabilities, addressing a critical need in inclusive education.

title: Enhanced Decision-Making in Disaster Response with Multi-Agent AI [S72880]
abstract: We introduce an AI-enhanced command-and-control system designed to reduce cognitive load for decision-makers in rapidly evolving disaster-response scenarios. The system employs a multi-agent architecture with real-time signal processing and AI capabilities, seamlessly integrating simulation and communication data to deliver actionable insights and improve situational awareness. Utilizing NVIDIA's full-stack toolset and Leidos' expertise in modeling, simulation, and C2 technologies, this cloud-native solution orchestrates the multi-agent system to enhance decision-making efficiency and effectiveness in high-stress environments.

title: Enhanced Decision-Making in Disaster Response with Multi-Agent AI [S72880]
abstract: We introduce an AI-enhanced command-and-control system designed to reduce cognitive load for decision-makers in rapidly evolving disaster-response scenarios. The system employs a multi-agent architecture with real-time signal processing and AI capabilities, seamlessly integrating simulation and communication data to deliver actionable insights and improve situational awareness. Utilizing NVIDIA's full-stack toolset and Leidos' expertise in modeling, simulation, and C2 technologies, this cloud-native solution orchestrates the multi-agent system to enhance decision-making efficiency and effectiveness in high-stress environments.

title: Enhanced Lateral Movement Detection With NVIDIA NIM and NeMo [S71515]
abstract: The increasing complexity and interconnectedness of enterprise networks have made lateral movement intrusions more sophisticated, demanding equally advanced detection strategies. We present a novel and lightweight method for detecting lateral movement by leveraging user and entity behavior analytics (UEBA) and machine learning on NVIDIA Morpheus. This approach enhances threat detection efficiency while minimizing time-to-value. To improve model interpretability and explainability, we build an interaction layer powered by NVIDIA NIM and NeMo on Morpheus. This layer generates incident summaries per entity by aggregating alerts, employing a LLM for (1) incident summarization and contextual search query generation with NIM and (2) threat intelligence retrieval via NeMo. This enables cybersecurity operators and threat hunters to swiftly triage accounts and systems involved in incidents, potentially reducing analysis time from weeks to days.

title: Enhance Geomechanics Simulation Performance With NVIDIA Grace CPU [P74405]
abstract:
This poster presents the collaborative efforts of Petrobras, CESAR, and NVIDIA in advancing geomechanics simulations by porting the GeomecBR to Arm. GeomecBR, an advanced geomechanics simulator developed by Petrobras, leverages the finite element method and multiscale techniques to predict subsurface behavior, crucial for oil and gas production. The simulator's main engine is SolverBR, a high-performance linear solver optimized for HPC environments, already ported to Arm in previous work. 

We'll delve into the steps of converting GeomecBR to Arm-based CPUs and discuss the challenges of transitioning from x86 Intel compilers to open-source alternatives like the GFortran compiler. We'll finish by presenting comparative performance analyses conducted in both cloud and on-premises settings. Initial results have shown a performance gain with Arm-based CPUs over Intel Xeon instances, alongside reduced cloud and energy costs.

title: Enhance LLMs With Writing in the Margins (WiM): A Better Inference Pattern for Long-Context Retrieval [S72323]
abstract: In the evolving landscape of artificial intelligence, managing long input sequences efficiently remains a significant challenge for large language models in retrieval-oriented tasks. We introduce a novel inference pattern, Writing in the Margins (WiM), specifically designed to address this issue. WiM innovatively utilizes a chunked prefill of the key-value cache, enabling segment-wise inference that significantly enhances the handling of extensive contexts. This method facilitates the generation and classification of intermediate information, termed "margins," which strategically guide the model toward accomplishing specific tasks. To further optimize this process, we integrate WiM with TensorRT, a high-performance deep learning inference platform. This combination allows for the efficient execution of LLMs by leveraging TensorRT’s capabilities to accelerate computational processes and reduce latency.

title: Enhance Observability for Chatbot Platforms With LLM Tracing and Security-Aware Configuration​ [P73588]
abstract: Our architecture tackles the critical challenge of LLM observability in chatbot platforms by integrating OpenTelemetry with LangChain callbacks to enable secure, sensitivity-aware tracing and data collection. This solution enhances the performance, reliability, and security of chatbots by offering deep insights into LLM workflows, including advanced reasoning techniques like ReAct and Chain of Thoughts. With proactive monitoring every five minutes, the system achieves a 2.5-minute mean-time-to-detect, minimizing latency and ensuring faster issue resolution. Additionally, customizable security configurations for individual bots maintain optimal performance and security. This implementation has demonstrated significant reductions in downtime and improved user experience, with the potential to be applied broadly across chatbot platforms to enhance overall system efficiency.

title: Enhance Operational Efficiency in Assembly Line Processes Using Video Analytics AI Agent (Presented by TCS) [S74614]
abstract: TCS will examine the implementation of a custom graphical user interface that was used to enhance standard operating procedure adherence and assembly line efficiency, leveraging NVIDIA’s video analytics AI agent. This agent enabled more accurate and meaningful interpretations, improving the functionality of video analytics applications and analysis. Learn how application of this advanced vision agent for activity recognition meticulously monitored the assembly and disassembly of laptops on the assembly line. TCS will discuss the technological backbone used for this sophisticated content generation and how AI models were leveraged to deliver accurate and insightful analysis. Learn how to achieve enhanced operational efficiency and ensure stringent quality control through precise activity tracking and accurate component placement. Discover how to unlock new application possibilities.

title: Enhance Operational Efficiency in Assembly Line Processes Using Video Analytics AI Agent (Presented by TCS) [S74614]
abstract: TCS will examine the implementation of a custom graphical user interface that was used to enhance standard operating procedure adherence and assembly line efficiency, leveraging NVIDIA’s video analytics AI agent. This agent enabled more accurate and meaningful interpretations, improving the functionality of video analytics applications and analysis. Learn how application of this advanced vision agent for activity recognition meticulously monitored the assembly and disassembly of laptops on the assembly line. TCS will discuss the technological backbone used for this sophisticated content generation and how AI models were leveraged to deliver accurate and insightful analysis. Learn how to achieve enhanced operational efficiency and ensure stringent quality control through precise activity tracking and accurate component placement. Discover how to unlock new application possibilities.

title: Enhance Patient Safety With Privacy-Preserving AI: Multimodal DNN and VLM for Event Detection in Healthcare [P73419]
abstract: Privacy-enhancing technologies, combined with multimodal deep neural networks (DNN) and vision-language models (VLM), are transforming patient monitoring by ensuring privacy, security, and contextual understanding in healthcare environments. This system integrates differentially private AI models with identity recognition and event detection to perform critical tasks such as fall detection, identifying dangerous activities, and recognizing elderly patients without exposing image data. Additionally, by incorporating VLM for natural image captioning (NIM), it helps healthcare providers gain clearer insights into event causes, improving response accuracy. This privacy-secure network reduces supervision needs, accelerates response times, and enhances patient and staff safety while seamlessly integrating with existing healthcare infrastructure.

title: Enhance Real-World Educational Materials With AI: Multimodal Solutions to Empower Educators [S71997]
abstract: Education often feels like a half-built bridge, struggling to connect what’s taught with how it’s used. Enter Evoke AI — a game-changer that transforms lessons from theory into vibrant, real-world experiences. Imagine a classroom where concepts aren’t just explained — they’re lived; where every student’s unique needs are met, and learning sparks true curiosity. Powered by NVIDIA’s technology, Evoke AI turns abstract ideas into interactive scenarios, making learning engaging and relevant. It’s not just about flashy tech; it’s about bridging gaps between theory and practice, teachers and students. Evoke AI empowers educators without replacing them, freeing up time by handling routine tasks so teachers can focus on building real connections. It caters to diverse learning needs, enhancing the joy of teaching and learning alike. Join us in making education not just smarter, but truly transformative.

title: Enhance Short-Dated IV Curve Calibration With Spot Volatility Estimation [P74372]
abstract: Discover how CUDA acceleration can significantly speed up the Fourier transform method for spot volatility estimation, improving short-dated IV curves calibration. This enhanced approach can be further applied in machine learning models to achieve more accurate price trend predictions. Moreover, the high-speed calculations make it feasible to utilize high-frequency data for spot volatility estimation, helping to mitigate the risk of financial crises.

title: Enhancing Domain-Specific Chatbot Evaluation [P73589]
abstract: An automated evaluation framework will simplify the process of assessing chatbot responses for new feature improvements, enabling consistent monitoring and reducing dependence on user feedback. This will save developers time on manual labeling and reduce the mean time for issue detection.

title: Enhancing Genomic Variant Detection [S71897]
abstract:
The genomics field is rapidly expanding. Efficient, accurate data analysis is critical for applications like drug discovery and precision medicine. Next-generation sequencing (NGS) generates massive datasets that require advanced bioinformatics tools for efficient processing and analysis.

We'll delve into how we leveraged the enhancements that were made possible by NVIDIA Clara Parabricks, a GPU-accelerated secondary analysis software. We'll share a study on 500 WES samples showing how Parabricks achieved 25X faster processing times and identified 9,000 more mutation sites in patients than traditional CPU-based pipelines. We'll demonstrate how to implement this technology, enabling you to benefit from greater precision and effectiveness when analyzing vast datasets.

title: Enhancing Oil & Gas Innovation: High-Fidelity Simulations & AI Surrogates with Accelerated Computing [S72150]
abstract:
The presentation with Schlumberger NV (SLB) emphasizes how cloud-based NVIDIA GPUs enable highly detailed and reliable simulations, helping developers optimize equipment design and production strategies. It's vital for the community, as it shows how advanced GPU technology is revolutionizing the oil & gas industry by addressing one of its most challenging aspects — equipment performance under harsh downhole conditions. By leveraging the immense parallel processing power of cloud-based NVIDIA GPUs, developers can conduct highly detailed and reliable simulations that were previously unattainable due to computational limitations.

These simulations enable precise modeling of complex physical phenomena, such as multiphase flows and particle interactions, which are critical for optimizing equipment design and production strategies. The insights gained not only improve operational efficiency and reduce maintenance costs, but also help ensure safer and more sustainable energy extraction. We'll underscore how cutting-edge technology can drive innovation, solve industry-critical problems, and unlock significant economic and operational benefits for stakeholders.

We'll also show how AI surrogate models can be built using NVIDIA Modulus based on the high-fidelity simulations to accelerate results by 100X, with real time inference in seconds. We'll include benchmark studies of combined computational fluid dynamics/discrete element method (CFD-DEM) simulations on various GPUs, and the end-to-end process of building an AI surrogate model using NVIDIA Modulus. 

Gain insights with significant potential for improving the safety and efficiency of hydrocarbon recovery by minimizing maintenance costs and improving effectiveness in high-salinity environments, demonstrating the transformative role of cutting-edge technologies in addressing critical industry challenges. By utilizing NVIDIA GPUs for high-fidelity simulations and NVIDIA Modulus to build AI surrogate models, the potential revenue impact for all types of energy companies could range from $150 million to over $1 billion annually, to pave the way for new, more efficient, and more sustainable technologies.

title: Enhancing Photovoltaic Power Prediction With High-Resolution Weather Forecasting From NVIDIA Earth-2 [S71387]
abstract: Renewable energy is crucial for the sustainable development of human society. However, most forms of renewable energy, such as solar energy, are heavily influenced by weather conditions, necessitating accurate forecasting for large-scale utilization. NVIDIA's Earth-2 platform, a full-stack and open solution, enables more efficient weather predictions. The predicted weather data helps to enhance the accuracy of photovoltaic power forecasts. We'll share our experiences, insights, and key takeaways from a collaborative project between GCL, PKU, and NVIDIA, which utilized time series models and weather data from the Earth-2 platform to predict photovoltaic power generation output.

title: Enhancing Photovoltaic Power Prediction With High-Resolution Weather Forecasting From NVIDIA Earth-2 [S71387]
abstract: Renewable energy is crucial for the sustainable development of human society. However, most forms of renewable energy, such as solar energy, are heavily influenced by weather conditions, necessitating accurate forecasting for large-scale utilization. NVIDIA's Earth-2 platform, a full-stack and open solution, enables more efficient weather predictions. The predicted weather data helps to enhance the accuracy of photovoltaic power forecasts. We'll share our experiences, insights, and key takeaways from a collaborative project between GCL, PKU, and NVIDIA, which utilized time series models and weather data from the Earth-2 platform to predict photovoltaic power generation output.

title: Enhancing Radiopharmaceutical Decision Support with Telix’s AutoML and CDSS Platform [P74389]
abstract: In the rapidly advancing field of radiopharmaceuticals, AI plays a critical role in transforming clinical workflows, particularly in the interpretation of complex medical imaging. Telix’s platform combines AutoML, MLOps, and CDSS (Clinical Decision Support System) to deliver actionable insights from PET/CT and PET/MRI imaging data for improved patient outcomes in oncology. The platform’s mixed-stacked, ensemble-based AutoML technology automatically generates multiple models during the training process and combines them into a super-ensemble for deployment, ensuring higher accuracy in predictions. This innovative approach is applied directly within the CDSS, allowing clinicians to make faster, more reliable treatment decisions based on real-time AI-driven predictions.

title: Enhancing Radiopharmaceutical Decision Support with Telix’s AutoML and CDSS Platform [P74389]
abstract: In the rapidly advancing field of radiopharmaceuticals, AI plays a critical role in transforming clinical workflows, particularly in the interpretation of complex medical imaging. title: Enhancing Surgical Efficiency With Concurrent On-Edge AI Algorithms [S71974]
abstract: Join us to explore how four AI algorithms running concurrently on NVIDIA IGX Orin optimize robot-assisted partial nephrectomy. Learn how phase recognition, organ segmentation, anonymization, and augmented reality provide real-time solutions for surgical precision, efficiency, and patient safety.

title: Enterprise Gen AI's Next Wave: Unlock Efficiency and Effectiveness in Business specific functions with Agentic AI (Presented by Deloitte) [S74233]
abstract:
Companies today are only scratching the surface of how foundation models can be used to transform business operations. The traditional setup of closed-source business model plus RAG can serve a few basic archetypes (e.g., "chat with your data", customer service chatbots) - but a fundamentally different approach is needed to deploy foundation models and unlock value in core business operations. What's needed is a new kind of application - one that begins with open-source models, deeply fine-tunes them with domain-specific data, and surrounds them with agents to allow them to problem-solve in specific functions and domain areas. In this session, you'll learn about how Deloitte and NVIDIA are partnering to create these domain-specific, agentic AI solutions, and the types of business problems they can uniquely solve.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Enterprise MLOps 101 [S71732]
abstract:
Virtually every organization has heard that they need to establish a machine learning operations (MLOps) practice, or at least define an MLOps strategy. Because machine learning systems are complex software systems, the ecosystem of tools supporting MLOps is rich and diverse. Unfortunately, enterprises often attempt to understand MLOps by first understanding this ecosystem, or by studying another organization’s processes — and the emergence of generative AI applications appears to add still more layers of complexity.
 
Learn a framework for making sense of MLOps that will also enable you to understand what the ecosystem offers. You’ll learn how to support the entire machine learning workflow and tomorrow’s generative AI apps, to evaluate which offerings are best for your needs, and to tailor a solution for your team. You’ll leave this session with a clear map to MLOps and large language model operations (LLMOps) processes, practices, and solutions that will support your organization’s machine learning initiatives.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Evaluating RAG and Semantic Search Systems [DLIT71593]
abstract:
As adoption of LLMs and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) becomes more prevalent in enterprise, the demand for robust evaluation arises, ensuring these new tools meet the high regulatory standards of various industries. Gain an in-depth understanding of the unique requirements as well as practical tools to robustly evaluate such systems addressing the complex nature of the underlying data. We'll introduce evaluation techniques addressing domain-specific language and knowledge, specific evaluation metrics, and independent assessment of the retrieval and generation steps, all while taking temporal information into account.
Prerequisite(s):

Python.
Basic knowledge of LLMs and RAG.

title: Evaluating the Adversarial Robustness of Detection Transformers [P73484]
abstract: This research presents a comprehensive evaluation of detection transformer (DETR) model and its variants under white-box and black-box adversarial attacks, using the MS-COCO and KITTI datasets to cover general and autonomous driving scenarios. We extend prominent white-box attack methods (FGSM, PGD, and C&W) to assess DETR’s vulnerability, demonstrating that DETR models are significantly susceptible to adversarial attacks, like traditional CNN-based detectors. Our extensive transferability analysis reveals high intra-network transferability among DETR variants but limited cross-network transferability to CNN-based models. Additionally, we propose a novel untargeted attack designed specifically for DETR, exploiting its intermediate loss functions to induce misclassification with minimal perturbations. Performed train/evaluation on Clemson Palmetto HPC with Nvidia V100 &A100 GPUs for about 600 hours.​

title: Everything DGX! [CWE72415]
abstract:
Wondering how to incorporate new technology into your current DGX SuperPOD? Trying to understand exactly how usage and management of a B200 DGX SuperPOD compares to one with DGX GB200? Trying to understand something that seems simple, but somehow isn't, on an NVIDIA DGX? This is the session for you! Connect with solution architects, product managers, and other experts in an open discussion to help get your questions answered by the people who know.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Everything You Want to Ask About NVIDIA Enterprise Reference Architectures [CWE74549]
abstract: Engage directly with NVIDIA specialists to discuss the new NVIDIA Enterprise Reference Architecture program in this informal "Connect With Experts" session. This is a unique opportunity to ask questions, share insights, and gain a deeper understanding of how these reference architectures help our global systems partners to streamline enterprise AI deployments. This session is ideal for IT professionals, AI system architects, and anyone interested in leveraging NVIDIA's cutting-edge technologies to deploy AI in the enterprise. Don’t miss this chance to connect with experts and deepen your understanding of NVIDIA's innovative enterprise AI solutions!

This is a unique opportunity to ask questions, share insights, and gain a deeper understanding of how this architecture can streamline the deployment of generative AI services in cloud environments. This session is ideal for cloud providers, IT professionals, and anyone interested in leveraging NVIDIA's cutting-edge technologies to enhance their AI service offerings. Don’t miss this chance to connect with experts and deepen your understanding of NVIDIA's innovative solutions!

title: Evolving Cooling Needs for High-Density Data Centers (Presented by Schneider Electric) [EXS74466]
abstract: Join our engaging fireside chat where industry leaders discuss the transformative potential of liquid cooling solutions in modern data centers. As AI workloads continue to evolve, so does the need for innovative cooling strategies that ensure efficiency and reliability. Discover the benefits these systems offer, from improved performance to enhanced energy efficiency, and learn how to navigate the selection of heat rejection methods and coolant distribution unit types. Our experts will discuss the latest advancements and provide insights into optimizing your data center operations.

title: Expert Tips for Optimizing AI Infrastructure (Presented by Penguin Solutions) [EXS74620]
abstract: In this highly engaging and informative 15-minute session, learn three expert tips for getting the most value and highest performance out of your AI Infrastructure. The challenges of deploying AI infrastructure are daunting — from finding the right partner to choosing the right technology from myriad hardware and software choices to standing up your new system so it runs efficiently. And just when you think you’ve crossed the finish line, there's the ongoing management and reporting. Today’s AI infrastructure deployments “are not your father’s IT data center.” These new systems are amazing and powerful. They harness cutting-edge technologies that come hand-in-hand with intense workloads, placing incredible demands on administrative resources tasked with managing their computational complexity. Gain insight into field-proven tips from Penguin Solutions’ savvy AI/HPC expert CTO that will help you optimize your AI infrastructure.

title: Exploit Inter-Layer Expert Affinity for Mixture-of-Experts Model Inference [P73569]
abstract: Deploying GPT mixture-of-experts (MoE) models for parallel inference on distributed systems presents significant challenges, primarily due to the extensive all-to-all communication required for expert routing and aggregation. We propose a lightweight optimization technique, called ExFlow, to largely accelerate the inference of these MoE models. By carefully examining the conditional probability in tokens' routing across multiple layers, we proved that pre-trained GPT MoE models implicitly exhibit a strong inter-layer expert affinity. We then design an efficient integer programming model to capture such features and show that by properly placing the experts on corresponding GPUs, we can reduce up to 67% cross-GPU routing latency. Our solution beats the cutting-edge MoE implementations with experts from 8 to 64, with up to 2.2X improvement in inference throughput.

title: Exploit Inter-Layer Expert Affinity for Mixture-of-Experts Model Inference [P73569]

title: Explore AI-Assisted Developer Tools for Accelerated Computing Application Development [S72435]
abstract: AI-assisted developer tools are evolving rapidly and provide developers with unprecedented productivity boosts. Our panel will discuss the latest developments on how AI is changing our approach to software development by looking at the latest features, capabilities, and trends from the commercial solutions, and areas of research that will shape the next generation of developer tools — from code generation to code refactoring and porting for performance or maintenance, and more. We'll also discuss how supporting accelerated computing can be accelerated by AI and what makes it different from traditional software development approaches. Our panelists will represent the commercial solutions available in the marketplace, as well as NVIDIA research, academics, and NVIDIA's AI-assisted developer tools team.

title: Exploring Breakthroughs in Healthcare using Generative AI for Radiology Imaging (Presented by AHEAD) [S74632]
abstract: In this engaging interview, Kris Kristinsdottir, machine learning engineer at Northwestern Medicine, shares insights into her role and background, the founding and vision of the R&D team, and what makes their approach unique. She discusses the success of Northwestern's Aries Program and the impact of NVIDIA on leveraging multi-modal LLMs. Kris also offers recommendations for practitioners and highlights exciting projects her team aims to accomplish this year. This conversation provides a comprehensive look into the innovative strategies and achievements driving Northwestern Medicine's advancements in the healthcare industry.

title: Exploring Earth’s Oceans: Using Digital Twins to Drive Digital Ocean Collaboration  [S73656]
abstract: The Earth's oceans cover over 70% of the planet's surface and play a crucial role in regulating climate, supporting biodiversity, and facilitating human activities. Despite their importance, the vastness and complexity of oceanic systems pose significant challenges in research, conservation, and management. This presentation explores the innovative use of NVIDIA's Omniverse platform to enhance digital collaboration in ocean exploration, research, and conservation efforts. By integrating real-time simulation, AI-driven modeling, and immersive visualization techniques, Omniverse enables scientists, educators, and policymakers to work together seamlessly across disciplines and locations. This exploration highlights a new paradigm for ocean research that harnesses the power of digital technologies to bridge gaps in understanding, promote sustainable practices, and protect our marine ecosystems. Join us as we chart a course for the future of ocean exploration through digital collaboration, driving initiatives that will enhance our stewardship of the world's oceans.

title: Exploring Factory-Scale Digital Twin Simulation [S73069]
abstract: Join Rockwell experts to hear how Emulate3D, OpenUSD, and Omniverse Cloud API’s are helping power factory-scale digital twin simulations, and how engineers can use these to virtually commission plants before they're even built. Explore Rockwell’s journey with OpenUSD and Omniverse with a deep dive into “why,” “how,” and “when” factory-scaling is necessary when working with complex models for simulating factories, warehouses, and plants.

title: Extending PCIe/CXL by Using Active Electrical Cables (Presented by Credo) [EXS74602]
abstract: Get an in-depth look at active electrical cables (AECs) using PCIe re-timers, trade-offs versus passive cabling, and emerging applications.

title: EY Voice: Artificial Intelligence-powered Contact Centers (Presented by EY) [S74622]
abstract: EY Voice is transforming how institutions understand and respond to customer interactions. This powerful tool leverages the latest in AI and large language models to monitor and analyze interactions, providing actionable insights at scale. By extracting valuable information from call transcripts, emails, chats, and more, EY Voice serves as a listening post driving productivity and automation within the contact center and delivering enterprise insights to enable digital transformation, improve revenue through enhanced customer/client engagement, improve and automate compliance, and enhance customer experience. Learn how organizations are integrating EY Voice into their operations to enhance decision-making and deliver value to diverse stakeholder groups — including customer experience, operations, compliance, and product development.

title: EY Voice: Artificial Intelligence-powered Contact Centers (Presented by EY) [S74622]
abstract: EY Voice is transforming how institutions understand and respond to customer interactions. title: Fast and Secure LLM Inference: GPU-Optimized CKKS Homomorphic Encryption [P73617]
abstract: Discover the technical underpinnings of implementing fully homomorphic encryption using the CKKS scheme to secure large language models (LLMs) on NVIDIA GPUs. This poster explores the foundations behind the encrypted LLM and demonstrates how it enables scalable encryption for billion-parameter models like Llama2 7B. We’ll dive deep into GPU acceleration, showcasing the optimization of bootstrapping, approximate activation functions, and matrix operations, which make secure LLM inference possible at scale. Gain insights into the cryptographic superiority of CKKS and how NVIDIA GPUs unlock unprecedented speed and efficiency for encrypted AI solutions.

title: Faster Triton Kernels on NVIDIA Ampere and Hopper [P72750]
abstract: We analyzed the performance of Triton kernels on NVIDIA A100 and H100 GPUs using Nsight Systems and Nsight Compute, which helped gain insights to performance bottlenecks. Modifications of the Triton kernels, using techniques such as SplitK parallelization and others, result in competitive performance results in the same ballpark as cuBLAS.

title: Fast Inference at Scale: Build SLA-Focused AI Stacks for Enterprise-Grade Scale (Presented by Simplismart) [EXS74490 ]
abstract: With the growing amount of data and number of models, ML workloads vary largely from company to company and use case to use case. Learn how enterprises break down their inference stack on a granular level and build the perfect stack needed to infer at the fastest speed possible, at the highest scale feasible. We'll quickly run through how enterprises use this modular approach to manage the trade-offs between cost <> latency <> throughput <> quality, all in order to increase return on investment (ROI). This session is brought to you by Simplismart, a member of the NVIDIA Inception program for startups.

title: Fast Orthogonal Search on Graphics Processing Unit [P71679]
abstract: See a novel method of detecting rotor faults in induction motors using a parallel fast orthogonal search (FOS) algorithm. Conventional methods based on current signature analysis that use the fast Fourier transform (FFT) are limited in applications that require high resolution and that are prone to transient conditions. Moreover, when motors are operating under light load conditions, a fine resolution must be achieved to distinguish between harmonics, since the fault signatures will be very close to the fundamental frequency. A balance between resolution and sampling time is needed, which is difficult with the FFT. An FOS algorithm is used to perform a high-resolution spectral analysis on stator current data to detect the fault signatures in a timely fashion.  FOS requires more computation time than FFT approaches, but by parallelizing the FOS algorithm, the computation time can be substantially decreased, and real-time performance can be attained.

title: Fast Orthogonal Search on Graphics Processing Unit [P71679]
abstract: See a novel method of detecting rotor faults in induction motors using a parallel fast orthogonal search (FOS) algorithm. title: Fault-Tolerant Managed Training: Crusoe Cloud’s Blueprint for AI Reliability (Presented by Crusoe.ai) [S74475]
abstract: Crusoe Cloud is revolutionizing AI with unmatched reliability and simplicity. With a seven-fold growth in customers since the last GTC, we’re rapidly becoming the go-to cloud for AI innovation. Discover how our managed training service eliminates complexity, allowing you to focus on building groundbreaking products using NVIDIA accelerated computing infrastructure. See it in action: automatic node-swapping, advanced monitoring, and actionable performance insights — all setting the “gold standard” for enterprise AI workloads. Join us to explore why top innovators trust Crusoe Cloud for their mission-critical AI training.

title: Federated Computing in the Real World: From Drug Discovery to Fraud Detection [P73585]
abstract: Rhino Federated Computing streamlines data collaborations using a mix of federated learning, edge computing, and generative AI. Learn more through illustrative case studies including drug discovery and fraud detection.

abstract: Rhino Federated Computing streamlines data collaborations using a mix of federated learning, edge computing, and generative AI. Learn more through illustrative case studies including drug discovery and fraud detection.

abstract: Rhino Federated Computing streamlines data collaborations using a mix of federated learning, edge computing, and generative AI. Learn more through illustrative case studies including drug discovery and fraud detection.

title: Federated Learning in Medical Imaging: Enhancing Data Privacy and Advancing Healthcare [S73112]
abstract: Federated learning is revolutionizing medical imaging by enabling collaborative AI development while preserving data privacy. In this session, attendees will gain insights into how federated learning advances healthcare by protecting patient data, simplifying collaboration, and accelerating the development of AI solutions for medical imaging. In healthcare, sharing sensitive patient data across institutions is challenging due to privacy regulations and contracting issues. Federated Learning addresses these concerns by allowing institutions to train AI models on decentralized data without transferring raw patient information. This session will explore how federated learning overcomes traditional barriers to innovation, with a focus on practical applications that enable healthcare organizations to harness distributed computing power. We will highlight key use cases, such as handling rare diseases with limited data availability across institutions and overcoming the lack of centralized compute resources often needed for training complex AI models. We will also examine the impact of federated learning on real-world case studies that not only tackle data privacy concerns, but also support researching rare disease and triaging patients.

title: Field Notes on Scaling Real-Time AI-Native Applications in Production (Presented by Baseten) [EXS74242]
abstract: Today’s AI models power a new class of real-time generative applications, but these near-magical user experiences can stumble when faced with the market’s overwhelming demand for these tools. Drawing from years of experience in scaling mission-critical production workloads for AI-native startups and enterprises, we'll outline the most important — and often overlooked — considerations for building robust AI model-serving infrastructure.

title: Finance-Specific Embeddings: Achieving Precision in Financial Data Search [P73504]
abstract: See how Linq-Embed-Finance improves the accuracy of financial data retrieval by up to 31% compared to general-purpose models. Leveraging the retrieval augmented generation (RAG) pipeline, Linq-Embed-Finance handles the complexities of financial documents such as earnings reports, 10-K/Q filings, and multistep queries. Learn how this model provides financial analysts with precise, context-rich information to make informed decisions across vast financial datasets.
