title: Find the Bottleneck: Optimize AI Pipelines With Nsight Systems  [DLIT71670]
abstract:
Learn to use NVIDIA Nsight Systems to detect bottlenecks in AI pipelines and explore new features to optimize and scale the execution of your applications. We'll guide you through the performance analysis process of GPU-accelerated AI applications that run across multiple, possibly containerized, compute instances. In addition to profiling of CPU, GPU, network and I/O activity, we'll show how NVTX and the plugin mechanism enable the collection of custom data, which allows an even more comprehensive and tailored analysis on the target platform. You'll also learn about the recipe system that simplifies the identification of bottlenecks in applications running across multiple nodes.
Prerequisite(s):

Familiarity with GPUs and CUDA.

title: Fine-Grained GPU Partitioning for Higher Performance and Energy Efficiency  [P73590]
abstract: Our experiments show partitioning and multiplexing the GPUs with multi-process service and multi-instance GPUs allows for higher throughput and higher energy efficiency for ML and HPC workloads. We present our analysis with different generation GPUs and show more than 25% energy efficiency compared to running applications without partitioning the GPUs.

title: Fine-Grained GPU Partitioning for Higher Performance and Energy Efficiency  [P73590]
abstract: Our experiments show partitioning and multiplexing the GPUs with multi-process service and multi-instance GPUs allows for higher throughput and higher energy efficiency for ML and HPC workloads. We present our analysis with different generation GPUs and show more than 25% energy efficiency compared to running applications without partitioning the GPUs.

title: Five Tips to Make You an Above-Average AI Data Storage Expert (Presented by Solidigm) [EXS74223]
abstract: We hold these truths to be self-evident: AI needs data; data needs infrastructure; and infrastructure needs performance, efficiency, and scalability. But how to do it? That’s the hard part. We'll provide five tips to accelerate your journey to becoming the most informed person you know on data infrastructure, an often-overlooked but critical part of producing great AI outcomes.

title: FlashAttention-3: Fast and Accurate Attention With Asynchrony and Low Precision [S71368]
abstract: Attention, as a core layer of the ubiquitous Transformer architecture, is the bottleneck for large language models and long-context applications. FlashAttention pioneered an approach to speed up attention on GPUs by minimizing memory reads/writes. However, it has yet to take advantage of recent hardware. We develop three main techniques to speed up attention on NVIDIA Hopper GPUs: exploiting asynchrony of the Tensor Cores and TMA to (1) overlap overall computation and data movement via warp-specialization and interleave block-wise matmul and softmax operations, and (2) block quantization and incoherent processing that leverages hardware support for FP8 low-precision. Our method, FlashAttention-3, achieves speedup on H100 GPUs by 1.5-2.0X, with BF16 reaching up to 800 TFLOPs/s, and with FP8 reaching1.3 PFLOPs/s. We validate that FP8 FlashAttention-3 achieves 2.6X lower numerical error than a baseline FP8 attention.

title: FlashAttention-3: Fast and Accurate Attention With Asynchrony and Low Precision [S71368]
abstract: Attention, as a core layer of the ubiquitous Transformer architecture, is the bottleneck for large language models and long-context applications. FlashAttention pioneered an approach to speed up attention on GPUs by minimizing memory reads/writes. However, it has yet to take advantage of recent hardware. We develop three main techniques to speed up attention on NVIDIA Hopper GPUs: exploiting asynchrony of the Tensor Cores and TMA to (1) overlap overall computation and data movement via warp-specialization and interleave block-wise matmul and softmax operations, and (2) block quantization and incoherent processing that leverages hardware support for FP8 low-precision. Our method, FlashAttention-3, achieves speedup on H100 GPUs by 1.5-2.0X, with BF16 reaching up to 800 TFLOPs/s, and with FP8 reaching1.3 PFLOPs/s. We validate that FP8 FlashAttention-3 achieves 2.6X lower numerical error than a baseline FP8 attention.

title: FlexAttention: The Flexibility of PyTorch With the Performance of FlashAttention [S72236]
abstract: Introducing FlexAttention: a novel PyTorch API that enables custom, user-defined attention mechanisms with performance comparable to state-of-the-art solutions. By leveraging the PyTorch compiler stack, FlexAttention supports dynamic modifications to attention scores within SDPA, achieving both runtime and memory efficiency through kernel fusion with the FlashAttention algorithm. Our benchmarks on A100 GPUs show FlexAttention achieves 90% of FlashAttention2's performance in forward passes and 85% in backward passes. On H100 GPUs, FlexAttention's forward performance averages 85% of FlashAttention3 and is ~25% faster than FlashAttention2, while backward performance averages 76% of FlashAttention3 and is ~3% faster than FlashAttention2. Explore how FlexAttention balances near-state-of-the-art performance with unparalleled flexibility, empowering researchers to rapidly iterate on attention mechanisms without sacrificing efficiency.

title: Flexible and Optimized Architecture to Train, Secure, and Deliver AI to the Edge (Presented by F5) [EXS74427]
abstract: Building and delivering AI applications is moving from experimentation by select groups with minimal cost controls to mainstream use, managed within organizations’ overall technology groups with real return-on-investment (ROI) calculations. Over the past couple of years, we've come to understand that it's not unlike architectures we are already familiar with, whether high performance computing data centers, previously only found in research, or microservice-based applications that have been adopted over the last decade. While we aren’t starting from scratch, we still must be aware of how AI differs, and what architectural decisions will influence performance, cost, and security. We’ll touch on architecture and security across training of models, inferencing, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), hybrid and multicloud networking, and edge AI deployments, in addition to protecting LLM model outputs and inputs.

title: Flight Training Reimagined With Mixed Reality [D7001]
abstract:
Experience Vertex Solutions and Archer’s flight simulator, powered by NVIDIA RTX™ GPUs

Location: XR Pavilion (Tech Interactive Museum)
XR Pavilion Hours:
Tuesday, Mar 18 | 1:00 PM - 7:00 PM PDT
Wednesday, Mar 19 | 12:00 PM - 7:00 PM PDT
Thursday, Mar 20 | 12:00 PM - 7:00 PM PDT
Friday, Mar 21 | 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM PDT

title: Fortran Standard Parallelism on Grace Hopper With Unified Memory [P72780]
abstract: Simplify GPU-accelerated code development without sacrificing performance using the new features of the Grace Hopper Superchip. By activating the "unified memory" feature in the NVIDA HPC SDK compiler, we used the parallel features of the Fortran standard language to accelerate two production open-source solar physics codes, without needing any GPU-specific external APIs, such as OpenACC or OpenMP directives.  The unique features of the Grace Hopper Superchip allow the pure Fortran codes to run even faster than when using manual data management directives.  We also show good scaling out to multiple Grace Hopper Superchips.

title: For What the Bell Tolls [S74524]
abstract: With today’s exascale computers requiring 20-40 megawatts (MW) and some cloud centers exceeding 100MW, and with no slacking of demand in sight, computing is a non-negligible factor in climate change. Today’s market for computing hardware is driven by machine learning applications that can exploit lower-precision arithmetic. Traditional computational science and engineering are therefore being reinvented to employ lower-precision arithmetic and replacement of blocks of operator and field data by low-rank substitutes, where possible without impacting accuracy. We provide examples from various applications, including Gordon Bell Prize finalist research in 2022 in environmental statistics, in 2023 in seismic processing, and in 2024 in genomics and again in climate emulation. The last broke through to capture the 2024 Gordon Bell Prize in Climate Modeling. We'll elucidate the algorithmic “secret sauce” shared by these diverse applications for which the (Gordon) Bell tolls.

title: Foundation Models in Biology [S73083]
abstract: Foundation models have revolutionized how we interact with the digital world, enabling vast efficiencies from the mundane automation of tasks to the handling of complex data. The same is true for biological systems and data, while the field grapples with the challenges of adapting and extending these models to solve fundamental problems in drug discovery and development. We'll dive into capabilities, promises, limitations, and future efforts in biological foundation modeling. We'll be joined by a panel of luminaries from academia, tech-bio, and the pharmaceutical industry to dig into the intricacies of handling biological data and scaling foundation models, to ultimately understand their current and future impact on our understanding of human health, the discovery of novel therapeutics, and the scientific process itself.

title: Founder Frameworks: Seven Lessons Learned  [DD73696]
abstract:
Join Caryn Marooney, general partner at Coatue, for a primer on how entrepreneurs can start to turn a vision into a scalable company. Caryn has had a front-row seat working with some of the best tech founders in the world, including her investments in Notion, Supabase, RunwayML, ClickHouse, DeepJudge, and Lightning AI. As the co-founder of OutCast, she spent 13 years working with Marc Benioff from the earliest days of Salesforce.com through IPO and beyond. She then went on to lead communications at Facebook/Meta, including its early days through IPO, as well as Instagram, WhatsApp, Oculus, and Congressional testimony.

Caryn will share the S.W.I.M. Framework, a guide to big moments in businesses. It helps answer the questions: How do you know when it’s time to launch? How to get internal alignment? How do you win in a crowded market? How do you get momentum? How do you keep momentum?

title: FP8 Large-Scale Training: Reach the Speed of Light Without Compromising Quality [CWE74808]
abstract:
Using FP8 and new low-precision formats like FP6 and FP4 significantly speeds up LLM training across many nodes and GPUs, versus previous formats based on BF16, FP16, or FP32. In this session, we’ll discuss how to achieve this speedup without compromising the stability of the training and model accuracy. We’ll bring experts with deep knowledge on both the hardware and the software side, so that you'll learn how to enable FP8 on your GPU to reduce memory footprint and accelerate training.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. You can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: From Clicks to Conversations - Intelligence Data Fusion Fueled by AI Agents [S71460]
abstract: In this session, we will explain how we introduced AI-agents into an Intelligence system holding massive amounts of data. How the interaction with the system changes from clicks to conversation, all shown in a coast guard scenario.

title: From Concept to Reality: Startups Driving AI-Powered Industry Automation [S72602]
abstract: Join us for an insightful lightning talk featuring founders and technologists from leading robotics startups in the NVIDIA Inception program. These innovators will share how they are addressing industry challenges using NVIDIA acceleration libraries, AI models, and the Omniverse platform. Gain insights into the unique challenges faced by these entrepreneurs and discover how they are using advanced AI to serve customers across industries such as manufacturing, healthcare, retail, and food service.

title: From Design to Operations: Optimize Data Center Energy and Water Efficiency: Q&A From the EMEA Region [S73167a]
abstract: How do you enhance and measure your data center’s energy efficiency? Industry experts from NVIDIA, Vertiv, Cadence, and Isambard AI will share real-world examples of cutting-edge solutions designed to enhance the sustainability of data center operations. They'll cover strategies for optimizing energy consumption, water efficiency, and reducing carbon footprints, highlighting the latest innovations in accelerated computing, cooling, digital twins, and sustainable supercomputing.

title: From Edge to Cloud: NVIDIA Platforms Accelerate Industrial AI with Comprehensive Solutions (Presented by EDOM Technology) [EXS74448]
abstract: In the era of Industry 4.0, AI drives industrial innovation, but edge-to-cloud applications demand exceptional performance, reliability, and security. Learn how NVIDIA platforms deliver end-to-end solutions for industrial AI. NVIDIA Jetson and IGX enable accelerated edge inference, MGX power data center training and deployment, and NVIDIA AI Enterprise provides enterprise-grade software support. Learn how to build efficient, scalable AI ecosystems using NVIDIA’s hardware and software, with real-world cases demonstrating smart factories, computer vision inspections, and edge intelligence applications.

title: From Failures to Throughput: Optimize Effective Training in AI Clusters (Presented by CoreWeave) [S74221]
abstract: For a better effective training time and faster speed to market, teams need to improve mean time to failure (MTTF). We’ll explore how MLOps teams can improve infrastructure performance and resilience through increased visibility and automation. Plus, discover the essential components that make these processes possible and scalable, including NVIDIA’s BlueField DPUs and the self-healing properties of NVIDIA Quantum InfiniBand.

title: From Failures to Throughput: Optimize Effective Training in AI Clusters (Presented by CoreWeave) [S74221]
abstract: For a better effective training time and faster speed to market, teams need to improve mean time to failure (MTTF). We’ll explore how MLOps teams can improve infrastructure performance and resilience through increased visibility and automation. Plus, discover the essential components that make these processes possible and scalable, including NVIDIA’s BlueField DPUs and the self-healing properties of NVIDIA Quantum InfiniBand.

title: From FP8 LLM Training to Inference: Language AI at Scale [S72799]
abstract: We'll take a deep dive into training DeepL's LLM-based, next-gen translation models and discuss how we put these models into production. In particular, we'll share our experience with FP8 training on a DGX H100 superpod based on NVIDIA Transformer Engine. You'll also learn how to prepare LLMs for FP8 inference using TensorRT-LLM, and gain insights into deploying models at scale. With this technology stack we achieve industry-leading translation quality at low latency.

title: From Guardrails to Agents: Navigating Safety and Security at AI's Frontier [S73872]
abstract: As AI systems evolve from simple chatbots to autonomous agents, we face a critical challenge: ensuring their safety and reliability while enabling their growing capabilities. With major regulatory frameworks like the EU AI Act coming into force, organizations must rethink how they evaluate and secure AI systems. This talk presents cutting-edge approaches that bridge the gap between basic safety guardrails and trustworthy autonomous agents. Drawing from our work on dynamic red teaming, automated evaluation benchmarks, and predictable scaling laws, we demonstrate how to build more robust safety mechanisms that adapt to AI's increasing autonomy. Through practical examples in fairness, factuality, and system robustness, we'll explore how organizations can implement comprehensive safety frameworks that meet both current needs and emerging regulatory requirements. This work reveals key patterns in how safety mechanisms must evolve alongside AI capabilities, offering crucial insights for researchers and practitioners working to make AI systems more reliable and secure.

title: From Ideation to Implementation: How to Ensure a Successful Generative AI Project (Presented by SHI International Corp.) [S74079]
abstract: Join us as we delve into our approach to helping customers adopt an evolutionary approach to implementing generative AI within their enterprise ecosystems. We'll share best practices and challenges encountered in identifying, prototyping, building, and scaling AI applications using the NVIDIA enterprise AI stack, including NVIDIA’s Blueprints and NIMS.

title: From Lab to Market: How Poland’s Research-Startup Ecosystem Drives AI Innovation [S74537]
abstract: A unique aspect of Poland’s vibrant technology ecosystem is the relationship between research institutions and startups. The innovative and important technology developed in research institutions is quickly spun up into successful startups — often by the researchers themselves. We'll explore this effective model through real-world examples and discuss how it has not only built momentum for Poland to be the world’s next major technology hub, but also how other markets can replicate this process for their own success. Aimed at startup founders, university leaders, investors, and policymakers, this discussion will uncover how Poland’s approach can serve as a blueprint for fostering innovation ecosystems worldwide.

title: From Lab to Market: How Poland’s Research-Startup Ecosystem Drives AI Innovation [S74537]

title: From Models to Microservices: Agentic AI at Data Center Scale [S73211]
abstract: AI is evolving from monolithic models to intelligent, modular microservices. Learn how NVIDIA collaborates with Google, Meta, Microsoft, Mistral, and other leading AI companies to develop enterprise-grade inference microservices (NVIDIA NIM) and blueprints optimized for seamless deployment across on-premises and cloud environments. By leveraging hardware-software co-optimization and defining the right abstractions, NVIDIA’s AI platform enables accelerated inference and faster time to market. You will gain practical insights into building production-ready AI solutions, starting from selecting pre-trained foundation models to customizing them on your enterprise data to connecting multiple models into an Agentic AI system and deploying them at the data center scale. This talk is an essential guide for anyone looking to leverage the power of AI in their business.

title: From NeRF to 3DGS: Exploring Advanced Methods for High-Quality Static and Dynamic Scene Reconstruction in Interactive 3D Worlds [DLIT71553]
abstract:
In this training lab, we'll explore the latest techniques in 3D scene creation using neural radiance fields (NeRF) and 3D Gaussian splatting (3DGS). These methods use machine learning to create detailed 3D scenes from just a few images. Learn how to model dynamic scenes where objects can move and rotate while keeping their color, opacity, and size consistent. We’ll also cover how to combine elements from different scenes and add new objects to moving scenes, like attaching a hat to a character that changes position. Gain practical skills in using NeRF and 3DGS to create and manage both static and dynamic 3D scenes.
Prerequisite(s):

Python.

title: From NIM to Blackwell: Effectively Drive all of Your Data to all of Your AI Projects (Presented by NetApp) [EXS74330]
abstract: From department-specific inferencing for Gen AI tools to machine learning projects in the cloud and all the way to powerful AI factories, a hybrid data management strategy feeds AI infrastructure with data, no matter where it lives. Discover how the combination of intelligent data services, an AI data engine, and infrastructure designed for AI first, can deliver an end-to-end data foundation for AI today — and tomorrow.

title: From Open Source to Frontier AI: Build, Customize, and Extend Foundation Models (FoxBrain Case Study)(Presented by Foxconn) [S74035]
abstract: We'll dive into the details of how to build an advanced foundation AI model that achieves top performance by leveraging open-source AI. In detail, we'll explore key components for customizing and extending model capabilities and knowledge through the development pipelines (data, training, inference, and benchmark evaluation).

title: From Pawn to Queen: Build Reliable AI Solutions with GMI Cloud (Presented by GMI Cloud) [S74329]
abstract: We'll present proven strategies and hands-on techniques to build and maintain reliable, scalable AI solutions on GMI Cloud, ensuring that as data volumes surge, models grow more complex, or performance demands change, your infrastructure stays resilient, your applications run seamlessly, and your teams can continuously innovate. By examining fault-tolerant architecture, efficient workload optimization, advanced model performance tuning, and streamlined integration, you'll gain the knowledge, tools, and confidence to transform your AI operations into a future-ready ecosystem that adapts to shifting industry landscapes, rising user expectations, and the urgent need for robust, high-performance solutions.

title: From Petabytes to Performance: How Rivian Scales ADAS Machine Learning and Simulation (Presented by Amazon Web Services) [S74272]
abstract: Join Rivian and AWS to discover how cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence innovations are accelerating workflows on Amazon EKS, leveraging open-source software and the latest GPU instances on AWS. Learn how Rivian leverages scalable containerized environments to manage petabytes of real-world data and train advanced ML models for autonomy and safety features. Explore best practices for deploying AI-powered simulations and real-time inference using GPUs, while achieving cost and time efficiencies. Whether you're building next-gen autonomy platforms or scaling AI workloads, this session will offer practical insights and collaboration opportunities for your ML journey.

title: From Petabytes to Performance: How Rivian Scales ADAS Machine Learning and Simulation (Presented by Amazon Web Services) [S74272]

title: From Products to Waste: Novel Backward Generation of Waste Datasets [P73482]
abstract: Discover how we turn the infinite and impossible task of collecting and annotating all waste data into a practical solution using NVIDIA Omniverse. By generating synthetic training data from 3D models of brand-new products, we introduce an innovative backward approach to waste object detection that enhances model performance and propels recycling efforts forward.

title: From Project to Profits: Unleash AI's Power With a Hybrid Approach (Presented by IBM)  [S74327]
abstract: To unlock AI’s full potential and speed the pace of innovation for specific business needs, organizations must evolve their IT landscape. As AI becomes woven into the fabric of business applications — from core enterprise to consumer-facing services to the edge — there's an increasing focus on reducing cost and maintaining flexibility of deployment. Through demos and conversations with experts, explore how adopting a hybrid platform approach, paired with the power of NVIDIA technologies, removes barriers to AI by delivering better reliability and performance, operational agility, and managed costs, no matter your operating environment.

title: From RAG to Agents: Building Enterprise Products with Generative AI [S71685]
abstract:
How can an LLM effectively navigate the diverse complexities of enterprise systems and data - emails, documents, calendars, messages, tasks, tickets, line of business
systems? How do you enable precise orchestration and execution of multi-step workflows while ensuring accuracy, predictability, and reliability in production? This
session will explore how Dropbox Dash leverages cutting edge advances in RAG and Agents to tackle these challenges. From integrating heterogenous data sources and optimizing task orchestration by leveraging advances in powerful LLM models, we share our journey in building scalable and secure AI solutions. We will discuss how robust evaluation frameworks and architectural innovations help us ensure reliable, enterprise-ready systems.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: From Reasoning Models to AI Planning Systems [S72668]
abstract:
Are LLMs the be-all and end-all of AI innovation? We'll explore the growing trend toward moving from standalone LLMs to LLMs as part of a comprehensive AI system. But not just any AI system — a planner-based system that combines complex reasoning and decision-making, adapts to unique environments, and offers transparency and resource management to address critical enterprise needs.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: From Rendering to Reality: Using Visualization Tools and GenAI to Improve Customer Decision Making Online [S71573]
abstract:
Revolutionize the way we approach home decoration and furnishing with GenAI and Omniverse. One of the biggest challenges for consumers is turning their design dreams into reality—matching their unique needs with tailored designs, visualizing products in real-life scenarios, and ensuring design feasibility.
Join us to discover how Homestyler, a design platform serving global homeowners and designers, is transforming the global home decoration industry through AI. With 18 million users and over 38 million design cases worldwide, Homestyler leverages NVIDIA Omniverse, integrating OpenUSD and RTX rendering technology, to enable seamless online collaboration. Learn how this innovative approach connects consumers with high-quality, cost-effective Chinese home furnishing providers, bridging supply and demand with unmatched precision and realism.

title: From Research to Production: Transforming AV Technology With AI [S72707]
abstract:
Learn how AI is transforming the development of autonomous vehicle (AV) technology, both in the data center and in the vehicle. We’ll focus on three key areas: (1) self-supervised training pipelines unlocking data scaling at unprecedented levels; (2) composing ingredients for universal and controllable end-to-end simulation; and (3) architecting end-to-end autonomy stacks that leverage foundation models (such as Cosmos world foundation models and vision language models) to seamlessly generalize to long-tail events. 

We'll demonstrate how applying the latest AI advancements across the three main computers of a car (training, simulation, and on-vehicle) can significantly accelerate AV development and large-scale productization.

title: From Workflow to Workforce: Deploy Intelligent, AI-Powered Digital Humans (Presented by Sterling) [EXS74199]
abstract: Explore how to transform static workflows into dynamic, AI-powered digital workforces. Developers and business leaders alike will learn how to build and deploy human-like virtual agents using innovative technologies like retrieval-augmented generators (RAGs), NVIDIA ACE, and Unreal Engine to deliver personalized, near face-to-face interactions at scale. Gain practical strategies for integrating these capabilities into your existing infrastructure, ensuring meaningful engagement, efficient support, and continuous innovation. Leave with actionable insights to enhance brand value and usher your organization into the era of intelligent digital experiences.

title: From Zero to Scale: How to Build an Efficient AI Cloud Platform From Scratch (Presented by Nebius) [S74357]
abstract:
Nebius built an AI cloud platform from the ground up in just one year, transforming a bold concept into a fully operational system running tens of thousands of NVIDIA GPUs connected via 400 Gbps InfiniBand network. We architected multiple Kubernetes clusters as the platform’s scalable backbone, enabling elastic growth, rapid provisioning, and seamless upgrades. We made several strategic decisions to leverage our own data centers, refine hardware configurations, and implement advanced cooling techniques to achieve sustainable energy efficiency.

We'll share the approach and experience of our foundational services and hardware teams. Learn how our LLM team and early multimodal customers provided critical feedback, guiding iterative improvements that honed our infrastructure’s capabilities. By the end, you’ll understand the strategic insights, technical optimizations, and customer-driven methodologies that enabled Nebius to build a cutting-edge AI cloud platform from scratch.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Frontiers of AI and Computing: A Conversation With Yann LeCun and Bill Dally [S73208]
abstract:
As artificial intelligence continues to reshape the world, the intersection of deep learning and high performance computing becomes increasingly crucial. This talk brings together Yann LeCun, a pioneer in deep learning and the chief AI scientist at Meta, and Bill Dally, a leading computer architect and chief scientist at NVIDIA, to explore the future of AI models, hardware accelerators, and the evolving computational landscape.
The discussion will cover:
•	The next breakthroughs in deep learning and AI architectures
•	How hardware innovation drives AI efficiency and scalability
•	Challenges in training large-scale models and real-time AI inference

title: Full-stack NVIDIA GB200 Solution for New Gen-AI (Presented by Aivres) [S74277]
abstract: Aivres constructs a comprehensive hardware infrastructure integrating the GB200 rack, storage, management, and liquid cooling. It also offers AI DevOps, which enables the management of multiple device platforms and efficiently allocates and optimizes AI computing power resources. This provides a one-stop AI business management platform for data centers, from model development to deployment, and supports the rapid iteration and online application of models.

title: Fundamentals of Accelerated Computing With Modern CUDA C++ [DLIW73642]
abstract:
This workshop provides a comprehensive introduction to general-purpose GPU programming with NVIDIA CUDA®. You'll learn how to write, compile, and run GPU-accelerated code, use CUDA core libraries to tap into the power of massive parallelism provided by modern GPU accelerators, optimize memory migration between CPU and GPU, and implement your own algorithms.
At the conclusion of the workshop, you'll have an understanding of the fundamental concepts and techniques for accelerating C++ code with CUDA and be able to:

Write and compile code that runs on the GPU.
Optimize memory migration between CPU and GPU.
Use powerful parallel algorithms that simplify adding GPU acceleration to your code.
Implement your own parallel algorithms by directly programming GPUs with CUDA kernels.
Use concurrent CUDA streams to overlap memory traffic with compute.
Know where, when, and how to best add CUDA acceleration to existing CPU-only applications.


Prerequisite(s):

Basic C++ competency, including familiarity with lambda expressions, loops, conditional statements, functions, standard algorithms, and containers.
No previous knowledge of CUDA programming is assumed.

Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

title: Fundamentals of Accelerated Data Science [DLIW73639]
abstract:
Data science is about using scientific methods, processes, algorithms, and systems to analyze and extract insights from data. It lets organizations turn data into a valuable resource, leading to smarter decision-making, improved operations, and enhanced customer experiences. In this workshop, you'll explore how to use GPU-accelerated tools to conduct data science faster, leading to more scalable, reliable, and cost-effective results.
You’ll learn how to:

Use cuDF to accelerate pandas, Polars, and Dask for analyzing datasets of all sizes efficiently.
Use a wide variety of machine learning algorithms, including XGBoost, for different data science problems.
Deploy machine learning models on an NVIDIA Triton™ Inference Server to deliver optimal performance. 
Learn and apply powerful graph algorithms to analyze complex networks with NetworkX and cuGraph.
Perform multiple analysis tasks on massive datasets to stave off a simulated epidemic outbreak affecting the U.K.

You’ll also be able to perform and accelerate the end-to-end data science workflow. The speedup will translate into more iteration cycles, better performance, and improved productivity.

Prerequisite(s):

Experience with Python, ideally including pandas and NumPy.

Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

title: Fundamentals of Agentic AI: A Brief Introduction [DLIT74813]
abstract:
Agents have been all the rage recently, with many frameworks advertising agentic capabilities, new use-cases popping up left and right, and some truly amazing software innovations that keep forcing us to redefine limits and expectations. We'll boil down the agent abstraction to its roots, discuss how the definition is manifesting in modern software, and highlight some key insights that are driving the space forward.
Prerequisite(s):

Minimal. Topics and some material from the Deep Learning Institute course on Building Agentic AI Applications with LLMs, will be discussed.

title: Fundamentals of Deep Learning [DLIW73635]
abstract:
Explore the basics of deep learning by training and deploying neural networks and using results to improve performance and capabilities.
You’ll learn how to:

Implement common deep learning workflows, such as image classification and object detection.
Experiment with data, training parameters, network, structure, and other strategies to increase performance and capability.
Deploy your neural networks to start solving real-world problems.


Prerequisite(s):

An understanding of fundamental programming concepts in Python 3, such as functions, loops, dictionaries, and arrays.
A familiarity of pandas data structures.
An understanding of how to compute a regression line.


Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

title: Future of Scaling Law – Computational Challenges and Infrastructure Innovation (Presented by Aivres) [S74275]
abstract: Large model development has shifted from the pre-training scaling law to the fine-tuning scaling law and the inference scaling law. With the introduction of new computing models, the new computing characteristics in fine-tuning and inference present new requirements for AI computing power infrastructure. Compared to pre-training, scaling computing power for fine-tuning and inference faces more complex system expansion performance requirements. We'll analyze the computing characteristics and requirements of the three scaling laws and share Aivres’ insights in the design and planning of next-generation AI infrastructure products.

title: Future-Proof Data Centers for a Dynamic World Using Dell AI Factory With NVIDIA (Presented by Dell Technologies) [S74416]
abstract:
Learn how Dell AI Factory with NVIDIA offers seamless integration of AI acceleration into your existing data center with Dell Integrated Rack Scalable Systems (IRSS), enabling your organization to prepare for the density, serviceability, power, and cooling requirements of the future. Beyond advanced hardware, Dell provides comprehensive design and deployment services, including AI cluster networking, power, cooling, and rack-scale solutions tailored to your needs.  

We'll explore how enterprises can tap into the full potential of Gen AI today with the latest Dell PowerEdge servers and agentic retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) solutions. Also discover how Dell's AI solution consulting services — covering data preparation, structured programs, and strategic guidance — empower businesses to transform and fully harness the power of AI.

title: Future Proofing AI Factories with Sustainable Computing and Private AI [S71691]
abstract:
With the growing adoption of AI, organizations are navigating a complex AI landscape shaped by unique business needs, data residency, privacy, and regulatory requirements. To address these challenges, many enterprises are shifting towards a distributed infrastructure for AI, with data and compute spanning private infrastructure and public clouds. In such a distributed environment, many enterprises require a private AI deployment that can deliver the highest level of data privacy and control over their AI operations, while also focusing on sustainability.

We will explore how organizations are navigating the complex AI landscape, maintaining the highest level of data privacy and control over their AI operations, while still prioritizing sustainability.

title: Future-Proof Your AI Infrastructure With Private AI (Presented by Equinix) [EXS73984]
abstract: As AI technology evolves at a rapid pace, organizations must balance security, speed, scalability, and sustainability. A "Private AI" strategy leverages partnerships with leaders like NVIDIA and major hyperscalers to provide the global reach and next-generation infrastructure needed to tackle these challenges. The key to success depends on having high-performance, AI-ready infrastructure with advanced cooling, secure data centers, and multi-cloud connectivity. Learn how optimizing speed, sustainability, and data privacy management can give you a competitive edge in an AI-driven world.

title: Future-Ready Factories: The AI-First Revolution in Manufacturing (Presented by TCS) [S74608]
abstract:
A machine halts. A defect spreads. A supply chain stalls. Traditional factories react — fixing issues after they occur. But what if your factory already knew? What if it predicted failures before they happened? If AI-driven vision caught defects early? If supply chains adapted in real time? This is not the future — it's happening now. TCS’s Design for Intelligence, powered by NVIDIA platforms — Omniverse for digital twins, Metropolis for vision AI, TAO Toolkit and NIM for scalable AI, Cosmos for generative simulations, and GR00T for AI-driven robotics in manufacturing — is enabling AI-first factories that predict, adapt, and optimize in real time. The result? Resilient supply chains, zero-defect quality, and intelligent automation at scale. See how future-ready factories are shifting from reactive to truly intelligent — because in manufacturing’s next era, you lead or fall behind.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Generate and Optimize GPU Code for Deep Learning  via Multi-Dimensional Homomorphisms [P71138]
abstract:
We introduce a code generation and optimization approach for DL computations, such as matrix multiplication and convolutions, targeting NVIDIA GPUs. Our code generation approach is based on our algebraic formalism of *Multi-Dimensional Homomorphisms (MDH)* (https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3665643). 

MDH is capable of generating CUDA code for DL computations that can be fully automatically optimized (auto-tuned) to higher performance than hand-optimized libraries (e.g., NVIDIA cuBLAS/cuDNN, for different kinds of NVIDIA GPUs (A100, V100, ...).

Our code optimization approach is based on our Auto-Tuning Framework (ATF) (https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3427093) that fully automatically optimizes auto-tunable GPU code (as generated via MDH). Our ATF approach introduces novel processes for generating, storing, and exploring the search spaces of highly tunable CUDA implementations, which have so-called interdependencies among their tunable parameters.

title: Generate Photorealistic Synthetic Data to Enhance AI Models with NVIDIA Omniverse Replicator [P74395]
abstract: Explore techniques for generating photorealistic synthetic data using physics-based simulations with NVIDIA Omniverse Replicator. Learn how these synthetic image datasets improve AI model performance across industries like electric vehicle battery manufacturing (LG Energy Solution) and metal scrap recycling.

title: Generative AI Applications for the Financial Services Industry [CWE73263]
abstract:
Join this interactive session with NVIDIA solutions architects to learn best practices and applied techniques for deploying generative AI applications for a variety of financial services use cases. Our team can help answer questions and guide you on your path of deploying Gen AI applications. Please note that Marcus Manos will only be present on Monday, while Alex Stephens will only be present on Thursday. All other listed experts will be present at both session times.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

Our team can help answer questions and guide you on your path of deploying Gen AI applications. Please note that Marcus Manos will only be present on Monday, while Alex Stephens will only be present on Thursday. All other listed experts will be present at both session times.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Generative AI-Driven Sentiment Analysis for Proactive Ticket Resolution [P73513]
abstract: Waiting for post-resolution surveys means missing chances to fix issues early. Our new approach brings real-time insights, allowing IT agents to tackle problems as they arise, boosting customer satisfaction and loyalty. Every month, over 6,000 tickets benefit from sentiment detection, with one-third of negative cases turning into positive outcomes. This change not only improves individual experiences, but also shapes IT strategies for better service and efficiency. By focusing on proactive support, we’re transforming challenges into opportunities to drive lasting improvements.

title: Generative AI: EYQ's Catalyst for Business Transformation (Presented by EY) [S74295]
abstract: EYQ is an ecosystem of generative AI capabilities designed to empower EY people. We'll explore how EYQ integrates advanced AI technologies to provide a secure, self-service tool that enhances productivity and drives exponential value in various projects. Learn about the development and deployment of EYQ, including its foundational tools, multi-agent framework, and the first released skill, EYQ Chat.

title: Generative AI for Code Generation (Presented by EXL) [EXS74214]
abstract: Learn about a Gen AI-powered solution designed to revolutionize the migration of legacy codebases to modern and open-source languages while enhancing data and code governance processes. By automating the labor-intensive tasks of writing and optimizing code, this tool drives accelerated delivery, reduces costs, and improves accuracy. We'll show how NVIDIA’s NeMo framework is leveraged for pre-training and fine-tuning large language models to deeply understand domain-specific code. NVIDIA Inference Microservice (NIM) ensures optimized inference speed and seamless interactions, while NVIDIA’s retrieval microservice is integrated to efficiently retrieve relevant code and contextual data from diverse sources and functional modules.

title: Generative AI for Core Banking [S71522]
abstract:
Learn about the development and implementation of the first generative AI solution for core banking operations. We'll explore how this technology was created to enhance workflows, user journeys, and query handling, providing a deep dive into the technical and practical aspects of its integration. Discover the innovative semantic layer that converts complex banking data into a format compatible with generative AI, addressing key challenges such as integration with existing infrastructure and maintaining data security. We'll also discuss the collaboration with NVIDIA, which enabled the deployment of this solution on-premises, ensuring robust and efficient performance.

Through this real-world use case, you'll gain valuable insights into the first generative AI application for core banking. Learn from NVIDIA how to optimize model inferencing using tools like NIMs, and understand the steps taken to meet high user-experience standards. We'll show how to leverage generative AI for operational improvements in the banking sector.

We'll show how to leverage generative AI for operational improvements in the banking sector.

title: Generative AI for High-Throughput Metal-Organic Framework Discovery  [S73703]
abstract: Explore how MOFA, a GPU-accelerated generative AI framework, enables the high-throughput discovery of novel metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) using large-scale HPC systems. Learn how this cutting-edge approach combines AI with advanced simulations to tackle key challenges in materials science, delivering faster, more efficient solutions for carbon dioxide capture and other critical applications.

title: Generative AI Model Serving With Triton Inference Server [CWE73367]
abstract:
Do you want to learn how to deploy and optimize model serving for the latest large language and generative AI models? Do you have questions on how to maximize throughput or integrate custom business logic into your AI pipelines? Join this interactive support session with Triton technical product managers, engineers, and solutions architects to get direct help and surface your questions, issues, and ideas specific to your use case.

title: Generative Approaches for Designing Bi-Functional Bioactive Small Molecules [P71388]
abstract: Protein degraders represent a promising avenue for disease treatment, yet an effective workflow for designing and discovering these small molecules is lacking. This poster introduces a comprehensive suite of AI-driven modules — ProMol, Property-guided MolMIM, and PROTACtory — for the design and discovery of bi-functional small molecule protein degraders. These modules offer a timely and crucial solution to accelerate the discovery of potent degrader molecules, addressing a significant gap in current drug development workflows.

title: Generative High-Content Imaging: Diffusion Models Meet Bioactivity Data [P74303]
abstract: An important task in drug discovery entails ascertaining experimentally the effects of molecules in cellular systems. To overcome fundamental limitations in experimental capacity, we developed Profile-Diffusion (pDIFF), a generative latent diffusion model that can predict high-content microscopy images of cellular responses to different compounds based on their in silico bioactivity profiles. Through a simulated drug discovery scenario, we show pDIFF’s unprecedented potential to accelerate and enhance the search for new active molecules.

title: Generative High-Content Imaging: Diffusion Models Meet Bioactivity Data [P74303]
abstract: An important task in drug discovery entails ascertaining experimentally the effects of molecules in cellular systems. To overcome fundamental limitations in experimental capacity, we developed Profile-Diffusion (pDIFF), a generative latent diffusion model that can predict high-content microscopy images of cellular responses to different compounds based on their in silico bioactivity profiles. Through a simulated drug discovery scenario, we show pDIFF’s unprecedented potential to accelerate and enhance the search for new active molecules.

title: Generative Sleep Music System Based on Physiological Voiceprint Closed-Loop Adaptive Feedback Care [P73614]
abstract: We present a generative AI-based sleep music system that uses physiological voiceprint feedback to create soothing, individualized music for sleep enhancement. The system incorporates GPT-SoVITS for voice cloning, Musicgen and Suno for music generation, along with a retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) model for selecting similar tracks by NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPUs for training and Jetson Orin for inferencing. An embedding approach converts audio to vector data, enabling efficient similarity searches. Using baby physiological data, the system identifies and generates favorable music, producing personalized albums. Over 30 nights, results showed an average 30% reduction in sleep onset time, a 40% drop in night awakenings, and 85% user satisfaction for sleep quality improvement, with 90% reporting stress reduction. The study also examines how generative music adapts through human feedback for different situations.

title: Get hard to find GPUs at lower costs through NVIDIA DGX Cloud and Lighting AI Studio (Presented by Lightning AI) [S74432]
abstract: Learn how to prepare terabyte-sized datasets across clusters of machines, execute fault-tolerant training of generative models in the 10-100 billion parameter range on optimized clusters running NVIDIA Hopper GPUs, and provide fast autoscaled inference for such models. All the demonstrations and benchmarks will be performed on DGX Cloud compute through Lightning Studios, an AI development and deployment platform that provides fully reproducible environments and collaboration out of the box.

title: Get hard to find GPUs at lower costs through NVIDIA DGX Cloud and Lighting AI Studio (Presented by Lightning AI) [S74432]
abstract: Learn how to prepare terabyte-sized datasets across clusters of machines, execute fault-tolerant training of generative models in the 10-100 billion parameter range on optimized clusters running NVIDIA Hopper GPUs, and provide fast autoscaled inference for such models. title: Get NVIDIA Certified [C74437]
abstract:
For the first time ever, GTC 2025 attendees will have the exclusive opportunity to earn NVIDIA certifications at no cost. Seize this unique opportunity to validate your expertise, showcase your skills, and join the ranks of NVIDIA-certified professionals. Seats are limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis—be sure to register onsite to secure your spot!
Why Certify?
Validate your expertise in cutting-edge NVIDIA technologies.
Boost your career prospects and earning potential.
Join an elite community of NVIDIA-certified professionals.
Available Certifications:

NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMs
NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AI
NVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and Operations

NVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI Infrastructure
NVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI Operations 

NVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)
How to Register for an exam slot: 
Register for the conference.
Review preparation materials thoroughly before attempting the exam.
Add this session to your schedule.
Sign up for an exam slot onsite.
Arrive early to secure your spot – seats are limited and fill quickly.
Please note the following:
This promotion is available to in-person attendees only, and only available at GTC.
The last exams will begin at 3:30 PM or 4:00 PM depending on the schedule.
Get certified and secure your invitation to the exclusive NVIDIA Certified Reception on Thursday, March 20th, 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM.
date_time: The last exams will begin at 3:30 PM or 4:00 PM depending on the schedule.

title: Get Ready for NVIDIA Certification [C74436]
abstract:
Ready to showcase your AI expertise and stand out in the crowd? Join us for an exclusive certification overview session and take the first step toward becoming NVIDIA certified.
In this session, we’ll help you figure out which NVIDIA certification best fits your career goals and walk you through the preparation process. You’ll get general exam hints and tips as well as details on exam topics and weightings, recommended training, and practice questions for the following exams:

NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMs
NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AI
NVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and Operations

NVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI Infrastructure
NVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI Operations

title: Get Started With Langflow: Build a Multi-Agent Shopping Assistant [DLIT74487]
abstract:
Harness Langflow and NVIDIA NeMo Framework to design and deploy powerful, multi-agent solutions. Join DataStax for an interactive training lab where you'll learn to design and deploy a custom shopping assistant using Langflow's intuitive drag-and-drop interface and NVIDIA NeMo Framework. From data ingestion to NVIDIA NIM model fine-tuning, uncover innovative strategies to streamline agent creation while designing intelligent agentic workflows. Gain hands-on experience in configuring agents, customizing retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines, and deploying a multi-agent workflow.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic familiarity with AI concepts like LLMs and AI Models.

title: Get the Most Performance From Grace Hopper [S72687]
abstract: Dive into the groundbreaking NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchip, a game-changing fusion of cutting-edge GPU and CPU technologies! This talk will delve into the heart of this architecture that seamlessly marries the raw power of the Hopper GPU with the adaptability of the Grace CPU via the high-bandwidth NVLink-C2C interconnect. We'll explore how existing applications can benefit from Grace Hopper and how it unlocks new algorithmic possibilities by leveraging unique architectural features.

title: Getting Started with Multi-GPU Scaling: Distributed Libraries [S72576]
abstract: Scaling beyond a single GPU can be challenging, but it's not as hard as you might think! Join us on a journey exploring multi-GPU libraries that simplify the process. We'll cover different strategies taken by such libraries, and how they impact the user experience.

title: GIGABYTE Green Data Center Solution (Presented by Giga Computing) [S74449]
abstract: GIGABYTE has been pivotal in providing its technology leaders with a supercomputing infrastructure built around powerful GIGABYTE GPU servers that house NVIDIA Backwell Tensor Core GPUs. GIGAPOD is a service that has professional help to create a cluster of racks all interconnected as a cohesive unit. An AI ecosystem platform thrives with a high degree of parallel processing as the GPUs are interconnected with blazing fast communication by NVIDIA NVLink. With the introduction of the GIGAPOD, GIGABYTE now offers a one-stop source for data centers that are moving to an AI factory that runs deep learning models at scale. The hardware, expertise, and close relationship with cutting-edge GPU partners ensures the deployment of an AI supercomputer goes off without a hitch and minimal downtime.

title: GIGAPOD: Redefining the Future Data Center by Scaling Beyond Servers and Software Stack (Presented by Giga Computing) [S74201]
abstract: GIGAPOD redefines the future data centers by providing scalable solutions of computing resources, tailored performance of cluster, ease of deployment, verified optimal performance, data storage platforms, networking solutions, and POD Manager software platform to manage infrastructure at scale and AI workload for development and applications.

title: GLake：大模型训练和推理的显存优化探索 [S72443]
abstract:
大模型需要巨大的 GPU 显存。为缓解显存不足 OOM 问题并实现高性能和易用性，我们将介绍一系列基于 CUDA 虚拟内存管理（VMM）的显存优化方案，包括训练和推理。

1. 对于训练，我们分享 GMLake（ASPLOS2024）来减少显存碎片。它动态地将非连续物理显存融合成连续的虚拟地址且对模型透明，在八个模型上的评测表明，GMLake 可每卡节省显存 9.2GB~25GB。
2. 对于推理，我们介绍 vTensor 和 LayerKV。前者是基于 VMM API 而新派生的 PyTorch tensor 数据结构，它可替代 vLLM PagedAttention，使得集成或定制新的 attention kernel 变得非常简单，例如只需修改 3 行代码可在 vLLM 中支持新的稀疏或量化 kernel。后者重点优化了显存不足导致的排队和首字延迟激增问题，在高负载下可将首字优化3X~69X 包括 TP 并行和 PD 分离。

title: Global Atmospheric Downscaling by Improving CorrDiff Process [P73554]
abstract: We enhance the regional generalization of CorrDiff, a machine learning model for downscaling global weather data. To address its limitation of being trained on a fixed region, we made several key improvements: incorporating forecast data from the Korea Meteorological Administration (KMA), using smaller grid cells for a more detailed training dataset, integrating digital elevation model (DEM) data to improve geographic awareness, reducing spatial coverage (1.4x zoom), and applying statistical bias correction using ERA5 as historical data. These changes improve predictions in Korea (where the model was trained), as well as unseen regions like Taiwan. By refining the training data and correcting biases, our model demonstrates significant improvements in accuracy across diverse regions. This research offers a more efficient alternative to traditional weather forecasting methods, reducing computational demands while maintaining high-resolution accuracy.

title: Going Deeper with Multi-GPU Scaling: Task-based Runtimes [S72579]
abstract: Do you want to write multi-GPU libraries, but don't know where to start or how to write message-passing interface code? We'll introduce the world of general-purpose, task-based runtime systems. These runtime systems will help you write programs transparently, scaling to any number of GPUs without any explicit communication and coordination that are difficult to do by hand. We'll also show you how to make your newly written code interoperate seamlessly with the existing domain libraries within the same program.
date_time: Discover how complex MPMD-style parallelism, such as pipeline and wavefront parallelism, can be expressed naturally and easily in the task-based models

title: Google AI: Research, Progress, and the Future of Ads [S73303]
abstract: Learn how cutting-edge mixture-of-experts (MoE) models from Google Deepmind are applied to solve problems in search and advertising use cases. We'll walk through how these models are developed and optimized for best performance on NVIDIA GPUs, using the NeMo Framework and TRT LLM. Learn how you can download these OSS Gemma models and apply them to similar problems in your business.

title: Google AI: Research, Progress, and the Future of Ads [S73303]

title: GPU-Accelerated HNSW Index Building for Databases [S71675]
abstract: Accelerated vector search is crucial for semantic search use cases, with embeddings created from unstructured data powering next-gen AI. As enterprise data scales to petabytes, zetabytes, and beyond, the demand for cost-effective, high-performance vector search solutions intensifies. The growth in vector embeddings over the past 7 years has been exponential and the problem begins with indexing. Google and NVIDIA have been working together to bring GPU-accelerated HNSW index builds to its modern cloud-based vector search infrastructure like AlloyDB. In this talk, we will discuss the innovations and challenges we’ve faced along the way as we work towards the ultimate goal of lowering cost and providing better indexing performance for HNSW and for the tree-quantization based ScaNN index, which is featured in AlloyDB and the Vertex AI Vector Search (VVS).

title: GPU-Accelerated Mixed-Precision Spatial Statistics for Efficient Climate/Weather Modeling and Emulation [S72300]
abstract:
We present the design and scalable implementation of an exascale climate emulator to address the escalating computational and storage requirements of high-resolution Earth System Model simulations. We utilize the spherical harmonic transform to stochastically model spatio-temporal variations in climate data. This provides tunable spatio-temporal resolution and significantly improves the fidelity and granularity of climate emulation, achieving an ultra-high spatial resolution of 0.034◦(∼3.5 km) in
space. Our BLAS3-rich code is optimized for systems equipped with different NVIDIA generations of GPUs, scaling well to achieve 0.739 exaFLOPs per second on 1,936 nodes (7,744 Grace Hopper Superchips (GH200)) of Alps, 0.243 EFLOP/s on 1,024 nodes (4,096 A100
GPUs) of Leonardo, and 0.375 EFlop/s on 3,072 nodes (18,432 V100 GPUs) of Summit.

title: GPU-Accelerated Semiconductor Process Simulations: From Atom to Transistor [S73203]
abstract: The NVIDIA CUDA software ecosystem has become a transformative force in the field of semiconductor Technology Computer-Aided Design (TCAD), enabling the resolution of tera-scale (10¹²) to exa-scale (10¹⁸) problems with turnaround times (TAT) in hours. Fundamental components of TCAD simulators—such as solvers, meshers, optimizers, and design of experiments—can be restructured using the "Single-Instruction-Multiple-Data" (SIMD) paradigm, allowing them to fully harness the power of GPU architecture for unparalleled computational efficiency.
date_time: Particle Monte Carlo (PMC) Simulations powered by Nvidia Optix: Ray tracing techniques significantly accelerate particle-tracked Monte Carlo simulations, achieving speedups of 10 to 10 squared for plasma process modeling, such as sputtered etching and deposition. These advancements enhance predictability, bridging the modeling gap from localized transistor components to integrated circuit cell levels.

title: GPU-Based Monte Carlo Simulation of Light Transport in Tissue: A Chapel Implementation [P73583]
abstract: This poster demonstrates how NVIDIA GPUs can be used to simulate photon propagation in tissue using the Chapel programming language. The Chapel implementation is concise and intuitive, while CUDA's device-side random number generators provide the backbone of the implementation, delivering more than 160X improvement over the sequential baseline.

title: GPU-Based Monte Carlo Simulation of Light Transport in Tissue: A Chapel Implementation [P73583]
abstract: This poster demonstrates how NVIDIA GPUs can be used to simulate photon propagation in tissue using the Chapel programming language. The Chapel implementation is concise and intuitive, while CUDA's device-side random number generators provide the backbone of the implementation, delivering more than 160X improvement over the sequential baseline.

title: GPU Databases: The New Modality of Database Analytics [P74548]
abstract: Explore why GPU-accelerated databases can potentially revolutionize the $300 billion database market. Dive into cutting-edge research in GPU databases and learn about Sirius, a GPU-accelerated query engine that delivers 5X better price/performance ratio compared to today's fastest analytical databases.

title: GPU Databases: The New Modality of Database Analytics [P74548]
abstract: Explore why GPU-accelerated databases can potentially revolutionize the $300 billion database market. Dive into cutting-edge research in GPU databases and learn about Sirius, a GPU-accelerated query engine that delivers 5X better price/performance ratio compared to today's fastest analytical databases.

title: GPUDirect Storage and AIStor: Accelerating AI and Data Workflows (Presented by MinIO) [S71475]
abstract: Learn how NVIDIA’s GPU Direct over Ethernet with MinIO Object Storage optimizes data access paths, bypassing the CPU on the GPU compute nodes, and thereby enabling GPUs to access data directly from object storage, lowering memory copies, and improving AI application performance, all while reducing infrastructure costs.

title: GPU DiskANN and Beyond: Accelerating Microsoft Vector Search with NVIDIA cuVS [S72905]
abstract: From web search to ads recommendation to RAG, vector search has become an essential operation for vast range of large-scale applications. However, these applications may have widely varying requirements. As such, no single design or algorithm fits all use cases. Nevertheless, GPUs can accelerate many scenarios, potentially giving orders of magnitude improvements in index construction time or search throughput, compared with CPU-based solutions. In this talk joint talk with Microsoft and NVIDIA, we will present a range of Microsoft use cases that require high performance vector search. We will then discuss the unique challenges of these scenarios and how we leverage NVIDIA GPUs and the cuVS library to accelerate these workloads. From fast DiskANN index construction to high-throghput filtered search, a range of algorithms, features, and optimizations are used to leverage GPUs and provide performance and cost benefits over current CPU-based solutions.

title: GPU-Driven FHE: Real-Time Private AI Inference Outperforming Custom ASIC [P73516]
abstract: Discover how our GPU-accelerated fully homomorphic encryption (FHE) framework achieves real-time private AI inference, significantly outperforming custom application-specific integrated circuits (ASICs). Using the Cheddar CKKS library, novel packing techniques, and polynomial activation functions, we demonstrate the feasibility of secure AI on GPUs without compromising speed or accuracy.

title: GPU Optimizations: An Efficient and Scalable Neural Network Quantum States Approach for Quantum Chemistry [P73380]
abstract: Explore new techniques for optimizing neural network quantum states (NNQS) to significantly improve computational efficiency and convergence in simulating complex electronic structures. This timely approach offers a 27-fold acceleration in systems with 154 qubits, making it crucial for advancing material computation and property prediction.

abstract:
NVIDIA Professional GPUs bring a new level of rendering power to XR

title: GPU-Powered Neural Depth and Point Cloud Filtering for Efficient Corridor Detection in Robotics [P73591]
abstract: Robotic systems depend on accurate real-time perception to navigate complex environments. Meet David's Robot, which leverages NVIDIA's GPU technology to enhance environmental awareness and corridor detection. By integrating a ZED stereo camera for depth sensing and employing CUDA-accelerated point cloud filtering, we improve processing speeds and detection accuracy. Our approach shows how GPU-powered systems can optimize navigation in dynamic and structured environments, advancing the field of mobile robotics.

Our approach shows how GPU-powered systems can optimize navigation in dynamic and structured environments, advancing the field of mobile robotics.

title: GPU 加速生命科学行业智能化 [S71836]
abstract: 生命科学行业正在全面拥抱智能化，构建基础大模型是加速智能化的先进范式。我们开发了生命科学跨模态的基础大模型，覆盖 DNA，RNA，蛋白质，细胞，生物视觉，生物文本 7个模态。我们利用 GPU 加速，以 FP8 精度优化了多专家 (MOE) 大型模型的训练，并基于 Megatron 为生命科学构建了统一的多模态训练框架。此外建设生物和 AI 融合的分布式推理引擎，大大加快了该行业向智能转型的步伐。

title: Graduate Fellowship Fast Forward Talks [S71166]
abstract: Join a special presentation from our 2024-25 Graduate Fellowship recipients to learn "what's next" from the world of research and academia. Sponsored projects involve a variety of technical challenges, including machine learning, robotics, computer vision, computer graphics, wireless communication systems, high performance computing, autonomous driving, and AI efficiency. We believe that these minds lead the future in our industry and we're proud to support the 2024-25 NVIDIA Graduate Fellows. We'll also announce the 2025-26 Graduate Fellows at this session. For more information on the NVIDIA Graduate Fellowship program, visit www.nvidia.com/en-us/research/graduate-fellowships

title: GraphBolt: Overcoming Dynamic Shapes and Irregular Accesses in GNN Data Loading [S71514]
abstract: GraphBolt is a state-of-the-art graph neural network (GNN) data loader. It owes its speed to its ability to keep GPUs utilized at all times. Whether it's copy operations from host to device or host device synchronizations, we'll show how to hide the latencies of such operations through heavy use of pipelining. We'll dive deep into the internals of GraphBolt and show how we achieved its unmatched performance by utilizing various CUDA programming techniques.

title: GraphBolt: Overcoming Dynamic Shapes and Irregular Accesses in GNN Data Loading [S71514]
abstract: GraphBolt is a state-of-the-art graph neural network (GNN) data loader. It owes its speed to its ability to keep GPUs utilized at all times. We'll dive deep into the internals of GraphBolt and show how we achieved its unmatched performance by utilizing various CUDA programming techniques.

title: Grounding LLMs in Reality: Enhancing SAP’s Document Grounding [S72059]
abstract: Large language models excel at generating human-like text, but they often lack the specificity and contextual understanding needed for business applications. Document Grounding, SAP's retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) solution for unstructured data, addresses this challenge by enabling contextual and semantic retrieval across diverse data types, including text, images, video, and audio. By harnessing state-of-the-art, GPU-accelerated models from NVIDIA for multi-modal embedding, re-ranking, speech-to-text conversion, and video processing, Document Grounding enables advanced data retrieval and interpretation, ensuring more accurate and relevant insights from various formats.

title: Grounding LLMs in Reality: Enhancing SAP’s Document Grounding [S72059]

title: Guardrails for NVIDIA Halos Across the Product Life Cycle [S74744]
abstract: This session will continue the presentation of NVIDIA Halos for autonomous vehicle (AV) safety, with a focus on deployment-time and validation-time safety guardrails. From runtime monitoring to scenario generation for stress testing, we'll cover the many elements needed to assure safety of AI-based, end-to-end AV stacks.

title: Hacking Agents: Unlock the Cognitive Value Chain With Langflow (Presented by DataStax) [S74265]
abstract: Join Rodrigo Nader, the founder of open-source Langflow, and a DataStax customer to learn how agents can leverage the powerful components of NVIDIA NeMo — from Guardrails to fine-tuning — to streamline the development, deployment, and management of data-driven applications. Gain insights into the benefits and trade-offs of different agent architectures, learn best practices for organizing and delegating tasks among multiple agents, and discover how to equip agents with the necessary tools to perform complex tasks autonomously. Through practical demonstrations and real-world examples, we'll show you how agents built on Langflow with NVIDIA components can significantly reduce development time, improve application performance, and connect the dots to how agentic architecture can drive business transformation.

title: Hands-on with Next Generation Digital Human Blueprint [DLIT72360]
abstract:
This hands-on lab explores the creation of interactive avatar applications using the NVIDIA Tokkio pipeline, building on the next generation digital human blueprint. Participants will learn to customize the Tokkio pipeline with ACE microservices for updating the avatar character and the end-to-end web experience. By the end of this session, participants will be able to imbue their digital avatars with advanced AI capabilities, enabling more natural and informed interactions for a wide array of use cases.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic understanding of AI and machine learning concepts.
Having an avatar to work with and make intelligent.
Familiarity with Python programming.

title: Hardware-Aware Algorithms for Sequence Modeling [S72274]
abstract: Hear about recent progress on designing models that take advantage of the hardware they run on, especially for GPUs. These include optimizations for attention (FlashAttention, FlashDecoding), state-space models (Mamba), as well as inference techniques like speculative decoding and large batch inference.

title: Harmonize AI in Financial Services: Insights From BNP Paribas' Data Science Office (Presented by Domino Data Lab) [S74467]
abstract:
As AI transforms the financial services industry, BNP Paribas is implementing strategies to empower its data science teams, scale innovation, and maintain operational excellence. Complementing the broader group AI strategy, BNP’s Data Science Office plays a critical role in harmonizing AI efforts across business units, enabling shared infrastructure, and fostering collaboration to deliver meaningful impact.
In this session, Fabrice le Chatelier, Head of the Data Science Office at BNP Paribas, will discuss:

title: Harmonizing Digital Twins and AI Factory: Unlocking Industrial Autonomy [S72673]
abstract:
This session delves into the transformative and complementary roles of digital twins and AI factory in achieving higher level of autonomy within our industrial facilities. We are going to demonstrate how PEGATRON leverages NVIDIA Omniverse, Metropolis, AI Blueprints, and visual language models (VLMs) to build and orchestrate AI agents that streamline operational workflows. Gain valuable insights into how digital and AI transformations are shaping the future of industrial autonomous operations. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Harness AI Agents to Strengthen and Scale Security Operations [S72531]
abstract: AI agents are transforming cybersecurity operations across security operations center (SOC) and application security teams by enhancing efficiency, accuracy, and responsiveness. Learn how Visa is integrating autonomous AI agents into cybersecurity operations and SOC workflows to streamline threat detection, automate event triage, and empower analysts to focus on high-priority incidents. Gain insights into the practical challenges and solutions involved in deploying these agents inside your operations, including strategies for balancing performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency

title: Harnessing AI Agents for Enterprise Success: Insights From AI Experts [S72355]
abstract:
AI agents and agentic architectures offer significant potential as enterprises move from initial experiments to widespread generative AI deployments. In this session, moderated by NVIDIA’s vice president of enterprise AI and automation, AI experts will share their insights and experiences in developing and deploying generative AI and agentic solutions. They'll discuss the opportunities AI agents bring, real-world enterprise use cases, strategies for building user trust, and the challenges of scaling these technologies across organizations. Join us as we explore the future of AI in the enterprise.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Harnessing AI for Advanced Flood Risk Modelling and Mitigation Strategies [S71381]
abstract: Understanding flood risk beyond historical precedent is essential for catastrophe modelling. We leverage Nvidia's Earth2 platform to evaluate the Huge Ensemble (HENS) method developed by researchers at Berkeley. The approach combines Spherical Fourier Neural Operators (SFNO) with bred vectors and multiple checkpoints to generate large ensembles of synthetic weather scenarios. By integrating this AI-driven approach into JBA’s flood modelling workflow, we simulated 1,008 realizations of the 2023-2024 winter season for the Elbe River basin, capturing a range of plausible meteorological conditions and their potential flood impacts. This work demonstrates the potential for AI weather models to enhance catastrophe modelling, enabling more comprehensive risk assessment and resilience planning for the insurance industry.

title: Harnessing AI for Advanced Flood Risk Modelling and Mitigation Strategies [S71381]
abstract: Understanding flood risk beyond historical precedent is essential for catastrophe modelling. We leverage Nvidia's Earth2 platform to evaluate the Huge Ensemble (HENS) method developed by researchers at Berkeley. The approach combines Spherical Fourier Neural Operators (SFNO) with bred vectors and multiple checkpoints to generate large ensembles of synthetic weather scenarios. By integrating this AI-driven approach into JBA’s flood modelling workflow, we simulated 1,008 realizations of the 2023-2024 winter season for the Elbe River basin, capturing a range of plausible meteorological conditions and their potential flood impacts. This work demonstrates the potential for AI weather models to enhance catastrophe modelling, enabling more comprehensive risk assessment and resilience planning for the insurance industry.

title: Harnessing Distributed Intelligence With Privacy Preservation: Federated Learning for the Early Detection of Lung Cancer  [P73501]
abstract: We developed and validated a federated learning (FL) framework for medical imaging datasets using NVIDIA FLARE. This framework quickly adapts existing machine learning/deep learning models/architectures to the federated paradigm. The global FL model outperforms its local model counterparts in every scenario. By fine-tuning a global model on local site data, performance can be further improved, outperforming local site models on out-of-distribution datasets.

title: Harnessing Generative AI to Scale the Autonomous Vehicle Industry  [S73216]
abstract: Take a deep dive with Zoox to uncover how generative AI is transforming the autonomous vehicle industry by empowering organizations to strategically scale into new markets, enhance safety, and cultivate consumer trust.

title: Harnessing NVIDIA’s Advanced Tools for Generative AI in Digital Health and Clinical Trials [DLIT71262]
abstract:
This training lab explores the cutting-edge capabilities of NVIDIA's suite of AI tools—NVIDIA Inference Microservices (NIMs) and NVIDIA AI Blueprints—in transforming digital health solutions. Participants will gain hands-on experience in developing sophisticated AI-driven applications that can converse with healthcare data, assist researchers in clinical trials, and enhance clinician-patient interactions. The session will explore NVIDIA-optimized large language models (LLMs) as well as advanced techniques using reasoning and agentic LLM systems. Emphasis will be placed on the practical aspects of deploying these GPU-accelerated technologies and customizing them to specific digital health scenarios.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic Python and ML understanding.

title: Harness the Potential and Navigate the Challenges of Generative AI in Higher Education and Research [CWE73348]
abstract:
Learn how to harness the power of NVIDIA's Gen AI platform to drive innovation in all areas of your university — administration, teaching, and research. Explore new strategies for mitigating its risks, improving human output, and leveraging its ability to solve the toughest problems.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.
