title: HCLTech’s GenAI platform – AI Force accelerates software engineering and IT operations life cycle with NVIDIA AI Enterprise (Presented by HCLTech) [EXS73952]
abstract: Software engineering and operations management across industries face several challenges, including poor code quality, long testing times, delayed deployments and extended resolution times. HCLTech’s flagship GenAI platform – AI Force has been instrumental in driving service transformation for customers across industries. Now, with the integration of NVIDIA AI Enterprise (NVAIE), AI Force is accelerating cloud native applications development, modernization and migration of legacy applications, software testing, applications support, infrastructure and business process operations. The platform is enabling enterprises with enhanced productivity, improved quality and faster time-to-market.

title: Healthcare Reimagined: Coding the Future of Medicine Through Digital Acceleration [S72847]
abstract: Every week, new breakthroughs in accelerated computing are made, with enabling SDKs and APIs to bring it to every industry on the planet. How can the industry leverage these to solve healthcare's biggest problems? An aging patient population, more complex and interwoven chronic health problems, ever-rising costs, staff burnout, service satisfaction, reimbursements — accelerated computing is making a real difference in all of these areas. In this talk, luminaries from all around the digital health landscape will share their insights into what's here, and what's next.

abstract: Every week, new breakthroughs in accelerated computing are made, with enabling SDKs and APIs to bring it to every industry on the planet. How can the industry leverage these to solve healthcare's biggest problems? An aging patient population, more complex and interwoven chronic health problems, ever-rising costs, staff burnout, service satisfaction, reimbursements — accelerated computing is making a real difference in all of these areas. In this talk, luminaries from all around the digital health landscape will share their insights into what's here, and what's next.

title: Heritage Meets Technology: Leveraging Virtualized Platforms for Architectural Conservation and Business Innovation [S72407]
abstract: In today’s fast-evolving technology landscape, enterprises need a flexible, future-proof infrastructure to tackle today’s and tomorrow’s business challenges. Presented by HOK, a global design, architecture, engineering, and planning firm, we'll explore how HOK revolutionized its operations by adopting NVIDIA vGPU technology to power AI innovations and intense design collaboration at scale across all of its teams on an exceptionally complex multi-billion-dollar project. Whether you're an IT professional, AI developer, or business executive, you'll gain insight into making your virtual desktop infrastructure a cornerstone for the next generation of AI-driven, accelerated graphics solutions of your own digital transformation.

title: Heterogeneous Computing Workflow Accelerates End-to-End Medical Image AI Training [P73464]
abstract: We present a workflow that uses heterogeneous computing in a cluster environment to overcome inefficiencies in medical image AI training. By utilizing multi-CPU distributed preprocessing and seamlessly transferring data to a GPU server for model training, we introduce a new and innovative approach that significantly accelerates preprocessing and optimizes the development of the end-to-end medical image AI training.

title: High-Bandwidth Memory: Backbone of High Performance Computing and AI (Presented by SK hynix) [S73974]
abstract: High-bandwidth memory (HBM) plays a key role in enabling high performance computing and generative AI, and is expected to see significant advancements in the coming years. We'll share HBM’s technical attributes, applications, and future implications so you can better understand the value of HBM, and how SK hynix leads the world in HBM technology and market.

title: Highly Optimized Edge-Compatible Gen AI-Enabled Avatars and NPCs for Education and Entertainment [S71884]
abstract: We've experimented with different digital humans and avatars for many years. We've created several unique projects and are willing to share the pros and cons. We'll share the case for kids' education, which brings many challenges, specifics, and possibilities: trunks, ears, cartoonish view and sound, children's voices, and childish tricky questions, with many more tricky topics are on the list. Apps for children face the same business and technical challenges, but the solutions are different. Chatbot-enabled avatars are good for education, but they seem a bit old-fashioned nowadays. We’ll share our experiments and thoughts about what’s beyond avatars and nonplayer characters (NPCs) in EdTech and entertainment. Finally, we’ll share our steps on the road to avatars and NPCs that can be generated with AI, based on photos, images, and text descriptions of kids' favorite physical toys.  Education for children should be bright, fun, and up-to-date, since they are much closer to the future.

title: High Scalability, Low Costs, and No Rate Limits: Peek Inside the Serverless Inference API Breaking the Mold (Presented by Lambda) [S74258]
abstract: Learn how Lambda serves inference at scale and at the best costs in the market. We'll review inference engine architectures, NVIDIA GPU options, model optimization, and inference delivery methods such as NVIDIA NIM microservices.

title: High-Throughput LLM Serving on Edge Devices (NVIDIA Jetson AGX Orin 32GB) [P73466]
abstract: This project demonstrates the feasibility of adapting vLLM’s memory management and scheduling mechanisms to Jetson’s unified memory, showing that not only is it possible to reduce latency for single inference tasks, but also significantly improve LLM inference performance by increasing throughput. This approach represents a breakthrough for LLM inference on edge devices with limited resources.

abstract: Explore techniques to scale training of LLMs on GPUs with JAX to 10,000k chips and beyond. Learn about JAX reference workload MaxText.

title: How AI is Fueling Innovation in Automotive Software and Manufacturing [S74936]
abstract:
Join David Richardson, senior vice president of software engineering at General Motors, joins Norm Marks, vice president of automotive enterprise at NVIDIA, in a fireside chat about how AI is driving transformation across automotive manufacturing and vehicle software development. With the broadest electric vehicle portfolio in the United States and strong internal combustion engine vehicle sales, GM is pioneering innovative AI applications across its global ecosystem. David will share how GM is leveraging AI to create a competitive advantage through better, safer, and more efficient processes — from digital twins that simulate production lines pre-construction to precision quality testing systems for battery packs and vehicle assembly to advancements in autonomous driving technology. Discover how industrial AI is not only reshaping traditional manufacturing, but fundamentally changing what vehicles can do and how they're built, while empowering GM's workforce to focus on craftsmanship and delivering exceptional customer experiences in today's competitive landscape. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: How AI is Transforming the Way We Create, Personalize, and Share Content [S73742]
abstract:
AI is transforming media production by changing how we create, handle, and share content. It helps artists and writers generate scripts, music, and visual effects. Natural language processing and transformer models are now used to create dialogue and story outlines, aiding storytellers in crafting narratives. In music, AI helps compose new pieces and improve others. For visual effects, it’s being used for tasks such as rotoscoping, adjusting colors, and creating computer-generated imagery more efficiently.

In the realm of media distribution, AI is optimizing content delivery and personalization. Recommendation systems, powered by AI, analyze user data to suggest content that aligns with individual preferences, thereby enhancing viewer engagement. AI is also instrumental in managing digital rights, detecting copyright infringements, and ensuring compliance with licensing agreements.

As AI continues to evolve, it will further disrupt traditional media production workflows, offering new creative possibilities while also raising important ethical considerations around authenticity and content manipulation. We'll highlight recent advances in technology and software products embracing this new world.

title: How Amgen Leverages NVIDIA DGX Cloud on AWS and Amazon EC2 Instances for Drug Discovery and Research (Presented by Amazon Web Services) [S74271]
abstract: Learn how Amgen uses NVIDIA DGX Cloud on AWS to train state-of-the-art protein language models (pLMs) and other, related generative AI workloads for biology. Amgen was a launch customer for DGX Cloud and continues to use DGX Cloud on AWS to train new models. As a result, Amgen has open-sourced AMPLIFY — a pLM that achieves state-of-the-art performance with significantly fewer parameters than previous models. AMPLIFY outperforms larger models while requiring fewer computational resources for training and inference. By open sourcing their code, data, and model checkpoints, the authors aim to democratize protein language model development.
date_time: Amgen was a launch customer for DGX C and has open sourced AMPLIFY — a protein language model that achieves state-of-the-art performance with significantly fewer parameters than previous models

title: How can OpenShift AI and NVIDIA NIM Help You Accelerate and Optimize GenAI Application Development [S71729]
abstract: In this session, we'll explore how Red Hat OpenShift AI empowers developers to create and deliver AI-enabled applications at scale across hybrid cloud environments. By offering native support for NVIDIA NIM, OpenShift AI unlocks seamless integration with state-of-the-art NVIDIA technologies, ensuring optimized performance. Learn how you can leverage NVIDIA NIM to deploy Generative AI (GenAI) applications on OpenShift AI for maximum efficiency and flexibility. This session will demonstrate the advantages of combining these platforms, including enhanced portability, enterprise-level security, and scalable deployment across both private and public clouds.

title: How Capital One Built its Own Generative AI Agent Servicing Tool (Presented by Capital One) [EXS74442]
abstract: Get a deep dive into how Capital One built a proprietary agent servicing tool for thousands of customer service agents across the business. Learn how the team used generative AI, advanced semantic search, and the NVIDIA Enterprise AI ecosystem to provide its agents with a natural, knowledge-grounded experience, and help them service customers effectively and efficiently.

title: How CrowdStrike Accelerates Agentic Cybersecurity with NVIDIA (Presented by CrowdStrike) [S74260]
abstract: Adversaries are faster and more sophisticated than ever before, leveraging advanced techniques to exploit vulnerabilities at unprecedented speed. Join us to explore how the collaboration between NVIDIA and CrowdStrike is revolutionizing cybersecurity in the modern, generative AI world. See how cutting-edge AI, accelerated computing, and AI-powered cybersecurity capabilities uniquely come together to deliver advanced protection across the business, giving organizations the edge to outpace evolving threats. Dive into real-world threat activity, the challenges of generative AI, and how CrowdStrike and NVIDIA collaborate to secure environments and AI deployments — at scale, at speed, and with unmatched precision.

title: How Efficient Inference Enables AI Transformation With Open-Source Models (Presented by Together AI) [S74205]
abstract: Join us for an engaging panel discussion on the journey of building Together AI Cloud — designed to empower next-generation enterprise Gen AI businesses with customized solutions for efficiently deploying high-quality, open-source models. We’ll share insights into our groundbreaking innovations in AI systems research, highlighting how these advancements shape our services, real-world applications, and impactful customer success stories. Lastly, we’ll explore the future of Gen AI and discuss how Together AI’s cutting-edge technologies are driving the revolution of the next-generation AI cloud.

title: How Indonesia Delivered a Telco-led Sovereign AI Platform for 270M Users [S73440]
abstract: Sovereign AI enables nations to create their own AI and participate in the new global economy. Nations are partnering up with telcos to enable the foundational AI platform and ecosystem required for their universities, startups, enterprises, and government agencies to create AI. Indosat, a major telecoms provider with over 100 million customers, working with Lintasarta, GoTo, Accenture, and Hippocratic, has deployed a Sovereign AI Factory and a collection of LLMs for Indonesia leveraging the NVIDIA Cloud Partner program. We'll explore how Indosat set up the sovereign cloud and launched its own foundational large language model, Sahabat.ai, for the 277 million native Bahasa speakers with NVIDIA NEMO and NIMs. We'll also discuss how partners like Accenture and Hippocratic AI are accelerating AI use-case deployment in Indonesia for critical sectors including banking and healthcare using NVIDIA AI Platform.

title: How Intercontinental Exchange is Taking AI from Production to Scale to Improve Efficiency [S72463]
abstract:
This session will be broken down into 2 parts: Role of AI Center of Excellence, and Use Cases.

Role of AI Center of Excellence in an established organization:
•	ICE is a $90 billion global financial organization operating exchanges, clearing houses, data services, and mortgage technology
•	ICE AICoE oversees all AI initiatives at ICE to streamline various AI workloads by providing a platform for cost-effective experimentation with necessary governance and seamless ways to deploy at scale, along with a company-wide collaboration channel in the company.
•	AICoE streamlined various existing, as well as new, AI use cases with a platform-first approach with a hybrid (on-premises plus multi-cloud) AI platform.

Use Cases :
•	Improving the accuracy of text2SQL using schema, document, with LLM prompting for natural language search support for structured data without data migration.
•	Unstructured-to-structured data with multiple AI and Gen AI models in a pipeline to reduce human labor cost and improve accuracy.

title: How Leading AI Labs Maximize Performance in GPU Clusters (Presented by CoreWeave) [S74216]
abstract: In the rapidly evolving field of artificial intelligence, leading AI labs are constantly seeking ways to maximize the performance of their GPU clusters. We'll explore advanced strategies and techniques for optimizing GPU clusters to achieve superior speed, efficiency, and reliability — without cutting into performance. We'll dive into critical aspects such as improved model loading, better checkpointing, and robust fleet management for improved fault management. Additionally, we'll discuss the NVIDIA GB200 NVL72 cluster CoreWeave rolled out last fall, highlighting its role in enhancing AI workloads. Gain valuable insights into best practices and emerging technologies that are shaping the future of GPU cluster management. You'll also get a quick inside view into how CoreWeave quickly identifies, remediates, and tracks job and job failures to achieve an industry-best effective training time for large-scale GPU clusters.

title: How Leading AI Labs Maximize Performance in GPU Clusters (Presented by CoreWeave) [S74216]

title: How Lowe’s Leverages AI to Become an Agile Digital Retailer [S73715]
abstract:
Lowe’s has been at the forefront of leveraging AI in every aspect of their business. From generative AI (GenAI) to digital twins to computer vision, Lowe’s is using AI across their entire value chain to become a more agile digital retailer, optimize merchandising, reduce shrink, and deliver the best customer shopping experience. We'll highlight how Lowe’s has created digital twins of their stores, combined with planograms to optimize merchandising. It created an associate sales advisor using GenAI to ensure store associates deliver the best in-store customer shopping experience. And finally, using computer vision, Lowe’s is preventing shrink and speeding up the customer checkout experience.  
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: How Many GPUs Do You Need for Your Inference Workload? [CWE74833]
abstract:
Learn about the factors to consider when estimating the number of GPUs needed for an inference workload. Focusing on NVIDIA Inference Microservices (NIMs), we'll discuss streaming, pre-fill, and decoding techniques, analyze throughput and latency trade-offs, and understand tensor parallelism and in-flight batching. You'll also learn to benchmark models and select appropriate inference hyperparameters, ensuring efficient scaling and sufficient capacity for real-world use cases, both on-premises and on the cloud. This session is designed for AI practitioners looking to deepen their understanding of model deployment and optimization toward scaled deployment and resource strategy.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

Focusing on NVIDIA Inference Microservices (NIMs), we'll discuss streaming, pre-fill, and decoding techniques, analyze throughput and latency trade-offs, and understand tensor parallelism and in-flight batching. You'll also learn to benchmark models and select appropriate inference hyperparameters, ensuring efficient scaling and sufficient capacity for real-world use cases, both on-premises and on the cloud. This session is designed for AI practitioners looking to deepen their understanding of model deployment and optimization toward scaled deployment and resource strategy.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: How Math Libraries Can Help Accelerate Your Applications on Blackwell GPUs [S72434]
abstract: NVIDIA’s GPU-accelerated math libraries, which are part of the CUDA Toolkit and the HPC SDK, are constantly expanding, providing industry-leading performance and coverage of common compute workflows across AI, ML, and scientific computing. One of the main advantages of these libraries is the portability they offer to applications that use them across different generations of GPUs. We'll do a deep dive into some of the latest advancements in the latest Blackwell architecture GPUs, and how math libraries make it easy to access them to accelerate your applications. We'll cover many topics, including how new Tensor Core functionality like micro-scaling formats can be used through libraries like cuBLAS; and how multi-GPU multi-node (MGMN) libraries (e.g., cuSOLVERMp) offer improved performance and scalability on GB200 NVL72 systems leveraging the larger NVLINK domain.

title: How MediaTek and NVIDIA Are Collaborating to Make AI Ubiquitous (Presented by MediaTek) [EXS74526]
abstract: Learn how MediaTek collaborated with NVIDIA on the design of the GB10 Grace Blackwell Superchip for Project DIGITS, a personal AI supercomputer. Learn about MediaTek’s unique expertise in optimizing performance and power efficiency for AI applications, from supercomputers to consumer electronics devices to datacenter applications. Also hear about MediaTek’s other initiatives with NVIDIA to bring advanced AI experiences to vehicles and internet-of-things devices.

title: How Nasdaq is Redefining Markets with Accelerated Compute [S73059]
abstract: Advancements in AI and accelerated compute are creating opportunities for optimizing performance and efficiency of trading systems. Discover how NASDAQ is focusing on improving exchange performance and introducing new functionality. This session will highlight the benchmarking tests done by NASDAQ for Grace and Grace Hopper.  Learn how the unique requirements of Nasdaq trading systems can be satisfied using NVIDIA's Grace, Grace Hopper, and NVIDIA NIMs.

title: How NVIDIA can Help You, as a Researcher, Accelerate Scientific Discovery [CWE74434]
abstract:
Join this engaging session led by NVIDIA experts who collaborate closely with the global academic research community, supporting leading researchers in leveraging NVIDIA software technologies to drive scientific advancements across diverse fields. We'll provide insights into how various NVIDIA teams, representing different functional areas, can assist in accelerating your scientific discoveries at multiple levels. The team will outline their approach to working with individual researchers and groups, share success stories, and introduce a range of developer support programs, including but not limited to the Academic Grant Program, Deep Learning Institute courses and Teaching Kits, Researcher Advisory Councils, etc. We'll also focus on aligning discussions with specific research domains such as robotics, biology, gen AI, data processing, and climate science — while showcasing tools and resources available to help researchers enhance research outcomes.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: How Predictive Intelligence is Driving the Future of Marketing [S73878]
abstract:
For over a century-and-a-half, businesses have grappled with optimizing marketing efficiency. While digital marketing has enhanced accountability, it still struggles to accurately measure offline channels, which make up nearly 40% of global advertising expenditure. Join us as we delve into the future of marketing analytics and discover how predictive intelligence is transforming enterprise marketing strategies. We’ll explore how predictive marketing analytics is becoming an essential tool for CMOs, empowering them to shape future outcomes with unparalleled precision and drive revenue growth.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: How Robotics and AI are Changing Surgery for the Better [EXS74646]
abstract: Surgical robotics and AI-assisted surgery were once the realm of science fiction. Now, thousands of procedures a day are performed using robots. Understand how surgical robotics solutions are developed, the role that AI plays in assisting surgeons throughout an operation, and what's coming next in world of AI-assisted surgical procedures. We'll also give some tips on how you can integrate best practices from surgical robotics into other areas of healthcare, such as imaging.

title: How SAP Combines AI, Data, and Applications to Elevate Every Aspect of Your Business (Presented by SAP) [EXS74613]
abstract: Discover how SAP Business AI helps modern enterprises make rapid, transformative impact a reality by making every process more efficient, every decision data-driven, and every employee more capable. By leveraging SAP Business AI-powered cloud transformation; Joule, SAP’s AI orchestrator; and our system of collaborative AI agents, businesses can achieve unparalleled cross-enterprise efficiency.

title: How to Accelerate a Multimodal LLM-Based Real-Time Video Generation and Life-Like Interactive System on a Digital Human Platform by TensorRT-LLM [S72675]
abstract: Kuaishou VGI (Visual Generation and Interaction) team has implemented a next-generation digital human platform, powered by the state-of-the-art, end-to-end Multimodal Interaction language model (LM), and industry-leading Life-Like Interactive System architecture. We'll share our innovative technical implementation and best practices using NVIDIA GPU and TensorRT-LLM, which can achieve industry-leading real-time, high-quality, low-latency, full duplex, and multimodal user experience. We'll also share the insights to the future development of lifelike digital humans.

title: How to Accelerate a Multimodal LLM-Based Real-Time Video Generation and Life-Like Interactive System on a Digital Human Platform by TensorRT-LLM [S72675]
abstract: Kuaishou VGI (Visual Generation and Interaction) team has implemented a next-generation digital human platform, powered by the state-of-the-art, end-to-end Multimodal Interaction language model (LM), and industry-leading Life-Like Interactive System architecture. title: How to Accelerate GenAI application development process with W&B Weave and NVIDIA (Presented by Weights & Biases) [EXS74222]
abstract: Leveraging and tailoring Generative AI for an enterprise's unique business requirements can be a daunting task when starting from scratch. In this lightning session, Weights & Biases will showcase how to leverage readily available reference architectures provided by NVIDIA Blueprints with W&B Weave, the platform for creating GenAI applications to evaluate, monitor, and iterate and ultimately build a production grade AI assistant.

title: How to Ace a Finance Developer Interview: A Deep Dive into GPU Matrix Optimization [S73619]
abstract:
Matrix multiplication is inarguably the most ubiquitous operation performed on GPUs. Yet it's one of the hardest of all algorithms to implement, and guidance for optimization is surprisingly scarce. The vast majority of users are well-served by cuBLAS and other NVIDIA tools, but there are cases where a developer's needs are so unique they must start from scratch. More importantly, the techniques used are extremely instructive for many other CUDA tasks. This talk is aimed at developers with such requirements. But even more importantly, the concepts taught here will be applicable to those seeking to improve their GPU performance programming skills overall.

We explore a dense MatMul Float 32 FMA kernel, using standard CUDA C++. We begin by analyzing speed-of-light expectations and performance bottlenecks. Then we’ll proceed from a naïve example to a highly performant version, properly illustrating use of the GPU memory hierarchy, and conclude with an Nsight Compute analysis.

title: How to Automate AI Transparency: Enhancing Model Transparency With Minimal Effort [S72399]
abstract: Producing model card documentation is a state-of-the-art best practice for advancing AI transparently, and educating enterprise developers and nontechnical influencers like customers, investors, users, and policymakers about AI in a clear and uniform manner. Learn how to streamline the creation and management of model cards through the model card generator. Understand how the model card automation engine captures essential metadata during training and from model source code, ensuring comprehensive, consistent, and up-to-date documentation for AI models.

abstract: Producing model card documentation is a state-of-the-art best practice for advancing AI transparently, and educating enterprise developers and nontechnical influencers like customers, investors, users, and policymakers about AI in a clear and uniform manner. Learn how to streamline the creation and management of model cards through the model card generator. Understand how the model card automation engine captures essential metadata during training and from model source code, ensuring comprehensive, consistent, and up-to-date documentation for AI models.

abstract:
Building a digital human requires several pipelines. We'll have a group of experts covering everything from avatar creation to customization with RIVA present to answer questions and help lead developers through a successful journey.

title: How to Build an Agentic AI System Using the Best Tools and Frameworks [S73739]
abstract:
AI agents are the new digital workforce, working for and with us. They can reason about a mission, create a plan, and retrieve data or use tools to generate a quality response. Data is the fuel for AI agents, but the magnitude and scale of enterprise data often make it too expensive and time-consuming to leverage effectively. For enterprises to thrive in the AI era, they must find a way to make use of all of their data. Join this session to learn about tools and frameworks to more easily build agentic AI systems that connectAI agents to a library of reusable tools that unlock your data, and drive efficiency gains across the organization. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: How to Build Multimodal Agentic AI Retrieval Systems [S72208]
abstract:
Join NVIDIA technical product architects for an in-depth tutorial demonstrating how to build agentic AI pipelines that integrate diverse data types—including text, images, audio, and video—into enterprise AI applications. This session will cover the full journey, from designing production-ready retrieval systems to effectively using them in Enterprise use cases. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: How to Not Fail: Simplify AI Deployment and Accelerate Time to Production with AI Platforms Built with NVIDIA AI [S73185]
abstract: Deploying AI applications in production is one of the toughest challenges enterprises face today, from navigating evolving tools to managing resource-heavy pipelines. Join experts from DataStax, and one of their customers Bud Financial to hear how they overcame significant roadblocks, including high costs and underwhelming performance with off-the-shelf solutions. Discover how adopting the DataStax AI Platform, built with NVIDIA AI, streamlined development, reduced complexity, and enabled a high-performance production launch—providing actionable insights to help developers and leaders tackle AI deployment hurdles and achieve success faster.

title: How to Onboard Your Team of AI Agents and Transform Your Enterprise [S71784]
abstract:
Agentic AI is inspiring a paradigm shift from software-as-a-service to service-as-software. Agents combine reasoning, dynamic data retrieval and can access tools to drive outcomes. Teams of AI agents can work together, achieving results that are often far better than those of a single AI agent. With NVIDIA AI Blueprints, building blocks for agentic AI, we will show how enterprises can easily compose teams of agents, and securely deploy them with confidence.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: How to Run and Optimize Your Workloads on the NVIDIA Grace CPU [CWE73338]
abstract:
Grace, NVIDIA’s first CPU for the data center, packs 72 high-performance Armv9 cores on a single die and integrates LPDDR5 memory for up to 500GB/s of memory bandwidth. Whether paired with NVIDIA’s best-in-class data center GPUs or combined with a second Grace CPU in the Grace Superchip, it delivers exceptional performance. It's designed for HPC and hyperscale data center deployments where absolute performance, energy efficiency, and density matter. In this interactive session, our experts will answer any questions you may have about fully unlocking the potential of the Grace CPU. We welcome anyone interested in evaluating and deploying NVIDIA Grace-based solutions in their data center. You should understand the basics of CPU programming and are encouraged to bring application-specific questions and general questions about the Arm software ecosystem.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: How to Use NVIDIA Omniverse™ on Smart Factory Design: The Fii Omniverse Digital Twin Project on NVIDIA GB200 Grace™ Blackwell Superchip Production Line (Presented by Foxconn) [S74429]
abstract:
Digital twin evolution represents the progressive development and implementation of digital twins, beginning from simple geometric representations to comprehensive enterprise-wide systems. This evolution reflects the increasing complexity and integration of technologies such as the industrial internet of things, AI, and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems to enhance operational efficiency, streamline production, and improve decision-making.

Key Benefits:
•	Enhanced Collaboration: Real-time updates and collaborative capabilities via platforms like Omniverse empower teams globally.
•	Improved Operational Efficiency: From visualizing machine layouts to conducting full factory simulations, these phases optimize workflows and reduce downtime.
•	Scalability: A modular and centralized approach ensures that the system can grow and adapt to new challenges and requirements.
•	Informed Decision-Making: By integrating real-time data and ERP systems, the enterprise twin enables data-driven decisions that enhance productivity and profitability.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: How To Write A CUDA Program: The Parallel Programming Edition [S72897]
abstract:
Join one of CUDA's architects on a journey through the concepts of parallel programming: how it works, why it works, why it's not working when you think it should be working, and in particular why it's different on a GPU from a CPU. We'll look at different approaches to parallel programming in CUDA and how to take advantage of the hardware it runs on.

This is the next episode in what has become a series looking at the way that CUDA and the GPU work, and why they work this way. This session will focus on how to think about parallel programming on a massively-parallel GPU and why that might be different to what you're used to. If you've never even written a parallel algorithm then you'll learn all sorts of new things, but even if you're a ninja you'll walk away with some new tricks up your sleeve.

title: How Volkswagen Shapes the Next Generation of Interactive 3D Experiences [S72806]
abstract: In today’s digital age, purchasing decisions for new cars are heavily shaped by online research and immersive digital experiences. With the vast range of customizable features available in modern vehicles, automakers like Volkswagen face the challenge of delivering highly detailed, realistic 3D visualizations that meet customer expectations. Traditional methods for creating these streaming experiences are often time-consuming and expensive. Discover how Volkswagen harnesses Universal Scene Description (USD) in NVIDIA’s Omniverse and SolidMeta’s CAD2Realtime AI to drive efficiencies. Learn how these complementary technologies streamline workflows, reduce production times, and enable fast, cost-effective, high-quality interactive visualizations that transform the customer experience.

title: How Walmart Uses RAPIDS to Improve Efficiency, and What We've Learned Along the Way [S71537]
abstract: Walmart has been involved with RAPIDS for almost a decade, guiding and helping to evolve the open-source accelerated data processing community. We'll describe the journey taken with RAPIDS data processing, including how RAPIDS helped us improve efficiency, enabled faster time-to-decision-making, and improved our ability to scale our data compute. We'll discuss how we leverage the range of RAPIDS libraries, from the core libraries to higher-level libraries like Dask RAPIDS and RAPIDS for Apache Spark. This talk will describe our learnings on when to apply the right RAPIDS library for different problem spaces.

title: How Walmart Uses RAPIDS to Improve Efficiency, and What We've Learned Along the Way [S71537]
abstract: Walmart has been involved with RAPIDS for almost a decade, guiding and helping to evolve the open-source accelerated data processing community. We'll describe the journey taken with RAPIDS data processing, including how RAPIDS helped us improve efficiency, enabled faster time-to-decision-making, and improved our ability to scale our data compute. This talk will describe our learnings on when to apply the right RAPIDS library for different problem spaces.

title: How We Built the First Multi-Agent Pipeline That Generates AI Software Interfaces [S71591]
abstract: Learn how we set out to build a platform that can gather information about an enterprise software system, and automatically generate an interface that allows AI agents and NIM applications to interact with that enterprise system in an accurate, agentic way. This advancement in AI and API integrations is a must for allowing AI agents to fetch real-time data and perform actions. We faced many hurdles and deployed advanced AI techniques to solve them, resulting in the ability to equip AI agents with interfaces to any target system.

title: How You Should Write a CUDA C++ Kernel [S72575]
abstract: You may think you know how to write CUDA C++ kernels, but are you making life harder than it needs to be? When a custom kernel is the best tool for the job, you want to be sure you're using the best libraries and practices so that you write excellent kernels that are reliable and performant. In this session, that's exactly what we'll teach you.

title: How Yum! Brands Serves Up Digital Innovation [S72790]
abstract:
Join us as Joe Park, chief digital and technology officer at Yum! Brands, highlights the company’s transformative use of AI in its digital evolution. Since 2019, digital sales have soared from 19% to over 50%, driven by AI-powered innovations that enhance both customer experiences and operational efficiency. Yum! leverages AI to optimize order customization, streamline kitchen management, and enhance ecommerce platforms. Joe will discuss AI’s pivotal role in creating a smarter, more responsive quick-service restaurant ecosystem tailored to evolving consumer needs.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Human Body Movement Notation as Tool for Social Communication [P73277]
abstract: Unlike verbal, musical, or visual expression, body movement lacks an effective written system. Our project, Nota-Anna, begun in 1983, addresses this gap by developing a way to capture and visualize movement as a form of communication. The BodyWays app uses smartphone cameras to track body movements and turn them into a shareable notation. This new language allows people to express emotions and ideas through movement, bridging communication across cultures. Tested globally, BodyWays offers a unique, accessible tool for social connection and creative expression.

title: Hybrid Parallel Quantum Chemistry Simulation for Large-Scale GPU Clusters [P73003]
abstract: We present a state-of-the-art solution for quantum-classical hybrid algorithms in quantum chemistry by integrating NVIDIA cuQuantum into our simulator as the computational backend. Optimized for both high-performance computing and quantum chemistry on clusters of 2,048 GPUs connected via hierarchical NVLink/InfiniBand networks, our approach offers numerous benefits to quantum algorithm developers, opening up new frontiers for unprecedented research opportunities.

abstract: We present a state-of-the-art solution for quantum-classical hybrid algorithms in quantum chemistry by integrating NVIDIA cuQuantum into our simulator as the computational backend. Optimized for both high-performance computing and quantum chemistry on clusters of 2,048 GPUs connected via hierarchical NVLink/InfiniBand networks, our approach offers numerous benefits to quantum algorithm developers, opening up new frontiers for unprecedented research opportunities.

title: Hybrid Parallel Quantum Chemistry Simulation for Large-Scale GPU Clusters [P73003]
abstract: We present a state-of-the-art solution for quantum-classical hybrid algorithms in quantum chemistry by integrating NVIDIA cuQuantum into our simulator as the computational backend. Optimized for both high-performance computing and quantum chemistry on clusters of 2,048 GPUs connected via hierarchical NVLink/InfiniBand networks, our approach offers numerous benefits to quantum algorithm developers, opening up new frontiers for unprecedented research opportunities.

title: HybridRAG: Make RAG More Accurate by Combining Graph and Vector-Based Retrieval  [CWE72566]
abstract:
VectorRAG techniques utilize vector databases for information retrieval. We published new retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) where retrieval is applied on graph, called GraphRAG. Hybrid RAG (VectorRAG+GraphRAG) techniques enhance question-answer (Q&A) systems for information extraction from any data modality are shown to be capable of generating the most accurate and contextually relevant answers.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

HybridRAG can be applied to any kind of data, including text, images, videos, etc., in all the verticals. Existing RAG implementation can accommodate the GraphRAG component as well, with little addition.
HybridRAG is flexible, and NVIDIA components like cuGraph, cuDF, NIM, and Raft, have great play in accelerating end-to-end pipelines.

title: Igniting the Real Robot Revolution Requires Closing the “Data Gap” [S74739]
abstract:
Imagine a future where robots handle billions of items with AI to support an aging population that doesn’t have enough human workers. Computation is increasing rapidly but much more data is needed to ignite this robotics revolution.  Several unicorn startups emerged in the past year to generate humanoid robot data but I’ll show that there is still a 100,000x “data gap” between large vision-language models and current robot models. Goldberg will present the state-of-the-art in robotics and review the options for generating robot data, including the case study of Ambi Robotics, which has collected 200,000 hours of real robot data from their award-winning robot systems that have sorted 100 million real consumer packages.  This is allowing Ambi Robotics to close the data gap for a practical subclass of robot skills to enable a new generation of real industrial robots.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Imitation Learning Techniques Using NVIDIA Isaac Lab and Apple Vision Pro [DLIT71432]
abstract:
This immersive lab introduces participants to the cutting-edge field of imitation learning for robotics. Using NVIDIA's GR00T and Isaac Lab frameworks, attendees will experience the full pipeline of imitation learning, from data collection via teleoperation to training and deploying an autonomous robot policy. The lab combines theoretical concepts with practical, hands-on exercises, allowing participants to gather data using Apple Vision Pro, synthesize additional training examples, and train a robot using Robomimic within the Isaac Lab environment. By the end of the session, attendees will have created and tested their own imitation learning model, gaining valuable insights into this powerful approach for robot skill acquisition.
For participants who plan on leveraging the Apple Vision Pro for data capture, please note that glasses are not permitted to be worn with the device.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic understanding of robotics concepts and principles, including teleoperation.
Experience with programming, particularly in Python.
Understanding of computer vision concepts and 3D simulation environments.
Familiarity with NVIDIA's robotics development platforms like Isaac Sim.
Familiarity with spatial computing concepts and Apple's development ecosystem.

title: Immersive BMW Factory Tour powered by AI [S71294]
abstract:
Building on our 3D AppStore, the cloud streaming solution for high-end visualization presented at last year's GTC, we're now enabling a new use case to support BMW's implementation of a new battery assembly process across multiple factories worldwide. We'll demonstrate how we integrate AI NPCs (non-playable characters) into any application on our 3D AppStore, focusing on the Gen 6 Battery Assembly use case. Using AWS Bedrock, we created a knowledge base (retrieval augmented generation, or RAG) from a Confluence project that details each station in the battery assembly process. Multiple users can interact with the AI freely via a group voice chat. Given the global requirement, we support multiple languages, including English, German, Spanish, and Chinese. The NPC is integrated into a detailed 3D visualization of the factory, which can be experienced in virtual and augmented reality, thanks to NVIDIA's Cloud XR. Additionally, we are evaluating different NVIDIA inference microservices, like Audio2Face, to better integrate the NPCs into the virtual world. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Impact of Standardization on Functional Safety-Related AI-Based Applications [CWE73342]
abstract:
As AI systems become more embedded in autonomous vehicles, robotics, healthcare, manufacturing, and critical infrastructure, ensuring their safety/reliability/dependability has become a top priority. Standardization, specifically related to AI functional safety, plays a vital role in addressing these challenges. We'll focus on the critical role of AI functional safety standards in shaping future of AI systems used in safety-critical applications. We'll explore upcoming AI functional safety standards and their impact, as these standards aim to set global benchmarks and guide organizations in deploying AI safely.
 
Key points are:
•	Understanding AI functional safety in safety-critical systems
•	An overview of the upcoming ISO/PAS 8800 and ISO/IEC TS 22440 standard series, and how they will impact safety-critical AI applications
•	Guidance on how to address the gaps between these standards and classical functional safety standards
•	Insights into global trends and future directions
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Impacts of Introducing Liquid Cooling into Data Center Infrastructure (Presented by EdgeConneX) [EXS74208]
abstract: Explore the drivers and overall impacts of deploying liquid cooling infrastructure into the physical data center.  Better understand the new challenges faced by the industry and the general path forward for designing data center architectures that can flex and evolve with future technology innovations.

title: Implement Accelerated PDE-Based Time-History Simulation by Data-Driven Methods on Strongly Coupled CPU-GPU systems [S72925]
abstract: Partial differential equation (PDE)-based time-history simulations, such as seismic wave simulations, are computationally costly, so we've been working on reducing their computational costs on HPC systems. Hear about recent research and implementation examples on using data-driven methods to accelerate PDE-based implicit time-history simulations without reducing simulation accuracy.

title: Implementing AI Regulation: A Global View of How Businesses are Approaching Compliance [S71594]
abstract: Around the world, a wave of regulations and standards designed to mitigate risks associated with AI are entering into force. Companies providing AI products and services across multiple jurisdictions are faced with a regulatory environment that imposes different obligations in different markets. Hear from experts working in a range of industries and regions about their approach to AI regulation and its impact on their work. The panel will share views on how businesses should think about compliance and consider how supervisory authorities are supporting the transition from preparation to implementation.

title: Implement Model Governance and RAG Capabilities With VMware Private AI Foundation With NVIDIA (Presented by VMware by Broadcom) [EXS74477]
abstract: Explore how the joint Gen AI platform, VMware Private AI Foundation with NVIDIA, helps enterprises unlock Gen AI and unleash productivity in their environment. Hear VMware and NVIDIA experts present a technical overview and demos showing this platform’s powerful capabilities — model governance and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).

title: Improve Chip Design Using Intelligent Retrieval and Agent-Driven Workflow Innovations [CWE74840]
abstract:
Several steps in the chip design flow can be streamlined using generative AI to shorten production cycles. This can encompass bug and issue tracking, generating verification tests, and running simulations to debug complex issues using intelligent agents. See how we can use next-gen retrieval techniques to extract relevant information from domain-specific databases. We'll also demonstrate how we can create an agentic ecosystem that leverages these retrieval methods to iteratively solve complex issues in the chip design cycle. 
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. title: Improve Training Throughput of MLIP Models With Load Balancing and cuEquivariance [P73584]
abstract: We present two ways to accelerate training of graph neural network-based machine-learning interatomic potential models — through more efficient kernel implementations and better load balancing.

title: Improve Vector Database Performance While Reducing DRAM Use in AI Systems (Presented by KIOXIA) [EXS74254]
abstract: As AI systems become more effective with more and better data, DRAM costs increase as memory requirements grow.  KIOXIA has developed a way to scale vector databases, while reducing DRAM use and cost with the use of flash memory and open-source software.
date_time: Understand why DRAM use significantly drives up AI system costs

title: Improving LLM Performance With University Math Problems via Repeated Fine-Tuning [P73499]
abstract: We develop a dataset of mathematical problems sourced from university curricula, and a training procedure featuring a novel rSFT (repeated supervised fine-tuning) approach. These yield up to 40% improvement in advanced problem-solving for the top-performing math specialist models. We also conduct a thorough investigation of various data augmentation and training techniques to establish best practices on leveraging a standalone high-quality dataset of complex reasoning data such as ours.

title: Improving Road Safety with GenAI, Metropolis, and NVIDIA Omniverse™ (Presented by Foxconn) [S74446]
abstract: Delve into the transformative role of digital twin technology in automating road safety assessments and enhancing intersection design. We'll explore how digital twins integrate real-time data, predictive analytics, automation, and Gen AI to identify hazards, diagnose accident-prone areas, and implement effective safety solutions. Learn how this innovative approach is revolutionizing traffic management, reducing risks, and shaping smarter, safer urban mobility.

title: Improving Workforce Productivity with Humanoid Robotics (Presented by Deloitte) [S72001]
abstract: Explore how Deloitte and NVIDIA are preparing organizations for the transformative impact of humanoid robotics on their future workforce strategies. As the adoption of advanced robotics accelerates, organizations must understand how to effectively integrate humanoid robotics technologies into their talent operations. We'll cover lessons learned from pilot deployments of humanoid robotics, the importance of strategic partnership in enabling operations and change management, and the impact of this technology on enhancing future workforce productivity and efficiency.

title: In a World of One-Year Tech Cycles, Can Traditional Financial Planning Keep Up? [S73404]
abstract: In a rapidly evolving tech landscape, traditional financial planning struggles to keep pace with one-year tech cycles. This panel will explore how outdated financial models hinder innovation and growth, particularly in AI. We’ll discuss adaptive strategies that empower organizations and nations to lead in AI advancements. Learn from innovators such as Bristol Myers Squibb, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), and NVIDIA Financial Services how modern financial frameworks can drive global competitiveness and technological progress.

Learn from innovators such as Bristol Myers Squibb, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), and NVIDIA Financial Services how modern financial frameworks can drive global competitiveness and technological progress.

title: In a World of One-Year Tech Cycles, Can Traditional Financial Planning Keep Up? [S73404]
abstract: In a rapidly evolving tech landscape, traditional financial planning struggles to keep pace with one-year tech cycles. This panel will explore how outdated financial models hinder innovation and growth, particularly in AI. We’ll discuss adaptive strategies that empower organizations and nations to lead in AI advancements. Learn from innovators such as Bristol Myers Squibb, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), and NVIDIA Financial Services how modern financial frameworks can drive global competitiveness and technological progress.

title: Incomplete Modality Federated Learning in Medical Imaging [P73593]
abstract:
In modern healthcare, the ability to handle a wide variety of diagnostic tasks is crucial. Hospitals generate and rely on a vast amount of medical data from different sources, such as X-rays, MRIs, CT scans, and electronic health records. Each of these data types serves different diagnostic purposes, and it is common for hospitals to have varying access to them depending on their resources and equipment. 

The importance of our model lies in its potential to consolidate diagnostic processes within a single framework. Currently, hospitals often rely on separate models or systems to process different data types, such as separate algorithms for CT scans, X-rays, and MRI images. By using our proposed model, several different tasks can be integrated.

abstract: We'll explore critical factors driving startup success in today's dynamic landscape, with a particular focus on the transformative potential of AI. Hear a diverse panel of experts share real-life examples of ways startups can reach their full potential and access valuable support. You’ll gain practical knowledge, discover valuable resources, and connect with key players in the startup ecosystem. You’ll learn how to access funding opportunities and hear more about the tools, resources, and programs that are available to help startups across the life cycle.

title: Insights From NVIDIA Research [S73202]
abstract: The talk will give some highlights from NVIDIA Research for the past year. Detailed topics will be disclosed closer to the event.

title: Insights From NVIDIA's Kaggle Grandmasters: Winning Techniques for World-Class Model Building [CWE73747]
abstract:
Gain unique insights from NVIDIA's Kaggle Grandmasters, who've competed and earned top honors in hundreds of international data science competitions. The team brings deep expertise in generative AI, computer vision, natural language processing, forecasting, recommender systems, tabular data, signals, and graphs. Discover the latest tools and techniques winning competitions today, hear best practices for GPU acceleration across diverse use cases, and explore how these experts approach complex challenges. Bring your questions and learn directly from data science champions on optimizing model performance for real-world applications.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Insights Into Disney’s Robotic Character Platform [S72595]
abstract: At Disney, we're redefining entertainment robotics from the ground up and are building artist-centric tools that provide creative control of dynamic character motion. Gain insight into our robotic character platform that enables the rapid design of freely roaming robotic characters like our BDX Droids. See how our characters learn to imitate artist-specified animations with a combination of deep reinforcement learning and GPU-accelerated simulation. Learn how we get our characters to perform highly challenging motions at the limit of hardware, and see the first results of bringing engaging autonomous interactions to our characters.

title: Insights on Building an Enterprise Multi-Agentic Conversational AI Workflow (Presented by Capital One) [S74439]
abstract: Get insights and learn lessons on building an in-house, proprietary, multi-agentic conversational workflow for the enterprise. Hear from Capital One about its journey to create a state-of-the-art and proprietary multi-agentic AI workflow that meets the needs of various users. The team will discuss best practices, approaches, and lessons learned from real-world experiments and applications for building an agentic workflow with several logical agents that understand natural language prompts, create an action plan, validate the plan, and explain it back to the user before taking action on their behalf.

title: Insights on Building an Enterprise Multi-Agentic Conversational AI Workflow (Presented by Capital One) [S74439]
abstract: Get insights and learn lessons on building an in-house, proprietary, multi-agentic conversational workflow for the enterprise. title: InstantSpeech: Instant Synchronous Text-to-Speech Synthesis for LLM-Driven Voice Chatbots [P72550]
abstract: Discover InstantSpeech, a novel low-latency synchronous speech synthesis model designed to enhance interactions with chatbots powered by large language models (LLMs). By enabling instant speech synthesis as soon as the first words are generated by the LLMs, we can improve user experience and reduce speech response latency, addressing the critical need for more natural, real-time communication in conversational AI.

title: Instruct-PBR: Text-Guided Material Editing With NVIDIA NIM Stable Diffusion [P73029]
abstract: We present a novel text-guided physically based rendering (PBR) material editing approach with the Stable Diffusion NIM model. Our method seamlessly alters the input texture based on user-provided text prompts, generating entirely new PBR materials complete with high-quality normal, roughness, metallic, and ambient occlusion maps. This process eliminates the need for manual mask selection, offering a streamlined and efficient solution for automating the creation of custom PBR materials. Additionally, our approach facilitates effortless integration of these materials into the Omniverse environment, significantly simplifying the design workflow and enhancing creative flexibility.

title: Integrate Advanced IO Shaping, Caching, and Data Placement Into NVIDIA BlueField-3 DPU Storage Service for AI Storage BeeGFS [P74020]
abstract:
CSAL is a cloud storage acceleration layer for big data and AI. It's an open-source user mode FTL, cache, and IO trace component to accelerate AI inside SPDK(upstreamed). It commercially helps Alibaba cloud storage system and refers to a joint top paper at Eurosys2024: https://dl.acm.org/doi/pdf/10.1145/3627703.3629566.

We'll introduce these new features, with joint development with NVIDIA BlueField-3 DPU and BeeGFS:
•	CSAL leverages NVIDIA BlueField-3 DPU DRAM as write buffer to achieve best latency
•	QLC is favored for AI since it saves power and space. NVIDIA BlueField-3 DPU&QLC is a great combination for better total cost of ownership
•	CSAL in NVIDIA BlueField-3 DPU brings advanced storage IO shaping, caching, and data placement into NVIDIA BlueField-3 DPU storage software service. We can tune BeeGFS metadata and data services to achieve the best service-level agreement. 
•	We’ll demonstrate future design ideas together with BeeGFS+CSAL inside NVIDIA BlueField-3 DPU, saving CPU with better performance
date_time: CSAL leverages NVIDIA BlueField-3 DPU DRAM as a write buffer that achieves best latency

title: Integrate LLMs Into Asset Management to Drive Innovation and Efficiency [S71575]
abstract:
Large language models are designed to predict the next word in a sentence, enabling them to generate coherent and contextually relevant text. In the context of asset management, LLMs can process unstructured financial data such as news, reports, and market analyses, offering fund researchers and managers the ability to analyze sentiment, predict trends, and automate decision-making processes.
 
In an era when technology is transforming every aspect of finance, integrating LLMs into asset management is not just a trend, but a revolution. We explore how LLMs are shaping the future of asset management. We'll examine the advanced techniques used to train and fine-tune LLMs for asset management applications, and delve into scenarios where LLMs can increase research efficiency and enhance decision-making processes. We'll also discuss the importance of foresight in leveraging these technologies to gain a broader industry impact.

title: Intelligent Industrial Robotics: From Simulation to Robot Low-Code Deployment [S71957]
abstract: Discover how collaborative robotics transforms industrial environments through NVIDIA Isaac Sim-based vision AI training and Yaskawa robots with integrated NVIDIA Jetson. See how encapsulated "skills," deployed as containers, enable low-code creation of complex robot programs, paving the way for new business models like skill providers and software as a service. Learn how these specialized skills can be combined by AI into intelligent robot solutions based on behavior trees.

title: Interactive Music With Multimodal Gen AI: Integrate Stories, Music, and Virtual Spaces [P73458]
abstract: Explore how multimodal generative AI is transforming music from passive listening to active participation. Discover new techniques for fans to interact with music in immersive virtual spaces, collaborate in real time, and create personalized content, driving creative growth and new revenue streams for the music ecosystem.

title: Interactive Music With Multimodal Gen AI: Integrate Stories, Music, and Virtual Spaces [P73458]
abstract: Explore how multimodal generative AI is transforming music from passive listening to active participation. Discover new techniques for fans to interact with music in immersive virtual spaces, collaborate in real time, and create personalized content, driving creative growth and new revenue streams for the music ecosystem.

title: Interconnected Multi-Agent in Recruitment [P73486]
abstract: Recruitment has evolved significantly with the advent of LLM and multi-agent systems. These technologies enhance various stages of recruitment, from resume screening to interview summarization and emotion recognition. Our research comprises several interconnected agents, each responsible for specific tasks within the recruitment process. These agents work collaboratively to deliver a comprehensive evaluation of candidates. This research work has been successfully spun off to aidios.ai.

title: Inter-GPU Communication Techniques and Libraries for HPC and AI [CWE72547]
abstract:
Discuss with experts everything related to inter-GPU communication through NVLink, Infiniband, or other networks. We'll cover all communication libraries: NCCL, MPI, UCX/UCC and NVSHMEM. This is the perfect place to discuss performance benefits of GPU Direct, NVLink, Infiniband, and SHARP to accelerate your deep learning training workload or your HPC application.

title: Inter-GPU Communication Techniques and Libraries for HPC and AI [CWE72547]
abstract:
Discuss with experts everything related to inter-GPU communication through NVLink, Infiniband, or other networks. We'll cover all communication libraries: NCCL, MPI, UCX/UCC and NVSHMEM. This is the perfect place to discuss performance benefits of GPU Direct, NVLink, Infiniband, and SHARP to accelerate your deep learning training workload or your HPC application.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Interpret Health Data With AI to Change the Future of Medicine  [S71671]
abstract:
Today, medicine stands on the cusp of revolution due to the availability of more health data than ever before. We’ll dive into how AI is used to cut through data complexity and enable faster innovation, while providing an opportunity to make medical advancements and advance health equity for all. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Introducing NVIDIA Dynamo: A Distributed Inference Serving Framework for Reasoning models [S73042]
abstract:
This session will introduce NVIDIA Dynamo, a new inference serving framework designed to deploy reasoning large language models (LLMs) in multi-node environments. We’ll explore the key components and architecture of the new framework, highlighting how they enable seamless scaling within data centers and drive advanced inference optimization. Additionally, we’ll cover cutting-edge inference serving techniques, including disaggregated serving, which optimizes request handling by separating prefill and decode, increasing the number of inference requests served. Attendees will also learn how they will be able to quickly deploy this innovative serving framework using NVIDIA NIM.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Introduction to Autonomous Vehicles [S72857]
abstract: Autonomous vehicles are revolutionizing the way we think about transportation. This session provides an entry point into this transformative technology and its effect on the future of mobility. You'll hear a comprehensive overview of fundamental concepts, including AI model development and validation, software-defined compute, and intelligent cockpits, as well as how recent technological breakthroughs such as generative AI are shaping the industry. Whether you're new to autonomous vehicles or seeking to deepen your knowledge, this session offers a foundation for engaging with the new era of mobility.

title: Introduction to NVIDIA Halos – Strategy for AV Safety [S74743]
abstract: We'll introduce NVIDIA Halos, a full-stack comprehensive safety system that unifies vehicle architecture, AI models, chips, software, tools, and services to ensure the safe development of autonomous vehicles (AVs) from cloud to car. After the introduction, we'll dive deep into design-time safety guardrails, from platform to algorithmic safety.

title: Introduction to Robot Simulation: Learn How to Develop, Simulate, and Deploy Scalable Robot Intelligence [DLIT74633]
abstract:
Robots hold massive potential to automate and scale difficult and repetitive tasks across industries and in our lives. Programming robots to conduct these tasks safely has historically been challenging, costly, and specialized. Robotics simulation enables developers to virtually train, test, and validate robots in physics-based digital representations of the real world.
In this lab, we’ll take you through the end-to-end robotics development process using Scaled Foundations’ GRID platform powered by NVIDIA Isaac Sim. Starting with a fully functional robot simulation instance with a robot, sensor, AI model, and environment, you’ll create an end-to-end, functional robot solution to perform a task and combine your robot solution with several of the latest robot AI models. Finally, you’ll see how you can take your solution from GRID and deploy on a real robot.
Prerequisite(s):

Experience with Python.
Basic knowledge of robotic architectures.

title: Introduction to the Construction of Liquid-Cooling AIDC Based on NVIDIA B200 (Presented by Aivres) [S74278]
abstract: We will discuss Aivres liquid cooling products based on NVIDIA B200 for an energy-efficient new generation of data centers that fully meet the needs and technical challenges of AIDC construction. This session will provide reference solutions for the overall layout of liquid cooling in data centers, planning of primary and secondary liquid cooling pipelines and equipment, power supply and cluster networking, etc.

title: Intro to Large Language Models: LLM Tutorial and Disease Diagnosis LLM Lab [DLIT71755]
abstract:
First we'll discuss what an LLM is and some of the strengths and weaknesses of these models, looking at a handful of models and approaches. We'll cover the difference between pre-training and fine-tuning and discuss input processing by showing how to take an input string and tokenize it into input ids. We'll present QLoRa as a means of greatly reducing computational requirements for LLM inference and fine-tuning. We'll wrap up the concepts portion of the session by discussing Hugging Face and their transformers library.
The lab portion starts with performing inference using the Hugging Face transformers library and the Falcon-7B-Instruct model. We'll then move to fine-tuning Falcon-7B-Instruct using the MedText dataset, where the goal is to take a prompt that describes symptoms of a medical issue and generate a diagnosis of the problem, as well as steps to take to treat it.
Prerequisite(s):

Python and/or ML experience is helpful but not required.

title: Isaac PerceptorとAutowareを組み合わせたNova Carterの自動運転 [S73870]
abstract: Jetson AGX Orinが搭載された自律移動ロボット開発プラットフォームであるNova Carterとオールインワン自動運転オープンソースソフトウェアであるAutowareを組み合わせ、自動運転のデモンストレーションを行います。Nova Carterに搭載された多種多様なセンサーをIsaac PerceptorやCUDA、TensorRTなどを用いて処理し、Autowareで軌道計画、ロボットの制御を行うことで自動運転を実現します。聴衆の皆様は、Isaac Perceptorのインテグレーション方法やJetson AGX Orinを用いたAMRアプリケーションの開発手順について学ぶことができます。
date_time: Jetson AGX Orinを用いたAMRアプリケーションの開発手順

title: “I See Dead Pipelines...Without CI/CD:" The Gen AI Easy Button for Fine-Tuning, Evaluation, and Inference With NVIDIA NIMs and NeMo Microservices [DLIT71751]
abstract:
"Dead pipelines" — abandoned scripts that once ran parts of a workflow — plague LLM development, causing errors, delays, and wasted resources. Learn how to automate the entire LLM life cycle using CI/CD pipelines, Kubernetes, NVIDIA NIMs, and NeMo Microservices in a cloud-agnostic approach. Discover how to streamline development, fine-tuning, evaluation, and deployment of LLMs, ensuring seamless integration, validation, and deployment of updates.
In this hands-on course, you'll:
Design and build a cloud-agnostic LLMOps CI/CD pipeline on Kubernetes for scalable and flexible Gen AI app deployment.
Utilize Argo CD for declarative continuous delivery and Argo Workflows for managing complex LLM workflows.
Leverage NVIDIA NIMs and NeMo Microservices in the end-to-end LLMOps pipeline.
Learn how to improve development cycles, accuracy, and reliability with automated fine-tuning and continuous evaluation.
Prerequisite(s):

Kubernetes basic knowledge.
DevOps tools basic knowledge like ArgoCD.

title: It’s Easier than You Think – Debugging and Optimizing CUDA with Intelligent Developer Tools [S72527]
abstract: CUDA applications running on NVIDIA GPUs, such as Gen AI, are some of the top-performing workloads running today. Unlocking this performance doesn't require expert knowledge of the hardware as long as you have the right tools for the job. We'll start with a brief overview of the tools available for free, and then dive deep on the latest features that provide even more insights into application behavior and performance. These include new optimization recipes for cluster-scale GPU workloads, a timeline for key kernel performance metrics, and source comparison features to show exactly how and why source modifications impact performance. Additionally, debugging tools have added several improvements to make bug detection and correction easier. Learn how to unlock the performance potential of CUDA applications.

title: Jane Street: How an Early AI Adopter Thinks About Infrastructure (Presented by CoreWeave) [S74219]
abstract:
Adopting AI early isn’t just a competitive advantage — it’s a necessity for staying ahead in today’s fast-paced financial markets. Discover how Jane Street, a global leader in quantitative trading, leverages CoreWeave’s cutting-edge NVIDIA GPU infrastructure to train and fine-tune AI models with speed and precision. Gain insights into the strategic decisions that support their success, from scaling GPU capacity to ensuring flexibility, security, and performance in their AI workflows. Learn how the partnership between Jane Street and CoreWeave is setting a new standard for reliable and scalable AI infrastructure.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Jetson Platform Reinforcement Learning CMP Controller  [P73251]
abstract: We set up a Jetson platform-based digital-twin CMP (chemical-mechanical polishing) control system and used reinforcement learning to control the CMP process. This AI controller enables over 10% WIP (wafers in processing) in an advanced semiconductor fabrication plant.

title: Keep up With AI Innovation, From Models to Agents [S72810]
abstract: Join Jeff, head of product at Hugging Face, and discover the latest AI models and agents through the lens of the world's largest open model platform. Drawing from the usage of millions of AI builders, Jeff will dive into how companies are transitioning from basic model deployment to building sophisticated AI agents. He'll examine the key challenges teams face when taking AI to production, emerging architectural patterns, and what's driving adoption of agent-based approaches. Through practical examples, learn how organizations combine open foundation models with tools on enterprise infrastructure to build their own AI, from prototype to production.

title: Keep Your GPUs Going Brrr : Crushing Whitespace in Model Training [S73733]
abstract: Substantial progress has recently been made on the compute-intensive portions of model training, such as high-performing attention variants. While invaluable, this progress exposes previously hidden bottlenecks in model training, such as redundant copies during collectives and data loading time. We'll present recent improvements in PyTorch achieved through Meta/NVIDIA collaboration to tackle these newly exposed bottlenecks and how practitioners can leverage them.

title: Kernel Optimization for AI and Beyond: Unlocking the Power of Nsight Compute [DLIT71640]
abstract:
Learn how to unlock the full potential of NVIDIA GPUs with the powerful profiling and analysis capabilities of Nsight Compute. AI workloads are rapidly increasing the demand for GPU computing, and ensuring that they efficiently utilize all available GPU resources is essential. Nsight Compute is the most powerful tool for understanding kernel execution behavior and performance. Learn how to configure and launch profiles customized for your needs, including advice on profiling accelerated Python applications, AI frameworks like PyTorch, and optimizing Tensor Core utilization essential to modern AI performance. Learn how to debug your kernel and use the expert system built into Nsight Compute, known as “Guided Analysis,” that automatically detects common issues and directs you to the most relevant performance data all the way down to the source code level.
Prerequisite(s):

Familiarity with CUDA.

title: Key Design Patterns to Build Trustworthy Data Agents (Presented by Snowflake, Inc.)  [EXS74584]
abstract:
Data agents respond to complex queries and execute actions to get organizational work done. Building data agents that enterprises can trust comes with unique design challenges. These agents must work reliably with both structured data (via text-to-SQL) and unstructured data (via text search), requiring tool selection that goes beyond standard function calling. Successfully using a text-to-SQL tool depends on having a semantic understanding of the underlying data, while search tools require knowledge of what’s indexed and how best to query it. These challenges grow when multiple tools are involved, as their semantic models can be large, requiring careful selection and management. Off-the-shelf orchestration solutions often fall short in handling these complexities.

Explore key design patterns that help build trustworthy data agents, covering strategies for tool selection, semantic modeling, and system integration. These strategies enable our industry leading search and text-to-sql tools, and data agents that effectively orchestrate to get organizational work done.

title: KitLLM: Automated Code Generation LLM for Omniverse Kit Extension Development [P72560]
abstract: We introduce KitLLM, an automated code generation language model specifically designed for Omniverse Kit extension development. It aims to assist developers and designers in overcoming the challenges they face when using Omniverse. With the increasing demand for effective tools tailored to the Omniverse Kit platform, KitLLM delivers precise code generation support, enhancing both productivity and creativity.
