title: Knowledge Bridging: Building Compute-Efficient, Multilingual Frontier Models for Sovereign AI [S73857]
abstract: Pre-training a non-English-centric large language model from scratch can be far more efficient than traditional approaches might suggest. By leveraging the vast pool of English data — while carefully injecting a small, high-quality corpus from the target language — we trained state-of-the-art multilingual models without incurring massive computational overhead. We'll introduce the concept of Knowledge Bridging, where a model’s “world knowledge” is largely learned through English, and then “bridged” to the target language with comparatively modest, region-specific data. See how this approach contrasts with naïve pre-training recipes (e.g., equal-ratio or monolingual emphasis) and why continual pre-training on an existing open-source checkpoint underperforms. We'll also highlight best practices for tokenizer design and data mixture strategies. Our real-world experiments demonstrate that this method not only sustains high performance on English benchmarks, but also significantly boosts target-language proficiency — making it an ideal recipe for building sovereign AI solutions in regions like Korea, Japan, and beyond. We'll close with the business implications of delivering custom LLMs to enterprises requiring robust, region-specific artificial intelligence.

title: Knowledge Graph Construction and Reuse for Question-Answering and Automated Reporting [P73603]
abstract: We introduce a new solution for handling large-scale, frequently updated data by constructing dynamic knowledge graphs. Our approach groups related data into subgraphs, reducing overlap and redundancy while ensuring that users receive timely, accurate answers and updates in real time.

title: Knowledge Graph Construction and Reuse for Question-Answering and Automated Reporting [P73603]
abstract: We introduce a new solution for handling large-scale, frequently updated data by constructing dynamic knowledge graphs. Our approach groups related data into subgraphs, reducing overlap and redundancy while ensuring that users receive timely, accurate answers and updates in real time.

title: Kolmogorov AI Networks for Interpretable Financial Forecasting [S72542]
abstract:
We apply KANs (Kolmogorov Arnold Networks) to forecast the financial markets, such as volatility. 
KANs allow the practitioner to learn interpretable features from the data and leverage 
domain-specific knowledge into the neural network in order to improve forecasting power. This sets up
a strong foundation for either using model outputs directly or selectively leveraging outcomes to integrate into the investment process.

title: Korean AI Expert Day [Spoken in Korean, 한국어 진행]  [DD72551]
abstract:
The Korean AI Expert Day is an opportunity to meet Korean NVIDIA experts and connect with conference attendees from Korea. Exchange knowledge and industry trends and share GTC experiences. You can also network with Korean AI experts, creating international business or academic collaboration opportunities. Korean will be the predominant language spoken here.  


Korean AI Expert Day는 한국 NVIDIA 전문가들을 만나고 한국에서 온 컨퍼런스 참석자들과 교류할 수 있는 기회입니다. 이 자리에서 지식과 업계 동향을 공유하고, GTC에서의 경험을 나눌 수 있습니다. 또한, 국제 비즈니스 및 학술 협력 기회를 창출하는 한국 AI 전문가들과의 네트워킹도 가능합니다. 본 행사에서는 한국어가 주요 언어로 사용됩니다.

title: Laiye AI Foundry - NVIDIA AI Enterprise 在中国的最佳实践 [S72276]
abstract:
在生成式人工智能时代，企业正迎来前所未有的机遇与挑战。为了助力企业实现智能化转型，Laiye AI Foundry 应运而生。它是一个专为企业场景应用打造的大模型定制化平台，致力于构建一个自主可控的人工智能生态系统。通过保障企业的数据主权，Laiye AI Foundry 为企业提供了坚实的数据基础，驱动企业迈向智能化的未来。
利用 NVIDIA AI Enterprise 组件，如 NVIDIA NeMo Framework，Laiye AI Foundry 构建了一个持续改进和优化的“数据和模型飞轮”。这一机制确保了企业大模型的性能和效果能够随着时间的推移而不断提升，通过不断的学习和适应，模型能够更好地服务于企业的具体需求。基于 NVAIE BCME 的集群管理系统，提供私有化集群部署服务保障了 GPU 集群稳定高效和稳定的运行。
此外 Laiye AI Foundry 基于 NVIDIA AI Blueprints，融合了 NVAIE 组件中的 NVIDIA NIM、NeMo-Microservices 等微服务，打造了全面的大模型企业服务， 提供了强大的模型构建和部署能力，确保了服务的灵活性和可扩展性，以满足不同企业在智能化转型过程中的多样化需求。

title: Large Dataset Provisioning With NVMe HDDs for GPU Direct Consumption (Presented by Seagate Technology) [S74562]
abstract: SAS and SATA drive interfaces require host bus adapters to feed CPUs and GPUs with data. Although it's undergone refinement over the decades, this interface doesn't offer direct memory placement, as with NVMe. Switching the disk drive interface to NVMe reduces the complexity and hardware required to deploy tiered storage, while also enabling NVMeoF and GPU direct consumption. See how a DPU is able to perform both NVMeoF encapsulation and data lake services from the AIStore project.

title: Leading Locally: State and Municipal Policymakers Driving AI Workforce Transformation [SE74556]
abstract: As AI transforms industries and redefines the future of work, state and local leaders are forging innovative partnerships to unlock its potential. This panel features policymakers who've collaborated with NVIDIA to drive workforce development, empower communities, and create pathways to economic growth. From integrating AI into education and public services to fostering inclusive, tech-enabled ecosystems, these trailblazing agreements are shaping a future of opportunity. Join us to explore how strategic alliances are advancing ethical AI, lifelong learning, and sustainable progress, building a stronger, more equitable workforce for tomorrow.

title: Learn how Gen AI Image Pipelines are Shaping up in Various industries With Hands-on Workflows [DLIT71866]
abstract:
Generating and understanding images are the two core areas of image-based workflows. We'll cover how the media & entertainment, retail/fashion, and healthcare industries are leveraging diffusion and transformer models together for Gen AI workflows. We'll emphasize emerging use cases while addressing how conventional computer vision pipelines are impacted by Gen AI, and its consequences. NIMs, ComfyUI, and TensorRT are the core components to demonstrate these workflows.
Prerequisite(s):

Awareness of general computer vision pipelines.
Basic understanding of deep learning and Python programming.

title: Learning a Language of Stains: Tokenization Facilitates Interpretable Multiplex Immunofluorescence and Histology Image Synthesis [P73573]
abstract: We show that augmenting masked image modeling with discrete representation learning improves biomarker imputation in multiplex tissue images. These discrete representations also enhance model interpretability by separating the tasks of image representation from channel imputation, and improve data interpretability by removing batch effects and staining artifacts.

title: Learn OpenUSD: Foundations to Applied Concepts [DLIT74499]
abstract:
Join our drop-in lab to develop your OpenUSD expertise, supported by on-site experts and guided by our OpenUSD AI tutor. This self-paced experience covers foundational terminology to best practices.
Beginners and experienced developers will gain practical skills through hands-on exercises covering OpenUSD vocabulary, schemas, composition arcs, asset structures, data exchange, and asset modularity.
Discover the power of NVIDIA NIM microservices for real-time guidance, or tap into the expertise of our OpenUSD specialists for in-depth knowledge. By the end of this lab, you’ll be ready to enhance your OpenUSD development and streamline workflows across industries.
Prerequisite(s):

An understanding of fundamental programming concepts in Python 3 such as functions, loops, dictionaries and arrays and Python 3 related libraries.

title: Learn OpenUSD: Robotics Best Practices [DLIT71288]
abstract:
In this course, we will be expanding on the concepts of assets from our previous Learn OpenUSD courses and applying them within the domain of robotics. We’ll learn about the benefits of a robot asset structure in OpenUSD and learn best practices by studying the asset structure utilized by the URDF Importer in Isaac Sim. We will gain insights on various optimizations that can be performed on a robot asset and experiment with the different techniques like mesh merging and instancing. Lastly, we will assemble the robot asset and an environment to construct a robot training scene.
Prerequisite(s):

An understanding of fundamental programming concepts in Python 3 such as functions, loops, dictionaries and arrays and Python 3 related libraries.

title: Learn to Build Agentic AI Workflows for Enterprise Applications [DLIT74032]
abstract:
Using NVIDIA technologies, you will build configurable tools and workflows for agentic AI. Learn to deploy an agentic AI workflow, create tools for an AI agent, and quickly augment existing workflows with new tools. With these workflows and tools, you'll increase productivity when dealing with multiple enterprise data sources.
Prerequisite(s):

Python programming, RAG, agentic frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, etc.).

title: Less is More: Data Filtering for Efficient Adversarial Training [P72983]
abstract: Adversarial training has been one of the most effective strategies to defend against adversarial attacks. However, most existing adversarial training methods have shown a trade-off between training cost and robustness. This work explores a new optimization direction from training data to reduce the computational cost of adversarial training without scarifying robustness.

title: Lessons in Deploying a Global Banking-Ready AI Platform (Presented by AHEAD) [EXS74642]
abstract: Learn about the design process and considerations that Bank of New York (BNY) and AHEAD are following for expanding from a centralized SuperPOD architecture for training, development, and initial inference applications to a distributed cluster on B200 to increase multi-site resiliency and meet production service-level agreements for critical use cases. This includes specific architectural considerations for cluster and network design. We'll also explain how BNY intends to leverage both environments to enhance their enterprise-readiness and shared services experience for their AI platform use across the organization.

title: Lessons in Deploying a Global Banking-Ready AI Platform (Presented by AHEAD) [EXS74642]

title: Lessons Learned From Building an Enterprise RAG App at Scale: A Deep Look (Presented by Cohesity) [S74268]
abstract: Bringing data to AI models can have its challenges, so as you're developing retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) AI applications at scale it’s important to understand some of the most common ones. Learn how Cohesity built RAG services on petabytes of unstructured data across multiple data sources. Get a deep look at the lessons we learned on topics such as data search, information retrieval, and answer generation, as well as scalability and security considerations.

title: Level Up Retail Store Security and Customer Insights with Video Analytics AI Agents [S71858]
abstract:
Learn how AI Agents are deployed using Infosys Video Analytics platform, transforming retail security and deeply understanding customer behaviour to improve loyalty retention, satisfaction, and safety. Using store security feeds, the joint solution can continuously analyse both customer and staff behaviour, detecting anomalous actions, potential vandalism, and potential security concerns in real time. 

We’ll show how our solution, which uses NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization, creates in-depth insights into customer traffic patterns, interactions with product displays, and drill times in key store areas. With a query-based interface, staff can retrieve detailed reports on past incidents and track shopping trends over time, all while maintaining privacy compliance. 
This comprehensive application of AI Agents will drive a safer, smarter shopping environment, prevents losses from thefts, and enables retailers to optimize store layout and marketing strategies based on actionable insights.

title: Level Up Your LLM Training: Resilient Training With NeMo [S72416]
abstract: Large-scale training of language models is crucial for state-of-the-art AI applications, but it's a complex process fraught with challenges. We'll demonstrate how NeMo Framework's robust resiliency features can help you overcome obstacles like network issues, slow GPUs, checkpointing bottlenecks, and data corruption. We'll show how to leverage the robust resiliency features of NVIDIA's NeMo Framework to enhance your LLM training workflows on leading cloud platforms. You'll learn practical strategies to overcome common hurdles and optimize your large-scale AI training operations for improved reliability and efficiency.

title: Leverage Computer Vision for High-Fidelity Scene Detection and Actionable Insights  [S74576]
abstract: In this session, Relo Metrics will share how their computer-vision models leverage NVIDIA NV-CLIP NIMS (a multi-modal embeddings model for image and text). These models are used to run placement analysis across various rights holders and sports. But Relo Metrics takes it a step further and runs logo detection for brand measurement and impact — key return-on-investment measures important to brands, agencies, and rights holders. Relo Metrics will also demo the next evolution of agentic AI use cases for the company, exploring video summarization, AI agents, and machine learning intelligence.

title: Leverage Computer Vision for High-Fidelity Scene Detection and Actionable Insights  [S74576]
abstract: In this session, Relo Metrics will share how their computer-vision models leverage NVIDIA NV-CLIP NIMS (a multi-modal embeddings model for image and text). title: Leverage Diffusion Models to Generate Photorealistic Facial Skin Data, Diverse by Skin Complexion and Skin Concerns [P73542]
abstract: Diffusion models have shown remarkable progress in image generation, but accurately capturing the nuances of human skin remains a challenge. This study investigates the potential of fine-tuned diffusion models for generating high-fidelity facial skin images. We curate a specialized dataset of real-world-resolution facial images with diverse skin tones, ethnicity, age, and conditions (e.g., pigmentation, blemishes, redness) and employ it to fine-tune a pre-trained stable diffusion model. Our results demonstrate significant improvement in realism and diversity compared to the baseline model, particularly in the depiction of wrinkles, texture, and blemishes. This technology holds great potential to advance dermatology, leading to more personalized and effective skincare for all.

title: Leverage Large Language Models to Transform the Software Development Process [P72731]
abstract: Explore the potential of LLMs applied to the software development process for productivity improvement. Learn how to integrate LLMs with domain knowledge and AI agentic workflow in real-world scenarios, such as test case generation from large-scale specifications.

title: Leverage Small Language Models for Your Digital Human Applications  [CWE73329]
abstract:
Learn the best practices for leveraging small language models for your digital human application. We'll dive deep into the art of small language model selection for your use case, how to configure model parameters, and how to deploy the models and applications leveraging NVIDIA tools.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Leverage Tailored LLMs for Improved Insights in Rail Transportation [S71296]
abstract: We'll share our experience and insights from our ongoing generative AI use cases including chatbots, retrieval-augmented generators, and code generators. We leverage our on-premises NVIDIA cluster to train and deliver fine-tuned LLMS to solve and assist users with problems that require highly domain-specific knowledge.

title: Leveraging AI for Digital Biology: BioNeMo, Parabricks, and NVIDIA NIMs and Agent Blueprints [CWE71519]
abstract:
Join NVIDIA experts to explore the field of digital biology. Discuss the latest advancements in accelerated computing and foundation models for drug discovery and genomics — from bioinformatics tooling to protein structure prediction, molecular dynamics to molecular generation, and much more. Learn how NVIDIA BioNeMo and Parabricks, together with NVIDIA NIM and Blueprints, empower developers, researchers, and enterprises to quickly create generative AI solutions across chemistry, biology, and genomics. Engage directly with our product managers, developer relations, and solution architects in discussions that address your challenges and seek answers to your questions.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Leveraging AI for Digital Biology: BioNeMo, Parabricks, and NVIDIA NIMs and Agent Blueprints [CWE71519]
abstract:
Join NVIDIA experts to explore the field of digital biology. Discuss the latest advancements in accelerated computing and foundation models for drug discovery and genomics — from bioinformatics tooling to protein structure prediction, molecular dynamics to molecular generation, and much more. Learn how NVIDIA BioNeMo and Parabricks, together with NVIDIA NIM and Blueprints, empower developers, researchers, and enterprises to quickly create generative AI solutions across chemistry, biology, and genomics. Engage directly with our product managers, developer relations, and solution architects in discussions that address your challenges and seek answers to your questions.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Leveraging Large Model-Based Embodied Intelligence to Enhance Financial Service Robots [S71267]
abstract: Multimodal large models-based embodied intelligence, which integrates cognitive and reasoning abilities with interaction in the physical world, allows agents to perceive, plan, and act in real world. In the financial services industry, where human interaction and data management are critical, embodied intelligence offers new opportunities and challenges. We have exploited multimodal model-based embodied intelligence to enhance branch service robots in the financial industry and optimize the assessment of insurance claims. These implementations were powered by training multimodal models on NVIDIA data center GPUs. With the NeMo, we achieved an acceleration of 20-25% in model training. ISAAC and Omniverse tools enabled us to perform virtual environment simulations and modeling, while TensorRT provided inference acceleration for deployment on Jetson platforms. Our practices have been employed in the financial industry, improving customer Net Promoter Scores and reducing operational costs by approximately 10%.

title: Leveraging NIM and GPU Acceleration to Transform Chip Design with AI [S72227]
abstract: AI-driven techniques are tackling the escalating complexity of design and PPA demands, optimizing specific workloads, and uncovering new insights in the design process. At Hot Chips 2024, Synopsys and NVIDIA showcased the transformative impact of AI-assisted design, utilizing generative AI to accelerate semiconductor development. This GTC talk will explore innovations in AI-assisted design techniques, generative AI, domain-adapted LLMs, and NIM for on-prem chip design. It will also delve into how accelerated computing is advancing chip design verification and semiconductor manufacturing. Synopsys' optical proximity correction software, powered by NVIDIA's cuLitho library, leverages GPU’s parallel processing for enhanced precision and efficiency. NVIDIA's Grace-Hopper architecture further boosts SPICE simulation performance by 2X, reducing turnaround times while maintaining accuracy.

title: Leveraging NIM and GPU Acceleration to Transform Chip Design with AI [S72227]

title: Lighting the Future: GPU Drives Breakthroughs in Photonic Simulations [P73435]
abstract: The rise of high performance computing GPUs, initially driven by AI, has also revolutionized numerical simulations in photonics, particularly in solving Maxwell’s equations. This report focuses on how NVIDIA GPUs enable faster, more efficient simulations using the finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) method for optics and photonics. These advancements have dramatically reduced the time required for complex device design and optimization, making large-scale simulations feasible. The hardware improvements have opened new horizons for photonics research and product development.

title: Liquid Cooling Impact to Backend Network Design (Presented by Credo) [S74627]
abstract: The migration to liquid cooling dramatically reduces interconnect lengths in AI/ML backend networks, enabling a rethinking of optical versus copper interconnect and the resulting cost/power/reliability trade-offs. Data center, rack elevation, and interconnect co-design is key to take advantage of this opportunity to save $1,000 and over 15 watts per GPU, and increase network reliability by 10X or more.

title: Live at NVIDIA GTC With Acquired [SE75924]
abstract: Be sure to catch the Live at NVIDIA GTC With Acquired broadcast lead-up to the keynote kickoff, featuring the Acquired podcast hosts Ben Gilbert and David Rosenthal, special guests, and content you won’t see anywhere else.

title: LLM 2-bit 后量化的加速与部署实践 [S72647]
abstract: 我们深入研究了用于 LLM 的高精度 2-bit 权重压缩。将模型参数解耦为整数和浮点部分，并通过对权重和 scale/zp 的交替迭代进行优化，求解局部极小值，最终在 Llama-1/2 7B~70B 的 2-bit 后量化上实现了 sota 精度。此外，我们还探索利用 2-bit 内存访问优势的新技术，并基于 TensorRT-LLM 中的 w4a16 Gemm 运算符开发 Gemm CUDA 内核，该内核可以高效加速 w2a16 模型的推理，并在 NVIDIA GPU 上实现 1.4 倍至 1.7 倍的加速。

title: LLM 2-bit 后量化的加速与部署实践 [S72647]
abstract: 我们深入研究了用于 LLM 的高精度 2-bit 权重压缩。将模型参数解耦为整数和浮点部分，并通过对权重和 scale/zp 的交替迭代进行优化，求解局部极小值，最终在 Llama-1/2 7B~70B 的 2-bit 后量化上实现了 sota 精度。此外，我们还探索利用 2-bit 内存访问优势的新技术，并基于 TensorRT-LLM 中的 w4a16 Gemm 运算符开发 Gemm CUDA 内核，该内核可以高效加速 w2a16 模型的推理，并在 NVIDIA GPU 上实现 1.4 倍至 1.7 倍的加速。

title: LLM Inference Performance and Optimization on NVIDIA GB200 NVL72 [S72503]
abstract:
In this session, we will dive into the GB200 NVL72 architecture and programming model, highlighting its inference performance on state-of-the-art LLM models.

We will also explore optimizations techniques that enable the 72 Blackwell GPUs to work together through the NVIDIA NVLINK, functioning as one giant GPU.

title: LLM Pruning and Distillation in Practice: The Minitron Approach [S71779]
abstract: We'll ive deep into the Minitron approach for producing compact language models via structured pruning and knowledge distillation. We'll describe how we apply this approach to compress LLMs in the Nemotron-4, Llama 3.1, and Mistral-NeMo families by 2-4X, achieving state-of-the-art accuracy while using orders of magnitude fewer training tokens compared to training from scratch.

title: LLM Pruning and Distillation in Practice: The Minitron Approach [S71779]
abstract: We'll ive deep into the Minitron approach for producing compact language models via structured pruning and knowledge distillation. We'll describe how we apply this approach to compress LLMs in the Nemotron-4, Llama 3.1, and Mistral-NeMo families by 2-4X, achieving state-of-the-art accuracy while using orders of magnitude fewer training tokens compared to training from scratch.

title: LongSpeak: A Long-Form Speech Large Language Model [P72718]
abstract:
Current open-source speech-augmented large language models (SpeechLLMs) are optimized for short audio segments, limiting their applicability for common enterprise and real-world use cases such as medical consultations, meetings, legal proceedings, and lectures. Without this capability, developers have to confront issues including degradation in model performance, compounding errors, and loss of information associated with multi-step cascaded processes. 

We present LongSpeak, a model designed for long-form (multi-hour) audio transcription, understanding, and summarization. LongSpeak utilizes specialized convolutional projectors to compress and project local and global audio representations into LLaMA's token embedding space. LongSpeak matches the performance of existing models on short audio and outperforms state-of-the-art cascaded methods on tasks with long-form conversations. The model and training code will be made available through the Nemo codebase.

title: Low-Latency Numerical Computing With MatX [DLIT71426]
abstract:
This lab will introduce MatX and demonstrate how to accelerate latency-sensitive workflows with its easy-to-use C++ template library for numerical computing. MatX's powerful Tensor language enables rapid prototyping and a seamless transition to production. Using this library, we'll demonstrate a powerful set of well optimized transforms and operations and walk users through optimizing their pipelines to speed of light performance. We'll then use our environment's profiling tools to measure and ensure compliance with critical performance budgets. From this solid foundation, we'll build a real-world workflow, showing how MatX's simple syntax can still provide outstanding acceleration. Finally, we'll use MatX's extensible operators to develop our own custom operator, seamlessly extending MatX for our own unique function.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic understanding of C++ and the ability to work with the command line.

title: Low-Precision Inference in vLLM [S72114]
abstract:
vLLM, now the de facto standard for open-source LLM serving, plays a pivotal role in driving the widespread adoption of open-weight LLMs. As enterprises and the broader community seek to reduce deployment costs and maximize inference performance, optimizing model execution time becomes essential. We'll explore how vLLM achieves significant performance gains, focusing on the quantized linear layers that deliver dramatically faster inference.

We'll deep dive into the implementation and performance of vLLM's quantized linear layers, explaining how they enable both compute speedup and memory compression. We'll examine the computational regimes where different quantization strategies excel and relate that to different real-world LLM inference server workloads. Finally, we'll look at some of the advanced optimizations in vLLM’s mixed-input Machete kernels, implemented via NVIDIA CUTLASS, and discuss how these innovations pave the way for high-performance LLM serving.

title: Machine Learning-Assisted Physical Layer Processing in 5G NR [P74454]
abstract: We present an overview of ongoing research on machine learning in wireless communications with practical validation on a real-world 5G system that's based on the NVIDIA AI Aerial platform.

title: Make It Easy with Nutanix GenAI Inference (Presented by Nutanix) [EXS74247]
abstract: As your business attempts to pivot and adopt generative AI (Gen AI), ask yourself: are you ready? Explore the integration of NVIDIA AI Enterprise with NIM inside Nutanix Enterprise AI (NAI) as a microservice platform powerhouse to easily deploy, monitor, and adapt Gen AI anywhere under your control, on-premises to the public cloud. Allow traditional IT personnel to become AI resources quickly, making it simple to manage, easy to secure, and predictable to budget without per-API or per-token costs.

title: Make My PyTorch Model Fast, and Show Me How You Did It [S73041]
abstract:
PyTorch is popular in deep learning and LLMs for richness and ease of expressions. To make the most of compute resources, PyTorch models benefit from nontrivial optimizations, but this means losing some of their ease and understandability.

Learn how with Thunder, a PyTorch-to-Python compiler focused on usability, understandability, and extensibility, you can optimize and transform (i.e., distribute across many machines) models while
•	leaving the PyTorch code unchanged
•	targeting a variety of models without needing to adapt to each of them
•	understanding each transformation step because the results are presented as simple Python code
•	accessing powerful extension code for your own optimizations with just one or a few lines of code

We'll show how the combination of Thunder transforms and the NVIDIA stack (NVFuser, cuDNN, Apex) delivers optimized performance in training and inference on a variety of models.

title: Make Retrieval Better: Fine-Tuning an Embedding Model for Domain-Specific RAG [DLIT71238]
abstract:
LLMs power AI applications like conversational chatbots and content generators, but are constrained by their training data. This might lead to hallucinations in content generation, which requires up-to-date or domain-specific information. Retrieval augmented generation (RAG) addresses this issue by enabling LLMs to access external context without modifying model parameters. Embedding or dense retrieval models are a key component of a RAG pipeline for retrieving relevant context to the LLM. However, an embedding model’s effectiveness to capture the unique characteristics of the custom data hinges on the quality and domain relevance of its training data. Fine-tuning embedding models is gaining interest to provide more accurate and relevant responses tailored to users’ specific domain.
In this lab, you'll learn to generate a synthetic dataset with question-context pairs from a domain-specific corpus, and process the data for fine-tuning. Then, fine-tune a text embedding model using synthetic data and evaluate it.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic knowledge of LLMs, TensorFlow/Pytorch and Python programming is required.
Intermediate-level understanding of ML/DL and NLP pipelines.

title: Making Physical AI a Reality Through Real-Time Edge Computing [S73298]
abstract:
The world's largest industries are poised to embrace physical AI. The challenge comes with necessity to understand multimodally in real time. The entire sensor AI processing needs to be accelerated. Developers now can tackle edge AI challenges by seamlessly integrating sensor data, accelerated computing, real-time visualization/actuation, and AI inferencing — all while it abstracts away complexities for developers and reduces time-to-market. 
 
We'll feature cross-industry use cases including medical surgical robotics, brain-computer interface, semiconductor defect detection, and high-bandwidth sensor processing at scientific computing to demonstrate real-world physical AI applications. Cross-industry use cases will demonstrate real-world physical AI applications and sensor processing problems from model training and simulation to edge computing.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

Cross-industry use cases will demonstrate real-world physical AI applications and sensor processing problems from model training and simulation to edge computing.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Mangrove Simulation Predicts Carbon Sequestration Solutions [P73549]
abstract: New solutions using artificial intelligence to enhance blue carbon focus on optimizing the carbon sequestration processes in coastal mangrove ecosystems while accurately predicting their carbon storage capacity.

title: Manifesting Physical AI in Industrial Applications (Presented by Hitachi Digital) [S74264]
abstract:
The pace of industrial transformation is faster than ever, driven by the adoption of AI, IoT, and robotics. Hitachi is collaborating with NVIDIA on industrial and physical AI solutions – such as for energy grid network optimization, predictive maintenance for trains, quality inspection in manufacturing, and more. In combination with AI factories, we are deploying Accelerated Computing in edge systems, ushering in an era of Infrastructure-as-a-Robot, where entire infrastructure systems can operate autonomously. 

In this session, we will share Hitachi's approach to engineering outcomes. You will learn: 

·                 How to pinpoint and address specific, tangible problems with AI 

·                 How to choose the right data and AI models for each unique use case 

·                 The critical role of data infrastructure and storage systems 

Additionally, you will learn about Hitachi iQ, a comprehensive AI solution accelerated by NVIDIA technologies with advanced compute power and deep industry expertise, enabling businesses to make data-driven decisions, optimize operations, and achieve greater efficiency and innovation.

title: Manufacturing for AI and AI for Manufacturing (Presented by Inventec) [S74307]
abstract: We'll share our journey with NVIDIA products in building AI servers and developing AI-driven solutions tailored for smart manufacturing. Drawing on real-world experience, we’ll explore challenges such as overcoming structural hurdles in server design and deploying AI effectively within manufacturing environments. We'll discuss strategies to minimize reliance on large-scale training labels through training-free techniques and NVIDIA Omniverse to accelerate AI deployment. Additionally, we’ll cover methods for deploying AI across diverse, dynamic environments while addressing operational efficiency and security requirements. Finally, we’ll showcase how AI supports manufacturing automation, driving smarter and more efficient processes. This blend of technical insights and practical lessons will empower and inform your AI initiatives.

title: Mass Capacity Storage: Storing Infinite Potential in the AI Era (Presented by Seagate Technology) [EXS74552]
abstract:
With the exponential growth of computing power, more resources have become available for applications requiring complex calculations. Developers have better access to the same robust computing ability thanks to the cloud, while open-source platforms and technologies greatly accelerate application development. This potentially life-changing level of innovation and revolutionary technology will lead to more and better AI models and, in turn, more reliable applications. These pivotal innovations will exist on a foundation of data storage.  

After all, data centers uphold data. Data upholds Al. Al upholds our next era. As always, Seagate remains focused on storage innovation. We empower operators with new technological capabilities, applications, and industry categories through products that maximize scale and optimize total cost of ownership. At this inflection point, partnering with customers and the Al ecosystem is crucial, and we’re poised to capture exciting opportunities.

title: Mass Personalization at Scale: Activating the Snickers Brand World Through Gen AI [S71571]
abstract:
Mars is innovating how it builds iconic brand worlds and experiences that engage, inspire and convert consumers, through data driven relationships with no dead ends, which enable personalization at scale and co-creation with fans.  

In the summer of 2024, Mars' Snickers brand partnered with the legendary soccer coach Jose Mourinho, with the aim of delivering a personalized Snickers experience to every soccer fan during Euro 2024.  The response to the brief to their partners at T&Pm took a team of combined talents and disciplines, to design a compelling consumer proposition, backed by an innovative technical solution, and robust safety layers.  

We will share some of the key organizational lessons learned as they worked to deliver such an ambitious campaign. Responsibility was paramount, and we'll share how we did a mass participative activation with zero harmful interactions.  See how we created a generative AI engine for Mars, Inc. that redefines personalized storytelling and brand building. Using custom language models, we crafted on-brand, funny scripts, then paired them with voice and video tech to generate unique content for each consumer. Finally, we'll discuss how this approach will shape consumer packaged goods marketing in the future, as we apply personalized storytelling to new markets and brands — demonstrating the power of innovation through generative AI.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Master AI Workload Optimization: Insights From Real-World Implementations (Presented by GMI Cloud)  [EXS74328]
abstract: Yujing Qian, vice president of engineering at GMI Cloud, will present a real-world case study showing how NVIDIA Kubernetes technologies helped a client reduce training times, scale models, and achieve measurable return on investment. By addressing infrastructure inefficiencies and employing innovative strategies, the client achieved significant performance and cost improvements.

title: Mastering NVIDIA Nsight: GPU Performance Analysis for Ray Tracing Applications [DLIT72423]
abstract:
Learn how to use NVIDIA Nsight Graphics to profile and optimize both graphics and compute workloads, focusing on ray tracing applications. You’ll analyze GPU performance through trace data from CUDA, DirectX, and Vulkan, identifying bottlenecks at the source-code and GPU assembly levels. By mastering tools like Flame Graphs and the “top-level triage” workflow, you’ll gain the skills needed to optimize and debug shaders and compute code for maximum efficiency.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic understanding of GPU programming (CUDA, Direct3D, or Vulkan).
Experience with 3D graphics.
Familiarity with GPU architecture and profiling/debugging tools.

title: Maximize AI Potential on Arm Neoverse Cores With NVIDIA’s Grace Hopper, Grace Blackwell, and Grace CPU Superchips (Presented by Arm) [S74288]
abstract: Join us for an in-depth technical presentation on the NVIDIA software stack for AI applications running on Arm-based CPUs, specifically focusing on the powerful NVIDIA’s Grace Hopper, Grace Blackwell, and Grace CPU Superchip architectures. We'll  cover a range of use cases, including retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) for large language models (LLMs), enabling chatbots, and implementing voice transcription. We'll also explore how the NVIDIA software stack, including tools, libraries, and frameworks, optimizes AI workloads on these advanced Arm-based platforms. Gain insights into the architecture and capabilities of NVIDIA’s Grace Hopper, Grace Blackwell, and Grace CPU Superchips, and learn best practices for leveraging these technologies to enhance performance and efficiency in applications. Whether you're developing AI solutions for cloud, edge, or data center environments, this presentation provides valuable knowledge and practical tips to help you succeed.

title: Maximize AI Potential on Arm Neoverse Cores With NVIDIA’s Grace Hopper, Grace Blackwell, and Grace CPU Superchips (Presented by Arm) [S74288]

title: Maximize AI Potential: Unlock Idle GPU Compute and Collaborate Smarter with Z by HP (Presented by HP) [S74464]
abstract: Reasoning Models have changed the AI landscape by delivering improved performance in real world tasks. As organizations rush to capitalize on open source models such as DeepSeek, infrastructure costs and GPU accessibility remain critical bottlenecks. This session discusses what reasoning models are and demonstrates how Z by HP Boost complements DeepSeek's innovation through intelligent GPU resource sharing. Join us to see how this powerful combination is making advanced on-prem AI capabilities more accessible and economically viable for companies of all sizes.

title: Maximize AI Training With NVIDIA AI Platform and Accelerated Solutions (Presented by PNY Technologies) [S74294]
abstract: Explore the use of the NVIDIA AI Platform and accelerated solutions powering AI training and customization, from the NVIDIA RTX 6000 Ada Generation and NVIDIA A800 40GB Active that support AI workloads. Discover the unparalleled performance, scalability, and innovations that enable faster processing, enhanced rendering, and AI-optimized operations across demanding industries. Gain insights into real-world applications and the transformative impact of NVIDIA's accelerated solutions.

title: Maximize Contact Center Efficiency With NVIDIA AI: Boost First-Call Resolution and Cut Handle Time [S71402]
abstract: Explore how Wipro Healthcare Process Solutions (WHPS) is leveraging NVIDIA’s AI technology to transform its contact center operations. We'll show how implementing AI-driven solutions increased first-call resolution from 84% to 92% and reduced average handle time by 20%. By using NVIDIA NeMo and Riva, WHPS has deployed an AI agent-assist system that supports human agents, achieving an initial 10% reduction in live agents, and is now transitioning to a fully AI-powered virtual assistant. Gain insights into the deployment process and the strategic benefits of using NVIDIA technology in customer service operations.

title: Maximize Contact Center Efficiency With NVIDIA AI: Boost First-Call Resolution and Cut Handle Time [S71402]
abstract: Explore how Wipro Healthcare Process Solutions (WHPS) is leveraging NVIDIA’s AI technology to transform its contact center operations. We'll show how implementing AI-driven solutions increased first-call resolution from 84% to 92% and reduced average handle time by 20%. By using NVIDIA NeMo and Riva, WHPS has deployed an AI agent-assist system that supports human agents, achieving an initial 10% reduction in live agents, and is now transitioning to a fully AI-powered virtual assistant. Gain insights into the deployment process and the strategic benefits of using NVIDIA technology in customer service operations.

title: Maximize GPU Utilization With Dynamic GPU Allocation (Presented by Ori Industries) [EXS74203]
abstract: Discover how dynamic GPU allocation drives efficient infrastructure utilization, optimizing use of resources from training to inference. Learn some practical strategies to maximize GPU utilization, enabling faster innovation and smarter infrastructure management.

title: Maximize the Performance, Efficiency, and Agility of Your AI Workforce and Budgets (Presented by Lenovo) [S74349]
abstract:
With rapid advancements in AI development — across hardware, software, and tools — how can you successfully navigate this shifting landscape? Maximizing the efficiency of your AI investments, boosting the performance and agility of your data science teams, and delivering measurable return on investment (ROI) are all critical for sustainable growth. Understanding not only how to get started, but also where to deploy and scale for maximum impact, will be a top priority for businesses ready to move beyond proof of concept and into true AI-driven results.

In this session, industry experts from Lenovo will explore how a new wave of end-to-end AI solutions, powered by NVIDIA AI, can transform your organization. Learn how to reduce time-to-insight, maximize time-to-value, and support your corporate growth and sustainability goals — ultimately turning AI from a proof of concept into a key driver of tangible ROI.

title: Maximize Your AI Performance and Scale With Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (Presented by Oracle) [S74280]
abstract: Some of the most advanced AI workloads are running on Oracle Cloud's AI Infrastructure, designed to provide the highest performance, sovereignty controls, and best value in the cloud. Whether you need small-scale AI inferencing or massive scale AI training, OCI has options, including clusters with up to 131,072 NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs. Learn about OCI's breadth of capabilities, including data center enhancements around power, cooling, networking, and more, that help Oracle bring you more efficient AI solutions and infrastructure than ever before. And then see examples of what you can do with all this power.

title: Maximize Your AI Performance and Scale With Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (Presented by Oracle) [S74280]
abstract: Some of the most advanced AI workloads are running on Oracle Cloud's AI Infrastructure, designed to provide the highest performance, sovereignty controls, and best value in the cloud. Whether you need small-scale AI inferencing or massive scale AI training, OCI has options, including clusters with up to 131,072 NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs. Learn about OCI's breadth of capabilities, including data center enhancements around power, cooling, networking, and more, that help Oracle bring you more efficient AI solutions and infrastructure than ever before. And then see examples of what you can do with all this power.

title: Maximizing Embedding and Retrieval Efficiency on Nasdaq’s Generative AI Platform with NVIDIA AI [S73129]
abstract: From Hackathon to Production: Discover how Nasdaq's Gen AI platform, an enterprise-grade solution that enables organizations to build and deploy AI applications through customizable skill, agentic flows and model access, leverages NVIDIA AI Enterprise to maximize the efficiency of embeddings and vector stores. This session will highlight the integration of cutting-edge tools like NVIDIA NeMo Retriever and NIM microservices deployed to Kubernetes with NVIDIA’s GPU Operator across L40s cloud infrastructure. Learn how these advancements deliver a significant increase in retrieval and embedding accuracy, improve performance, and reduce costs compared to alternatives. Gain insights into the benefits of flexible, up-to-date models and the partnership driving innovation in AI workflows.

title: Maximizing GPU Utilization: The Key to Accelerating AI Productivity (Presented by Ori Industries) [S74204]
abstract: Understand the financial and operational impact of inefficient GPU usage and explore practical strategies to optimize GPU performance. Using real-world examples, we’ll discuss scalability challenges and how dynamic GPU allocation can improve infrastructure efficiency and reduce costs.

title: MedTech: From Medical Imaging to Digital Surgery [CWE71530]
abstract:
Real-time edge AI and robotic systems are transforming medical workflows and creating revolutionary devices that are advancing the standard of care for disease detection, diagnosis, and interventions. NVIDIA's platforms — MONAI, Holoscan, Isaac, Omniverse, and Metropolis — span model training, digital twins/simulations, and runtime deployment. Together, they provide developers with an end-to-end, accelerated, full-stack infrastructure, enabling rapid prototyping and scalable development of real-time AI applications. Learn from NVIDIA experts how our platforms can save you time and money in bringing AI-enabled systems to market, from smart diagnostic devices and innovative imaging systems to surgical robots trained using digital twin technologies.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Meet the Experts From Deep Learning Framework Teams [CWE73312]
abstract:
Dive deep into how to use and contribute deep learning frameworks, such as PyTorch, Jax, TensorFlow,  DGL and PyTorch Geometrics. We have all engineer leads in different deep learning frameworks to enable you best use of these frameworks for your projects.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Meet Training Experts & Explore Self-Paced Learning [DLISP74697]
abstract:
Maximize your GTC experience and unlock up to $90 in free training! Visit the technical training area on the lower level of the conference center to explore how NVIDIA can help you and your team level up your AI and accelerated computing skills with hands-on technical training.
Stop by to connect with training experts, engage with instructors, and choose your free self-paced course. Laptops are available to enhance your learning experience, with courses designed to prepare you for NVIDIA’s Gen AI and data science certifications, including:

Accelerated Computing
Fundamentals of Accelerated Computing with CUDA Python
Fundamentals of Accelerated Computing with OpenACC
Data Science
Accelerating End-to-End Data Science Workflows*
Exploring Adversarial Machine Learning
Deep Learning
Building Real-Time Video AI Applications
Getting Started with Deep Learning*
Gen AI
Building LLM Applications with Prompt Engineering*
Building RAG Agents with LLMs
Generative AI with Diffusion Models*
Introduction to Deploying RAG Pipelines for Production at Scale
Rapid Application Development with Large Language Models*
Sizing LLM Inference Systems
* Recommended training for certification
Hours of operation: 
Sunday, March 16 | 9:00 a.m.–5:00 p.m.
Monday, March 17 | 8:00 a.m.–5:00 p.m.
Tuesday, March 18 | 1:00 p.m.–5:00 p.m.
Wednesday, March 19 | 8:00 a.m.–5:00 p.m.
Thursday, March 20 | 8:00 a.m.–5:00 p.m.
Friday, March 21 | 8:00 a.m.–4:00 p.m.

title: Membrane Pseudo-Bacterial Potential Field for Mobile Robot Path Planning [P72946]
abstract: This work presents a parallel implementation on the GPU of the membrane pseudo-bacterial potential field (MemPBPF) algorithm for mobile robot path planning. The MemPBPF algorithm achieves feasible paths, considering minimum path length, safety, and smoothness. The MemPBPF algorithm combines membrane computing with a pseudo-bacterial genetic algorithm — specifically, a membrane-inspired evolutionary algorithm with a one-level membrane structure — and the artificial potential field method to find the parameters to solve the robot path planning problem efficiently. The path-planning problem in mobile robots is one of the most computationally intensive tasks; in that sense, heterogeneous computing helps to gain performance. Employing GPUs is possible to process data-intensive tasks efficiently — in this work, the evaluation of solution paths.

title: Meta's Llama Ecosystem: Unlocking New Possibilities (Presented by Meta) [EXS74457]
abstract: Join us as we dive into the world of Llama models, exploring their capabilities, developer tools, and exciting use cases. Discover how these innovative models are transforming industries and improving performance in real-world applications.

title: Mission-Critical AI: Secure, Scalable, and Future-Proof for Enterprise AI Adoption (Presented by Astris AI) [EXS74623]
abstract: As AI adoption accelerates, enterprises must navigate challenges in security, scalability, and adaptability. In this session, Astris AI, a Lockheed Martin company, will introduce its defense-grade AI solutions, designed to help organizations deploy secure, open, and modular AI architectures without vendor lock-in. Discover how secure AI assistants and agents can enhance workforce productivity while safeguarding organizational data, and how the Astris AI Factory serves as an enterprise-wide operating system for rapid AI/ML development and deployment. Join us to explore real-world mission-ready use cases, strategic AI roadmaps, and how to future-proof your AI investments. Visit our booth for live demos and exclusive insights!

title: Mistral AI: Placing Frontier AI in Your Hands [S73942]
abstract:
Arthur Mensch, co-founder and CEO of Mistral AI, will explain why now is the time to take your AI future into your own hands. Discover what it takes to build enterprise-grade frontier AI solutions with a combination of custom models, configurable platforms, and delightful interfaces, while retaining complete ownership of your data, maintaining your competitive advantage, and up-leveling your entire organization. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: MiTAC G4527G6 MGX AI Server Introduction (Presented by MiTAC) [S74517]
abstract: Discover how MiTAC Computing is revolutionizing AI and high-performance computing with its next-generation server platforms, fully optimized for NVIDIA® MGX™ architecture. This session will explore how MiTAC’s scalable and configurable AI infrastructure enhances large-scale GPU cluster performance, delivering exceptional networking, thermal stability, and increased bandwidth. Learn how enterprises can gain a competitive edge and future-proof their AI workloads with MiTAC’s cutting-edge solutions.

title: MLOps Best Practices at NVIDIA [CWE73900]
abstract:
Join NVIDIA’s top engineers for an interactive session on how NVIDIA builds and uses MLOps tools and workflows to power cutting-edge AI projects. Discover internal use cases, explore tools like NVIDIA Base Command and Triton Inference Server, and learn best practices for automation, scalability, and reproducibility. Bring your questions for a live Q&A with the experts who design and implement these solutions daily. Perfect for data scientists, ML engineers, and IT leaders seeking actionable insights to enhance their MLOps strategies.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: MOAR Power for AI Workloads With Energy-Efficient, End-to-End Two-Phase Cooling (Presented by ZutaCore) [S74433]
abstract:
Available power is the single largest constraint world-wide for AI workloads — the more efficient/effective an end-to-end cooling solution is, the more value an AI factory produces. We'll highlight how two-phase liquid cooling can enhance AI server performance, provide the extra capacity needed for AI tasks, reduce environmental impact, and pave the way for waterless, energy-efficient data centers that can operate at 10 degrees Celsius higher facility water temperatures. High-performance GPUs driving AI advancements are pushing traditional cooling methods to their limits, calling for innovative solutions to manage heat, boost sustainability, and unlock more power for demanding AI workloads.
High-performance GPUs driving AI advancements are pushing traditional cooling methods to their limits, calling for innovative solutions to manage heat, boost sustainability, and unlock more power for demanding AI workloads.

This will be an extension to our 15-minute theater presentation showing real-world examples of waterless AI factory solutions and the return on investment that can be achieved at a 40-100 megawatt scale.

title: MOAR Power for AI Workloads With Energy-Efficient, End-to-End Two-Phase Cooling (Presented by ZutaCore) [EXS74431]

title: Mobile-Agent: 探索基于多模态智能体的汽车座舱助手新技术 [S72561]
abstract: 本主题将介绍通义 Mobile-Agent  技术在汽车智能驾驶舱助手场景中的实现方案和体验。该解决方案基于纯视觉理解和多模态智能体技术，提供驾驶舱屏幕感知、复杂任务规划和 UI 决策操作能力，大大扩展了驾驶舱智能助手的能力。此解决方案是由阿里云和 NVIDIA 联合开发的端云协作解决方案。

title: Modular Design to Accelerate AI Technologies (Presented by MSI) [S74188]
abstract: Discover how modular design transforms AI hardware development, enabling dynamic system architectures to meet the demands of evolving algorithms and diverse operating environments. We'll showcase real-world applications, such as how modularized server designs enhance performance for AI model training, edge computing, and data-intensive workloads. We'll delve into how modularization optimizes hardware utilization, accelerates development cycles, and ensures adaptability to rapid technological advancements.

title: MOMA: Zero-Shot Multi-Objective Antibody Evolution Using Multi-Agents [P73478]
abstract: MOMA (Multi-Objective Multi-Agents) is a novel framework that orchestrates generative models (agents) to evolve antibodies across multiple properties in a zero-shot fashion. Unlike traditional project-specific methods, MOMA leverages high-throughput data and reusable agents, drastically reducing the need for one-time experiments. This approach accelerates the discovery of antibodies with optimal stability, target affinity, and reduced side effects, revolutionizing high-valued therapeutic antibody design.

title: Multi-Agent AI Pharmacovigilance: Transforming Drug Safety Intelligence (Presented by Tech Mahindra) [EXS74619]
abstract: Pharmaceutical companies struggle with massive, complex datasets in drug safety monitoring. Learn how intelligent, collaborative AI agents can process intricate medical data streams, identify critical safety signals, and generate real-time actionable insights — transforming traditional pharmacovigilance from reactive reporting to proactive risk intelligence.

title: Multi-Domain Large Language Model Adaptation Using Synthetic Data Generation  [S71886]
abstract: Discover how we at Shell are collaborating with NVIDIA to adapt LLMs to learn about our domain-specific knowledge that open models lack. Dive deep into our methodologies such as DAPT, SFT, and reward modeling to systematically fine-tune LLMs across multiple domains, leveraging innovative approaches with synthetic data generation.

title: Multi-Domain Large Language Model Adaptation Using Synthetic Data Generation  [S71886]
abstract: Discover how we at Shell are collaborating with NVIDIA to adapt LLMs to learn about our domain-specific knowledge that open models lack. Dive deep into our methodologies such as DAPT, SFT, and reward modeling to systematically fine-tune LLMs across multiple domains, leveraging innovative approaches with synthetic data generation.

title: Multi-Location Solar Irradiance Forecasting Using Hybrid Quantum Neural Networks for Renewable Energy Assessment [P73390]
abstract: Accurate solar irradiance forecasting is crucial for optimizing renewable energy planning. This research explores using hybrid quantum neural networks (HQNNs), combining classical AI and quantum computing, to improve solar energy predictions. We evaluated two models — sparse and dense multi-location forecasts. HQNNs outperform classical models by 92.30% in sparse forecasts, with CUDA-Q delivering a 218% speedup in inference time and a 10.20% improvement in accuracy. These results demonstrate the potential of HQNNs and CUDA-Q to enhance the reliability and efficiency of renewable energy systems.

title: Multi-Location Solar Irradiance Forecasting Using Hybrid Quantum Neural Networks for Renewable Energy Assessment [P73390]

title: Multi-Modality and Multi-AI Agents for Hardware Design [S72294]
abstract: Hardware design presents numerous challenges due to its complexity and rapidly advancing technologies. These challenges result in longer turnaround times (TAT) for optimizing performance, power, area, and cost (PPAC) during synthesis, verification, physical design, and reliability loops. Large language models have demonstrated a remarkable ability to comprehend and generate natural language at scale, leading to numerous potential applications and benefits across various domains. Successful LLM-based agents for hardware design can significantly reduce TAT, enabling faster product cycles, lower costs, improved design reliability, and a reduced risk of costly errors. Cutting-edge multi-AI agents have shown promising results in Hardware Description Language (HDL) generation, layout optimization, design rule code generation, and Multi-Corner Multi-Mode (MCMM) timing report analysis and debugging at both the block and path levels. Notably, the developed multi-AI agents not only achieve a 94.2% functionally correct pass rate on the VerilogEval-Human v2 benchmark, but also deliver a 60X speedup in MCMM timing report analysis compared to experienced human engineers.

title: Multimodal Medical Report Generation System [P73564]
abstract: Advances in medical technology have greatly increased the volume of imaging, such as X-rays, MRIs, CT scans, and ultrasounds, which adds to doctors' workloads. Analyzing and reporting on these images is often time-consuming and error-prone, with factors like fatigue and variability between doctors affecting accuracy. Additionally, the quality of ultrasound images can vary due to differences in machines and scanning techniques, complicating analysis and introducing diagnostic uncertainty, which further impacts efficiency. Our research explores the potential of using advanced image-text analysis to automate structured reporting for X-rays, CT scans, and ultrasounds, which could enhance efficiency, reduce errors, and improve consistency in medical reporting. Furthermore, we leverage NVIDIA NeVA to significantly increase report generation speed by 8.66-fold compared to traditional methods, thereby enhancing overall efficiency.

title: Multimodal-to-Omniverse: An End-to-End Pipeline for 3D Model Generation from Voice or Text, Ninja Edition [DLIT71308]
abstract:
Learn how to run an multi-modal end-to-end pipeline generating 3D assets using your own voice. We'll use state-of-the-art NIM Agent LLMs with Langchain, Langgraph, and Langserve to create an agentic pipeline transforming from text to 2D to 3D, generating 3D assets to be imported via CAD Converter, and see it come to life using Omniverse KIT SDK. In the end, you'll be able to create a 360-degree beauty shot video as trophy that you can share on social media.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic understanding of Python.
 An understanding of Langchain and Omniverse is a plus but not mandatory.

title: Multimodal-to-Omniverse: An End-to-End Pipeline for 3D Model Generation from Voice or Text, Ninja Edition [DLIT71308]
abstract:
Learn how to run an multi-modal end-to-end pipeline generating 3D assets using your own voice. We'll use state-of-the-art NIM Agent LLMs with Langchain, Langgraph, and Langserve to create an agentic pipeline transforming from text to 2D to 3D, generating 3D assets to be imported via CAD Converter, and see it come to life using Omniverse KIT SDK. In the end, you'll be able to create a 360-degree beauty shot video as trophy that you can share on social media.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic understanding of Python.
 An understanding of Langchain and Omniverse is a plus but not mandatory.

title: Navigate the AI Frontier: Overcome Data Center Challenges and Harness Structured Cabling for Gen AI Deployments (Presented by CommScope) [S74369]
abstract:
In this era of rapid technological advancement, artificial intelligence stands at the forefront, promising transformative solutions across industries. However, the deployment of generative AI (Gen AI) in data centers presents unique challenges. We'll delve into these obstacles, shedding light on the complexities that data center operators face in the wake of Gen AI deployments.

From power consumption and cooling requirements to data processing demands, we explore the multifaceted issues that arise in the data center environment. More importantly, we turn our attention to the potential solutions that lie within structured cabling systems. Discover how these robust and flexible infrastructures can simplify Gen AI installations, enhance scalability, and support the high-speed data transmission that Gen AI applications need. Join us as we navigate the AI frontier, paving the way for a future where data centers are fully equipped to harness the power of Gen AI.

title: Navigating Challenges and Technical Debt in LLMs Deployment [S71116]
abstract:
Deploying large language models (LLMs) in production introduces numerous challenges and technical debt including memory management, parallelization, and model compression, highlighting a trade-off between utility and complexity.

Learn how Mastercard developed a generative AI assistant to augment LLMs with Mastercard-specific data, ensuring business-required latency and throughput and operating on-premises using NVIDIA DGX, NeMo, and Triton inference servers. This technical initiative is detailed in their recently accepted ACM paper titled "Navigating Challenges and Technical Debt in Large Language Models Deployment" (https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3642970.3655840) co-authored in collaboration with the University of Edinburgh.

This talk will discuss the paper and the technical debts associated with deploying LLMs for businesses, highlighting the need for solutions and sophisticated engineering strategies that go beyond the capabilities of standard machine learning libraries and inference engines.

title: Navigating Critical Challenges in AI Governance [S73058]
abstract: As AI systems grow more powerful and pervasive, interaction with users raises critical challenges beyond just technical implementation. Join NVIDIA experts as they discuss the complex and diverse set of regulatory compliance, safety protocols, and security imperatives shaping AI development. We'll explore practical approaches to building responsible AI systems while navigating evolving regulations, addressing safety concerns, and maintaining robust security measures. Gain insights into balancing innovation with protection, managing competing priorities, and implementing effective governance frameworks for the next generation of AI technology.

title: Navigating the Future: The Impact of Accelerated Computing and AI on Data Center Electricity Demand [S73672]
abstract: In this fireside chat, Laura Cozzi, Director of Sustainability, Technology and Outlooks at the IEA, will discuss with Josh Parker, Head of Sustainability at NVIDIA, the future evolution of energy consumption in data centres which is being driven by the exponential demand for computing power necessary for the development and deployment of AI. During the discussion, they will also explore the impact of AI in the energy sector as a whole and the benefits and the challenges that AI can bring. Attendees will gain a deeper understanding of the projected pathways for data centre electricity demand and how accelerated computing can ensure the energy efficiency of data centres. The conversation will also cover the implications of the adoption of AI and energy-efficient technologies across the whole energy sector.

title: Navigating the High-Stakes Safety Challenges of Autonomous Driving [S73122]
abstract: Building an autonomous vehicle to navigate safely in the complex physical world is challenging. The system needs to perceive and understand its surroundings holistically, and then make correct, safe decisions in a fraction of a second. This requires human-like situational awareness to handle potentially dangerous or rare scenarios. We'll dive into technological advancements related to safety processes and architectures. Additionally, we'll discuss the role of standardization and regulatory oversight in ensuring safety.

title: NCCL: The Inter-GPU Communication Library Powering Multi-GPU AI [S72583]
abstract:
The NCCL communication library has been powering the AI revolution, allowing LLM training to leverage the power of tens of thousands of GPUs to train larger and larger models. As LLM training and inference evolve, combining many parallelism techniques, NCCL is also evolving. Learn about all advances in the NCCL library, as well as how NCCL works under the hood and what impacts the multi-GPU performance. Learn how all NVIDIA technologies, including NVLink, DGX, Blackwell, Grace, and ConnectX, are combined by NCCL to improve parallel compute efficiency by many orders of magnitude.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Near-Real-Time Fire Detection Leveraging Edge AI in Space: Transforming Thermal Earth Observation with NVIDIA [S72067]
abstract: We'll showcase space-based fire detection leveraging NVIDIA technology on an operational thermal cubesat constellation. By using NVIDIA Jetson on board the satellite, image processing and fire detection can be achieved in under 60 seconds, dramatically reducing ground-based processing requirements and delivering near-real-time data to fire management teams. AI-powered cloud masking and onboard compression on the edge further refine data quality and push the boundaries of low-latency fire detection from space to assist fire management and suppression around the globe.

abstract: See how Nettrix NEX AI Lab aims to build the "super brain" for enterprises in the field of generative artificial intelligence. Computing power serves as the driving force behind this brain, enabling the value of AI to shine brightly through its capabilities.

title: Network Modernization in the Age of AI (Presented by Aviz Networks) [S74425]
abstract: In the age of AI, networks require a dual approach: adapting to support generative AI applications, and leveraging AI to enhance daily network management for increased productivity and long-term return on investment. We'll explore NVIDIA's role in transforming networking across these two dimensions, and how Aviz Networks complements this ecosystem with innovative products. Moderated by a well-known industry analyst, the discussion will feature insights from leaders at NVIDIA and Aviz, along with two prominent industry leaders from the customer side, providing a comprehensive view of network modernization in the AI era.

title: New Frontiers in Brain Research: Real-Time Imaging, BCIs, and AI-Driven Neuroscience Exploration [S71786]
abstract:
The brain remains one of the most complex studies in human biology, and advances in technology are opening new possibilities in neuroscience. This session brings together three initiatives shaping the future of brain research, namely: 

•	Exploration of real-time stereoscopic imaging in neurosurgical microsurgery using NVIDIA Clara’s edge AI platform, Holoscan, to enhance depth perception and precision. 
•	Discovery of brain-computer interfaces (BCIs) that are currently on the verge of creating a digital twin of the brain, unlocking key capabilities for individuals with neurological conditions. 
•	Multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) and NVIDIA’s AI tools, such as NeMo and NIM microservices. 

Learn how these tools are evolving neuroscience knowledge exploration. Together, these innovations are driving progress in brain science, education, and digital health.

title: Next-Gen Customer Experience Using Domain-Expert Digital Employees [S71968]
abstract:
Explore how Amdocs, in collaboration with NVIDIA, is transforming the telecommunications industry with cutting-edge generative AI. Discover how our digital agents enhance customer interactions and drive operational efficiency. We’ll share our strategic approach to verticalizing the agentic era, key technical considerations, and live demos that showcase the next generation of customer experience. This session blends thought leadership, technical design, and real-world insights—offering valuable takeaways for both technical professionals and business leaders.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Next-Gen Data Centers: Intelligent Automation and Integrated Observability for Peak Developer Productivity  [S72361]
abstract:
In the era of trillion-parameter models, even the most tech-savvy enterprises are seeing only 30% effective utilization of their infrastructure, with AI workloads frequently failing, creating time-to-market delays impacting return on investment. As AI workloads grow in scale and demand larger resource pools, a robust, software-powered, full-stack data center platform is essential to ensure developers can efficiently build and scale on infrastructure offering best-in-class uptime and effortless IT manageability. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Next-generation at Scale Compute in the Data Center  [S73623]
abstract:
As emerging technologies continue to advance computing, comprehensive builds of very large-scale systems are becoming increasingly integrated to address the rapidly evolving demands of next-gen workloads. We'll highlight our latest designs for DGX clusters, including both compute and data center configurations showcasing an example with DGX Superpod. We'll discuss the architectural and design principles underlying next-gen air- and liquid-cooled deployments. We'll also examine the network fabric, interconnect solutions, and storage options that enable maximum performance, and how these components integrate with the software stack for generative AI applications.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: NextStep: Optimizing Healthcare Resource Delivery Using a Multilingual Artificial Intelligence Assistant [P73601]
abstract: Access to healthcare resources remains a critical issue, with over 60% of underserved populations experiencing significant delays in receiving essential services due to language barriers and inefficient resource navigation. Nearly 50% of patients report difficulty finding relevant social services like housing, food assistance, or medical care, leading to avoidable delays in treatment. Our AI-powered, multilingual assistant, NextStep, addresses this by providing real-time, personalized recommendations based on user needs and location. Tested in over 100 field cases across hospitals and clinics, the assistant reduced resource matching time by 40% and improved patient satisfaction by 35%. Leveraging advanced natural language processing (NLP) models, CUDA-powered decision-making, and RAPIDS for geospatial processing, it delivers 98% accuracy in resource matching. Learn how our innovative approach enhances patient care while improving scalability and accessibility for high-demand settings.

title: No-Limits AI With Lenovo Neptune Cooling (Presented by Lenovo) [S74323]
abstract: Forty percent of a typical data center's energy consumption comes from cooling, and AI is a power-hungry workload. How can more organizations benefit from high-performance, powerful AI compute with greater energy efficiency? Hear strategies and solutions that can meet the increasing compute demands of AI while addressing energy efficiency through innovative thermal management. Thermal challenges are an unavoidable outcome to rapid innovation of the GPU to serve AI workloads. Liquid-cooled solutions are being deployed into next-gen AI factories to deliver performance improvements and energy savings. Learn about Lenovo’s expertise and consistent DNA of liquid-cooled designs since 2012, enabling no-limits AI and helping meet your sustainability goals.

title: No Memory Left Behind: How CXL Unlocks the Full Potential of AI (Presented by Astera Labs) [EXS74246]
abstract: Explore how CXL technology overcomes memory bottlenecks in AI infrastructure. As AI models grow larger and more complex, the demand for scalable memory capacity has outpaced traditional solutions. Learn how CXL can boost performance for AI inferencing with dynamic resource sharing and efficient scaling.

title: Novel Uses for AI to Drive Monetization in Large M&E Archives [S72715]
abstract:
In 1928, a Norwegian doctor put an original print of Carl Dreyer’s silent movie “The Passion of Joan of Arc” in a janitor’s closet in an insane asylum. This new cut was discovered during renovations 53 years later, changing our understanding of the film. Hopefully, most media companies don’t store in janitor’s closets, but most have hundreds of thousands of hours of footage sitting dormant, stored with little more information than the file name.

Learn how using a NIMS-based contextual analysis for metadata ingest within a software-defined broadcast pipeline can make your active media and archive searchable by a frame’s visual contents, and even the greater context around it. These data allow for dynamic and novel opportunities for monetization and personalization. We'll discuss how contextual metadata can be produced and refined recursively within a TAMS (time-addressable media) framework to add and amend metadata each time footage is retrieved. These data can be used to generate retrieval-augmented generation models for everything from anomaly detection to predictive/suggestive editing and FAST-content generation. 
Discover how a news organization will use metadata to “Control F” through their archive, and how a racing company will use their contextual data to create models to predict camera switching, improve safety, and generate user-specific narratives. We’ll close with an exploration of how media & entertainment (M&E) contextual data pipelines can be used outside our industry, from avoiding collisions with self-driving cars to sonar analysis.
date_time: TAMS-based storage systems allow the archive to be searchable and stored by context, rather than filename and date

title: Nsight Analysis System: Build Custom Python Analysis Scripts to Summarize Performance and Reveal Bottlenecks With Single- and Multi-Node Applications [DLIT74509]
abstract:
In this hands-on lab, we'll show you how to write custom analysis scripts, called recipes, to gain deeper insights into the performance of your application using the Analysis System of the Nsight Systems profiler. We'll walk through multiple examples to show the Nsight Analysis System functions that can process, filter, correlate, and visualize the various hardware and software events captured by Nsight Systems. We'll also show how to upgrade a single-report recipe to a multi-report recipe in order to identify performance issues in large-scale HPC and cloud applications.
Prerequisite(s):

Familiarity with Nsight Systems, Python, Pandas, and Jupyter Notebooks.

title: Nsight Analysis System: Build Custom Python Analysis Scripts to Summarize Performance and Reveal Bottlenecks With Single- and Multi-Node Applications [DLIT74509]

abstract: This poster presents new solutions for streamlining Gen AI application development by leveraging NVBot’s platform, which accelerates deployment through reusable components, dynamic orchestration, and enterprise-grade security. As companies rapidly adopt AI technologies, this approach helps improve performance and reduce time-to-market, enabling teams to focus on innovation and delivering real business impact.

As companies rapidly adopt AI technologies, this approach helps improve performance and reduce time-to-market, enabling teams to focus on innovation and delivering real business impact.

title: NVIDIA AI Platform and Accelerated Solutions Overview (Presented by PNY Technologies) [S74297]
abstract: See a high-level overview of PNY and the NVIDIA AI Platform and accelerated solutions, and how they help accelerate AI training and inference in different markets.

title: NVIDIA and Lenovo Present: Women in AI  [SE73374]
abstract: This event will feature a panel discussion with leading women executives in AI, exploring how gender diversity in AI development fosters a more inclusive and impactful user experience. This is a unique opportunity to connect with industry peers and expand your professional network.
