title: NVIDIA and Samsung's AI Memory: Enabling Advancements in High-Performance Computing and Gaming (Presented by Samsung Semiconductor) [S74615]
abstract: NVIDIA uses Samsung's GDDR7 AI Memory technology in its latest Blackwell and GeForce RTX 50 Series GPU architectures, enabling outstanding performance, efficiency, and reliability for the most demanding high performance computing, AI, and gaming applications. We'll take a deep dive into Samsung’s GDDR7 technical advancements and the collaborative efforts between NVIDIA and Samsung to optimize these innovations for modern computing.
date_time: Technical deep dive on the GDDR7 technology, including PAM-3 signaling, power efficiency, and thermal management

title: NVIDIA Cosmos World Foundation Models for Autonomous Driving Development [S73198]
abstract: NVIDIA Cosmos is a platform that aims to accelerate physical AI development. We'll discuss how the Cosmos World Foundation Models, when specialized to the autonomous driving (AV) domain, can enhance AV development workflows.

title: NVIDIA GPU クラウドを使った API アクセスによる高速アプリ開発 [S73913]
abstract: 国産 AI Factory を活用した NVIDIA H100/H200 GPU クラウドプラットフォームで、生成 AI モデル構築からエンタプライズ向け AI エージェントデプロイまで、エンドツーエンドの AI 開発を実現しましょう。直感的な API とFPT が開発した SDK を用いることにより、複雑なコーディングは不要です。僅か数行のコードで、モデルのファインチューニングも可能です。本セッションでは、具体的なユースケースを交え、迅速な開発と最適化された推論環境による国産 AI Factory の利点をご紹介します。

title: NVIDIA Inception: The Catalyst Fueling Your Startup’s Success [SE71117]
abstract: For most AI startups, "build it and they will come" doesn't describe what it takes to acquire customers. In a world of infinite alternatives, it takes ingenuity, grit, and committed partners to generate awareness and conversion for your product.

title: NVIDIA Inception: The Catalyst Fueling Your Startup’s Success [SE71117]
abstract: For most AI startups, "build it and they will come" doesn't describe what it takes to acquire customers. In a world of infinite alternatives, it takes ingenuity, grit, and committed partners to generate awareness and conversion for your product.

title: NVIDIA Math Libraries [CWE72398]
abstract:
Talk to experts about programming, code optimization, and topics like device extensions and multi-GPU multi-node support, share your experiences, and get guidance for Math Libraries cuBLAS, cuSOLVER, cuSPARSE, cuSPARSELt, cuDSS, cuTENSOR, cuFFT, cuRAND, the Math API, and NVPL.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: NVIDIA MedTech Developer Day [DD73322]
abstract: Physical AI will transform every industry by bringing AI-driven, robotic solutions directly into the real world. Take our deep dive into the game-changing innovations that will transform medical technology! NVIDIA experts and a select group of developers will showcase real-world use cases in medical imaging and robotics. We'll demonstrate how to build such physical AI applications across the three-computer framework of training, simulation, and runtime — from simulating data/environment/task (Isaac Sim and Omniverse) to training novel AI models for transformative tasks (MONAI powered by TAO and NeMo) to the physical AI runtime powered by NVIDIA Holoscan platform.

title: NVIDIA MedTech Developer Day [DD73322]
abstract: Physical AI will transform every industry by bringing AI-driven, robotic solutions directly into the real world. Take our deep dive into the game-changing innovations that will transform medical technology! NVIDIA experts and a select group of developers will showcase real-world use cases in medical imaging and robotics. We'll demonstrate how to build such physical AI applications across the three-computer framework of training, simulation, and runtime — from simulating data/environment/task (Isaac Sim and Omniverse) to training novel AI models for transformative tasks (MONAI powered by TAO and NeMo) to the physical AI runtime powered by NVIDIA Holoscan platform.

title: NVIDIA MGX Architecture for AI Infrastructure [CWE73408]
abstract:
Engage directly with NVIDIA specialists to discuss the innovative NVIDIA MGX modular reference design. This is a unique opportunity to ask questions, share insights, and gain a deeper understanding of how MGX can revolutionize accelerated computing deployment in data centers. This session is ideal for data center architects, original equipment manufacturers, original design manufacturers, and IT professionals interested in leveraging NVIDIA's cutting-edge technologies to enhance their AI and accelerated computing capabilities. Don't miss this chance to connect with experts and deepen your understanding of NVIDIA's innovative MGX architecture!
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: NVIDIA MGX Platform: Optimizations with Astera Labs Scorpio Smart Fabric Switch (Presented by Astera Labs) [S74256]
abstract: As AI workloads diversify and grow in size exponentially, the need for open and modular hardware has become even more critical for hyperscalers seeking scalable, flexible, and efficient solutions. This panel will explore the benefits of using open hardware to accelerate time-to-market and reduce total-cost-of-ownership. It will discuss the role of NVIDIA MGX to optimize AI workloads, improve power efficiency, and future-proof designs.

title: NVIDIA NIM and GPUs With Kubernetes [CWE72613]
abstract:
Join NVIDIA technical product managers, engineers, and solutions architects to learn about NVIDIA's offering to use GPUs and NVIDIA NIMs with K8s. This is the session to learn more about the NIM Operator and the NVIDIA GPU and Network Operator. We'll address a wide variety of topics like use cases, integration, and deployment best practices. We’ve also got you covered if you want information about specific feature/functionality, or even how to contribute, as those products are open-sourced. Join us to understand the amazing things we do with K8s!
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: NVIDIA NIM/Blueprintを活用したビジネス変革 [S73911]
abstract:
デロイトが、クライアントのビジネス変革をNVIDIA AI Enterprise（NIMとBlueprint）を活用して、実施しています。
導入事例を通じてAgentic AIのソリューションを説明し、導入方法及びお客様へのビジネス価値の提供についてご紹介します。

title: NVIDIA NIM/NeMoで実現する生成AIによる資産運用レポーティングの変革 [S73894]
abstract: SGICはLlama 3.1をベースに日本語対応したSwallowモデルを、自社の運用レポートデータでファインチューニングし、金融レポーティング専用の生成AIモデルを開発しました。NeMoフレームワークを活用して学習・推論を最適化し、投資家向けレポート作成の効率化と品質向上を実現しています。

title: NVIDIA NIM/NeMoで実現する生成AIによる資産運用レポーティングの変革 [S73894]
abstract: SGICはLlama 3.1をベースに日本語対応したSwallowモデルを、自社の運用レポートデータでファインチューニングし、金融レポーティング専用の生成AIモデルを開発しました。NeMoフレームワークを活用して学習・推論を最適化し、投資家向けレポート作成の効率化と品質向上を実現しています。

title: NVIDIA Nventures Showcase: AI Agents in Physical and Virtual Worlds [DD73694]
abstract: Join Jim Fan, Senior Research Manager & Lead of Generalist Embodied Agent Research at NVIDIA, as he presents a curated lineup of NVentures portfolio companies. Hear from each of the founders about how they're disrupting their respective industries and what's next for each in the era of AI Agents.

title: NVIDIA Quantum Developer Day [DD73669]
abstract:
Join us for the first NVIDIA Quantum Developer Day, celebrating the transformative work being enabled across the quantum computing ecosystem in collaboration with NVIDIA's expertise and world-leading software and hardware tools.  

Featuring the following technical talks from NVIDIA partners: Quantum Contextual Machine Learning: A Glidepath From GPU to QPU - Pranav Gokhale (Infleqtion), How to Build a Distributed Quantum Computer: Adaptive Circuit Knitting - Masoud Mohseni (Hewlett Packard Enterprise), Harnessing CUDA-Q’s Dynamics Capabilities for the Design of Quantum Sensors - Nima Leclerc (MITRE), A Quantum Computing Pipeline for Proteins - Kanav Setia and Kenny Heitritter (QBraid), Integrated QPU/GPU Calibration of Multiqubit Circuits - Ramon Szmuk (Quantum Machines), Acceleration of quantum simulations with fault-tolerant quantum algorithms for chemistry applications - Kenji Sugisaki (Keio University), Accelerate Quantum Apps Development with Realistic (Virtual) Quantum Processing Units - Andrea Tabacchini (Quantum Brilliance)

title: NVIDIA Video Technologies in Blackwell [CWE73720]
abstract:
Join us to discuss any topics related to video technologies at NVIDIA. Whether you’re interested in our video encoder (NVENC), video decoder (NVDEC), or the end-uses cases in Datacenter, Pro-viz or GeForce, we have experts who can answer your questions — NVIDIA engineers, product managers, solution architects, and dev-techs. Learn more about the exciting new features and developments in the Blackwell video architecture.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: NVIDIA 全面赋能端到端自动驾驶 [S74412]
abstract: 我们将从以下四个部分介绍 NVIDIA 如何赋能端到端自动驾驶：世界模型、神经重建引擎（NRE）、模型的训练加速和自动驾驶端侧优化部署。世界模型部分将介绍其起源，自动驾驶中世界模型的应用场景以及 NVIDIA Cosmos 这一前沿的世界模型；第二，我们将介绍为什么需要NRE，并从完善可用的传感器建模、为相机和 LiDAR 渲染新视角传感器帧等方面介绍神经重建引擎；第三，我们将从视频、图像训练 Pipeline、Core Lib 和损失计算加速介绍模型在数据中心的训练加速；最后针对自动驾驶的端侧优化，我们将探讨针对 Thor 的模型优化，以及模型部署的优化内容。

title: NVIDIA 开创 AI 计算网 [S73842]
abstract: 随着生成式 AI 的兴起，AI 模型的参数规模和数据集快速扩张，对于AI 算力的需求达到了前所未有的程度。NVIDIA 率先针对 AI 工作负载推出了突破性的 AI 网络 - 计算网（Compute Fabric），创新地实现了计算和通信的融合，助力 AI 数据中心走向高性能和无限可扩展，达到了算力和能源的优化平衡，并在十万卡以上 GPU 规模的 AI 集群中得到了验证。在本活动中，我们将深入探讨如何采用 NVIDIA 的 AI 计算网提升超大规模 AI 数据中心的整体性能、大幅降低数据中心的构建时间，助力于全球各大 AI 工厂和 AI 云。

title: NVIDIA 革新智能座舱技术发展 [S74413]
abstract: 我们将通过三部分介绍 NVIDIA 通过生成式 AI 加速智能座舱技术发展。首先将介绍生成式 AI 在智能座舱中的应用，以及 NVIDIA 生成式 AI 加速解决方案，如大模型训练并行加速和 FP8 训练优化和实践; 第二部分将介绍使用 TRT-LLM 部署和优化多模态推理；最后将介绍 Thor SoC 如何应用于大语言模型，以及 Thor 上 LLM 部署的软件解决方案和加速。

title: NVIDIA 革新智能座舱技术发展 [S74413]

title: NVINFO AI: Enhancing Enterprise Productivity with Mixture of Experts​ [P73511]
abstract:
Problem: Fulfilling NVIDIANs' various daily information needs such as IT support, HR/benefit questions, news, holidays, etc., as well as enhancing enterprise productivity across different domains, use cases, and language are essential and vital. How do we leverage AI and NVIDIA technologies while building it in a secure and performant way?​

​Solution: We built NVINFO, which adopts a "mixture-of-experts" architecture that sits on top of multiple domain experts, each owning its own retrieval-augmented generation pipeline to cover specific topics and use cases.

title: Omniverse-based Digital Twin for Delta Smart Manufacturing (Presented by Delta Electronics) [S73976]
abstract: Learn how Delta integrates NVIDIA's Omniverse and Delta's virtual machine development platform DIATwin to build up a digital twin platform for its smart production lines.

title: OmniverseとOpenUSDで実現する次世代バーチャルファクトリーの創り方 [S73886]
abstract: バーチャルファクトリーをテーマに、製造業におけるデジタルツイン導入の工程や課題を紹介します。またそれに対してOmniverseとOpenUSDを活用した最新の3Dワークフローがどのように有効なのか、3Dモデル・マテリアル・データ構造などの観点を含めてこれまでのユースケースをもとに解説します。

title: OmniverseとOpenUSDで実現する次世代バーチャルファクトリーの創り方 [S73886]
abstract: バーチャルファクトリーをテーマに、製造業におけるデジタルツイン導入の工程や課題を紹介します。またそれに対してOmniverseとOpenUSDを活用した最新の3Dワークフローがどのように有効なのか、3Dモデル・マテリアル・データ構造などの観点を含めてこれまでのユースケースをもとに解説します。

title: Open and Module Design for GPU Server (Presented by MiTAC) [EXS74178]
abstract: With frequent changes on both supply (technical trend) and demand (data center requirements), we need a platform with flexibility and options for multiple use cases such as different CPU, GPU power, different IO, and different storage devices. In this case, module design with Open SPEC is one of the better choices. Learn about the leverage and synergy of NVIDIA MGX and OCP DC-MHS for next-generation GPU server design.

title: Open-Sora: Training a Commercial-Level Video Generation Model with $200k [S72728]
abstract: Video generation is still in its early stages, similar to the development of language models like GPT-1 in the LLM domain. We'll share our experiences in building large AI video generation models and explore the latest technologies, including data processing pipelines, training strategies, model architecture, training codes, and model weights — all of which are open source on our GitHub. We aim to help you use or build your own video generation models, advancing AI video generation in filmmaking, advertising, marketing, gaming, and more.

title: Open-Sora: Training a Commercial-Level Video Generation Model with $200k [S72728]
abstract: Video generation is still in its early stages, similar to the development of language models like GPT-1 in the LLM domain. title: OpenUSD Best Practices for Developing with NVIDIA Omniverse [CWE73248]
abstract:
Join NVIDIA's product leaders and workflow specialists for an interactive discussion on how to get started building with OpenUSD and NVIDIA Omniverse. In either a group or 1:1 setting, discuss your use cases and challenges, get your questions answered, and learn how you can build USD-native applications. 
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Optimized Deployment of Large Language Models [CWE72337]
abstract:
Join this interactive session to deep dive into the world of large language model (LLM) inference. Learn about techniques to reduce computational overhead and discover strategies for scaling your applications to handle high-concurrency demands. Whether you’re exploring best practices for application deployment with NIMs or low-level model optimizations with Tensor-RT-LLM to accelerate inference and minimize latency, this session will cover it all.

title: Optimize Language Model Pre-Training With Semantic Chunking and Dynamic Concatenation [P72809]
abstract: We present a data pre-processing method to optimize language model pre-training by using semantic chunking and dynamic document concatenation. Documents exceeding the token limit are semantically chunked, while smaller documents from the same domain are concatenated, minimizing padding and maximizing learning efficiency. Compared to standard concatenation methods, this approach preserves document coherence and ensures contextual relevance. Implemented with Dask for scalability, the method shows a 5% reduction in training time and a 9.7% improvement in benchmark performance over traditional preprocessing techniques.

title: Optimize Large-Scale Models for Restricting Hardware Environments [P74481]
abstract: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing healthcare by automating common clinical processes. Some of the biggest challenges revolve around keeping adequately short inference times, small memory requirements, and no hardware dependencies, while keeping the performance high and the model robust. We implemented a 3D model for follicle segmentation on 3D transvaginal ultrasound scans. The architecture is based off a Mask-RCNN to achieve precise instance segmentation, and was modified to fit the limitation of the ultrasound hardware and the clinical settings.

title: Optimize Large-Scale Models for Restricting Hardware Environments [P74481]

title: Optimize Parallelism in Large Language Models Training: Trends and Future Directions [P74383]
abstract: Dive into advanced methodologies for optimizing large-scale AI model training by addressing bottlenecks in 3D parallelism. Optimus-CC employs compressed backpropagation, fused embedding synchronization, and selective stage compression to reduce communication overhead while maintaining model quality. Pipette enhances 3D parallelism with fine-grained worker dedication based on interconnect bandwidth and refined latency and memory estimators tailored for real-world clusters. These innovations tackle communication inefficiencies, interconnect variability, and GPU memory constraints, significantly improving training throughput and scalability for distributed AI systems.

title: Optimize Short-Form Video Processing Toward the Speed of Light  [S73178]
abstract:
Video Gen AI, world models, social media, and video search applications are tapping into hundreds of petabytes of video content, from the web or proprietary datasets. It's particularly challenging to process (decode, process, encode) such data efficiently: short clips, low resolutions, and many codecs and formats, in the Python ecosystem.

Learn how to leverage the latest and greatest from NVIDIA’s ecosystem (PyNvVideoCodec, CV-CUDA, CUDA-MPS, CUDA-ICP) to get the best out of NVIDIA’s hardware (NVDec, NVEnc, CUDA cores), with substantial throughput improvements over a CPU baseline.

title: Optimize Your Workloads for Rack-Scale Interconnected GPU systems [S73037]
abstract:
We’ll help you understand how to get the most out of the GB200 NVL72 architecture in a hyperscale environment. We'll share details on how GB200 NVL72 is implemented from a topology perspective; review how new APIs for unified memory, ultra-low datatype precision, and hardware-accelerated compression can be leveraged for maximum performance; and cover considerations on workload placement, parallelism strategies, and infrastructure resilience. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Optimizing AI Workloads on Windows Workstations: Strategies and Best Practices [CWE72514]
abstract:
Windows workstations present unique challenges for AI workload optimizations due to the diversity of hardware configurations and software options. Our experts will guide you through the best practices for optimizing AI models and inference pipelines in such environments. We’ll cover strategies for effective model quantization and fusion, explore the strengths of various inference frameworks like ONNX Runtime and TensorRT, and provide practical advice on maximizing performance and resource utilization across diverse GPU, CPU, and NPU hardware. Whether you’re developing applications for creative professionals or enterprise solutions, this session will help you navigate the complexities and make informed decisions to optimize your AI workflows.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Optimizing Clinical Trials with ConcertAI Trial Simulator  [P72765]
abstract: ConcertAI’s (CAI) Trial Simulator integrates proprietary generative large language models (LLMs), predictive models, NVIDIA NIM, and an agent-based framework to optimize clinical trial processes. This system enhances clinical trial planning by improving the accuracy of site selection and patient recruitment strategies, leading to more efficient and successful trials. The simulator comprises four key components: (1) Information Abstraction; (2) Language and Clinical Reasoning LLM; (3) Retrieval System; and (4) Recommender System. Further, to develop the simulator efficiently, CAI utilizes cloud-based NVIDIA NIM microservices to deploy models (e.g., Llama 3), enhancing performance and reducing latency.

The Aurora platform delivers one-click, scalable, AI-enhanced XR to your enterprise network with white-glove deployment

title: Optimizing HPC and AI for Energy and Performance [S72544]
abstract: It's becoming increasingly vital to optimize for energy and power, in addition to raw performance, for environmental, financial, and logistical reasons. We'll showcase recent work to tune a range of representative HPC and AI benchmarks and applications for energy and power, where the findings and techniques are transferable to other applications. We'll show how careful tuning of the industry-standard High Performance Linpack (HPL) benchmark within the performance and energy landscape on Grace Hopper has enabled the NVIDIA-powered supercomputers to sweep the Green500 world rankings. We'll show the effectiveness of tuning processor clock frequencies for energy minimization across a range of applications, and how application-level optimizations can go even further. We'll discuss this work within the context of the latest NVIDIA technology.

title: Optimizing MicroLED Mass Repair With Reinforcement Learning: A Framework for Large-Scale Manufacturing [P73544]
abstract: Explore how we apply reinforcement learning to optimize mass repair in the microLED industry, focusing on the critical transition from AI-assisted MicroLED-on-Carrier (AI MioC) to MicroLED-on-Template (MioT) for final display assembly. Using GPU-accelerated reinforcement learning and laser-based transfer methods, we improve production efficiency by minimizing repair time and ensuring precise chip alignment. This solution is key to scaling microLED manufacturing, with immense potential in consumer electronics, automotive, and especially augmented/virtual reality industries, where demand for high-resolution, low-power displays is rapidly growing.

title: Optimizing Multi-Language Scientific Simulations: A Grace Superchip Case Study [S72537]
abstract: The LANL Scalable Ecosystem for Complex Chemistry Simulations (SEDACS) team recently ported their computational chemistry framework and associated libraries from a pure CPU workload for the x86-64 instruction set to the LANL Venado supercomputer based on nodes built from NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchips. The SEDACS and NVIDIA Nsight Systems teams will tell this porting story, how the workload was balanced to take advantage of the compute resources, and explain the gains in performance and efficiency achieved. We’ll demonstrate how Nsight Systems features for Grace Hopper platforms are used in practice, with a large multi-language scientific software project.

title: Optimizing Multi-Language Scientific Simulations: A Grace Superchip Case Study [S72537]

title: Optimizing Vector Search for Scalable AI Native Applications using open source software [S71356]
abstract:
Vector search is crucial for high-performance AI applications and the need for flexible solutions that can efficiently handle both real-time and batch inference scenarios has grown. In this session, we’ll show you how to optimize vector search by integrating Weaviate, an open-source vector database, with NVIDIA cuVS, a GPU-powered vector search and clustering library that accelerates batch query performance and data ingestion.

We'll examine the architectural distinctions between the CPU-optimized HNSW and GPU-optimized CAGRA graph approximate nearest neighbors (ANN) algorithms, and discuss our implementation journey, including cuVS's dynamic batch support. By the end of this session, you'll be equipped with practical knowledge on pairing Weaviate with the GPU. This includes implementing hybrid CPU/GPU architectures, leveraging index conversion capabilities, and scaling AI systems to meet the growing demands of the future.

title: Orion: Fuzzing Workflow Automation [P74387]
abstract: "Fuzzing" is an automated software testing technique essential for detecting security vulnerabilities, effectively identifying over 100,000 bugs across the industry. While fuzzing has proven effective in uncovering critical issues, software teams often face challenges when implementing the fuzzing process. Teams must spend significant time identifying targets for fuzzing and creating test harnesses with initial inputs. Finally, engineering teams must analyze and fix issues detected by fuzzing. We created an automated fuzzing solution that leverages LLMs for the codebase analysis to identify optimal fuzzing targets, generating precise fuzzing test harnesses and initial seed inputs. Our solution automates the reproduction of bugs discovered during fuzzing and generates patches for the affected code. We achieved significant improvements across all targeted areas, demonstrating the effectiveness of integrating LLMs and automatic code analysis into the fuzzing process.

title: Overcome Challenges in Multi-Agentic AI Application Development With an AI Data Platform (Presented by Couchbase) [S74348]
abstract: AI agents represent a transformational shift for applications and developers, but technical barriers such as trustworthiness, scalability, and manageability hinder adoption. Learn how Capella Agent Catalog and Model Service with NVIDIA NIM and NeMo microservices solve these challenges by enabling developers to streamline multi-agent applications, debug interactions, and improve tool discovery. Discover how NeMo Guardrails ensures content safety and prevents vulnerabilities, while the Capella Data Platform provides short-term and long-term memory for enhanced personalization and contextual responses. Gain insights from real-world examples, like how telco customer service agents avoid costly errors, and see how the NVIDIA AI platform powers production-grade agentic retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) applications with unparalleled performance and accuracy.

title: Own Your AI: Building an Open-Source AI Strategy [S73262]
abstract: The release of DeepSeek R1 was a breakthrough moment for AI, showing that open-source models can match—and even surpass—proprietary models like OpenAI and Anthropic on key benchmarks like logical reasoning and code generation. This was a watershed moment that shook the entire AI industry because it proved that open models could now be a viable alternative against proprietary models. Every company now needs to ask itself: What is my open-source AI strategy?

title: Pathogenic or Benign? AI-Powered Predictions in Genomic Variant Classification [P73461]
abstract: Discover how NVIDIA GPUs accelerate both AI and quantum computing to transform genetic variant analysis to detect pathogenic mutations with enhanced precision. We'll explore how NVIDIA GPUs optimized model training, significantly improving the accuracy of identifying disease-causing mutations. We'll dive into the acceleration of quantum computing and amino acid large language models (LLMs) with NVIDIA cuQuantum and NVIDIA BioNeMo to drive advancements in genetic diagnostics and precision medicine.

title: Paving the Way for Data Center Networking With Zero-Tail Latency [CWE71413]
abstract:
Just as critical to the performance of AI model training, tail latency can negatively affect real-time AI inference, financial trading, and large-scale data analytics, where even microsecond delays can affect outcomes. The approach to zero-tail latency and accelerated networking with enhanced programmable I/O represent a paradigm shift in the performance and scalability of modern computing infrastructures. This session will open the discussion to dive into the significance of accelerated networking technologies in delivering zero-tail latency, ensuring that every data transfer meets demanding performance requirements even beyond 100k GPU scale.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: PDFSpeak: Unlocking Multimodal PDF Intelligence Through Speech [DLIT71304]
abstract:
Gain next-level insights from PDF documents just by speaking to your data. This hands-on session shows participants how to build and run PDFSpeak, an innovative approach to interacting with complex PDF documents using NVIDIA's cutting-edge AI technologies through speech, vision, and text.
Prerequisite(s):

GitHub, Docker, Bash, familiarity with Python.

title: Peering Into the Future: What AI and Graph Networks Can Mean for the Future of Financial Analysis [S74726]
abstract: Artificial Intelligence, agentic systems, and graph neural networks (GNNs) are providing the new frontier to assess, monitor, and estimate opportunities and risks across work portfolios within financial services. Although many of these technologies are still developing, organizations are eager to understand their potential. See how S&P Global and NVIDIA are working together to find practical ways to learn and integrate such capabilities, ranging from forecasting corporate debt issuance to understanding capital markets at a deeper level. We'll show a graph representation of market data using the PyTorch-Geometric library and a dataset of issuances spanning three decades and across financial and non-financial industries. Technical developments include generation of a bipartite graph and link-prediction GNN forecasting. We'll address data preprocessing, pipelines, model training, and how these technologies can broaden capabilities in an increasingly complex world.

abstract: Discover Pegatron's groundbreaking high-density GPU rack solution, leveraging the NVIDIA platform to revolutionize AI infrastructure. title: Perceptor: A Generative AI Assistant for SREs and IT Incident Managers [P73567]
abstract:
Problem:
Site reliability engineers (SREs) and incident resolvers rely on a multiple data sources and need the information at their fingertips when an incident is declared.

Solution:
Perceptor is a generative AI agent with Slack and web interfaces that brings automation, natural language query capabilities, and increased efficiency to traditional IT asset management and incident response workflows. 

Outcome:
Reduces mean time-to-resolution by bringing context and intelligence directly to the field. Automates time-consuming manual labor such as summarizing incidents, scanning through logs, and generating reports. Provides a single entry point interface using natural language to query various data sources.

abstract:

Site reliability engineers (SREs) and incident resolvers rely on a multiple data sources and need the information at their fingertips when an incident is declared.

Solution:
Perceptor is a generative AI agent with Slack and web interfaces that brings automation, natural language query capabilities, and increased efficiency to traditional IT asset management and incident response workflows. 

Outcome:
Reduces mean time-to-resolution by bringing context and intelligence directly to the field. Automates time-consuming manual labor such as summarizing incidents, scanning through logs, and generating reports. Provides a single entry point interface using natural language to query various data sources.

title: Performance Analysis and Optimization [CWE72456]
abstract:
Learn from NVIDIA experts how to program and optimize for GPUs and get all your questions answered. Discover profiling workflows with NVIDIA Nsight tools and how to achieve maximum performance on NVIDIA’s platform. Connect with experts and fellow users alike and share your experience.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Performance-Optimized CUDA Kernels for Inference With Small Transformer Models [S73168]
abstract: At Oxford Nanopore Technologies, we use transformer models to process signal data generated by our DNA sequencers. These models are similar to popular LLMs, although they are much smaller. Reduced size comes with different challenges to get optimum performance out of the GPU. We develop our own CUDA kernels and tune them for performance on our target architectures. We'll explain the Why and How of our approach.

title: Performance Tuning of LLMs for Scalable GPU Confidential Computing [P73618]
abstract: Explore the factors that affect end-to-end use-case performance of confidential computing (CC) workloads based on large language models (LLMs) and generative AI (GenAI) applications. Delve into multiple dimensions that determine the performance of CC use cases executed in hardware-based trusted execution environments spanning the CPU, GPU, the network, and full-stack CC software. See quantified results for a range of use-cases, including LLM fine-tuning and inference optimized for GPU-accelerated CC platforms on Blackwell.

title: Petascale Storage Integrated Platforms for AI Clusters (Presented by Supermicro) [S74296]
abstract: Supermicro presents a high-performance attached storage fabric for AI clusters to meet the expanding needs of modern AI data centers. Supermicro proposes an all-flash petascale data lake architecture to support a heterogeneous mix of AI applications, support unstructured and structured data, and deliver the highest possible application performance.

abstract: Supermicro presents a high-performance attached storage fabric for AI clusters to meet the expanding needs of modern AI data centers. Supermicro proposes an all-flash petascale data lake architecture to support a heterogeneous mix of AI applications, support unstructured and structured data, and deliver the highest possible application performance.

title: Photo-Realistic 3D Digital Twin to Enhance Understanding of the Great Barrier Reef [P73521]
abstract: Explore how AI-powered 3D digital twin technology, Reef-NeRF (Neural Radiance Field) and Reef-3DGS (3G Gaussian Splatting), is revolutionizing our ability to accurately model and monitor the Great Barrier Reef. Discover how these innovations can enhance coral reef recovery efforts and improve our understanding of climate change impacts on these vital ecosystems.

title: Photo-Realistic 3D Digital Twin to Enhance Understanding of the Great Barrier Reef [P73521]
abstract: Explore how AI-powered 3D digital twin technology, Reef-NeRF (Neural Radiance Field) and Reef-3DGS (3G Gaussian Splatting), is revolutionizing our ability to accurately model and monitor the Great Barrier Reef. title: Photorealistic Digital Twin at Scale in Product Design [S73051]
abstract: Teamcenter photorealistic visualization, powered by NVIDIA Omniverse, is now generally available, enabling companies to create photorealistic, physics-based digital twins of their products while eliminating workflow waste and errors. This breakthrough solution bridges the gap to AI-enabled digital twins, empowering companies to accelerate product development, enhance data-driven decision-making, and seamlessly integrate real-world and digital processes. With standards-based interoperability and robust data exchange, Teamcenter X enables engineering teams and developers to collaborate at scale, driving innovation in industrial applications. Join us to see how this cutting-edge platform is transforming the future of industrial digitalization.

title: Physical AI for the Next Frontier of Industrial Digitalization [S73232]
abstract:
The world’s largest industries are racing to become software-defined, using the latest advancements in AI and simulation technologies to transform their enterprises. Hear from this panel of distinguished luminaries about their journeys to industrial digitalization. Learn how they're leveraging generative AI, open data frameworks, and advanced digital twins to unlock new possibilities across their organizations, from accelerated planning to a new era of agentic-AI powered autonomous operations.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Pioneering AI Assistants in Banking [S72736]
abstract: Hear about the large-scale implementation of “S-AIPilot.” Learn how one of the first custom-made personal AI assistants, operated in-house and designed specifically for the employee workplace of the Savings Banks, was deployed 100% on-premises. Discover the benefits of the AI operating within Finanz Informatik (FI)’s own data center and understand the complexities and importance of integrating with the core banking system. This enabled contextually relevant support while ensuring data privacy and compliance. Explore the architecture, security measures, scalability of the AI infrastructure, and data integrity practices from one of the largest generative AI deployments worldwide, powered by NVIDIA GPUs.

title: Pioneering AI in Higher Education: Accessible Learning and Future-Proofing Universities [S73443]
abstract: Join us for a dynamic panel discussion with esteemed executives from top universities. We'll explore the transformative power of AI in higher education. Discover how these leading institutions are harnessing AI to enhance accessibility, innovate teaching methods, and future-proof their curricula. Dive into real-world case studies, emerging trends, and best practices for integrating AI into academia. This session is a must-attend for educators, administrators, and tech enthusiasts eager to shape the future of learning.

title: Pioneering Automated EV Battery Recycling: Leverage Synthetic Data and Reinforcement Learning for Sustainable Disassembly [P72740]
abstract: We present an innovative approach to automated electric vehicle (EV) battery disassembly, leveraging synthetic data generation and reinforcement learning (RL) to overcome challenges in sustainable recycling. The solution is designed to increase the recovery rate of valuable materials, reduce energy consumption, and mitigate risks such as thermal runaway. The system incorporates a dual-camera setup for real-time robot-vision interaction, facilitating accurate 6D pose estimation of battery components. A digital twin environment was created using NVIDIA Omniverse to train detection models and RL-based disassembly skills. Our approach achieved high detection and pose estimation accuracy, as well as successful sim-to-real transfer of robotic skills.

title: Pioneering Construction Innovation with Omniverse [S73809]
abstract: Discover how you can leverage NVIDIA Omniverse to revolutionize building and infrastructure projects, tackling important industry challenges. Building information modeling (BIM) enhanced project efficiency by standardizing use cases such as multi-discipline coordination, visualization, work phasing, and quantity extraction. Now, NVIDIA Omniverse is pushing the boundaries of BIM, enhancing design workflows, fostering collaboration, and improving safety by creating a unified platform connecting BIM, internet of things, site data, computer vision, geographic information system, and other emerging technologies. Learn how this unified platform is already transforming the construction industry:  leveraging OpenUSD and synthetic data generation, we can create realistic assets and hazardous situations to train vision models used to monitor construction sites to check safety rules and improve safety for the workers.

title: Pioneering the Future of CPG with Digital Twins [S72856]
abstract:
For over a decade, PepsiCo has been using cutting edge technology, driving innovation across the company.  Now, PepsiCo is deploying NVIDIA Omniverse and NVIDIA AI Enterprise in their distribution centers. 

Join us for a special fireside session featuring PepsiCo’s EVP and Chief Strategy and Transformation Officer, Athina Kanioura, and NVIDIA’s Vice President and General Manager of AI for Retail & CPG, Azita Martin.  
Learn how PepsiCo has built and deployed a physics-based digital twin of its warehouse, combined with Generative AI and computer vision to simulate and optimize operations in distribution centers — improving throughput and transforming operations from planning to production. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Pioneering the Future of Data Platforms for the Era of Generative AI [S71650]
abstract:
In the era of generative AI, retrieval augmented generation (RAG) is emerging as a vital tool, enabling enterprises to capitalize on their data. As data evolves and volumes grow exponentially, traditional storage solutions can no longer meet the rigorous demands of enterprise AI systems. GenAI inferencing has become a rack-scale computing workload, necessitating robust, enterprise-grade infrastructure. Discover how NVIDIA is collaborating with storage trailblazers to create a new class of accelerated data platforms — optimized for GenAI workloads and real-time RAG pipelines. Powering these next-generation systems are NVIDIA GPUs, high-performance NVIDIA networking, NVIDIA NIMs, and an AI-native data ingestion stack, delivering efficient pre-processing, storage, and retrieval at unprecedented speeds. Explore the innovations that are redefining enterprise data platforms and shaping the future of GenAI.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Pioneering the Future of Radar Systems and Wireless Communications Optimization With Synthetic Data on Demand (Ansys Perceive EM + NVIDIA Omniverse) [P72713]
abstract:
Ansys Perceive EM is a highly performant, physical optics-based shooting and bouncing rays (SBR) technology deployed through a lightweight API that integrates into new or existing simulation workflows as a high-fidelity physics simulation engine. Ansys Perceive EM offers physics-accurate wireless channel modeling for on-demand synthetic channel data generation. This technology allows electromagnetic (EM) simulation of near-field radar (including automotive radar) and radio frequency (RF) communications (e.g., 5G/6G) scenarios.

NVIDIA GPU technology is a game-changer for this solver to deliver engineering insights in record time. Integration with NVIDIA Aerial Omniverse digital twin, a real-time 3D graphics collaboration platform, empowers users to tackle a wide range of design challenges, from factory-level to planetary-level simulations.

title: Pioneering the Future of Radar Systems and Wireless Communications Optimization With Synthetic Data on Demand (Ansys Perceive EM + NVIDIA Omniverse) [P72713]
abstract:
Ansys Perceive EM is a highly performant, physical optics-based shooting and bouncing rays (SBR) technology deployed through a lightweight API that integrates into new or existing simulation workflows as a high-fidelity physics simulation engine. Ansys Perceive EM offers physics-accurate wireless channel modeling for on-demand synthetic channel data generation. title: Polymathic AI: Building Foundation Models for Science  [S72260]
abstract:
Foundation models like GPT-4 have dramatically altered the modern work landscape for many industries reliant on language tasks, but no equivalent model exists yet for scientific applications. Incorporating foundation models into research workflows could enable unprecedented discoveries that connect traditionally distinct scientific sub-disciplines. However, mainstream foundation models trained on human-scale datasets will be insufficient for analyzing most scientific phenomena — a foundation model for science will require special consideration for the requirements of scientific datasets, especially those with wide dynamic ranges. 

We'll introduce the Polymathic AI initiative: our goal is to accelerate the development of versatile foundation models tailored for numerical datasets and scientific machine learning tasks. Our challenge is to build AI models that leverage information from heterogeneous datasets and across different scientific fields.

title: Poster Reception [N74787]
abstract: The evening will kick off with a special address by Bill Dally, Chief Scientist and Senior Vice President of Research at NVIDIA. Enjoy a selection of drinks and delicious appetizers while exploring a collection of captivating posters.

title: Powering AI with QCT - Explore the Total Solutions for Tomorrow’s AI-Driven Business (Presented by QCT) [S74064]
abstract: In this session, QCT will unveil its groundbreaking servers powered by NVIDIA’s latest technologies. Explore how QCT maximizes performance of large-scale GPU clusters with optimized system designs, user-friendly modularity, superior cooling, and unmatched networking and storage expansions. Uncover QCT’s comprehensive solutions spanning from servers to rack solutions with air and liquid cooling options, including QCT’s stand-alone liquid cooling rack compatible with diverse QCT products. With QCT, enterprises can explore the most suitable solutions for their business applications, creating the most powerful infrastructure for their operations.

title: Powering the AI Revolution – Innovating and Accelerating Critical Physical Infrastructure for AI Factories (Presented by Vertiv) [S74243]
abstract:
As AI workloads grow in scale, complexity, and intensity, the demand for high-density, scalable, and rapidly deployable power and cooling infrastructure has never been greater. But challenges like power availability, permitting delays, infrastructure densification, and the need for dynamic, AI-specific solutions threaten to slow progress.

Join us for a cutting-edge discussion on the next generation of AI-ready infrastructure, from power-efficient architectures to liquid cooling breakthroughs, and discover how we can future-proof AI factories for demands of tomorrow.

title: Powering the AI Revolution – Innovating and Accelerating Critical Physical Infrastructure for AI Factories (Presented by Vertiv) [S74243]
abstract:
As AI workloads grow in scale, complexity, and intensity, the demand for high-density, scalable, and rapidly deployable power and cooling infrastructure has never been greater. But challenges like power availability, permitting delays, infrastructure densification, and the need for dynamic, AI-specific solutions threaten to slow progress.

Join us for a cutting-edge discussion on the next generation of AI-ready infrastructure, from power-efficient architectures to liquid cooling breakthroughs, and discover how we can future-proof AI factories for demands of tomorrow.

title: Power Sustainable AI Clouds With Advanced Networking [S74316]
abstract:
AI is transforming industries and driving solutions to some of the world’s most pressing challenges. To support this growing demand, the infrastructure powering AI must also evolve — with a focus on sustainability and energy efficiency. In this joint session, NVIDIA and Crusoe will discuss how advanced networking solutions are enabling a new era of AI-driven innovation.

Discover how Crusoe leverages NVIDIA’s accelerated networking platforms to build a sustainable AI cloud that delivers high performance while minimizing energy consumption. Learn how Crusoe’s vertically integrated infrastructure, powered by innovative energy sources and NVIDIA’s networking technology, combines enterprise-class controls, scalability, and sustainability to meet the demands of next-generation AI workloads.

title: Power the Next Wave of AI with Real-Time Runtime Security [S71642]
abstract:
As generative AI revolutionizes industries, it also brings unique security challenges that traditional defenses fail to address. Containerization, a cornerstone of AI workloads, enables repeatable and consistent deployment across platforms but also introduces security risks that demand innovative solutions.

Discover a cutting-edge DPU-powered solution to securing NVIDIA NIMs and other containerized AI workloads. Leveraging live memory forensics, this solution detects and stops threats in real time. Operating independently of the host, it creates a tamper-proof trust domain to safeguard every AI node. Purpose-built for modern AI factories and cloud data centers, it isolates malicious activity, identifies attack vectors targeting network-facing services, and delivers actionable forensic insights — all without compromising performance. Learn how this next-generation security framework redefines cybersecurity for cloud-native AI environments, delivering unmatched speed, agility, and trust for the next frontier of innovation.

title: Predicting Disease Outcomes for Multiple Sclerosis: A Vision-Language Model and Federated Learning Approach [P73540]
abstract:
The use of large vision-language models (VLMs) is being explored for various healthcare applications, including clinical research support and treatment recommendations. However, their potential to assist with complex clinical tasks under real-world constraints — such as privacy-preserving clinical environments — remain underexplored.

Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a chronic, inflammatory, and demyelinating disease of the central nervous system, often resulting in progressive neurodegeneration and disability. Accurate prediction of disease progression is crucial for delivering personalized care and ultimately enhancing long-term outcomes for individuals living with MS.

In this work, we assess the feasibility of using a VLM to predict the progression of MS disability. Our approach explores the potential of leveraging multimodal data for enhanced predictive accuracy and evaluates the suitability of VLM within privacy-preserving clinical settings.

title: Prepare for Agentic AI With Modular, Energy-Efficient Hybrid AI Factories (Presented by Lenovo) [S74338]
abstract: Lower the barriers to return on investment from AI with the potential for functional and vertical AI agents to enable humans to achieve more and be more productive. Building, integrating, and scaling agentic AI across business locations and workplaces requires a factory-type approach powered by validated AI solutions including AI infrastructure, devices, data, software, and models. The Lenovo Hybrid AI Advantage with NVIDIA helps customers to improve productivity, agility, and trust through faster deployment of industrialized AI agents and applications enabled by the Lenovo AI Library and our jointly developed full-stack AI portfolio. We'll provide real-world examples of how Lenovo and NVIDIA are helping customers innovate more sustainably and use AI for good through the deployment of AI agents enabled by NVIDIA AI Enterprise, NVIDIA Blueprints, energy-efficient hybrid AI factories, validated AI solutions like computer vision, and more.

title: Preparing for the Future: Automotive Memory and Storage Requirements (Presented by SK hynix) [S74033]
abstract: The automotive memory industry is evolving rapidly, driven by advancements in technology and stringent quality standards. At the forefront of this transformation, it's crucial to provide memory and storage solutions that align with the demand of the industry. We'll explore the key requirements of the automotive sector, focusing on aspects such as quality and safety assurance, reliable supportability, and the importance of technical collaboration. Additionally, we'll highlight our readiness as a memory and storage provider to meet these needs, introducing our diverse portfolio designed for automotive applications.

title: Preserving a Medieval Tower in Italy Using a Digital Twin Built With NVIDIA Omniverse [S72962]
abstract: The Garisenda Tower, located in Bologna, Italy, is one of most famous medieval towers. Similarly to the Tower of Pisa, the Garisenda Tower leans at about a 4-degree angle, requiring constant monitoring. In 2023, unusual movements were detected, leading to the tower being classified as "high risk" for collapse. To improve monitoring in this complex scenario, a digital 3D twin of the monument was developed using NVIDIA Omniverse, in collaboration with the Municipality of Bologna, the University of Bologna, and CINECA. This virtual 3D replica enables a comprehensive understanding of the tower's condition and helps anticipate critical scenarios, allowing for the planning of appropriate countermeasures. Real-time data streams generated by numerous sensors are integrated in the centralized platform for data visualization, and predictive modeling, to develop targeted, efficient strategies to ensure the tower's long-term stability and safety.

title: Pretraining of Foundation Large Language Models for Ecommerce [S72589]
abstract: We explore the pretraining of large language models (LLMs) specifically for application in the ecommerce domain.  Throughout the presentation, we touch on all aspects of model development: from data acquisition and processing, through large-scale distributed model training, to devising and performing domain-specific evaluations.  Finally, based on our experimental findings, we discuss the advantages and disadvantages of pretraining LLMs from scratch versus adapting an existing model.

title: Productionize LLMs for Quantitative Analysis of Market Risk: An Exploratory Attempt [S73818]
abstract:
Learn how Barclays uses the NeMo Retriever framework to interpret vast, unstructured financial data — such as earnings reports and regulatory filings — and identify signals relevant to market risk. These models can retrieve specific, real-time market data from large repositories, allowing analysts to generate risk scenarios grounded in up-to-date quantitative data. We also use the NeMo framework to fine-tune general-purpose LLMs, such as Llama 3.1 8B, to our set of hand-curated question-answer pairs to improve accuracy in information extraction pertaining to the modeling of market risk.
 
We run both NeMo and NeMo Retriever on our on-premises GPUs, since the critical nature of the data means our retrieval-augmented generation framework can't be hosted on any cloud services. We'll highlight the latency, throughput, and accuracy improvements obtained by using NVIDIA’s software, as well as the time saved to our market risk analysts.

title: Productionizing GenAI Models: Lessons from the world's best AI teams [S72489]
abstract:
Weights & Biases co-founder and CEO Lukas Biewald will discuss the trends and challenges leading enterprises are encountering when moving a generative AI (GenAI)-powered workflow from proof of concept to production. He'll also cover best practices enterprises are leveraging, including how to best evaluate the performance of the application and optimize the cost to maximize return on investment. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Production-Scale Generative AI for Science at NERSC [S72108]
abstract: The National Energy Research Scientific Computing Center (NERSC) at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory provides advanced supercomputers and extensive expertise to meet the growing computational demands of scientific AI workflows. We'll describe our strategy for supporting this maturing workload, share updates on some cutting-edge generative AI projects, and present recent studies in scaling and performance modeling of foundation models for science.

title: Production-Scale Generative AI for Science at NERSC [S72108]
abstract: The National Energy Research Scientific Computing Center (NERSC) at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory provides advanced supercomputers and extensive expertise to meet the growing computational demands of scientific AI workflows. We'll describe our strategy for supporting this maturing workload, share updates on some cutting-edge generative AI projects, and present recent studies in scaling and performance modeling of foundation models for science.

title: Profile Large Language Model Trainings on the Grace Hopper Superchip [S72967]
abstract: As LLMs continue to grow in size and demand, there's an increasing need to maximize the efficiency of available computational resources during training. This is particularly important with the introduction of new architectures like the NVIDIA Grace Hopper (GH) superchip. The training process must be optimized for the specific GPUs being utilized, especially when dealing with cutting-edge hardware. We'll explain the essential steps for profiling a workload to fine-tune an LLM on GH100 using the NeMo Framework for the training and NSight Systems for the profiling part. We'll guide you through the initial setup, teach you how to interpret and analyze the results obtained from code profiling, and help you discover various methods to enhance the efficiency of LLM training.

title: Profiling Hybrid CUDA/Graphics Applications using Nsight Graphics [S73224]
abstract: In this session, you'll learn how to use NVIDIA Nsight Graphics to profile applications that combine the use of CUDA and graphics APIs , including ray tracing and AI-enhanced workloads, focusing on optimizing performance across compute and graphics tasks. We’ll explore the connection between high-level CUDA C, shader code (HLSL, GLSL), and GPU hardware concepts, while inspecting performance traces of CUDA, DirectX, Vulkan, and NVIDIA SDK calls. By the end of the session, you’ll be better equipped to identify and resolve performance bottlenecks at both the source code and GPU assembly (SASS) levels, ensuring your applications run with maximum efficiency.

title: Profiling Hybrid CUDA/Graphics Applications using Nsight Graphics [S73224]
abstract: In this session, you'll learn how to use NVIDIA Nsight Graphics to profile applications that combine the use of CUDA and graphics APIs , including ray tracing and AI-enhanced workloads, focusing on optimizing performance across compute and graphics tasks. title: Programming Blackwell Tensor Cores with CUTLASS [S72720]
abstract: The release of CUTLASS 3.8 enables programmers to write optimized Tensor Core kernels for the NVIDIA Blackwell architecture. This session provides an overview of both the new features in the Blackwell architecture and the complementary CuTe + CUTLASS capability. We'll conclude with an in-depth example of how to construct a performant GEMM kernel using CUTLASS.

title: Programming Blackwell Tensor Cores with CUTLASS [S72720]
abstract: The release of CUTLASS 3.8 enables programmers to write optimized Tensor Core kernels for the NVIDIA Blackwell architecture. title: Promoting SSD Utilization in RAG Systems (Presented by KIOXIA) [S74249]
abstract: As AI systems become more effective with more and better data, DRAM costs increase as memory requirements grow.  KIOXIA has developed a way to scale vector databases, while reducing DRAM use and cost, with the use of flash memory and open-source software.
date_time: Understand why DRAM use significantly drives up AI system costs

title: Protect and Control Your AI Applications (Presented by Cloudflare) [EXS74302]
abstract: Traditional security tools weren't built for the AI age. Step into the future of AI security as we unveil Cloudflare's integrated approach to AI protection. Learn how leading enterprises are combining AI gateway controls for cost management, firewall rules for prompt injections, and AI scraper bot protection from scraping and training on your data.

title: Protein AI applications Using BioNemo for Agricultural Biotech Traits [S72587]
abstract: Protein folding modeling is a key step in designing and evaluating new molecules. Corteva Agriscience has been using this technique to explore designs of new fungicides, herbicides, insecticides, and other seed treatments, and to create new seeds with high yield and disease-resistant properties. Corteva uses ESMFold and DiffDock for these computations. In a recent benchmarking exercise, Corteva used  NVIDIA NIMs for ESMFold and DiffDock to compare their current open-source based deployment to NVIDIA NIMs and found that the speed up was 11.778X faster than the open-source-based deployment on A100. There are further opportunities to improve the speedup with implementation of batch processing, like the open-source implementation.

title: Pushing Spectral Efficiency Limits on CUDA-accelerated 5G/6G RAN  [S72990]
abstract:
The demand for mobile broadband continues to grow, and correspondingly the radio access networks (RAN) delivering it are asked to support an extraordinary rate of innovation. 

RAN-based on software-defined platforms are of key importance in enabling such a rate of innovation sustainably. Among all software-defined platforms, the one based on the GPU allows for the introduction of complex algorithms to pursue new levels of spectral efficiency. This is both to the ease with which the GPU can be programmed and their computational efficiency. 

Moreover, GPU-based 5G and 6G RAN stacks can run coherently with the code of a new class of simulation tools: digital twins. The efficiency with which the GPU can run both physics simulation chains as well as the 5G/6G RAN stack enable simulations to reach new scales and levels of accuracy. Such simulation environments, in turn, enable the creation and the detailed characterization of new algorithms.

In this talk, we will demonstrate how a series of key algorithms that make use of the GPU computational power allow us to push the boundary of system spectral efficiency. The characterization is performed in a digital twin environment, where the radio environment is closely resembling the field.

title: Put AI Agents to Work for People (Presented by ServiceNow) [S74232]
abstract: As the convergence of generative AI and accelerated computing takes center stage, ServiceNow and NVIDIA stand at the forefront of this revolution. By taking an innovative approach to AI agents using advanced reasoning grounded in cross‑enterprise data through the Now Platform, ServiceNow can advance the industry beyond prompting, to agents that can comprehend and interpret context, break down complex outcomes into smaller tasks, prioritize them, plan actions, and execute strategies to achieve desired results with built-in guardrails. From reshaping enterprise operations to enhancing productivity and streamlining workflows across industries, the potential is huge! Join us to discover the transformative potential of Agentic AI for your business.

title: Quality Inspection of Casting Aluminum Parts Using Augmented Reality and Deep Learning [P73307]
abstract: Aluminum alloys are essential in industries like automotive due to their strength, low density, and corrosion resistance. However, casting defects can compromise the quality of critical components, especially in reflective parts where image noise hinders inspection. Traditional machine vision systems improve accuracy but are limited in detecting defects in hard-to-reach areas and reflective parts. This work presents an inspection system using augmented reality (AR) goggles integrated with deep learning for real-time defect detection. AR enables operators to manipulate parts, counteract reflections, and inspect areas beyond the reach of conventional systems. Integrating AR googles with systems like NVIDIA IGX edge computing shows promise for enhancing interactivity, real-time defect tracking, and faster inference, offering more efficient, accurate, and intuitive inspections.

title: Quantize Large Transformer Diffusion Models to Improve End-to-End Latencies and Save Inference Cost [S72556]
abstract:
The emergence of diffusion models enables new creative workflows for artists, but their resource-intensive nature poses significant deployment challenges. With state-of-the-art image diffusion requiring tens of seconds per image, the computational cost of video diffusion is even more substantial.
We'll showcase the path from research to production-ready TensorRT deployment, leveraging the latest fp8 tensor cores on H100. Not only does this save inference cost, but it also increases the number of users that can be served per GPU. We'll provide in-depth insights into the performance and quality complexities of deploying a quantized diffuser on Adobe’s example. This presentation is ideal for AI researchers and software engineers looking to optimize diffusion model deployment on any NVIDIA GPUs.

title: Quantum Computing Meets AI: A Journey with CUDA-Q [DLIT71557]
abstract:
Embark on an exploration with CUDA-Q and learn how to use it to bring together quantum algorithms with machine learning and generative AI to elevate quantum computing. This hands-on session facilitates smooth navigation between classical and quantum domains, driving innovation in hybrid quantum-classical computing.
Prerequisite(s):

Python programming.
Basic knowledge of quantum computing.
Fundamentals of AI (including GenAI).

title: RA-Agent: A Human-Centered LLM-Based Agent for Enhanced Academic Research Support [P73526]
abstract: Large language models (LLMs) have transformed academic research, but often require excessive user interaction and produce outputs lacking natural fluency. We introduce RA-Agent, a human-centered research assistant designed to enhance academic productivity through integrated functionalities including document translation, summarization, text refinement, and innovation review. RA-Agent incorporates retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and domain-specific recognition to deliver outputs that closely mirror human-written content. Through comprehensive user studies with 60 participants across diverse academic backgrounds, we demonstrate that RA-Agent significantly outperforms GPT-4o baseline in output quality, user satisfaction, and system usability. Our results show superior performance across all tasks, with notably higher consistency with human evaluations and improved task completion efficiency.

title: Rack-Scale to Data Center-Scale AI Building Block Solutions (Presented by Supermicro) [S74306]
abstract: AI has led to a rethinking of data center IT infrastructure: functional units of compute have moved beyond rack-scale to data center-scale. Supermicro presents its Data Center Building Block Solution, building up from the system node level to the rack cluster level to the data center level. Supermicro presents best practices for optimizing data center resources, including space, power, and water utilization to deliver return on investment. Join his session to gain game-changing perspectives on building efficient, future-ready AI systems.

title: Rapid Application Development Using Large Language Models (LLMs) [DLIW73637]
abstract:
Most enterprises need to perform multiple language-related tasks every day. This includes organizing documents based on common themes (text classification), writing emails (content generation), removing harmful posts from their online communities (toxicity classification), and much more. Applications powered by LLMs can help enterprises automate these and many other tasks, letting them streamline their operations, decrease expenses, and increase productivity. Alternatively, enterprises can use large language model-powered apps to provide innovative and improved services to clients or strengthen customer relationships. For example, providing customer support with AI companions or using sentiment analysis apps to extract valuable customer insights.
You’ll learn about:

The intuitions and best practices underlying LLM architectures and systems, including transformers and context insertion.
Techniques to apply state-of-the-art language models to problems spanning vanilla classification, novel content generation, and image/audio reasoning.
Engineering and abstraction practices to work with and keep up with the evolving LLM ecosystem, including HuggingFace and LangChain offerings.

You’ll also have a deep understanding of the modern LLM ecosystem, the architectures and design choices that power the models, and the techniques necessary to build your own LLM-powered applications with a well-informed and responsible strategy.

Prerequisite(s):

Professional experience with the Python programming language.
Familiarity with fundamental deep learning topics like model architecture, training, and inference.
Familiarity with a modern Python-based deep learning framework, preferably PyTorch.


Certificate: Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth

title: RapidDock: Unlock Proteome-Scale Molecular Docking [P74400]
abstract: Accelerating molecular docking — the process of predicting how molecules bind to protein targets — could boost small-molecule drug design and revolutionize medicine. Our poster showcases RapidDock, a transformer-based docking model that is over 100 times faster than previous state-of-the-art solutions and enables high-throughput in silico experiments for faster drug design.

title: RapidDock: Unlock Proteome-Scale Molecular Docking [P74400]
abstract: Accelerating molecular docking — the process of predicting how molecules bind to protein targets — could boost small-molecule drug design and revolutionize medicine. title: RAPIDS in 2025: Accelerated Data Science Everywhere [S73290]
abstract:
RAPIDS open source library suite is the foundation for accelerated AI and data science workloads. It supports dataframes, machine learning, graph analytics, vector databases, and LLM-based workflows. In this session, NVIDIA technical leaders will walk data scientists and engineers through new features, zero code change interfaces, powerful optimizations and give a peek at what’s around the corner.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Realize the Promise of AI Agents as a Workforce Multiplier in Cybersecurity [S73136]
abstract: AI agents will be workforce multipliers in cybersecurity, boosting analyst productivity and accelerating threat detection and response to drive better outcomes. However, building and scaling agent deployments in a performant, cost-effective, and secure way is critical to realizing the potential of agentic systems. This technical presentation will demonstrate how CrowdStrike works with NVIDIA to deliver always-on, autonomous security agents that tirelessly work to safeguard customers by proactively detecting and automatically triaging suspicious activities in real-time. These agents augment and amplify the abilities of existing security teams, helping them bridge the cybersecurity talent gap to better protect their organizations.

title: Real-Time Enterprise AI Inference, From Data Center to Edge (Presented by Supermicro) [S74304]
abstract: As the AI ecosystem matures, enterprises are transitioning from development to serving real value to end users. To achieve the highest level of service, deploying trained AI models for inference is not a one-size-fits-all solution. Join Supermicro as we present AI inference solutions optimized specifically for the deployment environment and application type, with solutions from the data center to the edge.

title: Real-Time Fault Detection for Railway Surfaces Using Computer Vision (Presented by LTTS) [EXS74393]
abstract: Most rail accidents are caused by derailments. One of the top reasons for derailment is a defect in the track or rolling stock. We'll explain how we can use machine vision, lasers, and inertial measurement units to detect surface faults on railway tracks in real time.

title: Real-Time Mule Account Detection at India Scale [S72798]
abstract: Explore how National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), in partnership with NVIDIA, revolutionized the detection of mule accounts across India's extensive payments network. We'll cover the strategic shift from traditional fraud detection methods to a custom-developed algorithm that uses large matrix multiplication spread across multiple NVIDIA DGX H100s. With billions of transactions flowing through UPI, IMPS, and RuPay, real-time fraud detection was previously tackled using time- and resource-intensive CPU and RAM solutions. Learn how NVIDIA's CuNumeric and Legate-Sparse libraries enabled NPCI to overcome these limitations, providing a high-performance, scalable, and efficient solution at the scale required for India's financial ecosystem.

title: Real-Time Multi-GPU Rendering for Codec Avatars [S72650]
abstract: Learn practical strategies to accelerate and scale real-time, low-latency rendering workloads with multiple GPUs. We'll share examples from building "time machine"-style Codec Avatar virtual reality (VR) experiences, which provide a glimpse into the future of telepresence, and offer ideas on fully leveraging cutting-edge hardware.

title: Real-Time Physical Digital Twins: Leveraging GPU Ports and Omniverse for CAE and Simulation Workflows (Presented by Ansys) [S74599]
abstract:
Learn how Ansys and NVIDIA worked together bringing real-time physical digital twins to the next level, by both porting our solvers to GPU and integrating those solvers into Omniverse — including dataprep, solve, and post-processing — benefiting from the huge and growing ecosystem of partners working with the platform. We'll dive deep into some of the challenges we faced porting our computational fluid dynamics solvers on GPU, as well as provide some technical details about the deep integration into Omniverse, including enriching USD with physics-based schemas, developing a dedicated user interface for dataprep, running our solvers from within Omniverse, and finally post-processing the results efficiently with the computer-aided engineering (CAE) toolkit, as well as custom Hydra RenderDelegate.
 
Ansys continues to be excited with how Vertiv is evolving their advancements in cooling technologies, leveraging the power of real-time physical digital twins along with the Omniverse platform to keep virtual and physical mockups always perfectly correlated.

title: Recognition of Catastrophic Events using Structural Deterioration Patterns in Foundation Models [P73575]
abstract: In disaster management, timely and accurate information is critical for effective decision-making. Satellite imagery provides a vast amount of data, but manual analysis is time-consuming and prone to errors. Our project leverages advanced deep learning models CLIP and SAM to automate disaster type classification and building damage assessment. By integrating these models, we aim to generate comprehensive reports that include disaster types, building coordinates, and their respective damage levels.

title: Redefining Urban Evolution with Gen AI in Palermo, Italy [S71410]
abstract:
Explore the transformative power of video generative AI and video analytics AI agents in smart cities, where advanced neural network architectures analyze hundreds of thousands of video streams in real time to optimize urban management, enhance decision-making, and drive sustainable innovation for both residents and public administrations.

We’ll showcase a customer deployment in the City of Palermo, Italy and into the cutting-edge advancements driving the digital industrial revolution and transforming how to extract, manage, and capitalize complex data in urban settings leveraging NVIDIA GPUs, NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization, VLMs, and NVIDIA Metropolis.

title: Reduce Fraud and Financial Crime With Featurespace ARIC Risk Hub on AWS (Presented by Amazon Web Services) [S74269]
abstract: We'll go over payment fraud prevention and financial crime trends and how financial institutions are leveraging graph databases, LLMs, large transaction models (LTMs), and graph neural networks to increase fraud detection rates. We'll also cover how Featurespace ARIC Risk Hub running on AWS leverages advanced machine learning techniques using NVIDIA accelerated computing to adapt to changing behaviors and new scams, while profiling good and bad data. ARIC Risk Hub uses advanced, explainable anomaly detection to enable financial institutions to automatically identify risk, catch new fraud attacks, and identify suspicious activity in real time. ARIC Risk Hub has processed over 100 billion events per year, resulting in up to 75% of fraud attacks blocked as they occur with a 5:1 false positive ratio.

title: ReFer: Single-Shot Foresight Pruning for Retaining Feature Representation [P73494]
abstract: Fine-tuning and deploying large models incurs significant costs. We propose a foresight pruning technique that reduces these costs by pruning before fine-tuning while retaining feature representations, leading to improved performance.

title: Refreshing Manufacturing Operations at Coca-Cola Consolidated With Digital Twins [S73008]
abstract: Join Sight Machine experts to to explore how Coca-Cola Consolidated, the largest independent Coca-Cola bottler in the United States, is digitalizing manufacturing operations with digital twins. Learn how Coca-Cola Consolidated teams take advantage of real-time monitoring, collaboration, and physically based visualization capabilities, powered by Azure internet of things operations, NVIDIA Omniverse cloud APIs, OpenUSD, and Sight Machine’s manufacturing solutions to gain new insights into production and unlock new possibilities in operations.
