title: Reimagine Customer Service With Agentic AI (Presented by Wipro Limited) [EXS74503]
abstract: Discover the shift from traditional customer service to dynamic, AI-powered interactions where autonomous agents learn, adapt, and collaborate seamlessly with human representatives. Explore how this technology not only enhances customer experiences, but also empowers human agents to focus on complex, high-value interactions, ultimately redefining the future of customer service.

title: Re-Imagine Logistics Through AI-Driven Mapping [S73215]
abstract: Logistics networks for point-to-point movement of consumer goods for companies like Walmart, Kroger, and Loblaw are historically dictated by efficiency calculations on static route mapping, but autonomous vehicle (AV) deployment is helping to rewrite the rules. We'll examine how AVs are not only helping train AI mapping through real-time data, but also safely expanding their operational design domain by integrating AI-driven mapping, ultimately leading to more efficient delivery networks for companies and better service for consumers.

title: Reimagining Business Processes for Manufacturers with AI-Powered Digital Twins [S71662]
abstract: Industrial AI and enterprise data are transforming the way manufacturers buy, sell, manufacture, and service their products and equipment. Join SAP enterprise software experts to explore how we built an AI-powered product recommendation application leveraging OpenUSD and NVIDIA Omniverse. Learn how these advanced technologies are enabling manufacturers to streamline the business process for complex configurable products.

title: Reimagining Business Processes for Manufacturers with AI-Powered Digital Twins [S71662]
abstract: Industrial AI and enterprise data are transforming the way manufacturers buy, sell, manufacture, and service their products and equipment. Join SAP enterprise software experts to explore how we built an AI-powered product recommendation application leveraging OpenUSD and NVIDIA Omniverse. Learn how these advanced technologies are enabling manufacturers to streamline the business process for complex configurable products.

title: Reinventing Smart Manufacturing: How Foxconn Builds and Deploys an AI Workforce [S72841]
abstract: Join us to explore how AI is reshaping the workforce and how Foxconn is leading the charge in the era of agentic and physical AI. Learn how our developers used NVIDIA NeMo and NVIDIA Omniverse SDKs and APIs to build an AI workforce platform that is transforming our manufacturing and operations. We'll share the steps taken, tangible results achieved and the future vision of the Foxconn AI Factory — a fully integrated AI ecosystem driving innovation and efficiency in manufacturing.

title: Reinvent Warehouses and Distribution Centers With AI-Powered Digital Twins (Presented by Accenture) [S74342]
abstract: Join us to explore how KION, Accenture, and NVIDIA are collaborating to modernize supply chains with physical AI-powered digital twins. Learn how advanced AI and simulation technologies streamline facility design, improve productivity, and bring increased agility, safety, and resilience to facility operations.

title: Reinvent Warehouses and Distribution Centers With AI-Powered Digital Twins (Presented by Accenture) [S74342]
abstract: Join us to explore how KION, Accenture, and NVIDIA are collaborating to modernize supply chains with physical AI-powered digital twins. Learn how advanced AI and simulation technologies streamline facility design, improve productivity, and bring increased agility, safety, and resilience to facility operations.

title: Reliable Radiographic Skeletal Muscle Area Assessment: A Biomarker for Cancer Cachexia Diagnosis [P73592]
abstract: Our work presents a deep learning-based pipeline for automated skeletal muscle segmentation, designed to accurately and reliably track muscle loss in cancer patients as a biomarker for cachexia. This research is timely and critical due to the high prevalence of cancer cachexia in certain cancers and its significant impact on patient outcomes. Integrating AI-driven skeletal muscle area (SMA) analysis into clinical workflows meets the urgent need for scalable, precise diagnostic tools to better manage and predict patient prognosis

title: Reliable Radiographic Skeletal Muscle Area Assessment: A Biomarker for Cancer Cachexia Diagnosis [P73592]
abstract: Our work presents a deep learning-based pipeline for automated skeletal muscle segmentation, designed to accurately and reliably track muscle loss in cancer patients as a biomarker for cachexia. This research is timely and critical due to the high prevalence of cancer cachexia in certain cancers and its significant impact on patient outcomes. Integrating AI-driven skeletal muscle area (SMA) analysis into clinical workflows meets the urgent need for scalable, precise diagnostic tools to better manage and predict patient prognosis

title: Reshaping the Future of AI Filmmaking [S72649]
abstract: In the rapidly evolving world of filmmaking, the fusion of AI and digitization is unlocking extraordinary creative possibilities. We'll first exploreg how AI-driven tools — such as Sora, Runway, Kling, Luma Dream Machine, and others — are revolutionizing traditional filmmaking workflows. Next, we’ll illustrate how digitization enhances both directability and visual quality in AI-assisted productions. Using MineStudio, an innovative AI-based filmmaking pipeline, we’ll demonstrate how advanced AI technologies like gaussian splatting, stable diffusion, and style transfer integrate seamlessly into producing diverse film genres, including comedy, sci-fi, horror, documentary, romance, and animation. We welcome developers passionate about AI-driven filmmaking to engage with and contribute to the MineStudio initiative, fostering innovations that will help shape the future of the industry.

title: Resilient, Dynamic, and Optimal Performance for the Next Era of AI [S72772]
abstract: The landscape of AI is evolving rapidly, as we’ve observed with the emergence of physical AI and DeepSeek. While these advances offer immense potential to shape every industry, it also presents unique adoption challenges for enterprises and developers. Join Alexis Bjorlin, VP and GM of NVIDIA DGX Cloud, to explore real-world AI applications, emerging trends, and the cutting-edge of AI development to deployment. Discover how to accelerate impactful outcomes, and future proof your business.

title: Resilient Edge-Cloud Hybrid AI Infrastructure: Orchestrating Multi-Modal Agents in Resource-Constrained Environments (Presented by Lablup) [EXS74187]
abstract: Explore new solutions for building resilient AI infrastructure that seamlessly integrates edge and cloud computing through intelligent orchestration. We'll demonstrate how an eight-node NVIDIA Jetson Nano cluster serves multiple LLMs (including Gemma 2 2B and Llama 3.2 3B) and supports multi-modal AI agents while maintaining cloud GPU integration. Learn how to orchestrate distributed AI systems that process text, images, and sensor data, enabling robust edge computing with cloud failover capabilities. Our implementation shows how to maintain continuous AI operations in air-gapped environments and during network disruptions. Through real-world scenarios, you'll discover how this hybrid architecture provides both local processing reliability and cloud scalability, offering practical solutions for modern AI deployment challenges. We'll share specific deployment strategies and performance optimizations for running sophisticated multi-agent workloads across edge and cloud environments.

title: Rethinking E-Commerce: Build a Multi-Agent Shopping Assistant on Langflow  (Presented by DataStax) [EXS74321]
abstract: Agents are key to bringing your AI platform to life—but how do you get started? Join Kiyu Gabriel, GM, Search & AI at DataStax, to learn how to customize and deploy an agentic shopping assistant using Langflow’s intuitive drag-and-drop interface and the NVIDIA NeMo platform. Discover how Langflow and NVIDIA NeMo streamline the creation of robust, multi-agent solutions, empowering you to build intelligent, scalable systems with ease for e-commerce and beyond. This session is also a preview of the hands-on workshop, Getting Started with Langflow: Build a Multi-Agent Shopping Assistant, where you’ll get hands on and create the same flow demonstrated in this session.

title: Reverse Pitches: VC Pitches for Startups [S74530]
abstract: This isn't a typical pitch session. Join us for a fresh perspective, where investors from innovative venture capital firms pitch their firm and their vision for the future of their industries. Get a firsthand look at what the next wave of startups could look like.

title: Revolutionize AI Infrastructure With ASUS AI POD and Advanced Liquid Cooling (Presented by ASUSTek Computer Inc.) [S74192]
abstract: Explore how ASUS AI POD, empowered by state-of-the-art liquid cooling technology, addresses the challenges of high-performance AI workloads. We'll focus on its innovative architecture, highlighting the total cost of ownership (TCO) benefits, its role in sustainability, and how integrating NVAIE enables enterprises to excel in the AI-driven world. Learn how liquid cooling contributes not only to efficient thermal management, but also supports scalable, sustainable AI infrastructure.

title: Revolutionize Automotive Marketing with Generative AI and Apple Vision Pro [S71855]
abstract: Join Damian Fulmer, Director of Workflow and Technology at Katana, and Mario Viviani, Senior Developer Relations Manager at NVIDIA, for an in-depth presentation on how Katana is transforming marketing asset creation with NVIDIA Omniverse. This session will showcase Katana’s innovative COATcreate tool, powered by Omniverse, and its role in streamlining content creation for industry leaders like Nissan. Discover why Nissan embraced this technology by migrating to OpenUSD and how it has redefined their digital workflows. The presentation will also explore Katana’s integration of Extended Reality (XR) with Apple Vision Pro and the transformative impact of Generative AI on the future of automotive marketing and design.

title: Revolutionize Enterprise and Data Center AI with Advanced GPU Server Solutions (Presented by Pegatron) [S74282]
abstract: Join our insightful session on our cutting-edge AI server and rack solutions designed for enterprises and data centers. Discover the MGX architecture GPU servers that enhance AI training, inference, and data analytics. Learn about the latest GB200 NVL72 rack solution and the newest high-density GPU server rack, optimized for large language model AI training. We'll also explore our efficient and flexible cooling solutions that ensure optimal performance and reliability. Don't miss this opportunity to stay ahead in the AI revolution!

title: Revolutionize Manufacturing: Collaborative Innovations With NVIDIA Omniverse, Cognizant, and Trane Technologies (Presented by Cognizant) [S74522]
abstract: Discover how to revolutionize manufacturing by exploring new techniques with Cognizant, NVIDIA, and Trane Technologies, as we dive deep into enhancing asset health modeling, improving performance with robotics and autonomous mobile robots (AMRs), and driving efficiency and sustainability using NVIDIA Omniverse. Learn how to use collaborative labs and Omniverse to accelerate exploration of cutting-edge technologies to transform your operations, optimize productivity, and create a more sustainable future.
date_time: Innovative Integrations: Learn how to leverage NVIDIA Omniverse and related advanced analytic tools for asset health modeling, robotics, and AMRs to drive cutting-edge manufacturing solutions that connect to existing plant floor standard systems

title: Revolutionize Pedestrian Safety: AI-Powered Crash Worthiness  [S73087]
abstract:
We are excited to present groundbreaking approaches to pedestrian crash simulation, developed in collaboration with Simon Xu, Tech Fellow of Optimization and ML , and his colleagues from General Motors. This engineering project leverages deep learning models trained on NVIDIA A100 GPUs to predict impact physics in seconds, rather than days, significantly accelerating the automotive safety design process.
By integrating AI-driven simulations, engineers can rapidly explore safety-optimized vehicle geometries, setting new benchmarks in crash modeling and predictive safety engineering. General Motors, in collaboration with our team, recognizes both the immense potential of AI and the challenges that must be addressed to fully realize its impact on automotive product design.
A key challenge lies in seamlessly integrating AI models into existing engineering workflows, ensuring they complement decades of engineering expertise while maintaining confidence in real-world applications and consumer trust. AI must also demonstrate consistent, real-time performance across diverse scenarios, particularly in high-accuracy, physics-driven simulations.

title: Revolutionize Supply Chain Analytics With AI and Accelerated Computing (Presented by EY) [S74122]
abstract: Join us for an immersive experience where we show how the EY Supply Chain & Ops Platform, powered by NVIDIA’s accelerated computing and AI capabilities, is transforming our clients’ supply chains. This modern platform increases supply chain resiliency against disruptions and offers timely insights through integration with existing systems.

title: Revolutionize Virtual Production With AI-Powered Ray Tracing [S73751]
abstract: Join Academy Award and Emmy-winning software developer Chaos for a deep dive into Project Arena's architecture for delivering ray-traced content to LED walls in real time. Discover how this groundbreaking system achieves frame-synchronized distributed rendering across multiple GPUs while maintaining production-quality image fidelity. We'll demonstrate the benefits of direct digital content creation (DCC) application integration, handling scenes with trillions of polygons at interactive frame rates, and how AI-powered denoising with NVIDIA DLSS Ray Reconstruction is a game-changer. Using practical examples from the short film "Ray Tracing for the Win," see how Project Arena overcomes traditional virtual production bottlenecks to enable better creative iteration on set and enhance the filmmaking experience.

title: Revolutionizing Antarctic Flora Monitoring With AI and Drones [P73519]
abstract: Learn how we leverage NVIDIA GPUs to power advanced machine learning models for high-precision mapping of Antarctic vegetation using drones and hyperspectral imaging. This innovative approach enables efficient monitoring of fragile ecosystems, demonstrating the transformative potential of GPU-accelerated AI in addressing environmental challenges.

title: Revolutionizing Antarctic Flora Monitoring With AI and Drones [P73519]
abstract: Learn how we leverage NVIDIA GPUs to power advanced machine learning models for high-precision mapping of Antarctic vegetation using drones and hyperspectral imaging. This innovative approach enables efficient monitoring of fragile ecosystems, demonstrating the transformative potential of GPU-accelerated AI in addressing environmental challenges.

title: Revolutionizing Cardiac MRI Analysis and Diagnosis With AI: A Deep Dive into MONAI-Based Cardiac MRI Segmentation [S73347]
abstract:
Cardiac MRI is the gold-standard imaging technique for evaluating many heart conditions, yet it encounters challenges like manual analysis, complexity, and the need for specialized training, which can affect its effectiveness and accessibility. 

Discover how Northwestern University and Quantiphi are revolutionizing cardiac MRI analysis through the integration of MONAI and the Triton Inference Server. We'll showcase a MONAI-based cardiac segmentation model designed to provide faster and more accurate results, ultimately enhancing patient outcomes.

title: Revolutionizing Cardiac MRI Analysis and Diagnosis With AI: A Deep Dive into MONAI-Based Cardiac MRI Segmentation [S73347]
abstract:

title: Revolutionizing Construction Visualizations and Analyses with GeoAI, Radiance Fields, and Gaussian Splatting  [S71236]
abstract:
We'll explore the cutting-edge applications of GeoAI, radiance fields, and Gaussian splatting in the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry. Gain insights into the fundamental differences between traditional photogrammetry and Gaussian splats, and learn how these advanced techniques are transforming the way we visualize and manage construction projects. We'll delve into the process of creating Gaussian splats and discuss their practical uses in construction, from enhancing site surveys to improving safety and collaboration. 
Additionally, discover how GeoAI provides the crucial spatial intelligence that integrates these visualization techniques with real-world geospatial data, creating smarter, location-aware construction workflows.

title: Revolutionizing Healthcare: A Healthcare Language Model for Enhanced Accuracy in Medical Code Extraction (Presented by Cognizant) [S74228]
abstract: Join our architects for an engaging session on leveraging AI to bridge the accuracy gap in medical code extraction. Discover how fine-tuning language models can revolutionize the healthcare industry by enhancing operational efficiency and improving patient care, surpassing the capabilities of retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) models. We'll also delve into innovative techniques that can accurately identify key diagnoses from clinical notes and map them to the correct ICD-10 codes, ensuring precise and consistent medical coding while reducing manual efforts and subjective interpretations.

title: Revolutionizing Merchandising With Digital Twin Tools: Enhancing Retail Strategy and Visualization at Lowe's [S72069]
abstract: Dive into the transformative role of digital twin technology in retail merchandising. Discover how advanced Omniverse-driven technology can create dynamic, data-driven visualizations and simulations of store layouts, product placements, and customer behavior. We'll cover key strategies for optimizing merchandising decisions, reducing time-to-market, enhancing customer engagement, and improving labor optimization using digital twins. Gain insights on how to leverage these tools to drive innovation and efficiency in retail spaces

title: Revolutionizing Mobility through Edge AI: Train as a Robot [S72653]
abstract:
AI at the edge is reshaping human interaction with the physical world. With real-time data processing using advanced AI algorithms, edge AI is driving smarter decision-making, reducing operational costs, and improving experiences across various industrial sectors. This session does a deep dive on how the convergence of AI and edge computing is unlocking new possibilities in the railway industry.

The session details a groundbreaking use case in the rail industry: Hitachi Rail’s HMAX (Hyper Mobility Asset eXpert), accelerated by NVIDIA’s enterprise-grade IGX platform. HMAX technology improves maintenance and energy efficiency by optimizing trains, signaling, and infrastructure, promising to turn traditional rail systems into intelligent ecosystems. 

NVIDIA IGX platform's advanced sensor processing is fully integrated into existing railway systems, empowering transport operators with real-time actionable insights, replacing the delays of legacy data systems. By enabling predictive maintenance, improving operational efficiency, and supporting smarter decision-making, these technologies streamline railway performance while enhancing reliability.

Join us to discover how AI-powered edge solutions are driving a paradigm shift in transportation and learn how Hitachi is collaborating with NVIDIA:

title: Revolutionizing Personalized Chronic Disease Management Through GPU-Accelerated AI With Advanced RAG, Knowledge Graphs, and Multimodal Capabilities [P73627]
abstract:
This study highlights the effectiveness of AI models (Breeze-7B-Instruct-v1) in chronic disease management with the NeMo framework, leveraging advanced retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), knowledge graphs, and multimodal inputs. The advanced RAG technique combines real-time data with generative capabilities to improve accuracy and relevance, crucial for up-to-date medical information. Knowledge graphs organize complex healthcare data, providing necessary context, especially for patients with multiple conditions. The AnyGPT model, using multimodal inputs like images, offers personalized nutritional guidance, enhancing patient self-management.

Performance improvements include a 21.7% boost in semantic consistency, a 17.3% increase in fluency, and a 20.8% gain in content relevance. Clinically, AI-driven care reduced complication risks by 30%, cut healthcare costs by 30%, and raised healthcare workers' job satisfaction by 20%. Automated reports also reduce staff workload and empower patients in managing their health.

title: Revolutionizing Rideshare Customer Support using Generative AI [S72490]
abstract: Explore NOVA (Neural Omnipresent Virtual Assistant), Uber's generative AI (GenAI)-powered assistant, and learn how it revolutionizes customer support interactions, driving cost efficiency and quality improvement. With 200 million interactions annually costing $500 million, NOVA aims to optimize customer service while offering personalized, scalable, and empathetic responses. NOVA leverages retrieval augmented generation (RAG) to provide fact-based, useful support grounded in Uber’s extensive knowledge base.

title: Revolutionizing Semiconductor Manufacturing and Materials Engineering with GPU-Enhanced Computational Lithography and Atomistic Modeling (Presented by Synopsys) [S74636]
abstract:
The advancement of semiconductor and materials engineering relies heavily on computational lithography and atomistic modeling to push the boundaries of technology. Synopsys brings benefits of accelerated computing into these domains, significantly reducing computation times and enhancing productivity, using NVIDIA technologies.  

Synopsys’ GPU-enhanced computational lithography solution, leveraging NVIDIA’s cuLitho library, has reduced mask synthesis computation time by 15x and drastically slashed energy consumption, and datacenter space, providing a groundbreaking approach to optical proximity correction.  Synopsys’s QuantumATK platform with GPU support, accelerates large-scale bulk and transport calculations by up to 20x, transforming density-functional theory (DFT) simulation. Moreover, the integration of machine learning techniques to bypass iterative DFT calculations enables simulations that were previously impossible, reducing computation times from years to hours.

title: Revolutionizing the Customer Experience in Banking With LLMs [S73750]
abstract: Join an in-depth exploration of how we at İşbank are transforming financial services through a Turkish large language model (LLM) tailored for the banking sector. We'll cover selecting the appropriate LLM and fine-tuning it to understand and process the nuances of the Turkish language within a financial context. We’ll delve into how we scaled the fine-tuning and inference processes using cutting-edge technologies, unveiling our generative AI (Gen AI) architecture and the platform we’ve developed to support it. Additionally, we’ll showcase practical use cases we’ve implemented, demonstrating the tangible benefits and innovations in enhancing customer experience and operational efficiency.

title: Revolutionizing Warehouse and Factory Management With NVIDIA "Mega" Blueprint for Robot Facilities [S73076]
abstract: In this pivotal moment for industrial innovation, we explore how NVIDIA Robotics products — Omniverse, Isaac Sim, Metropolis, Fleet Management, and Discrete Event Simulation — are transforming warehouse and factory management from pre-commissioning to full-scale operations. We'll examine the overall value proposition of these cutting-edge technologies, focusing on their financial benefits, efficiency gains, and enhanced scalability. Additionally, we'll address the urgency for clients to adopt these technical enablers in response to evolving industry demands. Real-world examples will illustrate how these solutions meet the challenges of modern industrial environments, driving operational excellence and competitive advantage.

title: Rise of the Decentralized Cloud: Solving Societal Problems at Scale (Presented by Akash Network) [EXS74351]
abstract: Learn how AI agents running on distributed GPU networks are solving real-world problems by connecting idle compute resources to urgent computing needs, enabling new solutions that can scale quickly and cost-effectively across communities worldwide.

title: Robotic Simulations With Reinforcement Learning at Scale: Harness the Power of NVIDIA Isaac Lab on AWS [DLIT71688]
abstract:
Simulation-based reinforcement learning greatly benefits the field of robotics, enabling models to learn complex tasks quickly. NVIDIA Isaac Lab offers a reinforcement learning environment to train and test robots in realistic simulated environments using physics-based rendering. We'll dive deeper into NVIDIA’s Isaac Lab, AWS Batch, and Amazon EC2 instances powered by NVIDIA GPUs, and highlight the advantages of robotic simulation on AWS. Through hands-on labs, you’ll learn distributed training for robots across multiple GPU nodes, leveraging AWS Batch to accelerate performance. Additionally, we’ll explore the crucial sim-to-real transition, sharing insights and strategies for effectively translating simulation learnings to real-world robotic applications.
Prerequisite(s):

None.

title: Robotics Simulation and Synthetic Data Generation for Accelerating Robotics Development Workflows [CWE72522]
abstract:
Next-generation robots will need to sense, plan, and act autonomously. A "sim-first" approach is required to ensure that entire robot stack performs. Come and connect with NVIDIA experts to learn how you use Isaac Sim for your robotics workflows, including generating synthetic data for perception model training and software-in-loop testing to validate your robot stack.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: RocketKV: Accelerate Long-Context LLM Inference via Two-stage KV Cache Compression [P74474]
abstract: We present RocketKV, a training-free KV cache compression strategy designed specifically to reduce both the memory bandwidth and capacity demand of the KV cache during the decode phase of LLM inference. RocketKV provides end-to-end speedup by up to 3X, as well as peak memory reduction by up to 31% at the decode phase on an NVIDIA H100 GPU, while achieving negligible accuracy loss on a variety of long-context tasks.

title: RTeachBot: Transforming Health Education in Radiation Oncology  [P73437]
abstract: RTeachBot addresses the critical need for accessible and accurate patient education in radiation oncology. Leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies, it enhances patient understanding and treatment compliance in a field where clear communication is vital. This innovative solution provides round-the-clock health education while alleviating medical staff workload. In the complex world of radiation oncology, RTeachBot bridges the gap between medical professionals and patients, ensuring clear and consistent information delivery. It improves patient outcomes by promoting treatment adherence, reducing anxiety, and empowering patients to actively participate in their care. By automating routine educational tasks, RTeachBot enables healthcare providers to focus on personalized care, ultimately enhancing the quality and efficiency of radiation oncology services.

abstract: We'll discuss the RWKV model, including its core mechanisms, development history, and latest multi-modal applications.
date_time: The Drawbacks of Transformers: KV cache, VRAM consumption, energy consumption

title: Safety Regulation and Standardization in the Era of AI-Based AVs [S74745]
abstract: This session will elaborate NVIDIA's Halo strategy for compliance with safety regulations and international standards, including the implications related to the use of AI-based, end-to-end autonomous vehicle (AV) stacks. Learn how ecosystem partners can benefit from this strategy.

title: Scalable AI Infrastructure in the Gaming Industry [S73667]
abstract:
Discover how Electronic Arts is advancing its AI/ML infrastructure to scale teams who can run AI, scale applications of AI, and scale the impact of AI across player experiences. We'll highlight EA’s streamlined GPU provisioning across multi-cloud and on-premises environments, centralized model management for compliance and accessibility, and rapid deployment capabilities, enabling seamless workflows that accelerate development and bring AI innovations into production with robust service level agreements.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Scalable, Configurable Multi-Modal Data Processing Pipelines to Enhance Gen AI Accuracy [S73287]
abstract:
Enterprises are increasingly leveraging large-scale datasets that encompass not just text, but also image and video data, to drive advancements in generative AI. For video foundation models (for example), the aggregate input for these pipelines is on the order of hundreds of petabytes of raw data, and the output is tens of petabytes of high-quality data. Processing these massive datasets presents significant challenges, including scalability issues, bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and fragmented workflows.

We'll dive into the challenges and explore techniques you can leverage to effectively address them. We'll discuss data processing pipelines for various modalities and how to employ strategies that enable seamless scaling across multi-GPU and multi-node configurations. Learn how to accelerate data processing, improve GPU utilization, reduce processing time, and lower the total cost of ownership for enterprises. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Scalable Drug Discovery Pipelines With Kubernetes Operators and BioNemo NIMs [S71237]
abstract: Explore the use of Kubernetes Operators, specifically NIMOperator, to enhance drug discovery pipelines with BioNemo NIMs by providing efficient life-cycle management, model caching, and autoscaling capabilities while simplifying deployment. A sample implementation integrated in the Dataiku AI platform demonstrates how best practices can be leveraged for using these technologies to optimize resource utilization and streamline complex workflows.

title: Scalable Real-Time Planogram Compliance Using NVIDIA Optimized Object Detection and Recognition Models [P72664]
abstract: Our poster addresses the complex challenges of managing densely packed retail shelves for automated detection systems. This includes handling subtle product differences, such as variations in size or flavor, and overcoming environmental factors like frequent occlusions and variable lighting conditions that impact detection accuracy. Using NVIDIA’s DINO model for robust detection and a FAN-based hybrid model for fine-grained recognition, we created a GPU-accelerated, real-time pipeline. Our system enables precise planogram and realogram discrepancy detection, optimizing retail shelf management in challenging environments. Our work will serve as a benchmark for NVIDIA models in real time application.

title: Scalable Robot Autonomy Everywhere, All the Time, with Vision and AI 3D Perception [S73737]
abstract: Get an in-depth look at how a 3D perception solution based on vision, sensor fusion, and AI is revolutionizing autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) in real-world applications. We'll dive into how these technologies are solving critical challenges in autonomous robot navigation and site commissioning, and how they enable quick integration of advanced AI capabilities. We'll share best practices, insights, and lessons learned to help you quickly bring to market an autonomous robot based on vision and AI perception software, to streamline commissioning of new site with 3D global map. You'll also learn to leverage existing and developing AI capabilities like object recognition, natural language interaction, and large foundation models to accelerate development, enhance performance, and give your robotic solution a competitive advantage.
date_time: Hear about our experiences with integrating generative AI capabilities into AMR operations

title: Scale, Secure, and Manage AI — Powered by F5 (Presented by F5) [S74426]
abstract: Unlock the full potential of your AI initiatives with F5’s industry-leading and trusted solutions designed to scale, secure, and manage AI workloads. This on-demand breakout session will explore how F5 technology and our strategic collaboration with NVIDIA can optimize AI factories for maximum return on investment. Discover how F5 BIG-IP Next for Kubernetes, deployed on NVIDIA BlueField-3 DPUs, offloads traffic management and security from the CPU to the DPU to deliver high performance for large-scale AI infrastructure, maximizing efficiency and control. Learn how to architect for optimized training data throughput, enhanced security with robust measures like API and Kubernetes security, and simplified AI inference management to boost accuracy and performance. We'll show how F5 can transform your AI operations, ensuring high-performance, secure, and cost-effective AI application delivery.

title: Scale Up Your Data Processing on Apache Spark with Blackwell GPUs [S71503]
abstract: The RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark is a plugin that enables batch extract-transform-load workloads on GPUs with no code change. It improves performance while lowering cost and reducing server footprint. Learn how users benefit from RAPIDS Spark. We'll deep dive into scaling Spark applications using the NDS benchmark (based on TPC-DS). Our demonstration will feature the Blackwell GPU architecture, a high-speed interconnect (NVLink), a high-throughput data source and fast disks, together as a powerful compute system. We'll demonstrate GPU acceleration in commodity hardware, and provide tips on tuning RAPIDS Spark for optimal performance.

title: Scale Virtual Try-On: Deliver Thousands of Realistic Fittings in Seconds (Presented by Marvik) [EXS74108]
abstract: Explore the technical backbone of Doris, a state-of-the-art virtual try-on solution for fashion ecommerce. We'll explore the challenges of hosting large generative models for high-quality image synthesis and the strategies used to seamlessly deliver thousands of try-ons in seconds. We'll cover distributed system design, GPU-accelerated inference, and the integration of NVIDIA tools such as Triton and Nsight Systems to optimize performance. Learn how AI, computer vision, and generative networks are converging to transform the online shopping experience with accurate and scalable solutions.

title: Scaling AI: Next-Generation Data Center Innovations for High-Performance AI Workloads (Presented by Northern Data Group) [S74261]
abstract: As AI models push the boundaries of scale and complexity, traditional data center infrastructure is struggling to keep up. Join us for a technical deep dive into the cutting-edge advancements shaping AI-optimized data centers, from breakthroughs in AI chip design to the revolutionary cooling technologies enabling ultra-high-density compute. We’ll explore how power, space, and thermal management must evolve to support the latest NVIDIA accelerators, why modular AI data centers are critical for future-proofing, and which other technologies are redefining HPC infrastructure. If you want to ensure you are using the next generation of AI infrastructure, this session delivers the insights, strategies, and innovations needed to stay ahead.

title: Scaling AI Platform at LinkedIn: LLMs, Agents, GPUs, Kernels, and More [S72963]
abstract:
With more than a billion members on the platform, LinkedIn is AI-powered at its very core. In addition to recommendation/ranking powered feed, jobs, etc., we've recently launched many generative AI capabilities, and we heavily leverage NVIDIA GPUs for training. We'll cover our journey of scaling AI platform at all layers, including our GPU infrastructure; GPU kernels (including Kernel fusion), investments in compute foundations for distributed hierarchical checkpointing/restore, elastic queues, scaling large language models (LLMs) via techniques like Zero++, LLM agents, graph neural networks (GNNs), and everything in between.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Scaling AI startups: Overcoming Challenges & Building for the Future (Presented by Northern Data Group) [S74253]
abstract: Accessing high-performance AI computing is prohibited by costs and technical barriers which limits innovation. This session will provide insight into techniques for maximizing the efficiency of your first experience of using AI infrastructure, whether you are taking part in an AI accelerator or not. The benefits of data sovereignty, mentoring, expert technical support and ensuring sustainable scalability. Find out about case studies of the challenges of democratizing access to expensive AI resources.

title: Scaling AI Systems for Human Creativity: Lessons From Building Canva’s AI-First Design Platform  [S72895]
abstract: This deep dive explores the architecture and strategic challenges behind building accessible AI tools that power millions of creative use cases. Cameron Adams, co-founder and chief product officer of Canva, will share how the company scaled its infrastructure to unite more than 100 AI and ML models, and discuss the decisions and trade-offs that go into maintaining a reliable, seamless product experience for millions of users. We'll cover practical approaches to integrating multiple AI technologies into a cohesive platform that serves diverse user needs. Learn about the challenges of rapid AI deployment, upgrading as new capabilities become available, and how Canva approaches building AI workflows rather than siloed solutions.

title: Scaling and Leveraging Multi-Modal Large Models for Roblox's Metaverse  [S72911]
abstract: As part of the AI platform at Roblox, we train and serve hundreds of models. Virtually every interaction on Roblox has some form of AI powering it, including experiences recommendation, safety, or generative AI use cases. Gain insights into Roblox's approach to forecasting GPU requirements, enabling proactive resource scheduling and efficient utilization. Learn more about the challenges and opportunities in scaling GPU infrastructure and leveraging multi-modal large models for metaverse applications.

title: Scaling Coca-Cola's Content Creation with OpenUSD and NVIDIA Omniverse [S73123]
abstract: In this exciting session, Grip, a leader in content generation at scale, showcases their innovative approach and integration of the latest technologies to provide a controlled content creation environment for clients such as Coca-Cola. They built on OpenUSD and NVIDIA Omniverse to deliver a solution for the creation of digital twins and content that can be used in across a large variety of use-cases (digital shelf, campaigns, inventory, AI and more) and across multiple workflows, including traditional DCCs. We'll show how Grip combines digital twins with traditional production techniques as well as cutting edge generative AI, to streamline content production, significantly reducing time-to-market and expanding creative options for marketers. Learn how major customers, such as Coca-Cola, have used digital twins to automate production throughout their business, enabling faster iterations, richer storytelling, and more engaging marketing assets.

title: Scaling Distributed AI Applications with Ray [S71766]
abstract:
The Ray system (ray.io) makes it simple to scale distributed Python applications in machine learning. With the new Ray Compiled Graphs system, we're making it simple to develop programs for distributed accelerators. Ray Compiled Graphs lowers system overhead to make it suitable for millisecond tasks, and adds native APIs for GPU-to-GPU communication via NCCL.

We'll explore key use cases enabled by Ray Compiled Graphs, including online and offline multi-GPU LLM inference with Tensor and pipeline parallelism, as used in vLLM; and heterogeneous training workloads, including multimodal training and LLM post-training with reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF), leveraging fast and flexible communication across devices. We'll discuss these use cases and the performance improvements made possible by compiled graphs in distributed AI workloads.

title: Scaling Generative AI with Cloudera and NVIDIA: Deploy LLMs With AI Inference (Presented by Cloudera) [S74326]
abstract: Discover how to deploy scalable Gen AI applications with NVIDIA NIM using the Cloudera AI Inference service. Learn how to manage and optimize AI workloads during the critical deployment phase of the AI life cycle, focusing on large language models.

title: Scaling Generative AI with Cloudera and NVIDIA: Deploy LLMs With AI Inference (Presented by Cloudera) [S74326]
abstract: Discover how to deploy scalable Gen AI applications with NVIDIA NIM using the Cloudera AI Inference service. Learn how to manage and optimize AI workloads during the critical deployment phase of the AI life cycle, focusing on large language models.

title: Scaling Inference Using NIM Through a ServerLess NCP SaaS Platform [DLIT71918]
abstract:
We'll train you to scale your Gen AI workload and create a software-as-a-service (SaaS) serverless platform. We'll use NIMs of an open-source LLM, scaling it using open-source technologies like Kubernetes, Ray, and KServe, and we'll demonstrate the usage of NVCF. We'll show you how to obtain GPU utilization metrics using Grafana and Prometheus, autoscaling compute resources based on inflight demand and defining best practices around efficiently using the underlying abstracted GPU infrastructure based on NCP RA.
Prerequisite(s):

Basics of Model Inference, Kubernetes, KServe.

title: Scaling Inference Using NIM Through a ServerLess NCP SaaS Platform [DLIT71918]
abstract:

Prerequisite(s):

title: Scaling Levenberg-Marquardt Optimizer on Multiple GPUs [P73527]
abstract: The Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm (LMA) arises in solving the nonlinear least-squares problems and varies between the gradient descent method and the Gauss-Newton method by a damping factor. For our example problems with a small to medium number of weights, the LMA algorithm can rapidly converge to machine precision, offering significant benefits over other optimizers. The LMA optimizer results illustrate that it may be possible build better-performing deep learning models with up to 26x fewer parameters that require much less hyperparameter tuning. The key limitation in applying the LMA algorithm to larger model sizes is the need to compute the Hessian matrix, which in turn necessitates performing matrix multiplications that require n^2 memory and n^3 computations (where n is the number of model parameters). The study investigates building a scalable matrix multiplication algorithm on NVIDIA GPUs.

title: Scaling LLMs to Support 14 Million Users while Optimizing Performance and Accuracy [S72674]
abstract: Learn how bunq implemented and scaled large language models (LLMs) to support its 14 million users, with a focus on delivering high-speed performance at such a large scale. We encountered several critical technical challenges, including optimizing vectorization, embeddings, reducing latency, improving retrieval processes, and refining prompt generation. This case study highlights the strategies we used to effectively scale LLMs in large-scale applications, utilizing NVIDIA NeMo Retriever and NIMs for enhanced performance and improved accuracy. We'll finish with a forward-looking view on what's next for Finn, offering insights into the future developments and innovations we plan to integrate to further enhance user experience and operational efficiency.

abstract:
Join our experts to learn about generative AI for content creation, and how to gain tighter control over visual outputs.

title: Scaling Meta's Infrastructure for Heterogenous AI Use-Cases and Operational Efficiency [S72305]
abstract:
Learn about techniques that have reliably scaled Meta's infrastructure with GPUs. We'll review several dependencies needed to determine whether GPUs can operate efficiently, automate triaging of issues,  accelerate stability in terms of interruptions to jobs, and how we orchestrate the flow to minimize idle GPU time. Hear about our process for stabilizing new hardware SKUs such that they are effective in production more quickly. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Scaling Open Source AI: From Foundation Models to Ecosystem Success [S74647]
abstract:
Learn how open source is transforming AI development, bringing together experts from industry, academia, and venture capital to discuss the technical and business aspects of collaborative open source AI development. Our distinguished panelists will examine how open source projects like PyTorch, vLLM, Ray, and NVIDIA's NeMo are accelerating AI innovation while creating new opportunities for businesses and researchers. They'll share real-world experiences from PyTorch's development, Berkeley's research initiatives, and successful AI startups. Take away valuable insights into the technical and business aspects of open source AI. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Scaling Transformers: Navigating Challenges and Innovations in Long-Context Modeling [S73152]
abstract:
Explore the frontier of scaling transformer models to handle increasingly long contexts, a critical advancement in large language models. We'll examine the multifaceted challenges encountered in this pursuit, spanning modeling techniques, framework limitations, and computational constraints. We'll cover a range of approaches, from data preparation, modeling methods, and model architecture innovations to framework-level optimizations on GPUs. We'll also highlight some of the limitations of these methods and discuss future research and development.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Scaling Vision LLMs to extract and deploy targeted metadata for Catalog Management [S73701]
abstract: In the dynamic world of ecommerce, the challenge of managing unstructured product data is significant. Shopify leverages multimodal vision LLMs (large language models) for enhanced product metadata extraction. We discuss the complexities of categorizing products accurately and enabling precise search and filtering within a vast and diverse product catalog. Our two-step approach with vision LLMs involves category prediction followed by attribute prediction, utilizing cutting-edge techniques to achieve remarkable accuracy. We also detail the creation of a "Golden Dataset" to fine-tune these models effectively. This talk further explores the deployment of these models in production, highlighting the performance improvements achieved and the impact on Shopify's ecosystem. Addressing the challenges of unstructured product data enables Shopify to empower merchants and enhances the overall shopping experience for millions of users.

title: Scout, an Enterprise Knowledge Assistant Built Upon NVIDIA Retrieval-Augmented Generation [P73594]
abstract: The fragmented distribution of NVIDIA's public information across various sources, such as blogs, press releases, SEC filings, and forums, makes it difficult for users to access accurate, timely answers. Scout, a cutting-edge chat application, addresses this challenge by leveraging NVIDIA technologies to aggregate data from multiple sources. Specifically designed for NVIDIA employees, Scout delivers precise answers on topics ranging from financial reports to product updates and announcements. With a fully optimized retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipeline, Scout improves data ingestion, query decomposition, and retrieval accuracy. Performance metrics demonstrate its effectiveness in providing accurate and timely responses, offering a significant advancement over previous solutions like NVBot. Scout plays a critical role in enterprise knowledge management and supports product development efforts by sharing insights into the generative AI space.

title: Seamlessly Scale Python Programs From Single-CPU to Multi-GPU, Multi-Node Clusters With cuPyNumeric [CWE74695]
abstract:
Python is a powerful and user-friendly programming language, but as data sizes and computational complexity grow, single-CPU Python implementations struggle to deliver the speed and scale demanded by cutting-edge research. cuPyNumeric enables you to seamlessly scale your Python programs from a single-CPU machine to multi-node clustered computers, utilizing multiple Intel/AMD/ARM CPUs and multiple NVIDIA GPUs, without any modifications to your code. This Chat With Experts lets you meet with our Python experts to address a variety of numerical computing challenges. We can cover advanced topics related to using cuPyNumeric effectively, including debugging, profiling, performance optimization, and extending the library.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Secrets for Scaling Gen AI from Proof of Concept to Production [CWE72612]
abstract:
Discover the best practices and lessons learned for successfully transitioning Gen AI projects from proof of concept (POC) to large-scale production. Join experts from NVIDIA, who work closely with customers to overcome their toughest technical challenges, for one-on-one discussions about overcoming common hurdles in scaling model training, customization, inferencing, retrieval augmented generation, and deployment.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. title: Secure AI: Confidential Computing in the Cloud, in the Enterprise, and Decentralized Confidential AI with NVIDIA FLARE [CWE71235]
abstract:
Come and learn confidential computing from NVIDIA experts covering Confidential Computing from GPU hardware, virtualization, Confidential Containers (CoCo) and all the way to application with federated learning. Learn how to easily modify workloads to use Confidential Computing (CC).  Discover how to enable federated learning solutions like NVIDIA FLARE that deliver a streamlined, user-friendly workflow that simplifies the complexities of confidential computing, including attestation and bootstrapping, for both on-premises and cloud environments. Hear how this innovative approach transforms data collaboration and model training across industries, offering robust security guarantees and enabling decentralized, secure AI solutions. Join us to see how Confidential Computing with NVIDIA FLARE can elevate your AI strategies.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Secure AI: Confidential Computing in the Cloud, in the Enterprise, and Decentralized Confidential AI with NVIDIA FLARE [CWE71235]
abstract:
Come and learn confidential computing from NVIDIA experts covering Confidential Computing from GPU hardware, virtualization, Confidential Containers (CoCo) and all the way to application with federated learning. Learn how to easily modify workloads to use Confidential Computing (CC).  Discover how to enable federated learning solutions like NVIDIA FLARE that deliver a streamlined, user-friendly workflow that simplifies the complexities of confidential computing, including attestation and bootstrapping, for both on-premises and cloud environments. Hear how this innovative approach transforms data collaboration and model training across industries, offering robust security guarantees and enabling decentralized, secure AI solutions. Join us to see how Confidential Computing with NVIDIA FLARE can elevate your AI strategies.

title: Secure AI Without Killing the Innovation Buzz (Presented by Trend Micro) [EXS74452]
abstract: Amid the whirlwind of technological evolution, weaving AI into security frameworks unlocks unlimited possibilities. However, with unlimited possibilities often comes unknown challenges. We'll explore the delicate balance between accelerating innovation while keeping cyberrisk at bay in the ever-evolving universe of AI.

title: Secure Critical Infrastructure With AI-Powered Cyber Defense [S73907]
abstract: As threats to critical infrastructure grow — from sophisticated malware to nation-state attacks — the need for robust security in operational technology (OT) environments is more urgent than ever. Many of these systems, some built decades ago, were never designed with modern security in mind. The convergence of IT and OT networks, often accelerated by remote access requirements, has introduced new attack vectors. We'll demonstrate how the NVIDIA Cybersecurity AI platform, combined with a strong partner ecosystem, can secure critical infrastructure seamlessly — without the need to change existing networking infrastructure or how it operates. Learn strategies for achieving real-time visibility at the host, network, and application levels, enforcing command-level authorization, implementing zero-trust access control, and blocking cyberattacks in real time. Discover how these collaborative innovations enable organizations to safeguard OT infrastructure across the energy, utilities, and manufacturing sectors from evolving cyberthreats.

title: Secure Your Data and Model IP While Improving Productivity [S72775]
abstract:
Every day, people discover more ways to use AI to improve productivity and create more value out of the data. Data is the new gold. Varied datasets and models trained with it require more resources to ensure that the output is meaningful to the users. It's paramount to protect both data privacy and model intellectual property (IP) in the world of AI. 

While traditional solutions exist for protecting data at rest and in transit, we use confidential compute/Secure AI to protect data while it's in use. We'll walk through the different Blackwell platform-level solutions to solve this problem.

title: Securing Agentic AI Developer Day [DD73355]
abstract: In today’s rapidly evolving AI landscape, agentic AI is an emerging tool being leveraged by organizations across industries. However, as AI agents move from concept to production, they introduce new security challenges. Join the NVIDIA Security for an exclusive, in-depth session designed to transform your AI agentic workflows securely from blueprint to production. Discover how to navigate and mitigate key deployment risks in common agentic flows with expert guidance and practical advice. This collaborative and hands-on experience will empower you to bring your AI vision to life with confidence. Don't miss this opportunity to elevate your AI security knowledge and skills. Take the first step toward mastering AI security and achieving seamless integration into your workflows.

title: Securing the Future of Generative AI: CrowdStrike and NVIDIA in Action (Presented by CrowdStrike) [EXS74263]
abstract: As generative AI reshapes industries, securing these innovations is more critical than ever. CrowdStrike and NVIDIA are joining forces to ensure the future of AI innovation remains secure. Explore how their collaboration combines AI-powered cybersecurity with accelerated computing to defend against advanced threats and shadow AI. Learn how organizations can protect their generative AI deployments, innovate with confidence, and stay resilient in the face of an evolving threat landscape.

title: Securing the Future: Protecting and Consuming Agentic AI [S73049]
abstract:
This session is designed to equip business leaders and chief information security officers with the knowledge and strategies needed to protect and effectively consume agentic AI, safeguarding their organizations from emerging threats.

Key Topics: Understanding Agentic AI, Emerging Threats in Agentic AI, Best Practices for Securing Agentic Systems, Compliance and Regulatory Considerations, Incident Response Planning, Collaboration and Training
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: See the Unseen: Using AI for Encrypted Network Traffic Analysis (Presented by Arista) [S74231]
abstract: Approximately 85% of internet traffic is encrypted, and even the majority of east-west protocols are now encrypted. Learn how combining cryptographic insights with frequency-based global-local rarity analysis and Jaccard correlation (also used for recommendation AI) enables us to set a new standard for identifying threats concealed in encrypted channels. Discover how this approach outperforms conventional techniques and identifies the most advanced and emerging threats that typically go undetected.

title: Self-Driving Microscopes: From Malaria Diagnostics to AI-Driven Discovery Platforms for Spatial Biology   [S73188]
abstract: Microscopy is at the heart of life science research and diagnostics, with most discoveries rooted in visualizing the spatial context of the living world. Traditional microscopy platforms are bulky, expensive, lack the capacity to operate in real-world field settings, and are closed. Here, we'll present an open architecture and modular robotic microscopy platform that enables many biological explorations, from the jungles in Senegal to discovery of rare organisms living in the ocean. We share examples of real-time AI analysis driven by GPUs enabled in context of diagnosing malaria and tracking carbon sequestration in the open ocean.

title: Semi-Supervised Learning for Code-Switching ASR With LLM Filter [P72502]
abstract: Due to data scarcity, building an effective code-switching (CS) automatic speech recognition (ASR) system remains challenging. We propose to enhance CS-ASR systems by utilizing rich unsupervised monolingual data within a semi-supervised learning framework. To achieve this, we establish a general paradigm for applying noisy student training (NST) to the CS-ASR task. We introduce the LLM-Filter, to activate the correction capability of LLMs for monolingual data selection and pseudo-labels refinement during NST. Our method not only achieves significant improvements over supervised and semi-supervised learning baselines for the CS task, but also attains better performance compared with the fully-supervised oracle upper-bound on the CS English part. Additionally, we further investigate the influence of accent on AESRC dataset and demonstrate that our method can achieve additional benefits when the monolingual data contain relevant linguistic characteristics.

title: Shape the Future of Intelligent Networks With AI and Digital Twins (Presented by TCS) [S74610]
abstract: While the industry focus is on adoption of "AI for networks," TCS realized the growing need for "networks for AI". With its domain knowledge and expertise in digital twin, TCS produced a framework to maintain and scale up network on-demand using the potential of AI. Hear execs from TCS examine the broader areas for intelligent networks and explain how to harness AI for network performance. They'll examine solutions built on autonomous networks leveraging agentic AI, small language domain models, and NVIDIA Aerial Omniverse digital twin platforms.

title: Shaping the Future of Digital Health [S73465]
abstract: Digital health is transforming healthcare delivery, and startups are at the forefront of this innovation. A well-curated panel of digital health startup founders and experts will provide valuable insights into this dynamic and impactful industry. It will be informative for entrepreneurs, investors, healthcare professionals, and anyone else interested in the intersection of technology and healthcare.

title: Shaping the Future of Robotic Surgery: Innovations, Challenges, and Opportunities [S72930]
abstract:
The integration of robotics into surgery is revolutionizing the medical field, driving precision, efficiency, and improved patient outcomes. Join us for an insightful panel discussion moderated by David Niewolny, head of business development for healthcare and medical at NVIDIA, as we explore the cutting-edge advancements and future possibilities of robotic surgery. 

We'll delve into the latest technological breakthroughs, challenges in AI integration, and the future of robotic-assisted procedures. We’ll explore questions such as what role AI and data will play in driving the next wave of robotic surgery, and how these advancements will impact patient care, surgeon training, and healthcare accessibility. Whether you’re an industry leader, a clinician, or a technology enthusiast, you'll hear a unique perspective on the future of surgery and the vital role robotics will play in shaping it.

title: Shaping the Future of Robotic Surgery: Innovations, Challenges, and Opportunities [S72930]
abstract:
The integration of robotics into surgery is revolutionizing the medical field, driving precision, efficiency, and improved patient outcomes. Join us for an insightful panel discussion moderated by David Niewolny, head of business development for healthcare and medical at NVIDIA, as we explore the cutting-edge advancements and future possibilities of robotic surgery. 

We'll delve into the latest technological breakthroughs, challenges in AI integration, and the future of robotic-assisted procedures. We’ll explore questions such as what role AI and data will play in driving the next wave of robotic surgery, and how these advancements will impact patient care, surgeon training, and healthcare accessibility. Whether you’re an industry leader, a clinician, or a technology enthusiast, you'll hear a unique perspective on the future of surgery and the vital role robotics will play in shaping it.

title: Short-range, Deep-learning-based Probabilistic Forecasts of Heavy Precipitation: A Collaboration Between The Weather Company and NVIDIA [S72608]
abstract:
Despite many decades of staff and supercomputer time devoted to developing conventional numerical weather prediction (NWP) systems, accurately predicting surface precipitation amounts remains one of the most challenging problems in weather prediction. In part, this is because of the substantial bias of precipitation forecasts in conventional models, and also because precipitation exhibits variability on scales of a kilometer, with the precipitation often produced by local events such as thunderstorms
whose positions cannot be specified with precision. Potentially, with a large ensemble, one could better understand and quantify the likelihood of heavy precipitation, which has some modulation from large-scale weather patterns. Unfortunately, given the computational expense of conventional high-resolution NWP systems, a large ensemble of forecasts from these systems is intractable.

title: Simplify AI Adoption With Dell AI Factory and NVIDIA (Presented by Dell Technologies) [S74621]
abstract: Experience how Dell and NVIDIA are accelerating enterprise AI adoption. We'll highlight real-world success stories showing how Dell and NVIDIA are helping organizations harness the power of AI to gain a competitive edge, reduce costs, and deliver exceptional outcomes. Expand your knowledge of the Dell AI Factory with NVIDIA — a comprehensive solution combining cutting-edge infrastructure, software, and services to streamline AI deployment for organizations of all sizes. See how the Dell AI Factory with NVIDIA can empower your business to innovate at scale and unlock the full potential of AI — providing trusted, tailored, and scalable solutions designed to evolve alongside your needs.

title: Simplify AI Adoption With Dell AI Factory and NVIDIA (Presented by Dell Technologies) [S74621]
abstract: Experience how Dell and NVIDIA are accelerating enterprise AI adoption. We'll highlight real-world success stories showing how Dell and NVIDIA are helping organizations harness the power of AI to gain a competitive edge, reduce costs, and deliver exceptional outcomes. Expand your knowledge of the Dell AI Factory with NVIDIA — a comprehensive solution combining cutting-edge infrastructure, software, and services to streamline AI deployment for organizations of all sizes. See how the Dell AI Factory with NVIDIA can empower your business to innovate at scale and unlock the full potential of AI — providing trusted, tailored, and scalable solutions designed to evolve alongside your needs.

title: Simulating Trillion-Particle Fluid Systems on an NVIDIA A100-Powered Supercomputer [P73536]
abstract: We introduce the latest generation of our now public C++17 template library HTMPC17 for simulating hydrodynamic interactions using the particle-based Multi-Particle Collision (MPC) Dynamics algorithm. HTMPC17 is a versatile, user-extendable, plugin-based system that allows simulations of particles and objects in solution over a range of scales, from a single CPU core to supercomputers powered by thousands of GPUs.

title: Single-View X-Ray 3D Reconstruction Using Neural Back Projection and Frustum Resampling [P73547]
abstract:
Utilizing a 2D U-Net architecture, our method integrates a 12-dimensional pose vector, encompassing both rotation and translation parameters, to reconstruct the frustum and resample the original volume into a canonical position. We address the limitations of traditional X-ray imaging, which often requires multiple projections from various angles, increasing radiation exposure and complicating clinical workflows. 

Our approach synthesizes novel-view X-ray projections from a single input image, employing geometry and texture feature extraction for accurate view generation. The entire framework is built upon accelerated libraries such as NVIDIA MONAI, generative models, CUDA-compiled PyTorch and PyTorch3D from Meta, trained with 2x NVIDIA A100-80GB GPUs and inference with 2x NVIDIA Quadro RTX8000-48GB. Experimental validation demonstrates the model's capability to produce high-fidelity projections that align with the geometrical and textural characteristics of the original data.

title: Slice-100K: A Multimodal Dataset for Extrusion-Based 3D Printing [P74401]
abstract: Explore a new dataset for building manufacturing domain-specific foundation models. Furthermore, we provide a new solution to convert existing and outdated G-code format into modern-day G-code format by fine-tuning GPT-2 on as little as 25 samples.

title: Smaller Language Model with RAG and Fine-Tuning Gets Better Results and Reduces Costs With Red Hat AI (Presented by Red Hat) [S74237]
abstract:
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) helps align Gen AI apps to customer use cases, but large models can be expensive, and RAG has limitations. We’ll explore how Red Hat AI can provide a better approach with RHEL AI and OpenShift AI:

•	Fine-tune smaller language models with customer datasets for better accuracy and lower costs 
•	Introduce LAB: Large-Scale Alignment for ChatBots, a novel approach for instruction alignment and fine-tuning 
•	Achieve significant cost reduction with RAG + LAB-tuned small language models

We'll demo LAB and discuss real-world customers who have benefited from this approach with Red Hat AI and OpenShift AI.

title: Smaller Language Model with RAG and Fine-Tuning Gets Better Results and Reduces Costs With Red Hat AI (Presented by Red Hat) [S74237]
abstract:
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) helps align Gen AI apps to customer use cases, but large models can be expensive, and RAG has limitations. We’ll explore how Red Hat AI can provide a better approach with RHEL AI and OpenShift AI:

•	Achieve significant cost reduction with RAG + LAB-tuned small language models

We'll demo LAB and discuss real-world customers who have benefited from this approach with Red Hat AI and OpenShift AI.

title: Smart Agent Assist Enhances Call-Center Customer Service, Resulting in Contact Center Automation and Multi-Agent System (Presented by EXL) [S74210]
abstract: We relied on proprietary speech-to-text (STT) models for call transcription, which, despite being functional, present limitations in customization and cost efficiency due to API usage fees. With NVIDIA’s NeMo framework, particularly the NVIDIA Riva Conformer model, we've seen significant improvements in transcription accuracy, including a notable reduction in word error rates. The NeMo framework offers key advantages, such as fine-tuning capabilities for specific accents, making it highly effective for addressing regional speech variations. We'll discuss NVIDIA-powered smart agent assistance architecture and associated benefits. We'll also explain how we're building context-aware multi-agent systems across domains by introducing a higher level of autonomy with NVIDIA Blueprint.

title: Smart Agent Assist Enhances Call-Center Customer Service, Resulting in Contact Center Automation and Multi-Agent System (Presented by EXL) [S74210]
abstract: We relied on proprietary speech-to-text (STT) models for call transcription, which, despite being functional, present limitations in customization and cost efficiency due to API usage fees. We'll also explain how we're building context-aware multi-agent systems across domains by introducing a higher level of autonomy with NVIDIA Blueprint.

title: Smarter, Not Bigger: How Small Language Models With RAG and Fine-Tuning can Deliver Better Results at Lower Cost with Red Hat AI (Presented by Red Hat) [EXS74230]
abstract:
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) helps align Gen AI apps to customer use cases, but large models can be expensive, and RAG has limitations. We’ll explore how Red Hat AI can provide a better approach with RHEL AI and OpenShift AI:

title: Software-Defined Enterprise Powered by HCLTech SmartTwin (Presented by HCLTech) [S74283]
abstract:
Built on NVIDIA Omniverse, Metropolis and Isaac Sim platforms, HCLTech SmartTwin is driving the next era of digital innovation. This comprehensive, AI-powered solution is the catalyst for business innovation, enabling global enterprises to achieve faster time-to-market and first-time-right goals. 
HCLTech TwinX framework, combined with NVIDIA Omniverse, Metropolis and Isaac Sim platforms, creates a powerful ecosystem for driving business transformation. This collaboration integrates synthetic data generation, AI, multi-physics simulations and high-fidelity 3D environments to enable organizations to design, test and optimize systems in a virtual world before real-world deployment. It empowers businesses across industries to enhance operational efficiency, reduce costs and accelerate decision-making. The solution helps organizations tackle complex challenges, improve resilience and drive faster, smarter growth in an increasingly dynamic global market.
The time to transform is now!

title: Software-in-the-Loop Testing for Robots With OpenUSD, Isaac Sim, and ROS [DLIT71326]
abstract:
This lab focuses on software-in-the-loop for testing and validating AI-driven robots in a digital twin environment. Participants will learn to assemble a virtual environment using OpenUSD and NVIDIA Isaac Sim. You'll add virtual robots to the scene and simulate and validate their basic movements with ROS (Robot Operating System) commands. The lab will emphasize data aggregation, environment creation, and initial robot simulation.
By the end of this lab, you'll be able to create and leverage a digital twin environment to simulate basic robot movements within it using ROS. This lab is designed for developers interested in digital twin technology and robotics simulation in industrial settings.
Prerequisite(s):

Experience with OpenUSD, NVIDIA Omniverse and 3D CAD software.
Experience in Python.
Basic knowledge of NVIDIA Isaac Sim and Isaac ROS.

title: Software-in-the-Loop Testing for Robots With OpenUSD, Isaac Sim, and ROS [DLIT71326]
abstract:

Participants will learn to assemble a virtual environment using OpenUSD and NVIDIA Isaac Sim. title: Solving the Paradox of Sustainable AI (Presented by HPE) [S74332]
abstract: The adoption of AI comes with a large energy consumption challenge. The massive compute power required to run AI applications puts a heavy strain on resources and costs and, in the near term, risks exacerbating the climate crisis. We'll explore what HPE and NVIDIA are doing today to solve the paradox of sustainable AI — from reimagining data centers to radically more efficient hardware and innovative direct liquid-cooling solutions.

title: Solving the Paradox of Sustainable AI (Presented by HPE) [S74332]
abstract: The adoption of AI comes with a large energy consumption challenge. The massive compute power required to run AI applications puts a heavy strain on resources and costs and, in the near term, risks exacerbating the climate crisis. We'll explore what HPE and NVIDIA are doing today to solve the paradox of sustainable AI — from reimagining data centers to radically more efficient hardware and innovative direct liquid-cooling solutions.

title: Sovereign AI Summit [SE73317]
abstract:
Sovereign AI refers to a nation’s capacity to develop and deploy AI using its own infrastructure, local datasets, skilled workforce, and business ecosystems. Join us for a dynamic summit exploring how nations are embracing AI factories as critical infrastructure for digital transformation and resilience. Featured speakers include government and industry leaders from the UK, France, Italy, Denmark, Japan, India, Korea, Thailand and Brazil. Learn from experts as they come together to discuss the development of domestic AI capabilities to drive economic growth and tackle industry-wide challenges. 


Schedule

 7:30am Networking Breakfast 
8:00am Summit Opening: Transforming Nations with Sovereign AI
8:10am Unleashing Sovereign AI’s Potential: A UK Case Study
8:30am Sovereign AI Panel of prominent government leaders 
9:15am Empower the Ecosystem with Sovereign Foundation Models
10:30am Lessons Learned from Deploying Gen AI Applications
11:50am Closing remarks

Unleashing Sovereign AI’s Potential: the U.K.’s AI Opportunities Action Plan, a fascinating model for the innovative development and deployment of AI at the nation-state level.

title: Sparse2D-to-3D: High-Fidelity 3D Model Generation From a Few Images With Multi-View Diffusion for Ecommerce [P74322]
abstract: We'll explore advanced AI techniques for transforming sparse 2D images into high-fidelity 3D models at scale. By leveraging diffusion models for mesh generation and neural rendering for texture optimization, we present a robust pipeline that integrates dynamic camera pose estimation, style transfer, and inverse rendering. Learn how this scalable approach produces photorealistic 3D models with exceptional geometric and texture accuracy, achieving high-fidelity results that elevate industry standards for 3D model realism at scale. This innovation is revolutionizing fields like ecommerce and augmented/virtual reality, where precise, immersive digital content is critical.

title: Sparse2D-to-3D: High-Fidelity 3D Model Generation From a Few Images With Multi-View Diffusion for Ecommerce [P74322]
abstract: We'll explore advanced AI techniques for transforming sparse 2D images into high-fidelity 3D models at scale. By leveraging diffusion models for mesh generation and neural rendering for texture optimization, we present a robust pipeline that integrates dynamic camera pose estimation, style transfer, and inverse rendering. Learn how this scalable approach produces photorealistic 3D models with exceptional geometric and texture accuracy, achieving high-fidelity results that elevate industry standards for 3D model realism at scale. This innovation is revolutionizing fields like ecommerce and augmented/virtual reality, where precise, immersive digital content is critical.

title: Spatio-Temporal Predictive System Monitoring of AVs Using Graph Attention Networks  [P73502]
abstract:
Dive into the future of autonomous vehicle (AV) safety! This poster presents a cutting-edge system for predictive monitoring of autonomous vehicles using the power of graph attention networks (GANs). We explore how to capture the complex interplay of vehicle dynamics, perception data, and environmental context to forecast potential system risks. Our approach leverages:

•	Spatio-temporal modeling: Integrating vehicle history, real-time sensor inputs, and static map data for a comprehensive understanding of the AV's operational environment;
•	Graph neural networks: Harnessing the power of graph attention mechanisms to learn intricate relationships and dependencies within the autonomous system; and
•	Predictive distributions: Generating probabilistic forecasts of future vehicle states to proactively identify potential anomalies and safety hazards.

Discover how our innovative framework can contribute to safer and more reliable autonomous driving.

title: Spatio-Temporal Predictive System Monitoring of AVs Using Graph Attention Networks  [P73502]
abstract:
Dive into the future of autonomous vehicle (AV) safety! This poster presents a cutting-edge system for predictive monitoring of autonomous vehicles using the power of graph attention networks (GANs). We explore how to capture the complex interplay of vehicle dynamics, perception data, and environmental context to forecast potential system risks. Our approach leverages:
