Discover how our innovative framework can contribute to safer and more reliable autonomous driving.

title: Spectrum-X & H200で構築したGPUクラウドサービス開発の最前線 [S73890]
abstract:
スパコンランキング Top500で37位を獲得したGPUクラウドをゼロから立ち上げる過程で、GPUリソースを最大限お客様に提供するためにクラウドサービスとして最適化した手法を説明します。
リファレンスアーキテクチャを基盤とし、NVIDIA H200 GPU 768基 と Spectrum-Xを用いて構築したGPUクラウド環境開発のユースケースを紹介いたします。
また、高密度なインターコネクトネットワークにおける課題に対する解決策について、弊社の実例をもとに実践的な知見を共有します。

title: Spectrum-X & H200で構築したGPUクラウドサービス開発の最前線 [S73890]
abstract:
スパコンランキング Top500で37位を獲得したGPUクラウドをゼロから立ち上げる過程で、GPUリソースを最大限お客様に提供するためにクラウドサービスとして最適化した手法を説明します。
リファレンスアーキテクチャを基盤とし、NVIDIA H200 GPU 768基 と Spectrum-Xを用いて構築したGPUクラウド環境開発のユースケースを紹介いたします。
また、高密度なインターコネクトネットワークにおける課題に対する解決策について、弊社の実例をもとに実践的な知見を共有します。

title: Speech AI Demystified [S73113]
abstract: Speech AI technologies such as automatic speech recognition (ASR), text-to-speech (TTS), and neural machine translation (NMT) automate millions of conversations today. They provide customers with a personalized human-like experience through such applications as Virtual Assistant, Contact Center Agent Assist, and digital avatar. We’ll review a few inspiring use cases and solutions to common challenges faced by enterprises that are getting started with speech AI. Learn techniques for achieving world-class accuracy and customizing for your industry. We’ll also show the latest models, tools, and features in NVIDIA NeMo and Riva, demonstrate sample applications, and illustrate how to build a speech AI pipeline.

title: Speed-of-Light Data Movement Between Storage and the GPU [S73012]
abstract:
GPUs have long been compute monsters. But for a new class of applications with huge datasets and low computational intensity, like generative neural network (GNN) training and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), GPU-initiated communication from O(100K) GPU threads enable them to also be data access monsters. 

We'll frame the problem of storage IO, tie it to specific usage models and classes of applications, present breakthrough successes, and open new horizons to practical applications where storage IO optimization is needed for files and objects and both fine- and coarse-grained transfers. We'll cover two members of the GPUDirect Storage family, cuFile and cuObj, and SCADA, a new programming model for high-throughput, fine-grained, GPU-initiated access. We'll also touch on security issues and how they can be addressed through careful design and, in some cases, the help of DPUs.

title: Stable and Scalable FP8 Deep Learning Training on Blackwell [S72778]
abstract: Learn about the new advancements in low-precision training recipes coming with Transformer Engine 2.0 for Hopper and Blackwell GPUs. We'll dive deep into the training performance and convergence of large language models when using FP8.

title: Standardized Isaac Benchmark Tool for Embodied AI Research [P74364]
abstract: We designed a benchmarking framework for humanoid robots using NVIDIA Omniverse's Isaac Sim platform, and enabled simulation of different humanoid robots performing the same actions for standardized comparison. We also collected joint data during simulated actions and compared it with physical robot performance on identical tasks, evaluating how motions generated by large language models translate to both simulated and physical robots. We designed predefined tasks such as waving, saluting, raising arms, and walking to assess motor performance, and compared performance differences among various humanoid robots in simulation and real-world environments.

title: Start Your Private AI Journey and Lead in Quantum Computing (Presented by DXC Technology Services, LLC) [EXS74339]
abstract: Discover how to deploy AI solutions in hours by using private AI accelerators based on NVIDIA Blueprints, highlighted by a real-world deployment for an insurance customer. The result is a highly performant, secure, and cost-effective platform, as demonstrated by token generation benchmarks, with the capability to run chatbots (retrieval-augmented generation/inference) and agentic AI, both secured by guardrails and processing multi-modal data types, while being integrated with Intelligent Operations under an ITIL aligned service.

title: State-of-the-Art Deep Learning Foundation Models for Biology [S73896]
abstract: We'll explore making biological sequence data accessible through conversational AI. We'll discuss the challenges current conversational AI faces in handling biological sequences, and why existing tools present accessibility barriers. We'll then explore new techniques for integrating sequence understanding into conversational frameworks, including how to combine language and sequence data for more intuitive interaction. Learn about methods for calibrating confidence in AI-generated insights from biological data. Finally, we'll discuss potential applications of this technology in biology, including data analysis and knowledge discovery. We aim to inspire new research and foster collaboration between AI specialists and biologists, paving the way for more accessible bioinformatics tools.

title: Storage Benchmarks: Optimize AI Model Training and Inference at Scale (Presented by CoreWeave) [S74217]
abstract: Don’t let storage be the limiting factor in your large-scale training workloads. Dive into real-world benchmarking results of CoreWeave Distributed File Storage in a 32K NVIDIA H200 GPU cluster and uncover best practices to achieve peak performance and reliability. We’ll also discuss how NVIDIA’s InfiniBand and Bluefield DPUs help optimize storage performance.

title: Storage Innovations for AI Workloads [S72329]
abstract: The major impact that storage can have on the performance of AI applications often isn't realized before it's too late when architecting AI-focused data centers. We've assembled a panel of experts from across the NVIDIA storage partner ecosystem to provide insight on how innovation is enabling AI data centers to get the most from their storage for their AI application.

title: Stream Data Processing with Event-Driven GPUDirect Inference for Multi-Model AI [P72961]
abstract: We present new techniques for AI-driven cyber-physical systems with our event-driven streaming GPU computing approach. We enhance performance by reducing inference overhead by 20% compared to previous state-of-the-art methods and increasing throughput by 173.2%, enabling efficient multi-model concurrent execution with low GPU resource consumption.

title: Streaming Into the Future: AI in Live Sports [S72512]
abstract: Join our insightful session that will unveil the present and future of AI in live sports, showing how this technology is set to revolutionize every aspect of the game, from the field to the living room. Our expert panelists will discuss the cutting-edge applications of artificial intelligence across fan engagement, operations, and player performance, focusing on how AI is transforming the way we experience, analyze, and interact with athletic events in real time.

title: Streamline Drug Discovery With NVIDIA BioNeMo NIMs and Blueprints [DLIT73950]
abstract:
Drug discovery involves several stages, including target identification, hit identification, and lead optimization, each requiring the analysis of large biochemical datasets. Artificial intelligence has already shown great promise in enhancing these stages, for which NVIDIA BioNeMo provides a platform for training, fine-tuning, and deploying LLMs and generative AI tailored for drug discovery. With BioNeMo NIMs, researchers can streamline AI workflows using cloud-native, modular components that improve the scalability and deployment of complex models. We'll highlight how BioNeMo NIMs and Blueprints can accelerate drug development, improve prediction accuracy, and enable more efficient analysis of biochemical data, showcasing real-world examples of their transformative potential in drug discovery.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic python understanding.
Basic ML understanding.
Basic understanding of dockers.

title: Streamlining Investment Insights for Wealth Management with Generative AI [S71653]
abstract: The collaboration between UBS and NVIDIA focuses on real-time risk assessment and monitoring of production retrieval augmented generation (RAG). Unlike holistic evaluations of RAG applications, real-time solutions must introduce minimal latency and offer a high degree of live adaptation and reasoning. To ensure the live observability of large language models (LLMs), we use "LLMs as a judge," where the reliability of the answers provided by one LLM is re-evaluated by another LLM before being returned as the system’s output. A common pitfall in "LLM as a judge" applications is that models tend to prefer their own answers, and thus undermine a system’s trustworthiness. To provide a first-of-its-class solution to this problem in the heavily-regulated banking industry, we adopt NVIDIA’s NIMs to deploy an open-source model as the LLM judge and extend it with observability tools from NeMo Guardrails and Evaluator.

title: Stream Your Immersive Experiences With CloudXR [CWE72616]
abstract:
Discover how NVIDIA’s CloudXR technology enables the streaming of virtual and augmented reality content across devices without the need for high-powered local hardware. We’ll explain how developers and enterprises can leverage CloudXR to deliver high-fidelity, low-latency experiences over 5G and Wi-Fi networks, allowing users to interact with complex simulations and immersive environments from anywhere. Learn how to integrate CloudXR into your workflow and optimize performance for your applications, and see real-world use cases that are redefining industries through scalable and flexible immersive streaming.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Structured Cabling Considerations for AI Cluster Flexibility (Presented by CommScope) [EXS74388]
abstract: Enabling flexibility within AI clusters for capacity growth, application migration, and innovative next-generation solutions through physical layer choice can extend the values and life cycle of the network. We'll focus on cable media options and the longer-term impact on network evolution and scale. Join us as we review practical choices that can positively impact cabling installation, migration efficiency, and sustainability for Day 2 operations.

title: Structure From Chaos: Accelerate GraphRAG With cuGraph and NVIDIA NIM [DLIT71491]
abstract:
Learn how to integrate large language models (LLMs) with NVIDIA Inference Microservices (NIM) and cuGraph to create cutting-edge, graph-based AI solutions for handling complex, interconnected data. We'll cover fine-tuning techniques, Langchain agents, and GPU-accelerated graph analytics to enhance AI capabilities and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) evaluation.
Prerequisite(s):

Generative AI knowledge about LLMs and RAG.
Understanding of vector-based RAG and embedding vectors.

title: Supercharge Enterprise AI Inference Using Amazon Bedrock and SageMaker AI (Presented by Amazon Web Services)  [S74273]
abstract: As generative AI transforms enterprise applications, organizations face growing challenges in deploying and scaling these sophisticated models. This expert panel brings together technology leaders who have successfully implemented production-scale AI systems using Amazon Bedrock and SageMaker AI. Through real-world examples, including Cisco's implementation of AI-powered collaboration tools, panelists will discuss architectural decisions and operational best practices that enable successful AI deployment. Learn how enterprises are leveraging NVIDIA's technologies and AWS services to optimize inference performance, manage costs, and scale effectively. We'll cover such critical topics as advanced inference techniques, infrastructure choices, and performance tuning. Whether you're building customer-facing AI applications or scaling internal AI capabilities, you'll gain practical insights from organizations that have successfully navigated these challenges.

title: Supercharge Gen AI Development With Z by HP GenAI Lab and AI Studio (Presented by HP) [S74465]
abstract: Unlock the power of on-premise LLM development with Z by HP's comprehensive AI solutions. Learn how GenAI Lab and AI Studio enable developers to build, test, and deploy sophisticated LLM applications while maintaining complete data security and control. Through practical demonstrations, discover how these tools streamline the entire LLM development lifecycle - from initial experimentation to production deployment. See how you can leverage these solutions to create custom LLM applications that remain completely on-premise, ensuring data privacy while maximizing development efficiency. Perfect for organizations looking to harness the power of LLMs without compromising security or control.

title: SuperWater: Predicting Water Molecule Positions on Protein Structures by Generative AI [P73524]
abstract: We present a novel generative AI framework that integrates a score-based diffusion model with equivariant graph neural networks to predict water molecule placements around proteins with high accuracy. SuperWater surpasses existing methods, delivering state-of-the-art performance in both crystal water coverage and prediction precision, achieving water localization within 0.35 ± 0.06 angstrom of experimentally validated positions. This framework can be adapted for various applications, including structural biology, binding site prediction, multi-body docking, and water-mediated drug design.

title: Surgical AI Copilot for Robot-Assisted Surgeries [P72975]
abstract: Learn how we built Surgical AI Copilot, a real-time vision language model (VLM) capable of answering questions about ongoing surgical procedures that require both situational understanding and expert knowledge. We'll share our experience on how we leveraged the Holoscan platform to integrate our VLM in a real-time inference pipeline with other AI agents.

We'll share our experience on how we leveraged the Holoscan platform to integrate our VLM in a real-time inference pipeline with other AI agents.

title: Surgical Robotics and AI Agents From the Heart of the O.R.  [EXS74638]
abstract: Moon Surgical’s Maestro System has unparalleled edge compute capability, accelerated by NVIDIA Holoscan, the IGX 700 Orin Platform, and Dedicated Computing. We'll review the digital surgical assistant that can run multiple AI agents and computer vision/ML algorithms directly on the system, bringing the age of physical AI into the operating room (O.R.) of the future.

title: Sustainable Futures Showcase [S74531]
abstract: Join the Inception Sustainable Futures Showcase to discover how startups are harnessing NVIDIA technology for sustainable innovation. See real-world applications in climate entrepreneurship across high-impact domains such as agriculture, carbon capture, clean energy, climate and weather, environmental analysis, green computing, sustainable infrastructure, and waste management. You’ll also learn about the transformative impact of NVIDIA’s Earth-2 initiative.

title: SwinPIR: A Deep Learning Framework for Package Dynamic IR Drop Prediction Using Video Swin Transformer [P72811]
abstract: We propose SwinPIR, a novel framework using the Video Swin Transformer to predict the bump-to-bump inductance matrix for flip-chip chip-scale packages. This innovative solution addresses the critical issue of IR drop in shrinking processes, offering a 500X speed increase over commercial solutions while maintaining high accuracy, significantly reducing design cycle times, and enhancing power delivery network design quality and efficiency.

title: Tame AI Sprawl: Unify Models, Data, and Infrastructure Across Hybrid Clouds (Presented by Domino Data Lab) [EXS74428]
abstract: Enterprises must master expansive AI options to balance innovation, technical complexity, costs, and governance. AI, data, and IT leaders need a common operating environment across all data and models, integration with the world’s largest clouds, and a common control plane — coupled tightly with the AI model development life cycle. Learn how Domino Data Lab and NetApp are providing a unified approach to AI and data across environments accelerated by NVIDIA AI using Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP.

title: Tencent HunYuan: Building a High-Performance Inference Engine for Large Models Based on NVIDIA TensorRT-LLM [S71563]
abstract: Tencent HunYuan large language models cover a variety of tasks, including text-to-text, text-to-image, text-to-video, and multimodal understanding. Low latency and low-cost inference for large language models are key challenges for the implementation of HunYuan. Tencent HunYuan has worked closely with NVIDIA to build the high-performance inference engine AngelHCF for HunYuan large language models based on TensorRT-LLM. This supports the online deployment of the HunYuan Turbo trillion-parameter mixture-of-experts (MoE) large language model and has optimized the inference time of the HunYuan text-to-video model to within 2 minutes. Since the implementation of HunYuan large language models, the inference cost has been optimized by over 90%, supporting the efficient deployment of more than 700+ Tencent products. Therefore, we will take the HunYuan trillion-parameter MoE large language model and the HunYuan text-to-video diffusion model as examples to introduce how the HunYuan team and the NVIDIA team have optimized the inference technology based on the TensorRT-LLM framework, and highlight some key methods for optimizing the performance and reducing the latency of large language models and diffusion models.

title: Tencent HunYuan: Building a High-Performance Inference Engine for Large Models Based on NVIDIA TensorRT-LLM [S71563]
abstract: Tencent HunYuan large language models cover a variety of tasks, including text-to-text, text-to-image, text-to-video, and multimodal understanding. title: Text to Structural Form 3D: Enhancing Structural Form-Finding Through a Text-Based AI Engine Leveraging NVIDIA RTX A100 GPU for LLM Label Creation [P73381]
abstract: Text2StructForm3D is a machine-learning-based design framework that explores descriptive representations of structural forms. It utilizes a natural language processing (NLP) technique, with combinatorial equilibrium modeling (CEM), a form-finding approach based on graphic statics. The framework is trained on a dataset of structural design options generated by CEM, paired with corresponding text descriptions. Each structure is assigned text labels derived from its structural performance, including characteristics like typology, size, length, and height. Designers then label the clusters with descriptive adjectives to evaluate three creative dimensions: novelty, resolution, and elaboration. Using Llama 3, we generate multiple variations of each structure’s initial label. Using four NVIDIA RTX A100 GPUs, the processing time speedup 15X, from one week to two hours. Once the additional labels are created, an encoder translates them into word embeddings that serve as input for CEM.

title: The 2%: Investing in Women-Led Innovation [SE72610]
abstract: Despite the persistent narrative that a lack of women-led companies explains why only 2% of venture capital funding goes to women, in reality female entrepreneurs are leading some of the most innovative ventures across various industries. This panel will challenge the myth of scarcity by spotlighting the growing number of women-led companies and the groundbreaking innovations they're driving. We'll explore the untapped potential of women-led businesses, highlight examples of cutting-edge technologies, and provide insights on how investors can capitalize on this thriving but overlooked sector. Join us as we reframe the conversation around investing in women and the transformative impact of their work.

title: The ABCs of SDG (Synthetic Data Generation) [S73237]
abstract:
With recent releases of state of the art permissively licensed Large Language Models. Synthetic Data Generation (SDG) has
stormed onto the scene.
 
NVIDIA, alongside our partner Gretel, will examine how synthetic data generation techniques are evolving to meet the
demands of modern machine learning algorithms- with special focus on generating data to power AI data flywheels with RAG
systems and creating synthetic traces to improve models' reasoning capabilities. 
 
The session will discuss benefits of synthetic data, how to implement it within your training and evaluation workflow using software tooling, demonstrate practical model impacts, and discuss performance gains.

title: The Anti-Portfolio: VCs Share the Startups that Got Away [DD73697]
abstract: Join Eleanor Haglund, Manager of the VC Alliance at NVIDIA, along with a panel of leading VCs, as they explore the challenges even the most seasoned investors face. Hear firsthand from investors about the key insights and valuable lessons they've gained from deals they passed on, how those experiences have shaped their strategies moving forward, and what startups can do differently to get the coveted term sheet from the investor of their dreams.

title: The Big Data Challenge of Radio Astronomy [S72826]
abstract: Radio astronomers are engaged in an ambitious new project to detect faster, fainter, and more distant astrophysical phenomena using thousands of individual radio receivers linked through interferometry. The expected deluge of data (up to 300 petabytes per year) poses a significant computational challenge that requires rethinking and redesigning the state-of-the-art data analysis pipelines.

title: The CUDA C++ Developer’s Toolbox [S72572]
abstract: Getting the most out of your GPU with CUDA C++ doesn't require writing custom kernels or manually managing storage for everything! Learn about the libraries and techniques that not only make writing CUDA C++ applications easier, but give you better performance. Through examples, we'll explore all aspects of writing modern CUDA C++ software, including heterogeneous memory management, algorithm design, and project setup.

title: The CUDA Python Developer’s Toolbox [S72448]
abstract: Writing GPU code in Python is easier than ever! Gain valuable insight into the diverse collection of CUDA libraries and frameworks that enable significant performance boosts across various computational tasks. Through practical examples, you'll see popular CUDA Python libraries in action, illustrating their effectiveness in real-world scenarios. We'll share valuable tips and tricks designed to help you maximize the performance of your own Python projects. Whether you’re new to GPU programming or looking to enhance your existing skills, this session will equip you with the knowledge needed to leverage the full potential of the CUDA Python development stack for accelerated computing.

title: The Edge AI Application Development Ecosystem (Presented by EDOM Technology) [S74447]
abstract: This session provides an overview of the edge AI application ecosystem. Developers need to integrate all related hardware and software resources to complete edge AI application design. Get the whole picture and find suitable resources to speed up your edge AI application development. We'll explore hardware-accelerated AI pipelines, peripherals and sensors, and important software development kits support for edge AI applications like robotics, autonomous machines, and intelligent video analytics.

title: The embodied end-to-end VLA model driven by synthetic big data 合成大数据驱动的具身端到端 VLA 大模型 [S71942]
abstract:
The high cost and scarcity of data are significant bottlenecks for embodied intelligence. However, high-quality synthetic big data provides a cost-effective solution to enhance the generalization of embodied end-to-end models. This report highlights technological breakthroughs in Vision-Language-Action (VLA) model systems, using the end-to-end manipulation model GraspVLA and the navigation model Uni-NaVid as examples, to demonstrate the realization of their generalization capabilities.

具身数据的昂贵和不足目前是具身智能的重要瓶颈，而高质量的合成大数据为具身端到端大模型的泛化提供了一个低成本方案。
本报告以端到端操作模型 GraspVLA 和 端到端导航 Uni-NaVid 等系列工作为例，探讨视觉-语言-动作（VLA）大模型系统的技术突破及其泛化能力的实现。

title: The European AI Factory: What to Demand From AI Factory-as-a-Service (Presented by Northern Data Group) [S74244]
abstract: Scaling AI across the enterprise is essential for maintaining a competitive edge — but efficient execution is complex. Hear how visionary companies are working together to provide a one-stop-shop for any business, combining the latest GPUs, enterprise software platforms, and agile, on-demand compute models. Get insights about the European-style AI factory that ensures affordable, scalable access to cutting-edge NVIDIA accelerated technology for advanced AI use cases. Learn how data sovereignty principles that guide the development of AI infrastructure in Europe provide a future-proof model for global businesses.

title: The European AI Factory: What to Demand From AI Factory-as-a-Service (Presented by Northern Data Group) [S74244]
abstract: Scaling AI across the enterprise is essential for maintaining a competitive edge — but efficient execution is complex. title: The Evolving Landscape of Open Source in Generative AI Foundation Models [S72132]
abstract: In order to effectively and safely build generative technologies into their products and businesses, developers need continuous access to the latest AI innovations. However, new challenges are emerging: access to source code for high-performance foundation models is becoming increasingly limited, and concerns over data privacy, copyright, and risk management are slowing down development velocity. We'll explore the role of open-source foundation models in generative AI development, focusing on emerging licensing models that promote safer and more ethical use. We'll also present alternatives to open source that can accelerate development velocity, especially in domains where privacy and copyright are key concerns.

title: The Expanding Sound: Unlock Creativity With AI in Audio Innovation [S74507]
abstract: Advancements in artificial intelligence are reshaping the audio landscape, offering unprecedented opportunities for creativity and innovation. This panel explores how AI is revolutionizing music composition, sound design, audio production, and immersive experiences. Industry leaders and experts will discuss cutting-edge AI tools, ethical considerations, and the balance between human artistry and machine learning. Gain insights into how AI empowers creators to push the boundaries of sound, fostering collaboration and unlocking new dimensions of auditory expression. Join us to explore the future of audio innovation and the expanding possibilities of creative soundscapes.

title: The Fused Kernel Library: On-Demand Kernel Fusion, New Modularity [P73324]
abstract: State-of-the-art libraries don't properly exploit a GPU's latency hiding, because they offer many memory-bound kernels and/or fused kernels that suit most, but not all, users. To overcome these limitations we created The Fused Kernel Library, a methodology to write C++ GPU libraries that will allow non-CUDA programmers to create their own fused kernels, without having to learn CUDA Kernel programming, improving the state-of-the-art performance and feature flexibility.

title: The Fused Kernel Library: On-Demand Kernel Fusion, New Modularity [P73324]
abstract: State-of-the-art libraries don't properly exploit a GPU's latency hiding, because they offer many memory-bound kernels and/or fused kernels that suit most, but not all, users. To overcome these limitations we created The Fused Kernel Library, a methodology to write C++ GPU libraries that will allow non-CUDA programmers to create their own fused kernels, without having to learn CUDA Kernel programming, improving the state-of-the-art performance and feature flexibility.

title: The Future of AI: Scaling Intelligence, Open-Source Innovation, and Human-AI Collaboration [S73863]
abstract:
Join us for an exclusive fireside chat with Ali Farhadi, CEO of AI2, as we explore the next frontier of artificial intelligence — from scaling models efficiently to the transformative power of open-source AI. Ali, a strong advocate for open research and democratizing AI, will share his vision on how open-source AI ecosystems can drive innovation, accelerate breakthroughs, and ensure equitable access to cutting-edge technology.

In this engaging conversation, we’ll discuss efficiency-driven architectures like mixture of experts (MoE) and multi-head latent attention (MLA), test-time compute strategies, speculative decoding, and the balance between scalability and responsible AI development. We’ll also dive into the role of multi-modal AI, the challenges of proprietary versus open models, and how the AI community can foster transparency and collaboration.

title: The Future of AI: Scaling Intelligence, Open-Source Innovation, and Human-AI Collaboration [S73863]

title: The Future of Dynamic, Adaptive AI Models (Presented by Applied Digital) [S74224]
abstract:
AI innovation is accelerating at an unprecedented pace. The shift from pre-trained and fine-tuned models to post-training is revolutionizing how AI learns, adapts, and specializes—driving an explosion in compute demand.

In this session, Applied Digital and SF Compute explore the impact of open-source models like DeepSeek R1, which are lowering the barrier to AI development while increasing the need for high-performance, on-demand compute. Learn how post-training enables businesses to refine and optimize models for specific industry applications—without massive R&D costs.

We’ll discuss the evolving AI infrastructure landscape, how short-term, burstable compute solutions are changing the game, and why companies must act now to stay ahead in the race for AI specialization. Get started at www.post.training to access on-demand compute resources and unlock the full potential of post-training.

title: The Future of Marketing: Unilever’s Innovative Approach with Digital Twins [S71412]
abstract: Join Unilever’s Chief Growth and Marketing Officer Esi Eggleston Bracey and creative-tech innovators Collective World to discover how Unilever is pioneering consistent, creative, and ultra-high-quality product images at scale with NVIDIA Omniverse–powered digital twins.

title: The Future of Ray Tracing for Real-Time and Production Rendering [S73725]
abstract: Join us for a deep dive into new APIs and techniques using OptiX 9.0. Learn how to combine ray tracing with AI, including neural textures and neural materials; how to animate complex ray-traced scenes in real time; and how to improve hair rendering performance.

title: The Future of Retail E-Commerce: Embedding Generative AI to Enhance Search and Shopping Assistants [S71086]
abstract: Join this session to learn how definitive production-level data we can improve customer purchase conversions and increase revenue on ecommerce sites. We’ll dive into how are leveraging a NVIDIA built-model and inference technology to power a Hybrid vector search engine.

title: The Future of Training in the Era of Agentic, Physical, and Sustainable AI (Presented by HPE) [S74479]
abstract: The world’s largest companies and research centers are evolving to agentic and physical AI to advance their innovations and make breakthroughs. The growth of training sizes requires specialized solutions to efficiently support strong scaling and compute-intensive workloads. Learn how you can outpace the competition with AI-capable HPC solutions to drive discovery and streamline resources to make decisions faster — from accelerating time-to-market for new drugs and vehicles to advancing renewable energy initiatives.

title: The Future of Video Compression is AI-Driven [S72840]
abstract:
Learn how AI is reshaping video compression by enhancing efficiency and quality in future-ready video workflows. As AI algorithms focus on compression efforts and improve bitrate optimization, the video itself transforms into AI video.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly: Cost-Efficient LLM Inference With Quantization, Pruning, and Distillation [DLIT71489]
abstract:
Dive into theoretical aspects and practical use cases for compression techniques used in creating more efficient versions of preferred models. Learn the main methods of compression — quantization, pruning, distillation — in detail, and compare trade-offs and options for jointly using multiple compression techniques. You'll become well-equipped to perform efficient inference and reduce costs when deploying LLMs. You'll understand the trade-offs in accuracy, latency, and hardware requirements for each method, and have hands-on expertise in deploying them using solutions from NVIDIA stack.
Prerequisite(s):

Python.
Basic knowledge of LLMs.
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks.

title: The Great Power Shift: How AI is Changing Decision Rights (Presented by TCS) [S74601]
abstract: MIT Sloan Management Review, working with TCS, offers compelling evidence that intelligence choice architectures (ICAs) can transform decision-making. AI’s role is evolving from task automation to reshaping how decisions are made. ICAs use the power of AI to redefine decision-making; they're grounded in the principles of choice architecture from behavioral economics. As AI agents, ICAs can articulate and explain trade-offs, surface hidden options, highlight overlooked interdependencies, and suggest new pathways to success. What truly sets AI-driven choice architectures apart are their abilities to innovatively engage with human decision-makers and learn to make better recommendations and choices through feedback loops. TCS will examine the changing power dynamics of decision-making, decision rights considerations, and custom choices for a custom AI journey. We’ll explore how by leveraging NVIDIA’s innovative AI platform, AI is becoming a key player in corporate decision-making.

title: The Hidden Driver of Autonomy: Why Remote Driving is Indispensable [S71851]
abstract: Discover how integrating teledriving with autonomous driving systems is revolutionizing autonomy. You’ll hear about “assisted autonomy," an innovative solution that addresses complex edge cases through human oversight, bridging the gap toward full autonomy. See assisted autonomy in action, and understand why this approach is a game-changer for autonomous fleets. Gain insights into how addressing edge cases in autonomy through teledriving significantly reduces costs and development challenges. Dive into demonstrations of seamless transitions between AI-driven autonomy and human teledriving, and see how these enable end-to-end driverless operations.

title: The Human Touch: Enhance Gen AI With Quality Post-Training and Evaluation Data [S73235]
abstract:
We'll delve into the critical role of high-quality human data in the post-training phase of generative AI models. While initial training sets the foundation, the human-generated data used for fine-tuning and reinforcement often determine a model's real-world effectiveness. We'll explore how carefully curated human inputs can significantly improve model performance, reduce biases, and enhance the relevance and safety of AI-generated content.
 
Learn strategies for sourcing, vetting, and incorporating diverse human data, including leveraging internal experts, as well as techniques to balance automation with human oversight. Discover why investing in quality human data post-training is key to developing more capable, responsible, and human-aligned AI systems.

title: The Impact of AI in Industrial, Robotics, and Medical Safety and Security [S72815]
abstract: Artificial intelligence is unlocking new use cases in industrial, robotics, and medical, in which safety and security are a key concern. Get an overview of ongoing AI safety and security standardization initiatives. We'll also discuss the impact of those new requirements to AI-based methodologies, architectures, and tools.

title: The Impact of AI on Filmmaking: Real-World Transformation [S73743]
abstract:
Dive into the transformative power of AI across the entire filmmaking spectrum. We'll showcase groundbreaking examples from blockbuster movies and record-breaking music videos, demonstrating AI's impact beyond visual effects. Discover how AI technology empowers directors with unprecedented real-time control over character expressions and movements on set. Explore a future where AI amplifies human artistry, democratizes high-end production techniques, and redefines the boundaries of cinematic storytelling.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

abstract:
Connect with NVIDIA experts to discuss how generative AI is revolutionizing the automotive industry, from vehicle design and manufacturing to customer service and in-vehicle intelligence. Discuss how GenAI is being used to enhance customer service, personalizing the user experience and providing intelligent, real-time support.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. title: The Instrumental Edge: Enabling Real-Time AI Scientific Discovery [S72921]
abstract:
From radio telescopes to high-speed laser accelerators, scientific instruments produce tremendous amounts of data at equally high rates; previous architectures that relied on offline storage and large data transfers can't keep up. The future of scientific discovery is interactive, streaming, and AI-driven, placing the autonomous and intelligent instrument at the center of a given science workflow. By making our instruments smarter, scientists can run higher-impact experiments and yield higher-fidelity data, wherein noise is largely discarded from the signal.  
  
In this talk, collaborators from Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) and the SETI Institute will brief their work advancing edge HPC workflows. LLNL will highlight their efforts toward building and using small-scale surrogate facilities of large-scale instruments for rapid prototyping, and the SETI Institute will highlight their work in building the world’s first real-time AI pipeline on raw sensor data to look for fast radio bursts and extraterrestrial intelligence. Altogether, this talk highlights the power of building community across domains and advancing the state of the art of physical experimentation.

title: The (LLM) Architects – ARC-AGI 2024 Winning Solution (Presented by Lambda) [S74252]
abstract: LLMs can be trained to achieve high scores on abstract reasoning tasks like the Abstraction and Reasoning Corpus (ARC-AGI), as demonstrated by our 1st place solution to the Kaggle ARC Prize 2024 Competition, which employed a tailored data augmentation approach, a custom depth-first-search sampling scheme, and the Mistral-NeMo-Minitron-8B-Base model as both predictor and classifier for a 53.5% private set score. We fine-tuned first on an NVIDIA H100 Tensor Core GPU, then on Kaggle’s two NVIDIA T4 Tensor Core GPUs (as required by the competition), using unsloth with NVIDIA CUDA for efficient training.

title: The New Role of AI in Electric Vehicles [S73711]
abstract:
Join RJ Scaringe, CEO of Rivian, for a fireside chat with Rishi Dhall, VP of automotive business at NVIDIA, where he'll discuss the groundbreaking innovations shaping the future of electric vehicles (EVs) and the role of cutting-edge technologies in Rivian's vision. RJ will share insights into how Rivian is leveraging artificial intelligence, autonomous driving, and advanced computing to create sustainable transportation solutions that push the boundaries of performance, safety, and environmental impact. This conversation will explore the intersection of EV development with the latest advancements in AI and GPU-powered technology, underscoring how these tools are revolutionizing the automotive industry.

This is a must-attend session for anyone interested in the future of mobility and the technologies driving its transformation.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: The Next Era of Payments: How Generative AI is Shaping the Future  [S72846]
abstract: Artificial Intelligence is transforming industries, and the financial services sector is no exception. Visa has long been at the forefront of innovation, leveraging AI to enable secure, seamless, and personalized payment experiences for millions of customers worldwide. In this session, we’ll explore how Visa is harnessing the power of Generative AI to reshape the future of payments, leading the way in security and convenience. We’ll discuss the unique challenges of applying AI in financial services and share how our advanced techniques and tailored approaches unlock new possibilities. Join us to discover how Visa is shaping the future of payments and financial services through the transformative potential of AI.

title: The Next Era of Surgery: AI-Driven Innovation in the Operating Room [EXS74337]
abstract:
A new era of surgery is unfolding, driven by the potential of AI, advanced video connectivity, and intelligent surgical technologies. Learn how the next-generation surgical displays of Barco and SoftAcuity, equipped with voice assistance and real-time AI, are designed to enhance workflows during image-guided surgeries. 

Leveraging the NVIDIA Holoscan platform and the compute power of IGX, we'll demonstrate how Barco’s Nexxis technology aims to deliver optimized AI-powered compute integration, ultra-low latency, and enhanced performance in the operating room.
location: The Next Era of Surgery: AI-Driven Innovation in the Operating Room [EXS74337]

title: The Next Frontier in AI: Multi-Agent Systems (Presented by Cognizant) [S74588]
abstract:
Learn how enterprises can quickly discover, prototype, and deploy AI-driven solutions using the Cognizant Neuro AI Decisioning Platform. We'll request a company name from the audience and build a use case in under 15 minutes. 

Enhanced with multi-agent orchestration, this platform helps identify opportunities, create prototypes, and build AI decision-making use cases across siloed operations. Leveraging specialized AI agents and powered by NVIDIA NIMS/NeMo, it improves performance and generates new revenue streams. 
Additionally, the Neuro AI Multi-agent Accelerator is a no-code/low-code framework with pre-built agent networks for rapid creation, customization, and scaling of multi-agent systems. It supports various enterprise and industry functions and allows natural language descriptions to create additional agent networks suited to specific use cases. Built on NVIDIA NIM models and endpoints, it incorporates langchain-based substitutes and NVIDIA blueprints. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: The Next Frontier of AI Supercomputing: Efficiency With Unprecedented Capability [S72599]
abstract: Groundbreaking hardware technologies and AI are unlocking unprecedented computational power. NVIDIA’s Ian Buck will highlight cutting-edge innovations that are revolutionizing high-performance computing while prioritizing energy conservation. Discover how these technologies are enabling industries and nations to achieve new insights. Join us to explore how supercomputing is not only advancing capabilities, but also paving the way for a greener, more efficient future in tech.

title: The Next Generation of C-Level Leaders [SE73734]
abstract: We're bringing together visionary leaders from today's hottest startups to share insights shaping the future of business. Get an inside look at how these innovators are leveraging cutting-edge technology, bold strategies, and fresh perspectives to redefine industries and create disruptive growth. From lessons in leadership to the latest trends in innovation, this session offers invaluable takeaways for established executives and aspiring leaders alike. Discover what it takes to thrive in an era of rapid transformation and emerging opportunities.

title: The Next Reasoning Benchmark [S72934]
abstract: Sakana AI is releasing a new reasoning benchmark. This benchmark is currently extremely hard, even for the best reasoning models. We believe that this will push AI progress forward. We'll also present brief overviews of other research projects at Sakana AI.

title: The Performance of CUDA with the Flexibility of PyTorch [S71946]
abstract: This talk explores how PyTorch users are also becoming CUDA developers. We'll start with motivating examples from eager, the launch of torch.compile and the more recent trend of kernel zoos. We will share details on how we went about integrating low bit matmuls in torchao and the torch.compile CUTLASS backend. We'll also discuss details on how you can define, build and package your own custom ops in PyTorch so you get the raw performance of CUDA while maintaining the flexibility of PyTorch.

title: The Promise of Humanoid Robots: Research vs. the Real World [S72592]
abstract: The promise of humanoid robots performing complex tasks alongside humans has captivated imaginations for decades. We've seen remarkable progress in areas like bipedal locomotion, manipulation, and even basic task learning. However, the crucial question remains: are we truly seeing progress in terms of practical, deployable humanoid solutions, or are we primarily observing results in isolated research settings? We'll delve into this critical distinction, examining the current state of humanoid robotics and identifying the gap between laboratory demonstrations and real-world applications. We'll analyze key challenges hindering widespread adoption, including robustness in unstructured environments, cost-effectiveness, and the critical need for advanced AI capable of genuine adaptability and problem-solving. We'll also explore promising avenues for bridging this gap. By critically assessing both the achievements and the limitations of current humanoid technology, we'll foster a realistic perspective on the future of humanoids in the workforce and identify the key steps needed to translate exciting progress into tangible results.

title: The Race to AI Advantage: Rapidly Deploy and Optimize AI Infrastructure (Presented by Penguin Solutions) [S74594]
abstract:
AI is evolving at an unprecedented pace and, in today’s data-driven landscape, CIOs, vice presidents of infrastructure and operations, and data center leaders are under tremendous pressure to deliver high-performance and scalable AI to a broad range of users with varying needs. These dynamics exponentially complicate the management of AI infrastructure — which is unlike prior architectures. Learn AI cluster management best practices for overcoming project delays and failures, talent shortages, and ultimately poorly performing systems. 

Learn what IT leaders need to know to deliver high-performing integrated and intelligent compute environments, including a recent successful deployment at Georgia Tech. The need for intelligent compute environments finely tuned to an organization’s AI workloads has never been greater, as siloed systems and fragmented workflows compromise the efficiency, security, and responsiveness of today’s AI-powered operations.

title: The Real Last Mile: De-Risking Generative AI in Production [S72874]
abstract: While moving generative AI proofs of concept to production is often considered a key final phase in the journey to achieving results, efficiently assessing and mitigating ongoing security, safety, and performance issues present additional hills to climb. In this round of lightning talks, hear from three innovative companies tackling real-time gen AI risk assessment and mitigation. Through demos and real-world examples, you’ll understand tools and best practices for programmatically addressing LLM application vulnerabilities across the development life cycle.

title: The Real Last Mile: De-Risking Generative AI in Production [S72874]
abstract: While moving generative AI proofs of concept to production is often considered a key final phase in the journey to achieving results, efficiently assessing and mitigating ongoing security, safety, and performance issues present additional hills to climb. In this round of lightning talks, hear from three innovative companies tackling real-time gen AI risk assessment and mitigation. Through demos and real-world examples, you’ll understand tools and best practices for programmatically addressing LLM application vulnerabilities across the development life cycle.

title: The Role of AI and Accelerated Computing in Understanding and Mitigating Urban Climate Change [S73442]
abstract:
This panel explores the transformative potential of artificial intelligence and accelerated computing in deciphering the complex drivers of urban climate change, and how it can help mitigate it. As cities, home to 4.4 billion people, grapple with increasing environmental challenges, including extreme heat waves driven by a combination of climate change and the urban heat island effect, these cutting-edge technologies offer unprecedented capabilities to analyze vast datasets, model intricate urban systems, and generate actionable insights for policymakers and urban planners.

We'll delve into how AI-powered tools are revolutionizing climate modeling and weather forecasting, enabling high-resolution simulations of urban microclimates and their interactions with the built environment. Experts will discuss the application of generative AI, digital twins, and machine learning algorithms in processing and interpreting diverse data sources, including satellite imagery, internet-of-things sensor networks, and social media feeds, to provide a comprehensive understanding of urban heat islands, air pollution patterns, and energy consumption dynamics.

We'll highlight accelerated computing's role in dramatically reducing computation time and energy consumption for climate simulations and show how it enables more frequent and detailed analyses of urban climate phenomena. We'll also cover innovative projects leveraging these technologies, such as digital twins of cities and AI-driven urban planning tools that optimize for climate resilience. 

Panelists will discuss the challenges and opportunities in implementing AI and accelerated computing solutions, including data privacy concerns, the need for interdisciplinary collaboration, the critical role of compute infrastructure, and strategies for ensuring equitable access to these technologies. We'll finish by exploring the potential of these technologies to inform evidence-based climate adaptation strategies and contribute to sustainable development goals.

title: The Safe and Trustworthy Intelligent AI Assistant for Every Enterprise [P72499]
abstract: There are many generative AI solutions, but not many that offer enough safety, reliability, and effectiveness for a specific enterprise. IvyChat is a comprehensive solution tailored to each enterprise's needs to increase productivity by automating various tasks like Q&A on documents, visualization, advanced data analysis, and text-to-SQL.

title: The Speed of Thought: Navigate LLM Inference Autoscaling for a Gen AI Application Toward Production [DLIT71339]
abstract:
Learn how to choose the autoscaling hyperparameters for your LLM applications by understanding the key metrics during inference. Gain essential tools to optimize latency and throughput by running and dissecting LLM inference benchmarks. See how NVIDIA's benchmarking software can be leveraged to make an informed decision about the Kubernetes deployment of your Gen AI application. You'll acquire best practices and tips to allow you to bring low latency at unmatched cost-effectiveness to your NIM applications for production.
Prerequisite(s):

Comfortable reading code in Python and Pandas.
Basic understanding of Kubernetes.
Basic understanding of LLMs.

title: The Telco AI Renaissance Is Here [S72984]
abstract:
It’s been a bumper year for AI-focused initiatives in the telecoms industry. On the infrastructure side, at least 10 telcos have deployed sovereign AI infrastructure, enabling them to turbocharge AI initiatives in their domestic market. On operational activities, the spate of Gen AI initiatives across different segments of the telecom business is accelerating. On preparing for the future, we saw the launch of the first AI-radio access network (RAN) in Japan and accompanying acceleration of activities at the AI-RAN Alliance to develop technologies and capabilities for the 5G+ and 6G era. These industry developments highlight that going AI-first is now every telco's default aspiration. NVIDIA is enabling the industry on this journey, providing the hardware and software platforms, tools, and blueprints for the AI-first telco. NVIDIA SVP Telecoms, Ronnie Vasishta, will talk about how NVIDIA is working with its partners to deliver on this ambition and announce new platforms, tools, and blueprints that NVIDIA is bringing to the market. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: The Trend Toward Server Liquid Cooling in the LLM Era (Presented by Powerleader Computer System Co., Ltd.) [S74354]
abstract: The development of AI and LLM has brought serious consumption of AI computing power and electricity. Traditional air cooling poses severe challenges for IT support. Liquid cooling technology has emerged to meet the demand, and will lead AI computing power into a new era.

title: The Vision AI Toolbox [CWE71225]
abstract:
Visit us and discuss ways to get started or deepen your understanding of NVIDIA tools that support Vision AI applications. Our topic experts are offering one-on-one dialogue on topics related to training, fine-tuning, and deploying a range of vision AI models. Ask about NVIDIA Metropolis, VLMs, Foundation models, NIMs, Reference workflows, DeepStream, TAO, TensorRT, Triton Inference Server, Jetson, and more.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Think A-Byte It: Overlook AI Storage Requirements at Your Own Peril (Presented by Solidigm) [S74241]
abstract: Bytes. They seem so trivial today — but without a way to store those bytes, there is no AI, there is no technology. For that reason, storage decisions have a bigger impact than you might think on the success and efficiency of your AI pipeline. Understanding AI workloads, their I/O characteristics, and making corresponding choices is imperative. We'll speak to the unique impacts of performance, mainstream, and capacity storage solutions and their influence on the power, performance, and overall density of a complete AI solution. From rack space to power analysis, a multi-variable, total-cost-of-ownership analysis is not a simple task. Efficiency at scale can only be accomplished with careful planning and ongoing innovation in storage solutions to accompany the associated GPU, CPU, memory, and power analysis to drive your AI strategy forward.

title: Think Fast! Accelerate Your Game Services [S74406]
abstract: Unlock the full potential of your game services and elevate performance by leveraging GPU acceleration. In this session, we'll show you how to supercharge critical services— disruptive name detection, prosocial chat detection, and disruptive voice detection—by transitioning from CPU to GPU compute. By harnessing the power of GPUs, you'll gain faster, more efficient data processing, and increased concurrency—all while delivering real-time responses that enhance player experience and trust.

title: Tokyo-1とBioNeMoで実現するAIベースの創薬ワークフローの構築 [S73892]
abstract: 小野薬品はNVIDIA DGX H100を計算基盤としたTokyo-1プロジェクトに参画しました。それ以降GPUを活用した大規模ドッキング、高精度タンパク質ーリガンド結合予測の高速化、タンパク質言語モデルの活用などを推進しています。GPU活用するを希望する人材も3倍になり、AI創薬を加速させています。

title: Toward a Comprehensive Framework for Evaluating LLMs in Clinical Applications [S72020]
abstract:
Healthcare AI is evolving fast, but how do we know if it's truly ready for real-world use? Benchmarks like MedQA, USMLE, and MMLU don't tell the whole story. And while real-world trials are crucial, they take time — often so long that the AI has already moved on by the time results are in. With proliferating model choices both open (Med42-v2, Meditron-3, OpenBioLLM) and closed (GPT-4, Claude 3.5, Gemini, etc.), we need a structured way to evaluate LLMs quickly and thoroughly, helping us select the right one for specific medical tasks.

That's why we developed MEDIC, a new framework to assess LLMs more comprehensively. It looks at key areas like medical reasoning, ethics, and safety, giving us a clearer picture of how these models might perform in actual clinical settings. We also introduce a novel cross-examination framework that helps detect hallucination, assess coverage, and other metrics for applications such as clinical note generation, among others.

title: Toward Better Compute-Memory Balance in GPU-Enabled Density-Based CFD Solvers [P73604]
abstract: We present the transition of our unstructured polyhedral flow solver, scFLOW, to a fully GPU-resident architecture. We concentrate on an implicit multicolor Gauss-Seidel density-based CFD (computational fluid dynamics) solver, parallelized with OpenMP target offload. The solver, which offers Rusanov and HLLC fluxes for the inviscid flux and alpha-damping method for the viscous flux, executes continuously on the GPU with all data persistent in the GPU memory. We propose Frechet derivative for GPU-oriented numerical design of the CFD solver with more compact memory footprint, portable OpenMP code for multicore and GPU offload, and C++ templates for generating highly-tuned code paths. Our results demonstrate the ability to fit very large problems into a single A100 GPU, enabling the simulation of problems previously feasible only with a multinode cluster. The current prototype solver on a single NVIDIA A100 is 20% faster than our previous-generation solver running on 192 CPU threads of 4x AMD EPYC 7763 CPUs.
date_time: We present the transition of our unstructured polyhedral flow solver, scFLOW, to a fully GPU-resident architecture. We concentrate on an implicit multicolor Gauss-Seidel density-based CFD (computational fluid dynamics) solver, parallelized with OpenMP target offload. The solver, which offers Rusanov and HLLC fluxes for the inviscid flux and alpha-damping method for the viscous flux, executes continuously on the GPU with all data persistent in the GPU memory. We propose Frechet derivative for GPU-oriented numerical design of the CFD solver with more compact memory footprint, portable OpenMP code for multicore and GPU offload, and C++ templates for generating highly-tuned code paths. Our results demonstrate the ability to fit very large problems into a single A100 GPU, enabling the simulation of problems previously feasible only with a multinode cluster. The current prototype solver on a single NVIDIA A100 is 20% faster than our previous-generation solver running on 192 CPU threads of 4x AMD EPYC 7763 CPUs.

title: Toward Better Compute-Memory Balance in GPU-Enabled Density-Based CFD Solvers [P73604]
abstract: We present the transition of our unstructured polyhedral flow solver, scFLOW, to a fully GPU-resident architecture. We concentrate on an implicit multicolor Gauss-Seidel density-based CFD (computational fluid dynamics) solver, parallelized with OpenMP target offload. The solver, which offers Rusanov and HLLC fluxes for the inviscid flux and alpha-damping method for the viscous flux, executes continuously on the GPU with all data persistent in the GPU memory. We propose Frechet derivative for GPU-oriented numerical design of the CFD solver with more compact memory footprint, portable OpenMP code for multicore and GPU offload, and C++ templates for generating highly-tuned code paths. Our results demonstrate the ability to fit very large problems into a single A100 GPU, enabling the simulation of problems previously feasible only with a multinode cluster. The current prototype solver on a single NVIDIA A100 is 20% faster than our previous-generation solver running on 192 CPU threads of 4x AMD EPYC 7763 CPUs.

title: Toward Database-Free Text-to-SQL Evaluation: A Graph-Based Metric for Functional Correctness [P72633]
abstract: We introduce FuncEvalGMN, a graph-based evaluation metric designed to accurately assess SQL query correctness in text-to-SQL tasks, overcoming the limitations of existing metrics. By leveraging relational operator trees and graph neural networks, our method offers a scalable, schema-only solution that generalizes well across datasets, making it a timely and essential tool for improving the reliability of SQL query evaluation.

title: Toward Multidisciplinary Scientific Foundation Models [S72256]
abstract: We present the PolymathicAI approach to building foundation models for scientific applications, with a focus on bridging the traditional boundaries between data modalities and scientific domains. See our results on building foundational surrogate models for fluids, trained on a wide diversity of different physical systems, as well as our research on multimodal foundation models to bridge different scientific data types, with a concrete example from the field of astrophysics.

title: Toward Multidisciplinary Scientific Foundation Models: Q&A From the EMEA Region [S72256a]
abstract: We present the PolymathicAI approach to building foundation models for scientific applications, with a focus on bridging the traditional boundaries between data modalities and scientific domains. See our results on building foundational surrogate models for fluids, trained on a wide diversity of different physical systems, as well as our research on multi-modal foundation models to bridge different scientific data types, with a concrete example from the field of astrophysics.

title: Toward Rational Drug Design With AlphaFold 3 and Beyond [S72684]
abstract:
The new AlphaFold-3 model heralds a new era of drug discovery by applying the power of Artificial Intelligence to advance our understanding of biological systems and some of the fundamental mechanisms of life. The talk will share more about how we develop general models of biology and translate these into real-world impact.
 
While building upon the foundational work of AlphaFold, IsoLabs’ models push far beyond, covering molecular design, dynamics and molecular property prediction. These capabilities are general and modality and therapeutic area agnostic, giving rise to a universal AI drug design engine. By applying these models, we are not only reducing the time and cost associated with drug discovery but exploring new chemical space, making progress against traditionally intractable targets. IsoLabs’ state-of-the-art search-based and generative methods help us design new chemical matter that is transforming how we can deliver new medicines with precision and at digital speed.

title: Traceability for Agentic AI Blueprint: Deliver generative AI applications with confidence (Presented by Weights & Biases) [S74218]
abstract: Leveraging and tailoring generative AI for an enterprise's unique business requirements can be a daunting task when starting from scratch. Weights & Biases will show how to leverage readily available reference architectures provided by NVIDIA Blueprints with W&B Weave, the platform for creating Gen AI applications to evaluate, monitor, and iterate and ultimately build a production-grade AI assistant. We'll also show how W&B Weave enables continuous improvement in quality, latency, cost, and safety by running comprehensive evaluations and leveraging new technologies and techniques as the Gen AI industry evolves.

title: Train and Serve AI Systems Fast With the Lightning AI Open-Source Stack (Presented by Lightning AI) [EXS74430]
abstract: See how the Lightning stack can cover the full life cycle, from data preparation to deployment, with practical examples and particular focus on distributed training and high-performance inference. We'll show examples that focus on new features like support for multi-dimensional parallelism through DTensors, as well as quantization through torchao.

title: Training Perception AI Models With Synthetic Data Generated From Isaac Sim [DLIT71431]
abstract:
In this hands-on lab, we'll using NVIDIA Omniverse and Isaac Sim to generate synthetic data for training AI models that control robotic manipulators.
By the end of the lab, we'll provide hands-on experience in developing pipelines to create synthetic datasets, training perception models, and deploying these models in simulated environments before bringing them to the real world.
Prerequisite(s):

Experience with OpenUSD, NVIDIA Omniverse and 3D CAD software.
Experience in Python.
Basic knowledge of NVIDIA Isaac Sim and Isaac ROS.

title: Training Ultra-Long-Context Language Model With Fully Pipelined Distributed Transformer [P73578]
abstract:
Large language models with long-context capabilities are integral to complex tasks in natural language processing and computational biology, such as text generation and protein sequence analysis. However, training LLMs directly on extremely long contexts demands considerable GPU resources and increased memory, leading to higher costs and greater complexity. Alternative approaches that introduce long-context capabilities via downstream fine-tuning or adaptations impose significant design limitations. We propose Fully Pipelined Distributed Transformer (FPDT) for efficiently training long-context LLMs with outstanding hardware efficiency.

For GPT and Llama models, we achieve a 16X increase in sequence length that can be trained on the same hardware compared to current state-of-the-art solutions. With our dedicated sequence chunk pipeline design, we can now train 8B LLM with 2 million sequence length on only four GPUs, while also maintaining over 55% of MFU.

title: Train Video Foundation Models at Scale [S73918]
abstract:
Join us for a deep dive into how generative AI is being used to train foundation models at scale. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Transform AECO with AI: Insights from Industry Innovators [S72528]
abstract:
Artificial intelligence is reshaping the architecture, engineering, construction, & operations (AECO) industry, unlocking new possibilities and revolutionizing workflows. Join our engaging panel discussion with thought leaders from Trimble, Autodesk, Bentley Systems, and Nemetschek as they explore the transformative potential of AI in AECO. Discover how AI is addressing some of the industry’s biggest challenges, driving innovation in design, construction, and infrastructure management, and paving the way for smarter, more sustainable practices. Gain insights into current trends, the exciting momentum surrounding AI adoption, and the opportunities it presents for redefining the future of AECO.

Whether you’re navigating today’s AI-driven landscape or seeking inspiration for tomorrow, this session will provide valuable perspectives, actionable takeaways, and a glimpse into how these global leaders are shaping the industry’s next chapter. Don’t miss the chance to be part of the conversation driving the future of AECO!

title: Transform an Enterprise Data Platform With Generative AI and RAG [S72205]
abstract: Trillions of PDF files are generated every year, each file likely consisting of multiple pages filled with various content types, including text, images, charts, and tables. Learn how generative AI and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) is enabling enterprises to extract massive volumes of data to quickly empower employees with valuable expertise.

title: Transform an Enterprise Data Platform With Generative AI and RAG [S72205]

title: Transform Cloud Infrastructure for Hyperscale AI With Accelerated Networking [S74312]
abstract:
The future of AI cloud computing demands infrastructure that is not only powerful but also agile, scalable, and efficient. In this joint session, NVIDIA and CoreWeave will share their collaborative journey of innovation — where cutting-edge networking meets real-world cloud-scale AI challenges. Get an exclusive look at NVIDIA’s full-stack networking platforms, designed to unlock AI’s full potential. CoreWeave, as an AI hyperscaler and early adopter, will reveal how they leverage the breadth and depth of NVIDIA’s networking platforms to transform cloud infrastructure. They’ll discuss achieving supercomputing scale with reliability, deep observability, and flexibility to support next-gen AI workloads. Join us to explore the breakthroughs, lessons, and strategies that enable AI platforms to scale without compromise. Gain insights into the innovations driving the industry forward and discover actionable takeaways to build infrastructure ready for tomorrow’s demands.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Transform Cybersecurity With Agentic Blueprints [S72417]
abstract:
As cyberthreats grow more sophisticated, enterprises need advanced strategies to defend against evolving risks. Learn how multi-modal AI, specifically through NVIDIA Blueprints, is being utilized to tackle modern cybersecurity challenges at scale. These agents, combining generative AI, natural language processing, and machine learning, provide a automated and accelerated solution for threat detection and response, and operational efficiency for security tasks.

Key use cases will demonstrate how AI-driven Agents are transforming enterprise security, automating real-time threat intelligence, managing vulnerabilities, and mitigating risks. We'll also announce new products, showcasing innovations designed to enhance AI's role in securing large-scale infrastructures.

This talk is ideal for cybersecurity developers and enterprise leaders looking to leverage AI to strengthen their security frameworks against emerging threats."

title: Transform Data Center Architecture With Micron’s AI Memory and Storage Portfolio (Presented by Micron Technology) [S74473]
abstract: For AI to deliver insights, decisions, and innovations, it needs a vast amount of data. Data are fueling the AI revolution. And all of these data must be stored, analyzed, and processed across diverse infrastructures, from edge to cloud. We'll highlight the progress Micron has enabled by collaborating with NVIDIA to address the pivotal role that memory and storage play in transforming the data center architecture. From HBM3E to GDS, advanced memory and storage technologies enable faster and more power-efficient ingestion, processing, and analysis of vast data volumes. We'll delve into how advancements in technologies such as HBM3E, high-capacity DDR5 DIMMs, and PCIe Gen5 SSDs are not only enhancing AI's capabilities, but also paving the way for more sustainable, energy-efficient data centers. Join us as we explore the interconnected realms of data, storage, memory, computing, and AI algorithms, and how they seamlessly integrate into our lives to enrich our future.

title: Transform Human Lives and Experiences With NVIDIA AI Platforms (Presented by LTTS) [S74392]
abstract:
Artificial intelligence has the power to drive meaningful change, improving human lives and tackling some of the world’s biggest challenges, revolutionizing the way we solve problems. We'll explore two novel solutions, based on NVIDIA AI platforms, that are transforming human lives and experiences and creating real-world positive impact with AI. 

The first solution talk will explore how NVIDIA tech is used to manage large gatherings effectively by integrating video-based crowd analytics with a centralized dashboard to generate actionable reports for crowd density and ensure swift, informed responses to maintain safety and order in crowded spaces. The second solution talk will show how NVIDIA AI platforms are used to accelerate medical imaging and diagnostics to enable early and accurate detection of polyp formations in the colon, thereby improving prognosis and patient care.

title: Transforming Complex Value Chains with Generative AI & Digital Twins [S72390]
abstract: As industries tackle some of the world’s most intricate challenges—from conceptual design to engineering, construction, and operations—leaders are harnessing Generative AI and Digital Twins to drive transformation. This session will explore how Worley, in collaboration with Nvidia’s cutting-edge technology, enables change management with a global workforce, accelerating productivity and reducing time to value. Drawing from the success and lessons learned in Worley’s Advanced Development Lab, we’ll discuss how innovation, talent activation, and a sharp focus on business and customer success are shaping the future of complex, integrated value chains.

title: Transforming Reality: From Scan to Stunning With Hexagon and NVIDIA Omniverse (Presented by Hexagon) [EXS74605]
abstract: Discover how Reality Cloud Studio, powered by NVIDIA Omniverse APIs and OpenUSD, is transforming reality capture workflows by enabling teams to drastically reduce rendering times, simplify complex processes, and leverage immersive visualizations to accelerate and improve decision making.

title: Transform Natural Catastrophe Risk Simulations With Advanced Computational Tools [S72833]
abstract: Artificial Intelligence is transforming the way we model and predict natural catastrophe risks by creating more comprehensive and accurate datasets than ever before. AXA leverages the NVIDIA Earth-2 platform on AWS to simulate large sets of hypothetical weather events. Utilizing the Huge Ensembles (HENS) method, developed by researchers at LBNL, AXA can more precisely estimate natural hazard risks, enhancing global risk management and resilience planning for extreme weather. AWS offers robust solutions for the compute, storage, and networking demands of these AI-driven weather simulations.

title: Transform OTT Streaming Leveraging AI and Deep Learning Technologies [S74577]
abstract: Join us to learn more about how AI is revolutionizing the future of streaming. Discover how iQIYI, a top Chinese over-the-top (OTT) streaming service is leveraging deep learning to enhance video quality by converting standard dynamic range (SDR) videos to high dynamic range (HDR) and significantly enhancing the viewer experience. Learn how NVIDIA AI libraries, like TensorRT, helped substantially improve video conversion efficiency, resulting in huge savings in computing costs. And, how NVIDIA’s GPU-powered compute capabilities, driven by CUDA, helped accelerate processing, greatly reduced video production costs. Gain insights into how NVIDIA’s hardware and software solutions are transforming iQIYI’s operational efficiency enabling reliable scaling in large-scale production with over 30,000 hours of video generated.

title: Transform Patient Care with Digital Twins and Nursing Collaborative Robots (Presented by Foxconn) [S74078]
abstract: Explore how Foxconn leverages NVIDIA Omniverse and Isaac Sim to simulate and optimize robots to assist nurses and create high-resolution digital twins of diseases like breast cancer and coronary artery disease. Learn how high-resolution 3D modeling and simulations powered by NVIDIA platforms transform healthcare workflows, improve diagnostics, and enhance patient-physician communication.

title: Transform Patient Care with Digital Twins and Nursing Collaborative Robots (Presented by Foxconn) [S74078]
abstract: Explore how Foxconn leverages NVIDIA Omniverse and Isaac Sim to simulate and optimize robots to assist nurses and create high-resolution digital twins of diseases like breast cancer and coronary artery disease. Learn how high-resolution 3D modeling and simulations powered by NVIDIA platforms transform healthcare workflows, improve diagnostics, and enhance patient-physician communication.

title: Transform Semiconductor Design With AI-Driven EDA Solutions Using NVIDIA Technologies (Presented by Synopsys) [EXS74631]
abstract: The semiconductor industry is facing increasing demands for faster, more efficient design and manufacturing processes amidst the rapid advancements in accelerated compute technologies. Addressing these challenges, Synopsys leverages NVIDIA technologies to harness the power of AI and accelerated computing to substantially accelerate chip design and advance automotive prototyping. Hear how Synopsys helps maximize the capabilities of engineering teams by delivering significant runtime gains of up to 15X, supercharged by NVIDIA GH200 Grace Hopper, across Synopsys’ AI-driven electronic design automation (EDA) suite, encompassing design, verification, simulation, and manufacturing.

title: Transform the Automotive Industry With Agentic AI and Multi-Modal LLMs [DD40003]
abstract: Agentic AI and multi-modal large language models are transforming the automotive industry — both inside and outside the vehicle. See how agentic AI and LLMs enable the development of intelligent autonomous driving systems, AI-powered in-car experiences through virtual assistants, and customer experiences such as AI-chatbots and knowledge co-pilots that help reduce costs while increasing revenue for automakers.

title: Transform the Automotive Industry With Agentic AI and Multi-Modal LLMs [DD40003]
abstract: Agentic AI and multi-modal large language models are transforming the automotive industry — both inside and outside the vehicle.
