title: Transform the Enterprise with AI, Sustainably and at Scale (Presented by Equinix) [S73983]
abstract: Future-proofing your AI requires a dynamic platform, accelerated infrastructure, and multicloud interconnection to scale effectively. An integrated end-to-end solution can speed up AI deployment, while accelerated infrastructure optimizes the training and development of AI models. As AI drives higher demand for data center supercomputing, enterprises will continue to seek a flexible, predictable, and sustainable approach to acquiring, deploying, and managing accelerated computing infrastructure — without the complexity of designing a data center that can accommodate high-density power and advanced liquid cooling in a sustainable way. Learn how businesses can architect a hybrid multicloud-connected AI data center that offers greater flexibility, scalability, and sustainability.

title: Transform the Enterprise with AI, Sustainably and at Scale (Presented by Equinix) [S73983]
abstract: Future-proofing your AI requires a dynamic platform, accelerated infrastructure, and multicloud interconnection to scale effectively. An integrated end-to-end solution can speed up AI deployment, while accelerated infrastructure optimizes the training and development of AI models. As AI drives higher demand for data center supercomputing, enterprises will continue to seek a flexible, predictable, and sustainable approach to acquiring, deploying, and managing accelerated computing infrastructure — without the complexity of designing a data center that can accommodate high-density power and advanced liquid cooling in a sustainable way. Learn how businesses can architect a hybrid multicloud-connected AI data center that offers greater flexibility, scalability, and sustainability.

title: Tree Attention: Scalable Long-Context Transformer Decoding on GPU Clusters [P73607]
abstract: Discover Tree Attention, a novel parallelization method that enables significantly faster and more memory-efficient transformer decoding for long contexts. Tree attention achieves 8X faster decoding at 1 million sequence lengths while requiring 2X less communication volume compared to Ring Attention, with benefits scaling logarithmically across GPU clusters.

title: Trinix: High-Accuracy Synthetic Data Generation Using 3D CAD Engine [P74381]
abstract: Most synthetic data generation is processed at the 2D image level, which means that holes, cuts, bends and volume changes of the product can't be represented, and the data quality is poor. Because of these issues, most anomaly detection models in manufacturing are trained with either 100% normal data or a small amount of defect data, due to the scarcity of defect data. And defect data that isn't found in a production line is impossible to collect, which limits improving model accuracy. We propose an innovative approach for generating synthetic data at the 3D mesh level using a 3D CAD engine, and share our collaboration cases and experimental results that improve accuracy when training with our synthetic data, in both a private dataset (collaboration case) and public datasets.

title: Trip Reports Bot: A Chatbot That Prioritizes Expert Content and Generates Insights From a Large Volume of Data [P73512]
abstract: After events like the GTC, NVIDIA’s World Wide Field Office must analyze thousands of travel report emails from staff, containing lessons learned, successes, challenges, and customer feedback. Compiling a comprehensive summary from these reports is time-consuming, often taking weeks, which delays decision-making. While a retrieval-augmented generation chatbot helps answer questions, it struggles to synthesize insights from large datasets and doesn’t prioritize input from domain experts. We propose a novel solution to enhance the chatbot’s ability to efficiently retrieve, synthesize, and prioritize expert insights from extensive documents.

title: Trustworthy Data Agents and Making Inference Faster and Cheaper (Presented by Snowflake) [S74585]
abstract: Discover key research advances in building trustworthy data agents and inference optimization. Data agents enable complex queries spanning structured and unstructured data. To guard against errors compounding over a series of steps, we build industry leading search and text-to-sql components, novel orchestration over these components, and observability. Next we dive into inference optimization using spec decoding and sequence parallelism. Spec decoding improves the speed of text generation on LLMs. By leveraging lightweight draft models, systems can score and generate multiple tokens at each step which makes them less memory-bound. Sequence parallelism reduces TTFT in prefill of long-context sequences by partitioning the input across GPUs for parallel processing. We’ll share improvements in TPOT and reductions in TTFT achieved with these techniques.

title: Turbocharge Cloud-Native AI Workloads With DPU-Accelerated Service Proxy for Kubernetes [S72237]
abstract:
AI clouds deploy AI applications at a massive scale, typically as containerized workloads accelerated for cloud-native environments. To meet the needs of LLMs, RAGs, and other AI applications, AI cloud infrastructure relies on high-bandwidth, low-latency interconnections between CPU, GPU, memory, and storage.

AI cloud architecture is built using Kubernetes clusters. Kubernetes networking lets containerized applications communicate within the GPU cluster directly. Deployment of AI applications at scale needs high performance, efficient load balancing, application security, auto scaling, and multi-tenancy. An efficient proxy infrastructure service provides ingress/egress access to cluster resources without burdening the CPU and GPU.

Learn how to meet AI cloud demands with a cloud-native, hardware-accelerated proxy. Offloading and isolating application delivery services to a DPU dramatically reduces CPU overhead and boosts infrastructure efficiency while minimizing attack surface.

title: Turbocharge Numerical Computing on GPU and CPU in C++ [CWE72491]
abstract:
MatX provides an open-source, easy-to-use C++ numerical computing library with an interface similar to Python. The same code can be executed on both GPUs and CPUs (ARM and x86) with a single line change. Using MatX frees developers from language details to write clear code without sacrificing performance. In this session you can speak to the MatX developers any questions you have about usage, optimization, and getting started writing GPU-accelerated codes.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Turbocharge Prescriptive Analytics and Optimization With GPU Acceleration [S72603]
abstract:
As industries face increasing demands in logistics, scheduling, and portfolio management, traditional optimization approaches struggle to scale efficiently. SimpleRose integrates NVIDIA cuOpt to accelerate linear programming (LP) and mixed-integer linear programming (MILP), delivering significant speedups without compromising accuracy.
Join us to:
•	Discover how to optimize root MILP p solutions for faster, more efficient decision-making with cuOpt
•	Explore the impact of GPU-accelerated optimization on large-scale LP and MILP problems
•	Gain insights into real-world use cases and performance breakthroughs enabled by cutting-edge optimization technology

title: Turn Data Into Decisions: Revolutionize Your AI Pipeline With Dell’s AI Data Platform (Presented by Dell Technologies) [S74298]
abstract: Discover how the Dell AI Data Platform supports the end-to-end AI pipeline, from data ingestion to analysis, by leveraging PowerScale’s scalable, open architecture to deliver enhanced speed and efficiency with high-performance storage near GPUs. Learn how the Dell AI Data Platform simplifies data preparation and pre-processing via a simple, consolidated data lake solution with expert guidance from Dell's professional services to establish an AI-ready data environment, build scalable pipelines, and manage the data life cycle to maximize the value of AI initiatives.

title: Turn Text into Video: Explore Animated Content Creation with Multimodal Gen AI and NVIDIA NeMo Framework [DLIT71194]
abstract:
This training explores the principles behind multimodal generative AI, focusing on text-to-video diffusion models and their practical applications. We will begin by defining multimodal generative AI and examining the core mechanisms of text-to-video synthesis. Participants will learn how input descriptions influence video quality and how guardrails—both pre-generation (Pre-Guard) and post-generation (Post-Guard)—help ensure safe and responsible content creation.
We will break down the process of converting text into numerical representations for diffusion models, encoding video into a latent space for efficient processing, and decoding it back into high-quality outputs. Additionally, we will explore methods to extend generated videos using video-to-video models.
Attendees will gain insights into building an interactive text-to-video generation pipeline using Gradio, leveraging multi-GPU processing, and optimizing performance with NVIDIA NeMo Framework for faster video generation. While live model training won’t be conducted due to resource constraints, participants will leave with a strong foundational understanding and practical tools to experiment with text-to-video AI models.
Prerequisite(s):

Programming skills, Python, and knowledge of AI fundamentals.

title: UF Campus Twin: Leveraging GPUs, Game Engines, and IoT Sensors to Enhance Collaboration, Monitoring, and Safety in the Building Life Cycle [P73595]
abstract:
At the College of Design, Construction, and Planning (DCP) at the University of Florida (UF), we're creating protocols to develop digital twins (DT) for various buildings at different stages of their life cycles. 

The first building in this project is the DCP Collaboratory. These protocols serve as comprehensive guidelines, defining the users, environmental settings, and use cases, focusing on leveraging supercomputers equipped with NVIDIA GPUs to create digital twins in an educational setting. The project utilizes the OpenUSD framework in Omniverse Nucleus, accessible through UF's supercomputer, Hipergator. Our goals include streamlining BIM data integration into DT, improving project efficiency, and ensuring stakeholders have equal access to crucial information.

title: UFO-Lite: 基于自推测解码的低延迟多模态大模型 [S72498]
abstract: 近年来，多模态大语言模型（MLLMs）展示了卓越的能力和强大的泛化能力。然而，目前的 MLLMs 往往难以满足快速响应的需求，推理延迟成为其在现实应用中的一个重要的挑战。本讲座将介绍 UFO-Lite，这是 VIMER-UFO MLLMs 系列的最新快速版本，其针对现实场景中的高效化部署进行了优化。具体而言，UFO-Lite 引入了自推测解码机制，显著的减少了端到端的延迟，且准确性几乎没有损失。它采用了新颖的双 LLM 结构，将自回归生成任务中序列化的多次前向推理卸载到了快速分支（即草稿模型），并通过原始模型对草稿序列进行并行的验证，以保持精度。为了实现自推测解码，UFO-Lite 基于量化感知的知识蒸馏，有效地开发了双 LLM 的快速分支，确保其分布与原始模型相似且具备较高的推理速度。此外，UFO-Lite 还提出了基于置信度的自适应切换，利用动态验证窗口大小，而不是固定大小，并兼容短序列生成。UFO-Lite 在 AI2D 和 MathVista 数据集上展示了与 Qwen2-VL-7B 和 InternVL2-8B 相当的性能。在 MMMU 上，它实现了与 InterVL2-8B、MiniPCPMV2-2_6 和 GLM-4V-9B 相当的结果。与上述模型相比，UFO-lite 可以加速 2 倍以上。此演讲可以为进一步发展高效且有效的多模态大语言模型提供有价值的见解。
date_time: 近年来，多模态大语言模型（MLLMs）展示了卓越的能力和强大的泛化能力。然而，目前的 MLLMs 往往难以满足快速响应的需求，推理延迟成为其在现实应用中的一个重要的挑战。本讲座将介绍 UFO-Lite，这是 VIMER-UFO MLLMs 系列的最新快速版本，其针对现实场景中的高效化部署进行了优化。具体而言，UFO-Lite 引入了自推测解码机制，显著的减少了端到端的延迟，且准确性几乎没有损失。它采用了新颖的双 LLM 结构，将自回归生成任务中序列化的多次前向推理卸载到了快速分支（即草稿模型），并通过原始模型对草稿序列进行并行的验证，以保持精度。为了实现自推测解码，UFO-Lite 基于量化感知的知识蒸馏，有效地开发了双 LLM 的快速分支，确保其分布与原始模型相似且具备较高的推理速度。此外，UFO-Lite 还提出了基于置信度的自适应切换，利用动态验证窗口大小，而不是固定大小，并兼容短序列生成。UFO-Lite 在 AI2D 和 MathVista 数据集上展示了与 Qwen2-VL-7B 和 InternVL2-8B 相当的性能。在 MMMU 上，它实现了与 InterVL2-8B、MiniPCPMV2-2_6 和 GLM-4V-9B 相当的结果。与上述模型相比，UFO-lite 可以加速 2 倍以上。此演讲可以为进一步发展高效且有效的多模态大语言模型提供有价值的见解。

title: Unfolding Humanoids Safety [CWE72631]
abstract:
Robotics safety is at a tipping point with humanoids: safety requirements for autonomy, mobility, and AI fuse all together. Let's explore together the challenges and opportunities to achieve humanoids safety, including a deep dive into most recent developments on safety architectures, methodologies, and tools.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Unfolding Humanoids Safety [CWE72631]
abstract:
Robotics safety is at a tipping point with humanoids: safety requirements for autonomy, mobility, and AI fuse all together. title: Universal NIM Acceleration With GPU-Sharing Containers (Presented by Lablup) [S74194]
abstract: Multi-modal, multi-agent AI systems are becoming the next-generation norm, and NVIDIA NIMs envisions the path to achieve it using optimized container templates. We'll explain how our GPU-native container engine further accelerates NIMs to deliver such advanced multi-agent AI systems at low cost and high performance. It exploits a novel fractional GPU-sharing technology to accommodate multiple different models having diverse performance bottlenecks in a single GPU, automate resource allocation and model combinations with memory size estimation techniques, and auto-scale the NIM containers by incorporating inference runtime metrics. All these features are implemented on both air-gapped on-premises clusters and cloud-native setups. On top of it, we've also built a streamlined UI to import, fine-tune, and serve open models in just one click, effectively hiding all those technical details from the end user. Putting it all together, let's dive into the universal world of NIMs.

title: Unleash Generative AI Microservices at the Edge With NVIDIA Jetson and AWS IoT Greengrass [DLIT74570]
abstract:
Push the boundaries of edge computing by leveraging the power of NVIDIA Jetson alongside the seamless connectivity of AWS IoT Greengrass. In this hands-on lab, you’ll learn how to deploy generative AI microservices on Jetson devices, both directly and through the cloud using AWS IoT Greengrass. Engage in practical exercises to enable edge-to-cloud connectivity, optimize deployment pipelines, and orchestrate device management, all while exploring the transformative potential of generative AI at the edge and ready-to-deploy AI microservices. Don’t forget to bring your laptop for an interactive, step-by-step learning experience.
Prerequisite(s):

Basic Linux command familiarity.

title: Unleash Next-Gen AI: The Data Intelligence Engine Accelerating Training, Analytics, and RAG (Presented by DDN) [S74284]
abstract: Discover how a cutting-edge data intelligence platform can streamline the entire AI life cycle. We'll explore advanced techniques to enhance training processes, optimize data analytics, and seamlessly integrate retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). Learn how the platform’s versatile architecture supports a variety of data protocols and streaming frameworks, transforming raw information into actionable insights for next-generation AI solutions.

title: Unlock AI Performance: Developer Resources for Arm-Based CPUs Like NVIDIA’s Grace Hopper, Grace Blackwell, and Grace CPU Superchips (Presented by Arm) [EXS74301]
abstract:
Discover the tools, resources, and software available to optimize your workflows and achieve efficient accelerator utilization, such as GPUs, as we explore the powerful capabilities of Arm-based CPUs to supercharge your AI development. 

Here we delve into the architecture of Arm-based CPUs, highlighting their versatility and efficiency in handling AI and ML workloads on NVIDIA’s Grace Hopper, Grace Blackwell and Grace CPU Superchip. This includes LLMs, recommender systems, vector databases, graph neural networks, HPC, cloud, and data analytics.

title: Unlock AI Potential With Azure Infrastructure: Innovations, Best Practices, and Real-World Success (Presented by Microsoft) [S74600]
abstract: Discover the latest innovations in Azure AI infrastructure and how they empower organizations to build and scale AI solutions efficiently. We'll cover best practices for optimizing AI workloads on Azure, ensuring performance, cost-effectiveness, and sustainability. Additionally, a customer will share their firsthand experience running AI workloads on Azure — covering challenges, solutions, and key learnings. Whether you're exploring AI deployment or optimizing existing workloads, this session will provide practical insights to help you succeed with Azure AI.

title: Unlock AI Potential With Azure Infrastructure: Innovations, Best Practices, and Real-World Success (Presented by Microsoft) [S74600]
abstract: Discover the latest innovations in Azure AI infrastructure and how they empower organizations to build and scale AI solutions efficiently. title: Unlock AI's Potential: A Roadmap to Get Started (Presented by Cisco) [S74616]
abstract:
AI adoption can be costly and complex. To stay competitive, organizations need their data center infrastructure to support new performance demands while balancing power constraints, sustainability imperatives, security requirements, and operational challenges across distributed environments. Build strategies to overcome obstacles by understanding what to look for on your AI journey:
•Avoid overprovisioning: Tailor your infrastructure to AI use cases and desired outcomes.
•	Reduce time-to-value: Streamline the path from initial investment to full deployment with pre-sized and preconfigured full stack solutions.
•	Achieve reliability at scale: Build a scalable and adaptable AI infrastructure that’s tested and proven to deliver results.
•	Simplify operations: Automate processes and use integrated solutions to minimize manual management/maintenance.

Explore best practices for managing complexities to reduce risk and ensure consistent performance, from pilot projects to large-scale deployments.

title: Unlock Business Success with DataRobot's Enterprise-ready Agentic AI platform [S72261]
abstract: Organizations are eager to embrace the era of agentic AI, but moving beyond prototyping into creating enterprise-ready agents that can be deployed into production is still challenging.  DataRobot with its integration with NVIDIA AI Enterprise, provides customers with an end-to-end AI platform to rapidly develop their Agentic AI Apps and deploy them to production with confidence. In this session, we will walk you through key considerations to build enterprise-ready agentic AI apps and show you how you can build and deploy them into production with built-in observability, monitoring, and governance. We will bring it all together with a live demo of a real world use case.

title: Unlock Business Success with DataRobot's Enterprise-ready Agentic AI platform [S72261]
abstract: Organizations are eager to embrace the era of agentic AI, but moving beyond prototyping into creating enterprise-ready agents that can be deployed into production is still challenging. title: Unlock Deep Learning Performance on Blackwell With cuDNN [S73071]
abstract:
Since its launch, cuDNN, a library for GPU-accelerating deep learning (DL) primitives, has been powering many AI applications in domains such as conversational AI, recommender systems, and speech recognition, among others. CuDNN remains a core library for DL primitives in popular frameworks such as PyTorch, JAX, Tensorflow, and many more while covering training, fine-tuning, and inference use cases.  Even in the rapidly evolving space of Gen AI — be it Llama, Gemma, or mixture-of-experts variants requiring complex DL primitives such as flash attention variants — cuDNN is powering them all.

Learn about new/updated APIs of cuDNN pertaining to Blackwell’s microscaling format, and how to program against those APIs. We'll deep dive into leveraging its graph APIs to build some fusion patterns, such as matmul fusion patterns and fused flash attention from state-of-the-art models. Understand how new CUDA graph support in cuDNN, not to be mistaken with the cuDNN graph API, could be exploited to avoid rebuilding CUDA graphs, offering an alternative of CUDA graph capture with real-world framework usage.

title: Unlocking AI Potential with NVIDIA: Optimizing Datacenter Design (Presented by Sterling) [S74209]
abstract: Our 40-minute session provides valuable insights into NVIDIA's dominant role in shaping modern AI data center design. By understanding the key technologies, infrastructure considerations, and future trends, you'll gain a deeper understanding of the evolving landscape of AI computing and how NVIDIA is driving innovation in this space. We'll provide practical knowledge for IT professionals, data center operators, and anyone interested in the future of AI infrastructure.

title: Unlocking Generative AI's Full Potential: Expert Insights for Rapid Innovation and Scale [S72363]
abstract: Generative AI is revolutionizing industries by driving operational efficiencies and fueling innovation. Yet, even the most advanced enterprises face significant challenges like infrastructure disruptions, AI workload inefficiencies, and suboptimal resource utilization. Today’s AI leaders need best practices and insights to overcome infrastructure limitations that inhibit enterprise developers. Join industry leaders who've successfully tackled these issues and built their own AI factories to scale development, reduce risks, and accelerate AI application deployment.

title: Unlocking High-Performance AI Applications at Airbnb  [S73265]
abstract:
Discover ways in which we transformed AI applications at Airbnb, building high-performance ML serving infrastructure and enabling new use cases. 

We'll discuss challenges encountered when integrating rapidly evolving, sophisticated technologies into a complex ML stack and solutions we implemented to overcome these challenges.

We’ll talk about technical evaluations and explorations of various technologies, from serving optimizations to engine accelerations, and highlight use cases enabled by these capabilities.

Join us as we share our story in unlocking high performance AI at Airbnb.

abstract:
Using accelerated computing and parallel processing, CUDA Solvers stand out as the game-changing computational power provider necessary to handle massive datasets and iterative problem-solving with unmatched speed and precision. This capability enables industries to perform large-scale simulations and analytics efficiently, driving smarter decision-making and unlocking new opportunities for optimization across industries.

This session explores how CUDA-accelerated solvers are delivering transformative results across various sectors. Using NVIDIA’s accelerated computing capabilities, Hitachi and NVIDIA are leveraging CUDA-driven solutions for innovation solutions to real-world industrial problems. Additionally, you will:

title: Unlocking the Future of Enterprise Applications, Business Intelligence and Data with SAP Business AI (Presented by SAP) [S74618]
abstract: AI is fundamentally redefining the future software architecture and the way end-users interact with the enterprise software. SAP’s deep ERP expertise, built over 50 years, remains unmatched in its ability to handle complex, global operations. Discover how SAP's cutting-edge Business AI suite of solutions are set to revolutionize the enterprise application landscape in 2025 and learn how adopting these innovations can drive unparalleled growth and efficiency in your organization.

title: Unlocking the Future of Enterprise Applications, Business Intelligence and Data with SAP Business AI (Presented by SAP) [S74618]

title: Unlocking the Future of LLMs: High-Efficiency xLSTM Architectures for Scalable Performance [S71812]
abstract: As AI applications push the boundaries of large-scale deployments, traditional architectures face limitations in efficiency and scalability. Enter xLSTM — a groundbreaking evolution in long short-term memory (LSTM) networks. We'll unveil how xLSTM's innovative memory structures and exponential gating mechanisms allow for unprecedented efficiency, enabling models to manage larger context windows without sacrificing performance. Discover how this architecture is setting new standards in LLM adoption across industries by dramatically reducing energy consumption and boosting throughput in enterprise applications.

title: Unlocking the Potential of Multilingual Language Models [S73871]
abstract: Hear about the latest advancements in multilingual language modeling, exploring a new family of large language models trained on a massive, diverse dataset encompassing 35 European languages and programming languages. We'll examine the challenges and opportunities in multilingual natural language processing, discussing how these models can break down language barriers and foster cross-cultural communication. We'll dive into the architecture and training of large-scale language models, providing insights into the underlying technology driving this revolution. We'll also show the application of these models in various domains, including translation, cross-lingual information retrieval, and code generation, highlighting their potential to transform how we interact with information and each other.

title: Unlocking the Potential of the AI Compiler in Recommendation Systems [S72642]
abstract:
Despite the widespread adoption of AI compiler accelerators on GPU-based recommendation systems, these tools often fall short in harnessing the full computational and memory potential of modern GPUs. We'll explore innovative strategies to transcend these limitations that achieve a better-than 30% model training performance gain compared to OpenXLA. 

The speaker Han Shen and Ruitao Wang will present via recording and Xinbo Zhao will be on site and lead the Q&A.

title: Unlock the Future of Data Security with GPU-Powered Pipelines [S71358]
abstract: Join Trend Micro as we explore how to modernize data loss prevention (DLP) architecture using accelerated computing and AI. We’ll dive into the architectural strategies considered and why NVIDIA cuDF and Morpheus Runtime Core (MRC) were chosen to create GPU-powered data pipelines with built-in AI processing. Discover how this cutting-edge approach tackles the challenges of real-time analysis and processing of massive data streams, delivering unmatched speed, intelligence, and scalability for enhanced data security. Don't miss this opportunity to envision the future of AI-driven data protection and its transformative impact on cybersecurity.

title: Unlock the Potential of Unstructured Data  [S72223]
abstract: In a world inundated with sensory information, our digital interactions often lag behind the richness of our experiences. Traditional systems have focused primarily on text-based data, limiting our ability to harness the full potential of unstructured data. We'll explore how NVIDIA's transformer models and infrastructure are revolutionizing our interaction with computers, enabling us to transform audio and video inputs into deeply discoverable and contextualized knowledge.

title: Unlock the Power of AI Agents in Automotive [S73306]
abstract:
Discover how Ford Motor Co. is leveraging AI agents to revolutionize customer experience, operational efficiency, and innovation. Explore real-world applications, including customer-facing agents, service technician assistants, and employee productivity agents. Learn about the benefits, challenges, and practical solutions for deploying AI agents in the automotive industry, including from ensuring reliability to implementing effective feedback loops. See examples of AI agents in production use for manufacturing, engineering, and marketing.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Unlock the Power of NVIDIA Certified Systems: Live Q&A With Experts [CWE74649]
abstract: Engage directly with NVIDIA specialists in an informal "Connect With Experts" session to learn about the NVIDIA-Certified Systems program. This unique opportunity allows you to ask questions, get insights, and gain a deeper understanding of how NVIDIA-Certified Systems validate optimal performance for a wide range of real-world applications. Ideal for IT professionals, AI system architects, and anyone interested in leveraging NVIDIA's cutting-edge technologies to deploy AI in the enterprise, this session offers invaluable insights and expert advice. Don’t miss this chance to connect with experts and enhance your knowledge of NVIDIA-Certified Systems!!

title: Unlock the Speed of Light for Data Science Workflows With Gemini Coding Assistant [S73027]
abstract: Boosting your data science workflows has never been easier — just access pre-installed CUDA-X libraries for data processing to accelerate your workflows in Google Colab. Discover and unlock the benefits of accelerated data science with zero code changes; speed up your code by simply switching on the GPU runtime — no need for code refactoring or library installations. For better discoverability, Gemini provides multiple touch points to help Colab users discover and generate code to accelerate their data science workloads

title: Upskill Manufacturing Workforces with AI Agents [S73304]
abstract:
Rapid advancements in Industry 4.0, robotics, and automation require companies to reskill and upskill their workforce. To reduce this skill gap and transfer knowledge effectively, DeepHow was founded to capture expert knowledge and deliver it in ways that empower frontline workers. 

In this session, we’ll showcase how DeepHow leverages NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization to transform expert video demonstrations into rich, multimodal Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). These SOPs include interactive videos, step-by-step textual instructions, summaries, and assessments, all seamlessly managed and shared through our Maven platform. We’ll also highlight how DeepHow integrates AI-generated SOPs with critical industrial systems like Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), and Learning Management Systems (LMS) to provide high-quality, consistent training at scale—significantly reducing operational errors and training costs.

Hear from Acuity Brands, a valued DeepHow customer, who will showcase the impact of leveraging AI Agents to close the skills gap in industrial environments.  Join us to discover how AI-driven knowledge transfer empowers workers, boosts efficiency, and fosters human-AI collaboration in manufacturing.

title: Use GPUs to Accelerate Vector Databases [DLIT71710]
abstract:
Vector databases are a hot topic today for semantic search, and they're powering everything from generative AI workloads to recommender systems. This lab will provide hands-on instruction for optimizing vector database workloads on the GPU, including (1) optimizing ingest and index creation at scale, (2) choosing the best indexes for your data, and (3) tuning the indexes to trade off search speed and quality.
Prerequisite(s):

This lab assumes basic Python skills and only a high-level familiarity with databases. No familiarity with vector search or vector databases is assumed.

This lab will provide hands-on instruction for optimizing vector database workloads on the GPU, including (1) optimizing ingest and index creation at scale, (2) choosing the best indexes for your data, and (3) tuning the indexes to trade off search speed and quality.
Prerequisite(s):

This lab assumes basic Python skills and only a high-level familiarity with databases. No familiarity with vector search or vector databases is assumed.

title: Use GPUs to Accelerate Vector Databases [DLIT71710]
abstract:
Vector databases are a hot topic today for semantic search, and they're powering everything from generative AI workloads to recommender systems. This lab will provide hands-on instruction for optimizing vector database workloads on the GPU, including (1) optimizing ingest and index creation at scale, (2) choosing the best indexes for your data, and (3) tuning the indexes to trade off search speed and quality.
Prerequisite(s):

This lab assumes basic Python skills and only a high-level familiarity with databases. No familiarity with vector search or vector databases is assumed.

title: Use NVIDIA Base Command Manager and Run:ai to Fuel Your AI Superpowers [DLIT71684]
abstract:
In this hands-on lab, we'll show you how to harness the power of NVIDIA Base Command Manager and Run:ai to fuel your AI factory. You'll start with a cluster managed by Base Command Manager and learn how to use it to install Run:ai, unlocking its full potential to increase utilization of your AI resources. By the end of this session, you'll be able to transform your AI cluster from hard-to-use to easily manageable by administrators and data scientists alike. Whether you're looking to simplify your AI workflow or take your AI factory to the next level, this lab is perfect for using NVIDIA Base Command Manager and Run:ai to power your AI endeavors.
Prerequisite(s):

Familiarity with the Linux command line, and a basic understanding of cluster management.

title: Using AI Tools to Digitize Performers in Live Events [S72089]
abstract:
How can AI empower experiences that appear across multiple spatial realities? 

Today 2D, 3D, and even 2.5D mediums are allowing more opportunities to capture real people and real environments and turn them into new virtual realities during live performance. A central workflow is needed to capture and then visualize these assets for successful graphics rendering and compositing. 

Learn all about AI-based monocular depth reconstruction. We'll dive into how you can capture production rehearsal footage with only a single camera. And, using AI, transform the footage into a 2.5D capture of the performers and played within previsualization software.

title: Using Astris AI Factory to Build Scalable AI for Control Systems (Presented by Astris AI) [S74567]
abstract: We'll explore the development of scalable AI solutions for control systems, demonstrated through a real-world example of training an AI-powered system to optimize dynamic control — in this case, achieving the perfect catch with a robotic football. Leveraging Astris AI Factory's capabilities, we'll discuss key techniques, including a tailored ML Ops pipeline, high-dimensional time series anomaly detection, and scalable data visualization, as well as optimized big data storage for episodic time series data. By showcasing these capabilities, we'll highlight the potential for AI to transform control systems and improve performance.

title: Using Astris AI Factory to Build Scalable AI for Control Systems (Presented by Astris AI) [S74567]
abstract: We'll explore the development of scalable AI solutions for control systems, demonstrated through a real-world example of training an AI-powered system to optimize dynamic control — in this case, achieving the perfect catch with a robotic football. abstract:
Do you want to learn how to get started accelerating Large Language Models and other state of the art DL models? Join this interactive support session with the cuDNN engineering staff to get direct help and surface your questions, issues, and ideas specific to your use case.

title: Using Digital Factories to Advance Physical AI [S73848]
abstract: Learn how Mercedes-Benz is utilizing Omniverse to power their digital factories with connected simulation power. This mighty test ground allows for the training and optimization of physical AI within digital factories.

title: Using Digital Factories to Advance Physical AI [S73848]
abstract: Learn how Mercedes-Benz is utilizing Omniverse to power their digital factories with connected simulation power. This mighty test ground allows for the training and optimization of physical AI within digital factories.

title: Using Immersive Design Collaboration to Improve Efficiency in AECO [S71927]
abstract: Together with T-Mobile and Lake/Flato, a leading architecture firm, we leveraged the T-Mobile 5G network, NVIDIA CloudXR, and the QuarkXR platform to deliver remote customer presentations in virtual reality. Customers of Lake/Flato experienced immersive Enscape renders from the comfort of their office, thus enabling a quicker and more impactful design collaboration. By having a robust solution that works anywhere, Lake/Flato could reliably deliver an engaging customer presentation to geographically distributed stakeholders, and speed up the project approval process. Learn how NVIDIA CloudXR and 5G technology can reduce friction in the architecture and construction process and speed up the architecture, engineering, & construction (AEC) workflow.

title: Using NVIDIA CUDA Compiler Tool Chain for Productive GPGPU Programming [CWE73310]
abstract:
Learn how to use CUDA compiler tool chain effectively for your needs. We'll cover all aspects of the tool chain — including nvcc, libnvvm, ptxas, nvrtc, and nvJitLink. Maybe you're a beginner trying to understand the CUDA C++ language and compiler usage, or maybe you're planning to use CUDA C++ for your applications and want to find out if your requirements can be met by parts or the whole tool chain, or you may already be programming in CUDA C++ and want to learn about new features in NVIDIA’s compiler tool chain to use it even more productively. Whatever your level of experience, we’re ready to share our knowledge of best practices  and CUDA C++ programming, so that you get the most out of NVIDIA’s GPU capabilities and performance and succeed in your GPGPU development and deployment. We're equally interested in your feedback on how to further improve the overall compiler support.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Using NVIDIA Omniverse To Support Space Mission Design: Simulation First [S71724]
abstract: NIVIDIA Omniverse has been recognized by diverse industries as an extremely potent environment and toolset that provides a framework for rendering, for high-fidelity physics-based modeling of assets including perception systems and advanced controllers, and for corresponding simulations up to and exceeding real-time capability. We'll demonstrate several use cases of how NVIDIA Isaac Sim and other extensions of the Omniverse can be deployed for important spacecraft and space robotics design problems, such as digital twinning of satellite constellation orbit control, optimal control of dynamical systems as applied to rendezvous and capture for on-orbit servicing, spacecraft thermal analysis, and lunar rover digital twinning with terrain-vehicle interaction.

title: Using Video Codecs in Blackwell for Transcoding and Other Video Processing Applications [S72756]
abstract:
Get an overview of the latest enhancements, features, and APIs (native and cloud) being introduced in Video Codec SDK 13.0, releasing in Q1 2025. Specifically, we'll will cover:

•	Video encode and decode quality and performance enhancements and new features
•	Cloud APIs that we’ll be introducing for video encoding/decoding 
•	Microservices (NIMs) for video encoding and decoding

Video codec technologies on NVIDIA GPUs are extremely important for designing any use cases that involve video processing on GPUs. Gain insights into the latest features and enhancements in NVIDIA video technologies that help cutting-edge applications such as video transcode, intelligent video analytics, video data curation, efficient cloud-based video processing services, etc.

title: Utilizing NVIDIA NIM™ for Enterprise-Grade AI Code Assistance (Presented by Codeium) [EXS74374]
abstract: We'll clearly explain the exploding AI code assistant market and how to think about the various categories of tools, their value propositions, and options of configurability, including incorporating NVIDIA NIM microservices.

title: Venture Capital Reverse Pitches [S73503]
abstract:
Finding the right investor for your startup can be tricky. Venture capital (VC) firms offer more than just funding. They provide mentorship, technical guidance, access to valuable partners and customers, and a range of other benefits. Making the right connections can help your business reach its potential.
Join us to hear four visionary VCs pitch their firms and present their thesis. This event is for founders and business leaders looking to connect with some of the most impactful VCs in the technology industry. You'll also get a chance to request to connect with a VC of your choice for a deeper individual discussion.

title: Vibe Coding: AI-Assisted Development for 10X Productivity [CWE75062]
abstract: Learn how AI agents and coding tools are transforming software development. Whether you're a seasoned software engineer, ML specialist, or a product owner looking to go from idea to minimum viable product quickly, discover how intent-driven development (a.k.a. vibe coding) can dramatically accelerate your workflow and help you achieve 10X, or even 100X, productivity gains.

title: Video Generation Models for Storytelling and World Modeling [S74625]
abstract: Get an overview of Runway's video generation models and their applications to creativity and filmmaking. Discover how Runway's tools are being used in production to enable artists to iterate on ideas with unprecedented speed. Learn more about Runway's research efforts in making visual generative models more controllable and expressive, bridging the gap between AI research and everyday creative workflows, as well as improving the capabilities of video generation models in simulating the world.

abstract:

title: Virtualization Unleashed From VDI to AI: Tactics for Successful Deployments [CWE72704]
abstract:
Join this interactive session where seasoned professionals will share insights and strategies for successfully deploying various workloads such as graphic-intensive apps, digital twin, AI development, and more in virtualized data centers. You can engage directly with subject matter experts who have navigated the complexities of virtualization, offering practical advice and proven methodologies. Bring your questions and scenarios and leave with actionable strategies to enhance your virtualized data center operations.

abstract:
Join this interactive session where seasoned professionals will share insights and strategies for successfully deploying various workloads such as graphic-intensive apps, digital twin, AI development, and more in virtualized data centers. You can engage directly with subject matter experts who have navigated the complexities of virtualization, offering practical advice and proven methodologies. Bring your questions and scenarios and leave with actionable strategies to enhance your virtualized data center operations.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Vision Language Models at NVIDIA [S72699]
abstract:
Vision language models (VLMs) are starting to play an important role in robotics, autonomous vehicles, and more. We'll discuss the VLMs developed at NVIDIA. 
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Vista: The Bridge to a New Era of HPC [S72518]
abstract: Dan will give a brief update on new capabilities and plans at the Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC) for the U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) Leadership Facility and the National AI Research Resource and present some recent highlights from Vista, which is the new system at TACC based on Grace Hopper, and the planned leadership computing capability named Horizon. Then he'll cover some of the main challenges in HPC research and the HPC industry, from power and sustainability to the shifts in architecture toward lower precision, changes in programming model, etc.

title: Visualizing California's Infrastructure with Caltrans' State-Scale Digital Twins [S72968]
abstract: Learn how the California Department of Transportation (Caltrans) leverages Trimble's integrated solutions to enhance construction project coordination and risk management through accurate and timely data visualization. By combining design and field data, Caltrans enables survey and construction teams to quickly understand project plans, identify potential risks, and improve coordination with contractors. This approach not only reduces risks and costs, but also streamlines workflows, underscoring the importance of holistic data visualization. Additionally, we delve into Trimble's collaboration with NVIDIA to further enhance data visualization and coordination capabilities, illustrating the impact of innovative technology on infrastructure projects.

title: Visualizing the Future Brain: Generating Future Synthetic 3D Brain via VBM With MONAI and Generative AI (CVAE-GAN) [P74379]
abstract: Explore how our novel integration of multi-modal data, 4D generative AI, and the MONAI framework can generate synthetic future brains to revolutionize brain health assessment and promote cognitive longevity amidst global aging.

title: VLA：迈向自动驾驶物理智能体的关键一步 [S72557]
abstract: 在 GTC2024 大会上，我们介绍了 DriveVLM-Dual，一种快-慢思考混合的自动驾驶系统，可协同发挥端到端 (传感器数据输入、轨迹输出) 模型和视觉语言模型 (VLM) 的优势。两个模型均基于大量人类驾驶数据进行训练，并展现出符合数据量扩展定律（data scaling law）的特性，系统在真实驾驶环境中的表现随训练数据量的增加而提升。双系统被部署在双 NVIDIA DRIVE AGX 车载平台上，并已经大规模交付给终端客户，覆盖超过 40 万辆汽车。今天，我们将介绍理想 VLA（视觉-语言-行动）模型。理想 VLA 模型将快慢系统结合为一个单一大模型并赋予该模型自主决定何时采用慢思维的能力。它实现了空间感知与理解、开放世界知识、语言推理和行动策略的统一并进行联合训练和优化。此模型已经部署在下一代单 NVIDIA DRIVE AGX 的车载平台上，展现出了诸多令人兴奋的特性和能力。这套系统可以被视为一个物理世界智能体的雏形，通过语言自然地与用户互动，执行复杂、开放世界的驾驶任务。这一进步不仅标志着技术上的飞跃，也预示着一种全新、前所未有的自动驾驶产品形态的出现。

title: Voice-to-Voice LLM for End-to-End Voice Generation [S71829]
abstract: We'll share our journey, best practices, insights, and lessons learned from training an enterprise-grade cross-lingual SpeechLLM leveraging NVIDIA Nemo platform. Voice-to-voice LLM  (a.k.a SpeechLLM) integrates speech and text processing, allowing real-time voice output generation without relying on traditional speech-to-text and text-to-speech steps. This technology can potentially impact billions of people by eliminating language barriers in human-to-human and human-machine interactions. We'll also look at an example use case on how SpeechLLMs can enable voice bots to respond more accurately and empathetically where speed, clarity, and contextual relevance are crucial. Additionally, we'll explore how SpeechLLM can enhance voice bots through retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) for delivering precise responses.

title: Voice-to-Voice LLM for End-to-End Voice Generation [S71829]

title: Watch Party: Accelerated Python: The Community and Ecosystem  [WP72450]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Ken He, Developer Community Manager, NVIDIA
Python is everywhere. Simulation, data science, and Gen AI all depend on it. Unfortunately, the dizzying array of tools leaves a newcomer baffled at where to start. We'll take you on a guided tour of the vibrant community and ecosystem surrounding accelerated Python programming. Explore a variety of tools, libraries, and frameworks that enable efficient computation and performance optimization in Python, including CUDA Python, RAPIDS, Warp, and Legate. We'll also discuss integration points with PyData, PyTorch, and JAX communities. Learn about collaborative efforts within the community, including open-source projects and contributions that drive innovation in accelerated computing. We'll discuss best practices for leveraging these frameworks to enhance productivity in developing AI-driven applications and conducting large-scale data analyses.

Tour of key Python segments: simulation, data science, and generative AI
Overview of key accelerated Python frameworks
Complete examples of LLMs and scientific workflows in Python
Best practices for teams and community
Collaboration between community and internal projects

title: Watch Party: Accelerate Energy Transformation With Industry Domain AI Models [WP72520]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Patrick Sun, Senior Manager, NVIDIA
Energy companies handle some of the world’s largest and most complex datasets, from seismic surveys and well logs in the oil & gas sector to grid sensor data and smart meter readings in the power sector. This panel brings together industry leaders to explore how domain-specific AI models are transforming these vast data sources into actionable intelligence. Panelists will share real-world examples of how generative AI is not only driving significant cost savings, but also unlocking new revenue streams by enhancing productivity and operational efficiency. The discussion will delve into strategies for accelerating AI adoption, reducing operating costs, and enabling faster, safer, and more informed decision-making. Key topics will include overcoming challenges in AI model development and deployment, as well as insights into how AI can help the energy sector achieve greater efficiency, sustainability, and reliability across the entire value chain.

SLB building energy NIMs 
First energy-specific Gen AI commercial solutions
NeMo and NIMs leveraged

title: Watch Party: Accelerate the Future of AI-Defined Vehicles and Autonomous Driving [WP40000]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，下方列出的原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Michael Zhao, Senior Marketing Manager, NVIDIA
AI-defined vehicles are shaping the future of autonomous driving. To safely develop and deploy these vehicles, an end-to-end platform that combines high-performance in-vehicle computing and a scalable infrastructure is required. See how NVIDIA is leading this AI-centric approach with our three-computer solution, spanning from the cloud to the car, and gain insights into how generative AI is accelerating the industry toward a foundation model-empowered, end-to-end approach to bring the autonomous driving experience to the next level.

AI-defined vehicles are revolutionizing autonomous driving with the need for integrated, end-to-end platforms
NVIDIA’s three-computer solution spans from cloud to car, enabling scalable and high-performance in-vehicle computing
Generative AI is driving the advancement of foundation models, accelerating the development of safer, more reliable autonomous driving

title: Watch Party: Advanced RAG Pipelines: Engineer Scalable Retrieval Systems for Enterprise AI  [WP73015]
abstract:
A GTC Session Watch Party is a replay of an original GTC talk hosted by our NVIDIA Team. This is an interactive session and we encourage you to join the discussion with any comments or questions. Please note that the original speakers of the talk listed below may not be in attendance.
 
Hosted by: 
Tran Minh Quan, APS Senior Developer Technologist, NVIDIA
 
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems integrate the reasoning capabilities of large language models and information retrieval by searching for the relevant content from a large corpus to generate informed, accurate responses. Learn how to build advanced, custom RAG applications. You'll explore the design of an end-to-end RAG system, including data preparation, indexing, retrieval, and response generation. Then, we'll show how you can leverage Haystack pipelines with multiple NVIDIA NIMs such as the LLM, text embedding, and reranking microservices to self-host on a Kubernetes production environment at scale. Finally, we'll discuss AI models evaluation and customization for specific RAG tasks.  
 
A “Join Watch Party Now” link will appear below, 15 minutes before the session start time. Click on the link to launch Microsoft Teams on your computer or from your web browser.

title: Watch Party: AI Agents for Real-Time Video Understanding and Summarization [WP72784a]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Yipeng Li, Integrated Marketing Manager, NVIDIA
The NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization enables the creation of interactive analytical agents that reason through massive amounts of video, assess physical processes, and provide decision-making insights to streamline operations. The blueprint combines powerful Vision Language Models (VLMs), Large Language Models (LLMs), and NeMo retriever into a full suite of software for building, fine-tuning, and deploying a diverse set of visual understanding agents. These interactive AI Agents leverage realtime multi-camera streaming and long context understanding in our factories, warehouses, airports and cities - helping enable operations teams to make better decisions faster from richer insights and more natural interactions. Learn more about NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization and how you can customize and deploy on-prem or in the cloud.

title: Watch Party: AI for Humanoid Robots  [WP73182]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Darcy Tang, Senior Solution Architect, NVIDIA
Humanoid robotics hardware is seeing a major acceleration in progress. It's reasonable to expect commercially viable humanoid hardware to exist within three years. The question is, how do we build the AI that can make these robots helpful? Humanoids have high dimensional action spaces and high dimensional multimodal observation space, posing challenges to existing paradigms. We'll explore these challenges in more depth and highlight some promising paths forward.

abstract:

The ChatGPT of robotics has arrived. Humanoid robots will be one of the largest form-factor deployments of generalist robotics the world has ever seen. Hear from luminaries across some of the world's leading humanoid robotics companies about their outlook on the future of humanoid robotics, and what it'll take from foundation models, simulation technology, and computing to get there.

The ChatGPT of robotics has arrived. Humanoid robots will be one of the largest form-factor deployments of generalist robotics the world has ever seen. Hear from luminaries across some of the world's leading humanoid robotics companies about their outlook on the future of humanoid robotics, and what it'll take from foundation models, simulation technology, and computing to get there.

The challenge of adapting internet-scale foundation models to physical robotic tasks
The importance of data strategies, and how each are approaching real-world and simulated data
The technology and industry milestones developers, researchers, and end customers should be looking out for

title: Watch Party: An Introduction to Building Humanoid Robots [WP72590]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Michael Ma, HER Senior Account Manager, NVIDIA
Developers are building more intelligent, responsive, and efficient humanoid robots capable of transforming industries such as manufacturing, healthcare, and retail. NVIDIA is building Isaac GR00T — a platform for developing humanoid robots. Isaac GR00T has four parts: robot foundation models for cognition and control, simulation frameworks built on NVIDIA Omniverse and Cosmos, data pipelines for generating synthetic data and environments, and finally — a supercomputer in the robot Jetson AGX Thor. This engaging session will cover the latest advancements in each of the four pillars of the platform built by NVIDIA Research and Engineering through concrete use cases and examples.

A deeper understanding of the primary components of Isaac GR00T platform, and how developers can take advantage of each
Insight into the progress of NVIDIA Research's unified generalist models and early deployments in industry
New workflows to overcome the humanoid data challenge, built on NVIDIA Omniverse and Cosmos
A deep dive into new performance specifications for Jetson AGX Thor — the world's most advanced robotics supercomputer

title: Watch Party: Build a Strategic Foundation for Enterprise Gen AI [WP72357]
abstract:
A GTC Session Watch Party is a replay of an original GTC talk hosted by our NVIDIA Team. This is an interactive session and we encourage you to join the discussion with any comments or questions. Please note that the original speakers of the talk listed below may not be in attendance.
 
Hosted by: 
Raghavender Ganti, Malaysia & Philippines Enterprise Business Lead,NVIDIA
 
Generative AI is now central to global business strategies, with a recent survey showing that nine in 10 companies are already deploying or piloting the technology. However, with this integration comes the challenge of scaling AI development and deployment across the enterprise. We’ll delve into the critical elements required to operationalize Gen AI at scale — including proven infrastructure with a comprehensive software stack that enables high reliability and uptime, high visibility into cluster and job status, and simplified workload management to maximize developer productivity.

title: Watch Party: Build Scalable Data Flywheels for Continuously Improving Generative AI Applications [Spoken in Korean, 한국어 진행] [WP73280]
abstract:
A GTC Session Watch Party is a replay of an original GTC talk hosted by our NVIDIA Team. This is an interactive session and we encourage you to join the discussion with any comments or questions. Please note that the original speakers of the talk listed below may not be in attendance.
 
Hosted by: 
Hyungon Ryu,Sr. Solution Architect, NVIDIA
 
Enterprises need a scalable, efficient, and modular solution for building data flywheels to capture the latest data and train and continuously improve the models that power generative AI applications. NVIDIA NeMo offer a complete solution for building these flywheels. NeMo enable enterprises to quickly and easily collect and process data, customize the generative AI models, evaluate the model's performance, and implement guardrails to ensure responsible and ethical use of the model. Learn about the ease of use, flexibility, and advanced techniques that will help you build your solutions faster.

title: Watch Party: CUDA: New Features and Beyond [WP72383]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Ken He, Developer Community Manager, NVIDIA
The CUDA platform is the foundation of the GPU computing ecosystem. Every application and framework that uses the GPU does so through CUDA's libraries, compilers, runtimes and language — which means CUDA is growing as fast as its ecosystem is evolving. At this engineering-focused talk by one of the architects of CUDA, you'll learn what's new and what's coming next for both CUDA and GPU computing as a whole.

Learn about a host of new features we're adding to the CUDA Platform this year
Learn about the future direction of CUDA and GPU computing
This talk has a strong developer focus, and will point at all sorts of other developer material to see at GTC this year

title: Watch Party: How AI is Transforming the Way We Create, Personalize, and Share Content [WP73742]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Maggie Jiang, Director for Media and Entertainment, China and ROAP, NVIDIA
AI is transforming media production by changing how we create, handle, and share content. It helps artists and writers generate scripts, music, and visual effects. Natural language processing and transformer models are now used to create dialogue and story outlines, aiding storytellers in crafting narratives. In music, AI helps compose new pieces and improve others. For visual effects, it’s being used for tasks such as rotoscoping, adjusting colors, and creating computer-generated imagery more efficiently. In the realm of media distribution, AI is optimizing content delivery and personalization. Recommendation systems, powered by AI, analyze user data to suggest content that aligns with individual preferences, thereby enhancing viewer engagement. AI is also instrumental in managing digital rights, detecting copyright infringements, and ensuring compliance with licensing agreements. As AI continues to evolve, it will further disrupt traditional media production workflows, offering new creative possibilities while also raising important ethical considerations around authenticity and content manipulation. We'll highlight recent advances in technology and software products embracing this new world.

We'll highlight recent advances in technology and software products embracing this new world
AI offers new creative possibilities while also raising important ethical considerations around authenticity and content manipulation
AI is also instrumental in managing digital rights, detecting copyright infringements, and ensuring compliance with licensing agreements

title: Watch Party: How Indonesia Delivered a Telco-led Sovereign AI Platform for 270M Users [WP73440]
abstract:
A GTC Session Watch Party is a replay of an original GTC talk hosted by our NVIDIA Team. This is an interactive session and we encourage you to join the discussion with any comments or questions. Please note that the original speakers of the talk listed below may not be in attendance.
 
Hosted by: 
Andry Gunawan, Enterprise Business Manager Indonesia,NVIDIA
 
Sovereign AI enables nations to create their own AI and participate in the new global economy. Nations are partnering up with telcos to enable the foundational AI platform and ecosystem required for their universities, startups, enterprises, and government agencies to create AI. Indosat, a major telecoms provider with over 100 million customers, working with Lintasarta, GoTo, Accenture, and Hippocratic, has deployed a Sovereign AI Factory and a collection of LLMs for Indonesia leveraging the NVIDIA Cloud Partner program. We'll explore how Indosat set up the sovereign cloud and launched its own foundational large language model, Sahabat.ai, for the 277 million native Bahasa speakers with NVIDIA NEMO and NIMs. We'll also discuss how partners like Accenture and Hippocratic AI are accelerating AI use-case deployment in Indonesia for critical sectors including banking and healthcare using NVIDIA AI Platform.
 
A “Join Watch Party Now” link will appear below, 15 minutes before the session start time. Click on the link to launch Microsoft Teams on your computer or from your web browser.

title: Watch Party: How to Build an Agentic AI System Using the Best Tools and Frameworks [WP73739b]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Yipeng Li, Integrated Marketing Manager, NVIDIA
AI agents are the new digital workforce, working for and with us. They can reason about a mission, create a plan, and retrieve data or use tools to generate a quality response. Data is the fuel for AI agents, but the magnitude and scale of enterprise data often make it too expensive and time-consuming to leverage effectively. For enterprises to thrive in the AI era, they must find a way to make use of all of their data. Join this session to learn about tools and frameworks to more easily build agentic AI systems that connectAI agents to a library of reusable tools that unlock your data, and drive efficiency gains across the organization.

There are several challenges with developing agentic AI systems: Connecting the many AI agent frameworks and orchestration tools that currently exist, Evaluation and benchmarking of agentic AI systems,  Telemetry and logging are important for complex agentic AI workflows or production environments Achieving the best performance requires system-level accelerations which can be implemented only with knowledge of the entire system
Learn about technologies that will help with building full-stack accelerated agentic AI systems that accelerate developer velocity and provide built-in interoperability to choose from the best available frameworks for your task.

title: Watch Party: How to Build an Agentic AI System Using the Best Tools and Frameworks [WP73739b]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Yipeng Li, Integrated Marketing Manager, NVIDIA
AI agents are the new digital workforce, working for and with us. They can reason about a mission, create a plan, and retrieve data or use tools to generate a quality response. Data is the fuel for AI agents, but the magnitude and scale of enterprise data often make it too expensive and time-consuming to leverage effectively. For enterprises to thrive in the AI era, they must find a way to make use of all of their data. Join this session to learn about tools and frameworks to more easily build agentic AI systems that connectAI agents to a library of reusable tools that unlock your data, and drive efficiency gains across the organization.

There are several challenges with developing agentic AI systems: Connecting the many AI agent frameworks and orchestration tools that currently exist, Evaluation and benchmarking of agentic AI systems,  Telemetry and logging are important for complex agentic AI workflows or production environments Achieving the best performance requires system-level accelerations which can be implemented only with knowledge of the entire system
Learn about technologies that will help with building full-stack accelerated agentic AI systems that accelerate developer velocity and provide built-in interoperability to choose from the best available frameworks for your task.

abstract:
A GTC Session Watch Party is a replay of an original GTC talk hosted by our NVIDIA Team. This is an interactive session and we encourage you to join the discussion with any comments or questions. Please note that the original speakers of the talk listed below may not be in attendance.

Hasan Aijaz, Business Head, Generative AI Companies, NVIDIA
 
In this session, we will dive into the GB200 NVL72 architecture and programming model, highlighting its inference performance on state-of-the-art LLM models.
We will also explore optimizations techniques that enable the 72 Blackwell GPUs to work together through the NVIDIA NVLINK, functioning as one giant GPU.

title: Watch Party: Pretraining of Foundation Large Language Models for Ecommerce [WP72589]
abstract:
A GTC Session Watch Party is a replay of an original GTC talk hosted by our NVIDIA Team. This is an interactive session and we encourage you to join the discussion with any comments or questions. Please note that the original speakers of the talk listed below may not be in attendance.
 
Hosted by: 
Avinash Business Head, Generative AI Companies, NVIDIA
 
We explore the pretraining of large language models (LLMs) specifically for application in the ecommerce domain.  Throughout the presentation, we touch on all aspects of model development: from data acquisition and processing, through large-scale distributed model training, to devising and performing domain-specific evaluations.  Finally, based on our experimental findings, we discuss the advantages and disadvantages of pretraining LLMs from scratch versus adapting an existing model. 

 
A “Join Watch Party Now” link will appear below, 15 minutes before the session start time. Click on the link to launch Microsoft Teams on your computer or from your web browser.

title: Watch Party: 使用 NVIDIA 机器人解决方案加速端到端无序抓取的开发 [WP72427]
abstract:
GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。
会议主持人：
Richard Guo, China HER IBD, NVIDIA
借助 NVIDIA 机器人解决方案，我们帮助人形机器人合作伙伴“银河通用”快速构建了一个端到端解决方案，用于复杂的工业随机无序抓取任务。深入了解技术流程，探索我们如何创建数字孪生并在仿真和真实环境中验证我们的软件栈，以加速工程开发。

在 ISAAC Sim 仿真环境和真实机器人上验证端到端的无序拣选解决方案
探索零样本 6D 位姿估计算法在工业领域的应用
设计智能决策和排序算法
构建快速动态响应的无碰撞轨迹生成工作流

abstract:

title: Watch Party: 如何使用最佳工具和架構建立代理 AI 藍圖 [WP73739a]
abstract:
本場 GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 團隊所主持，將由台灣的技術專家 Cliff Chiu 以中文講解並導讀國外精選演講，會中可以即時與講師互動、發問，歡迎您一起加入討論。(請注意：由於時區差異，本場講座的原講者可能不會參加。)
 
AI 代理程式是新的數位勞動力，為我們以及與我們一起工作，可對任務進行推理、擬定計畫、擷取資料或使用工具產生高品質回應。資料是 AI 代理程式的燃料，但企業資料的數量和規模往往導致有效利用資料的成本過高且耗時。企業若要在 AI 時代茁壯，就必須設法利用所有資料。參加此講座瞭解工具和架構，即可更輕鬆地建立代理 AI 系統，將 AI 代理程式與各種可重複使用的工具結合，進一步解鎖資料潛力，並提高整個組織的效率。 
 
在演講開始前 15 分鐘，下方將出現「Join Watch Party Now」連結。請點擊該連結，並在電腦應用程式或網頁瀏覽器開啟 Microsoft Teams 以線上加入。

title: Watch Party: 如何使用最佳工具和架構建立代理 AI 藍圖 [WP73739a]
abstract:
本場 GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 團隊所主持，將由台灣的技術專家 Cliff Chiu 以中文講解並導讀國外精選演講，會中可以即時與講師互動、發問，歡迎您一起加入討論。(請注意：由於時區差異，本場講座的原講者可能不會參加。)
 
AI 代理程式是新的數位勞動力，為我們以及與我們一起工作，可對任務進行推理、擬定計畫、擷取資料或使用工具產生高品質回應。資料是 AI 代理程式的燃料，但企業資料的數量和規模往往導致有效利用資料的成本過高且耗時。企業若要在 AI 時代茁壯，就必須設法利用所有資料。參加此講座瞭解工具和架構，即可更輕鬆地建立代理 AI 系統，將 AI 代理程式與各種可重複使用的工具結合，進一步解鎖資料潛力，並提高整個組織的效率。 
 
在演講開始前 15 分鐘，下方將出現「Join Watch Party Now」連結。請點擊該連結，並在電腦應用程式或網頁瀏覽器開啟 Microsoft Teams 以線上加入。

title: Watch Party: 定義加速量子超級電腦 [WP74424]
abstract:
本場 GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 團隊所主持，將由台灣的技術專家 Pika Wang 以中文講解並導讀國外精選演講，會中可以即時與講師互動、發問，歡迎您一起加入討論。(請注意：由於時區差異，本場講座的原講者可能不會參加。)
 
量子運算具有大幅提升運算能力的潛力，對於藥物探索到投資組合最佳化等各種產業皆產生深遠影響。若要實現這些效益，必須突破量子資訊科學的極限，包括開發演算法、研究更強大的量子處理器，以及建立緊密整合的量子與傳統混合系統和工具。我們將檢視這些挑戰、分析 AI 超級運算如何實現量子優勢，並探討緊密整合的量子與傳統混合運算軟體和系統的最新發展。
 
在演講開始前 15 分鐘，下方將出現「Join Watch Party Now」連結。請點擊該連結，並在電腦應用程式或網頁瀏覽器開啟 Microsoft Teams 以線上加入。

title: Watch Party: 數位和實體 AI 助醫學領域譜寫全新篇章 [WP71353]
abstract:
本場 GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 團隊所主持，將由台灣的技術專家 Ying-Ja Chen 以中文講解並導讀國外精選演講，會中可以即時與講師互動、發問，歡迎您一起加入討論。(請注意：由於時區差異，本場講座的原講者可能不會參加。)
 
AI 正徹底改變醫療業，透過將數位與實體技術完美整合來克服關鍵的產業挑戰。數位 AI 代理程式現在提供全年無休的個人化醫療服務，藉此大幅減輕醫療團隊的管理負擔。同時，AI 與生物學的融合為生物流程帶來前所未有的洞見，使探索廣闊的治療可能性成真。在實體領域，AI 醫療器材和機器人提高診斷和治療精準度，同時將作業效率最佳化。領域專用運算平台促進更具反應能力並以患者為中心的醫療生態系統。這些進步有望改善全球健康預後，在醫學史上寫下變革性篇章。與 NVIDIA 醫療和生命科學副總裁 Kimberly Powell 一同探索這些進步如何重塑產業的未來。 
 
在演講開始前 15 分鐘，下方將出現「Join Watch Party Now」連結。請點擊該連結，並在電腦應用程式或網頁瀏覽器開啟 Microsoft Teams 以線上加入。

title: Watch Party: 數學函式庫如何協助您在 Blackwell GPU 上加快應用程式速度 [WP72434]
abstract:
本場 GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 團隊所主持，將由台灣的技術專家 Jay Chen 以中文講解並導讀國外精選演講，會中可以即時與講師互動、發問，歡迎您一起加入討論。(請注意：由於時區差異，本場講座的原講者可能不會參加。)
 
NVIDIA 的 GPU 加速數學函式庫是 CUDA 工具套件和 HPC SDK 的一部分，並且正不斷擴展，提供領先業界的效能並涵蓋 AI、機器學習和科學運算中常見的運算工作流程。這些函式庫的主要優點是為跨不同世代的 GPU 使用它們的應用程式提供可移植性。我們將深入探索最新 Blackwell 架構 GPU 的一些最新進步，以及數學函式庫如何讓您輕鬆存取這些功能以加快應用程式速度。我們將涵蓋許多主題，包括如何透過 cuBLAS 等函式庫使用新的 Tensor Core 功能，如微縮放格式，以及如 cuSOLVERMp 多 GPU 多節點 (MGMN) 函式庫如何利用更大的 NVLINK 網域在 GB200 NVL72 系統上提供更高的效能和擴充性。
 
在演講開始前 15 分鐘，下方將出現「Join Watch Party Now」連結。請點擊該連結，並在電腦應用程式或網頁瀏覽器開啟 Microsoft Teams 以線上加入。

title: Watch Party: 用於可擴充影像理解和即時摘要的視覺 AI 代理程式 [WP72784]
abstract:
本場 GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 團隊所主持，將由台灣的技術專家 Eason Hung以中文講解並導讀國外精選演講，會中可以即時與講師互動、發問，歡迎您一起加入討論。(請注意：由於時區差異，本場講座的原講者可能不會參加。)
 
用於影像搜尋和摘要的 NVIDIA AI Blueprint 使建立互動式分析代理程式成為可能，代理程式可透過大量影像進行推理、評估實體流程，並提供有利於簡化作業的決策見解。此藍圖將強大的視覺語言模型 (VLM)、大型語言模型 (LLM) 和 NeMo Retriever 結合成一整套軟體，以利建立、微調和部署各式各樣的視覺理解代理程式。這些互動式 AI 代理程式在工廠、倉庫、機場和城市中利用即時多攝影機串流和長期脈絡理解，讓營運團隊能夠透過更豐富的洞見和更自然的互動更快做出更好的決策。深入瞭解用於影像搜尋和摘要的 NVIDIA AI Blueprint 以及如何在內部或雲端進行自訂和部署。 
 
在演講開始前 15 分鐘，下方將出現「Join Watch Party Now」連結。請點擊該連結，並在電腦應用程式或網頁瀏覽器開啟 Microsoft Teams 以線上加入。

title: Watch Party: 資料中心的次世代大規模運算 [WP73623]
abstract:
本場 GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 團隊所主持，將由台灣的技術專家 Mason Wu 以中文講解並導讀國外精選演講，會中可以即時與講師互動、發問，歡迎您一起加入討論。(請注意：由於時區差異，本場講座的原講者可能不會參加。)
 
隨著新興技術持續推動運算進步，超大規模系統的全面建構逐漸整合，以利滿足迅速演變的次世代工作負載需求。我們將聚焦於 DGX 叢集的最新設計，包括運算和資料中心配置，展示 DGX Superpod 的範例。我們將探討次世代氣冷和水冷部署所根據的架構和設計原則，並且將檢視實現最大效能的網路結構、互連解決方案和儲存選項，以及這些元件如何與生成式 AI 應用程式的軟體堆疊整合。
 
在演講開始前 15 分鐘，下方將出現「Join Watch Party Now」連結。請點擊該連結，並在電腦應用程式或網頁瀏覽器開啟 Microsoft Teams 以線上加入。

title: Watch Party: 資料快速道路：利用次世代網路充分發揮 AI 的潛力 [WP71190]
abstract:
本場 GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 團隊所主持，將由台灣的技術專家 Sungta Tsai 以中文講解並導讀國外精選演講，會中可以即時與講師互動、發問，歡迎您一起加入討論。(請注意：由於時區差異，本場講座的原講者可能不會參加。)
 
我們將介紹專為 AI 資料中心而設計的最新網路解決方案和先進功能。我們將藉由展示尖端技術和近期創新，探索這些發展如何徹底改變 AI 模型訓練和部署的局勢。這些進步將造就前所未見的效能、推動下一波 AI 進步，並更快速、更有效率地處理 AI 工作負載。

title: Watch Your Language: Create Small Language Models That Run On-Device  [S74407]
abstract: Large language models are great for complex tasks like writing code or translating Japanese into Greek, but they're overkill if you just need a nonplayer character dialog generator in a single language. We'll present tools and techniques you can use today to generate, curate, and distill a dataset, then train a small language model (SLM) that can perform the tasks you designed it for.

title: What's CUDA All About Anyway? [S72571]
abstract: Discover the full power of CUDA beyond just writing kernels! We'll unlock the entire ecosystem of tools, libraries, and SDKs that make GPU-accelerated computing faster, easier, and more powerful than ever. This is a comprehensive tour of the CUDA landscape, showing how all the pieces fit together to solve real-world challenges. Whether you're just getting started or have been using CUDA for years, you’ll gain a fresh, up-to-date understanding of the latest tools and best practices to keep you at the cutting edge of CUDA development.

title: What's in Your Developer Toolbox? CUDA and Graphics Profiling, Optimization, and Debugging Tools [CWE72393]
abstract:
We'll provide a brief overview of the NVIDIA Nsight family of tools and debuggers. We'll introduce the latest features for debugging, profiling, and optimizing CUDA compute and graphics applications on the newest platforms. Several experts from the tools development and management teams will be available to talk about getting started, best practices, and advanced techniques for application debugging and optimization with NVIDIA developer tools. You can ask questions about anything from high-level concepts to specific tools details, and also discuss plans and suggestions for improving the tools in the future.
Important: Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Wired for AI: Lessons from Networking 100K+ GPU AI Data Centers and Clouds [S71145]
abstract:
As AI continues to evolve, the need for massive computational power has led to developing some of the world's largest GPU-based data centers. These centers are at the forefront of training large language models (LLMs) with trillions of parameters, pushing the boundaries of what AI can achieve.

In this session, leading AI cloud data centers will come together to share our experiences and insights from building and deploying these colossal systems. We'll delve into the unique challenges of networking at such a massive scale, and how we overcame them.

Attendees will gain a deep understanding of the lessons learned in scaling infrastructure to support the next generation of AI, from the complexities of connecting thousands of GPUs to the innovations required to maintain performance and reliability at such an unprecedented scale.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

Attendees will gain a deep understanding of the lessons learned in scaling infrastructure to support the next generation of AI, from the complexities of connecting thousands of GPUs to the innovations required to maintain performance and reliability at such an unprecedented scale.
Important: Near capacity, highly suggest arriving early. Attendees are let in on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Workflow for Practical Quantum Chemical Calculations on a Quantum Computer With GPGPU [P72714]
abstract:
Quantum chemical calculations of molecules is one of the most promising applications of quantum computing. Quantum phase estimation (QPE) with a fault-tolerant quantum computer (FTQC) is particularly notable for its potential to perform precise calculations with exponential speedup. As FTQC advances rapidly, studying FTQC algorithms has become urgent. We've developed a general framework for QPE-based quantum chemical calculations of the ground and excited electronic states of sizable molecules, such as those containing aromatic rings. Our workflow, implemented on a general purpose GPU (GPGPU) environment, shows that the GPGPU accelerates calculations faster than 48-CPU simulations without GPGPU. 
We've shown that the IQPE algorithm can calculate excitation energies with deviations of less than 30 meV from the numerically exact values. The outlined procedures have the potential to become a general standard for QPE-based quantum chemical calculations.

title: Zyda-2: A 5-Trillion-Token, High-Quality Dataset Built Using NeMo Curator [P73602]
abstract: Learn how Zyphra built a 5-trillion-token, high-quality dataset using NVIDIA NeMo Curator, achieving 10X faster processing and 2X lower total cost of ownership while powering state-of-the-art small language models.

title: これからの工場プランニングとIsaac Perceptor搭載のAMR例 [S73883]
abstract:
Musashi AIは産業顧客向けにAI技術を搭載した外観検査機とAMRのサービスを提供しています。
これらの技術導入をさらに加速させるため、Omniverse Platformを使用したデジタルツインを構築し、これからの工場プランニングのあり方を企画・開発しております。
その中で本セッションでは、Isaac Perceptorを搭載したAMRの取り組みと開発内容についてもご説明させていただきます。
